original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: idaṃ tu te guhyatamaṃ pravakṣyāmy anasūyave /
analyzed: idam tu te guhyatamam pravakṣyāmi anasūyave
translated: But I will tell you this, which is the most secret of all secrets, to one who is not a fault-finder.

original: jñānaṃ vijñānasahitaṃ yaj jñātvā mokṣyase 'śubhāt ////
analyzed: jñānam vijñāna sahitam yat jñātvā mokṣyase śubhāt
translated: Knowing this knowledge along with realization, you will be freed from evil.

original: śrīdharaḥ
translated: Shridhar

original: pareśaḥ prāpyate śuddhabhaktyeti sthitam aṣṭame /
analyzed: pareśaḥ prāpyate śuddha bhaktyā iti sthitam aṣṭame
translated: It has been established in the eighth chapter that the Supreme Lord is attained through pure devotion.

original: navame tu tadaiśvaryam atyāścaryaṃ prapañcyate //
analyzed: navame tu tat aiśvaryam ati āścaryam prapañcyate
translated: But in the ninth chapter, His inconceivable opulence is elaborated.

original: evaṃ tāvat saptamāṣṭamayoḥ svīyaṃ pārameśvaraṃ tattvaṃ bhaktyaiva sulabhaṃ nānyathā
analyzed: evam tāvat saptama aṣṭamayoḥ svīyam pārameśvaram tattvam bhaktyā eva sulabham nā anyathā
translated: Thus, it has been said that the Supreme Lord's truth, which is His own, is easily attainable through devotion alone, not otherwise,

original: ity uktvā idānīm acintyaṃ svakīyam aiśvaryaṃ bhakteś cāsādhāraṇaṃ prabhāvaaprapañcayiṣyan
analyzed: iti uktvā idānīm acintyam svakīyam aiśvaryam bhakteḥ ca asādhāraṇam prabhāva a prapañcayiṣyan
translated: in the seventh and eighth chapters. Now, intending to elaborate on His own inconceivable opulence and the extraordinary power of devotion,

original: bhagavān uvāca idam iti /
analyzed: bhagavān uvāca idam iti
translated: the Blessed Lord said this and so on.

original: viśeṣeṇa jñāyate 'neneti vijñānam upāsanam /
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa jñāyate nena iti vijñānam upāsanam
translated: Vijñana is meditation, by which one knows something in particular.

original: tatsahitaṃ jñānam īśvaraviṣayam /
analyzed: tad sahitam jñānam īśvara viṣayam
translated: The knowledge about the Lord, along with that, is knowledge along with realization.

original: idaṃ tv anusūyave punaḥ punaḥ svamāhātmyam evopadiśatīty evaṃ paramakāruṇike mayi doṣadṛṣṭirahitāya /
analyzed: idam tu anusūyave punar punar sva māhātmyam eva upadiśati iti evam parama kāruṇike mayi doṣa dṛṣṭi rahitāya
translated: To one who is not a fault-finder means to one who, again and again, instructs about one's own greatness, thus to one who is free from seeing faults in Me, who am supremely compassionate.

original: tubhyaṃ vakṣyāmi /
analyzed: tubhyam vakṣyāmi
translated: To you I will tell.

original: tuśabdo vaiśiṣṭye ////
analyzed: tuśabdaḥ vaiśiṣṭye
translated: The word tu (but) is for distinction.

original: madhusūdanaḥ pūrvādhyāye mūrdhany anāḍīdvārakeṇa hṛdayakaṇṭhabhrūmadhyādidhāraṇāsahitena
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ pūrva adhyāye mūrdhani a nāḍī dvārakeṇa hṛdaya kaṇṭha bhrū madhya ādi dhāraṇā sahitena
translated: In the previous chapter, the Lord has described the gradual liberation of one who, by the yoga consisting of the control of all the sense-doors, along with the meditation on the heart, throat, middle of the eyebrows, etc.,

original: sarvendriyadvārasaṃyamaguṇakena yogena svecchayotkrāntaprāṇasyārcirādimārgeṇa
analyzed: sarva indriya dvāra saṃyama guṇakena yogena sva icchayā utkrānta prāṇasya arciḥ ādi mārgeṇa
translated: through the door of the head, not through the channels, and who, by his own will, has departed from life through the path of light, etc.,

original: brahmalokaṃ prayātasya tatra samyagjñānodayena kalpānte parabrahmaprāptilakṣaṇā🔽kramamuktir vyākhyātā /
analyzed: brahma lokam prayātasya tatra samyak jñāna udayena kalpa ante para brahma prāpti lakṣaṇā  krama muktiḥ vyākhyātā
translated: and has gone to the world of Brahman, and there, by the rise of perfect knowledge, attains the supreme Brahman at the end of the kalpa.🔽And there, it is explained that liberation is attained only by this very means, not by any other.

original: tatra cānenaiva prakāreṇa muktir labhyate nānayathety āśaṅkya ananyacetāḥ satataṃ yo māṃ smarati nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca anena eva prakāreṇa muktiḥ labhyate na anayathā iti āśaṅkya an anya cetāḥ satatam yaḥ mām smarati nityaśas
translated: Suspecting this, the Lord says: He who always remembers Me with an undivided mind, and worships Me with love, is considered by Me to be the most devoted among those who are devoted.

original: tasyāhaṃ sulabhaḥ ity ādinā bhagavattattvavijñānāt sākṣān mokṣaprāptir abhihitā /
analyzed: tasya aham sulabhaḥ iti ādinā bhagavat tattva vijñānāt sākṣāt mokṣa prāptiḥ abhihitā
translated: To him who is thus devoted, I am easy to attain. Thus, liberation is directly attained by the knowledge of the truth of the Lord.

original: tatra cānanyā bhaktir asādhāraṇo hetur ity uktaṃ puruṣaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyas tv ananyayā iti /
analyzed: tatra ca ananyā bhaktiḥ asādhāraṇaḥ hetuḥ iti uktam puruṣaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyaḥ tu ananyayā iti
translated: And there, undivided devotion is said to be the special cause, as stated: That supreme Person, O Partha, is attained only by devotion that is undivided.

original: tatra pūrvoktayogadhāraṇāpūrvaprāṇotkramaṇārcirādimārgagamanakālavilambādikleśam antareṇaiva sākṣān mokṣaprāptaye bhagavattattvasya
analyzed: tatra pūrva ukta yoga dhāraṇā pūrva prāṇa utkramaṇa arciḥ ādi mārga gamana kāla vilamba ādi kleśam antareṇa eva sākṣāt mokṣa prāptaye bhagavat tattvasya
translated: For the direct attainment of liberation without the trouble of delaying the departure of the life-breath through the path of light, etc., preceded by the yoga and meditation described earlier,

original: ca vistareṇa jñāpanāya navamo 'dhyāya ārabhyate /
analyzed: ca vistareṇa jñāpanāya navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ ārabhyate
translated: And in order to make it known in detail, the ninth chapter is begun.

original: aṣṭame dhyeyabrahmanirūpaṇena taddhyānaniṣṭhasya gatir uktā /
analyzed: aṣṭame dhyeya brahma nirūpaṇena tad dhyāna niṣṭhasya gatiḥ uktā
translated: In the eighth chapter, the goal of one who is devoted to the meditation on Brahman, which is to be meditated upon, has been stated.

original: navame tu jñeyabrahmanirūpaṇena jñānaniṣṭhasya gatir ucyata iti saṅkṣepaḥ /
analyzed: navame tu jñeya brahma nirūpaṇena jñāna niṣṭhasya gatiḥ ucyate iti saṅkṣepaḥ
translated: But in the ninth chapter, the goal of one who is devoted to knowledge is stated by describing the Brahman that is to be known. This is the summary.

original: tatra vakṣyamāṇajñānastutyarthās trīn ślokān /
analyzed: tatra vakṣyamāṇa jñāna stuti arthāḥ trīn ślokān
translated: There, three verses are stated for the purpose of praising the knowledge that will be described.

original: idaṃ prāg bahudhoktam agre ca vakṣyamāṇam adhunocyamānaṃ jñānaṃ śabdapramāṇakaṃ brahmatattvaviṣayakaṃ te tubhyaṃ pravakṣyāmi /
analyzed: idam prāk bahudhā uktam agre ca vakṣyamāṇam adhunā ucyamānam jñānam śabda pramāṇakam brahma tattva viṣayakam te tubhyam pravakṣyāmi
translated: I will declare to you this knowledge, which is based on the scriptures, which deals with the truth of Brahman, and which has been stated in many ways before and will be stated later.

original: tuśabdaḥ pūrvādhyāyoktād dhyānāj jñānasya vailakṣaṇyam āha /
analyzed: tuśabdaḥ pūrva adhyāya uktāt dhyānāt jñānasya vailakṣaṇyam āha
translated: The word but indicates the difference of knowledge from meditation stated in the previous chapter.

original: idam eva samyagjñānaṃ sākṣān mokṣaprāptisādhanaṃ na tu dhyānaṃ tasyājñānānivartakatvāt /
analyzed: idam eva samyak jñānam sākṣāt mokṣa prāpti sādhanam na tu dhyānam tasya ajñāna anivartaka tvāt
translated: This alone is the true knowledge, which is the means of attaining liberation directly, and not meditation, because it does not remove ignorance.

original: tat tv antaḥkaraṇaśuddhidvāredam eva jñānaṃ sampādya krameṇa mokṣaṃ janayatīty uktam /
analyzed: tat tu antaḥkaraṇa śuddhi dvārā idam eva jñānam sampādya krameṇa mokṣam janayati iti uktam
translated: But that, by the way of purifying the internal organ, accomplishes this very knowledge and gradually produces liberation - this has been stated.

original: kīdṛśaṃ jñānaṃ guhyatamaṃ gopanīyatamam atirahasyatvāt /
analyzed: kīdṛśam jñānam guhyatamam gopanīyatamam ati rahasya tvāt
translated: What kind of knowledge? The most secret, to be kept most hidden, because of its extreme confidentiality.

original: yato vijñānasahitaṃ brahmānubhavaparyantam /
analyzed: yatas vijñāna sahitam brahma anubhava paryantam
translated: From which, along with knowledge, it goes up to the experience of Brahman.

original: īdṛśam atirahasyam apy ahaṃ śiṣyaguṇādhikyād vakṣyāmi tubhyam anasūyave /
analyzed: īdṛśam ati rahasyam api aham śiṣya guṇa ādhikyāt vakṣyāmi tubhyam anasūyave
translated: I shall tell you this kind of extremely confidential knowledge, even though it is so, to you who are free from envy, because of your being a disciple endowed with excellent qualities.

original: asūyā guṇeṣu doṣadṛṣṭis tadāviṣkaraṇādiphalā /
translated: Envy is seeing faults in good qualities, and its result is not revealing them, etc.

original: sarvadāyam ātmaiśvaryakhyāpanenātmānaṃ praśaṃsati matpurastād ity evaṃ rūpā tadrahitāya /
analyzed: sarvadā ayam ātma aiśvarya khyāpanena ātmānam praśaṃsati mad purastāt iti evaṃ rūpā tad rahitāya
translated: By proclaiming one's own lordship, one praises oneself as in front of me - to one who is free from that.

original: anenārjuavasaṃyamāv api śiṣyaguṇau vyākhyātau /
analyzed: anena ārju ava saṃyamau api śiṣya guṇau vyākhyātau
translated: By this, self-control and self-restraint are also explained as qualities of a disciple.

original: punaḥ kīdṛśaṃ jñānaṃ yaj jñātvā prāpya mokṣyase sadya eva saṃsārabandhanād aśubhāt sarvaduḥkhahetoḥ ////
analyzed: punar kīdṛśam jñānam yat jñātvā prāpya mokṣyase sadyas eva saṃsāra bandhanāt aśubhāt sarva duḥkha hetoḥ
translated: Again, what kind of knowledge is that, knowing which, you will be liberated from the bondage of the world, from inauspiciousness, the cause of all suffering, immediately?

original: viśvanāthaḥ 🔽ārādhyatve prabhor dāsair aiśvaryaṃ yad apekṣitam /
analyzed: ārādhya tve prabhoḥ dāsaiḥ aiśvaryam yat apekṣitam
translated: Visvanatha

original: tat śuddhabhakter utkarṣaś cocyate navame sphuṭam //
analyzed: tat śuddha bhakteḥ utkarṣaḥ ca ucyate navame sphuṭam
translated: In the ninth chapter, it is clearly stated that the supremacy of pure devotion is the same as the lordship that the Lord's servants desire in worshipping Him.

original: karmajñānayogādibhyaḥ sakāśāt bhakter eve utkarṣaḥ /
analyzed: karma jñāna yoga ādibhyaḥ sakāśāt bhakteḥ eve utkarṣaḥ
translated: The supremacy of devotion is over karma, jnana, yoga, etc.

original: sā ca bhaktiḥ pradhānībhūtā kevalā ceti saptamāṣṭamayor uktam /
analyzed: sā ca bhaktiḥ pradhānībhūtā kevalā ca iti saptama aṣṭamayoḥ uktam
translated: And it is said in the seventh and eighth chapters that devotion is the most important and is alone.

original: tatrāpi kevalāyā atiprabalāyā jñānavad antaḥkaraṇaśuddhyādyanapekṣinyā bhakteḥ spaṣṭatayā eva sarvotkarṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra api kevalāyāḥ ati prabalāyāḥ jñāna vat antaḥkaraṇa śuddhi ādi anapekṣinyāḥ bhakteḥ spaṣṭa tayā eva sarva utkarṣaḥ
translated: Even there, the supremacy of devotion is clearly seen, which is very powerful, and does not depend on the purification of the internal organ like knowledge, etc.

original: tasyām apekṣitam aiśvaryaṃ ca vaktuṃ navamo 'dhyāya ārabhyate /
analyzed: tasyām apekṣitam aiśvaryam ca vaktum navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ ārabhyate
translated: In that (chapter), the necessary (topic) is the (Lord's) sovereignty. The ninth chapter begins to describe that.

original: sarvaśāstrasārabhūtasya gītāśāstrasyāpi madhyam adhyāyaṣaṭkam eva sāram /
analyzed: sarva śāstra sāra bhūtasya gītā śāstrasya api madhyam adhyāya ṣaṭkam eva sāram
translated: The middle six chapters are the essence of the Gita scripture, which is the essence of all scriptures.

original: tasyāpi madhyamau navamadaśamāv eva sārāv ity ato 'tra nirūpayiṣyamāṇam arthaṃ stauti idaṃ tv iti tribhiḥ /
analyzed: tasya api madhyamau navama daśamau eva sārau iti atas tra nirūpayiṣyamāṇam artham stauti idam tu iti tribhiḥ
translated: Of that (middle six chapters), the ninth and tenth are the essence. Therefore, he praises the topic to be described here with three (verses) beginning with this (verse).

original: dvitīyatṛtīyādhyāyādiṣu yad uktaṃ mokṣopayogijñānaṃ guhyam /
analyzed: dvitīya tṛtīya adhyāya ādiṣu yat uktam mokṣa upayogi jñānam guhyam
translated: The secret knowledge useful for liberation that was stated in the second, third, and other chapters,

original: saptamāṣṭamayor matprāptyupayogijñānaṃ jñāyate 'nena bhagavattattvam iti jñānaṃ bhaktitattvaṃ guhyataram /
analyzed: saptama aṣṭamayoḥ mad prāpti upayogi jñānam jñāyate nena bhagavat tattvam iti jñānam bhakti tattvam guhyataram
translated: and the knowledge useful for attaining Me in the seventh and eighth (chapters) is the knowledge of the truth of the Lord. It is called the secret of secrets.

original: atra tu kevalaśuddhabhaktilakṣaṇaṃ jñānaṃ guhyatamaṃ prakarṣeṇaiva tubhyaṃ vakṣyāmi /
analyzed: atra tu kevala śuddha bhakti lakṣaṇam jñānam guhyatamam prakarṣeṇa eva tubhyam vakṣyāmi
translated: Here, I will speak to you of the most secret knowledge, which is characterized by pure devotion alone.

original: atra tu jñānaśabdena bhaktir avaśyaṃ vyākhyeyā /
analyzed: atra tu jñāna śabdena bhaktiḥ avaśyam vyākhyeyā
translated: Here, the word knowledge must be explained as devotion.

original: na tu prathamaṣaṭkoktaṃ prasiddhaṃ jñānam /
analyzed: na tu prathama ṣaṭka uktam prasiddham jñānam
translated: But not the well-known knowledge stated in the first six chapters.

original: paraśloke 'vyayam anaśvaram iti viśeṣaṇadānād guṇātītatvalābhād guṇātītā bhaktir eva /
translated: In the next verse, by giving the qualification imperishable, it becomes the transcendence of qualities. Therefore, it is devotion that transcends qualities,

original: na tu jñānam /
analyzed: na tu jñānam
translated: but not knowledge.

original: tasya sāttvikatvāt /
analyzed: tasya sāttvika tvāt
translated: Because that is of the sattva quality.

original: aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣā dharmasyāsya ity agrimaśloke dharmaśabdenāpi bhaktir evocyate /
analyzed: aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣāḥ dharmasya asya iti agrima śloke dharma śabdena api bhaktiḥ eva ucyate
translated: Those who lack faith in this dharma in the next verse, the word dharma also refers to devotion itself.

original: anasūyave 'matsarāyety anyo 'pīdam amatsarāyaivopadiśed iti vidhir vyañjitaḥ /
analyzed: anasūyave matsarāya iti anyaḥ pi idam amatsarāya eva upadiśet iti vidhiḥ vyañjitaḥ
translated: To one who is not envious, to one who is free from jealousy. It is implied that another person should also teach this to one who is free from jealousy.

original: vijñānasahitaṃ madaparokṣānubhavaparyantam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna sahitam mad aparokṣa anubhava paryantam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is accompanied by knowledge and culminates in the direct experience of Me.

original: aśubhāt saṃsārād bhaktipratibandhakād antarāyād
analyzed: aśubhāt saṃsārāt bhakti pratibandhakāt antarāyāt
translated: From inauspiciousness, from the world, from obstacles that hinder devotion,

analyzed: vā
translated: or from anything else.

original: baladevaḥ 🔽bhaktyuddīptikaraṃ svasya pāramaiśvaryam adbhutam /
analyzed: baladevaḥ  bhakti uddīpti karam svasya pāramaiśvaryam adbhutam
translated: Balarama🔽In the ninth chapter, Hari has spoken of His own wonderful supreme lordship, which illuminates devotion,

original: svabhakteś ca mahotkarṣaṃ navame harir ūcivān //
analyzed: sva bhakteḥ ca mahā utkarṣam navame hariḥ ūcivān
translated: and of the great excellence of devotion to Him.

original: vijñānānandaghano 'saṅkhyeyakalyāṇaguṇaratnālayaḥ sarveśvaro 'haṃ śuddhabhaktisulabha
analyzed: vijñāna ānanda ghanaḥ saṅkhyeya kalyāṇa guṇa ratna ālayaḥ sarveśvaraḥ haṃ śuddha bhakti sulabha
translated: I am the Lord of all, the abode of innumerable jewels of auspicious qualities, dense with the bliss of knowledge, easily accessible through pure devotion.

original: iti saptamādibhyām abhidhāyedānīṃ bhakter uddīpakaṃ nijaiśvaryaṃ tasyāḥ prabhāvaacābhidhāsyann
analyzed: iti saptama ādibhyām abhidhāya idānīm bhakteḥ uddīpakam nija aiśvaryam tasyāḥ
translated: Having thus described myself in the seventh and other chapters, now, intending to describe my lordship, which illuminates devotion, and its power,

original: ādau tāṃ stauti idam iti tribhiḥ /
analyzed: ādau tām stauti idam iti tribhiḥ
translated: he praises devotion first with three verses beginning with this.

original: idaṃ jñānaṃ matkīrtanādilakṣaṇabhaktirūpam /
analyzed: idam jñānam mad kīrtana ādi lakṣaṇa bhakti rūpam
translated: This knowledge is in the form of devotion characterized by glorifying Me and so on.

original: paratra dharmasyāsya ity ukteḥ /
analyzed: paratra dharmasya asya iti ukteḥ
translated: Because it is said to be the dharma of this in the next verse.

original: kīrtanādeś cicchaktivṛttitvāt /
analyzed: kīrtana ādeḥ cicchakti vṛtti tvāt
translated: Because the glorification is the manifestation of the potency of consciousness.

original: jñāyate 'nena iti nirukteś ca /
analyzed: jñāyate nena iti nirukteḥ ca
translated: And because of the etymological explanation: It is known by this.

original: tat kila guhyatamam /
analyzed: tat kila guhyatamam
translated: That is indeed the most secret.

original: dvitīyādāv upadiṣṭaṃ madaiśvaryajñānaṃ guhyataram ity arthaḥ /
translated: The meaning is that the knowledge of My opulence, which is taught in the second chapter and so on, is more secret.

original: navamādāv upadeśyaṃ tu kevalabhaktilakṣaṇam idaṃ jñānaṃ guhyatamam ity arthaḥ /
translated: But the meaning is that this knowledge, characterized by pure devotion, which is to be taught in the ninth chapter and so on, is the most secret.

original: tac ca vijñānasahitaṃ madanubhavāvasānaṃ te vakṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat ca vijñāna sahitam mad anubhava avasānam te vakṣyāmi
translated: And that, along with knowledge, ending with the experience of Me, I will tell you.

original: kīdṛśāyety āha anasūyava iti /🔽madguṇeṣu doṣāroparahitāya durgamasya svarahasyasyānukampayopadeṣṭari mayi nijaiśvaryaprakhyāpanenātmānaṃ praśaṃsasīti
analyzed: kīdṛśāya iti āha anasūyave iti  mad guṇeṣu doṣa āropa rahitāya durgamasya sva rahasyasya anukampayā upadeṣṭari mayi nija aiśvarya prakhyāpanena ātmānam praśaṃsasi iti
translated: To what kind of person? He says: free from envy.

original: doṣadṛṣṭiśūnyāyety arthaḥ /
analyzed: doṣa dṛṣṭi śūnyāya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: to one who is free from the fault of seeing faults in Me, who is the teacher out of compassion of the difficult-to-understand secret, who praises himself by proclaiming his own opulence in teaching this to one who is free from envy.

original: tenānyo 'py etad anasūyaṃ prati brūyād iti darśitam /
analyzed: tena anyaḥ api etat anasūyam prati brūyāt iti darśitam
translated: By that, it is shown that someone else should also speak this to one who is free from envy.

original: yaj jñātvā tvam aśubhāt saṃsārān mokṣyase ////
analyzed: yat jñātvā tvam aśubhāt saṃsārāt mokṣyase
translated: By knowing which you will be liberated from inauspicious saṃsāra.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: rājavidyā rājaguhyaṃ pavitram idam uttamam /
analyzed: rāja vidyā rāja guhyam pavitram idam uttamam
translated: This is the royal knowledge, the royal secret, the most purifying.

original: pratyakṣāvagamaṃ dharmyaṃ susukhaṃ kartum avyayam ////
analyzed: pratyakṣa avagamam dharmyam su sukham kartum avyayam
translated: It is directly perceptible, righteous, very easy to practice, and imperishable.

original: śrīdharaḥ kiṃ ca rājavidyeti /
analyzed: ca
translated: Śrīdhara: And what is more, it is the royal knowledge, etc.

original: idaṃ jñānaṃ rājavidyā vidyānāṃ rājā /
analyzed: idam jñānam rāja vidyā vidyānām rājā
translated: This knowledge is the king of all sciences, the king of the kings of sciences.

original: rājaguhyaṃ guhyānāṃ ca rājā /
analyzed: rāja guhyam guhyānām ca rājā
translated: It is the king of all secrets, the king of the kings of secrets.

original: vidyāsu gopyeṣu ca atirahasyaṃ śreṣṭham ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: vidyāsu gopyeṣu ca ati rahasyam śreṣṭham iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is the most secret of all secret sciences.

original: rājadantāditvād upasarjanasya paratvam /
analyzed: rājadanta ādi tvāt upasarjanasya para tvam
translated: Due to being like 'king's teeth' etc., the prefix becomes supreme.

original: rājñāṃ vidyā rājñāṃ guhyam iti vā /
analyzed: rājñām vidyā rājñām guhyam iti vā
translated: Or it is the secret of all kings, the secret of the kings.

original: uttamaṃ pavitram idam atyantapāvanam /
analyzed: uttamam pavitram idam atyanta pāvanam
translated: This is the best purifier, the most purifying.

original: jñānināṃ pratyakṣāvagamaṃ ca /
analyzed: jñāninām pratyakṣa avagamam ca
translated: And it is directly perceived by the wise.

original: pratyakṣaḥ spaṣṭo 'vagamo 'vabodho yasya tat pratyakṣāvagamam /
analyzed: pratyakṣaḥ spaṣṭaḥ vagamaḥ vabodhaḥ yasya tat pratyakṣāvagamam
translated: That which has direct, clear understanding is directly perceived.

original: dṛṣṭaphalam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa phalam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it has visible results.

original: dharmyaṃ dharmād anapetam /
analyzed: dharmyam dharmāt an apetam
translated: It is righteous, not apart from dharma.

original: vedoktasarvadharmaphalatvāt /
analyzed: veda ukta sarva dharma phalatvāt
translated: Because it is the result of all dharmas taught in the Vedas.

original: kartuṃ ca susukhaṃ kartuṃ śakyam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kartum ca su sukham kartum śakyam iti arthaḥ
translated: And it is easy to perform, the meaning is that it can be performed.

original: avyayaṃ cākṣayaphalatvāt ////
analyzed: avyayam ca akṣaya phala tvāt
translated: And it is imperishable, because it has inexhaustible results.

original: madhusūdanaḥ punas tadābhimukhyāya tajjñānaṃ stauti rājeti /
analyzed: stauti   iti
translated: Madhusudana again praises that knowledge for the purpose of inclining towards it, with the word 'raja'.

original: rājavidyā sarvāsāṃ vidyānāṃ rājā sarvāvidyānāśakatvāt /
analyzed: rāja vidyā sarvāsām vidyānām rājā sarva avidyā anāśaka tvāt
translated: It is the king of all sciences, the king of the kings of sciences, because it destroys all ignorance.

original: vidyāntarasyāvidyaikadeśavirodhitvāt /
analyzed: vidyā antarasya avidyā eka deśa virodhi tvāt
translated: Because other sciences only oppose a part of ignorance.

original: tathā rājaguhyaṃ sarveṣāṃ guhyānāṃ rājā /
analyzed: tathā rāja guhyam sarveṣām guhyānām rājā
translated: Similarly, it is the king of all secrets, the king of the kings of secrets.

original: anekajanmakṛtasukṛtasādhyatvena bahubhir ajñātatvāt /
analyzed: aneka janma kṛta sukṛta sādhya tvena bahubhiḥ ajñāta tvāt
translated: Because it is not known by many due to being accomplished by good deeds done in many births.

original: rājadantāditvād upasarjanasya paranipātaḥ /
analyzed: rājadanta ādi tvāt upasarjanasya para nipātaḥ
translated: The prefix is placed after the principal word like 'rajadanta' etc.

original: pavitram idam uttamaṃ prāyaścittair hi kiṃcid ekam eva pāpaṃ nivartyate /
analyzed: pavitram idam uttamam prāyaścittaiḥ hi kiṃcid ekam eva pāpam nivartyate
translated: This is the most sacred, for by expiations only one sin is removed.

original: nivṛttaṃ ca tatsvakāraṇe sūkṣmarūpeṇa tiṣṭhaty eva /
analyzed: nivṛttam ca tat sva kāraṇe sūkṣma rūpeṇa tiṣṭhati eva
translated: And that sin, when removed, remains in its subtle form in its cause.

original: yataḥ punas tatpāpam upacinoti puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: yatas punar tat pāpam upacinoti puruṣaḥ
translated: From which that sin again accumulates for a person.

original: idaṃ tv anekajanmasahasrasañcitānāṃ sarveṣām api pāpānāṃ sthūlasūkṣmāvasthānāṃ tatkāraṇasya cājñānasya ca sadya evocchedakam /
analyzed: idam tu aneka janma sahasra sañcitānām sarveṣām api pāpānām sthūla sūkṣma avasthānām tad kāraṇasya ca ajñānasya ca sadyas eva ucchedakam
translated: But this immediately destroys all the sins accumulated over thousands of births, even the gross and subtle states of those sins and the ignorance that is their cause.

original: ataḥ sarvottamaṃ pāvanam idam eva /
analyzed: atas sarva uttamam pāvanam idam eva
translated: Therefore, this alone is the most excellent and purifying.

original: na cātīndriye dharma ivātra kasyacit sandehaḥ svarūpataḥ phalataś ca pratyakṣatād ity āha pratyakṣāvagamam avagamyate /
analyzed: na ca atīndriye dharme iva atra kasyacid sandehaḥ svarūpataḥ phalataḥ ca pratyakṣa tāt iti āha pratyakṣa avagamam avagamyate
translated: And unlike a transcendental dharma, there is no doubt here about its nature or result, because it is directly perceived. Thus it is said: 'It is directly perceived.'

original: nenety avagamo mānam avagamyate prāpyata ity avagamaḥ phalaṃ pratyakṣāvagamo mānam asminn iti svarūpataḥ sākṣipratyakṣatvam /
analyzed: nena iti avagamaḥ mānam avagamyate prāpyate iti avagamaḥ phalam pratyakṣa avagamaḥ mānam asmin iti svarūpataḥ sākṣi pratyakṣa tvam
translated: 'Ava' means 'to be known', 'gam' means 'to be obtained'. 'Ava-gam' means 'to be known'. The result is 'to be obtained'. 'Pratyaksha-avagama' means 'to be known by direct perception'. This is its nature. It is directly perceived by the witness.

original: pratyakṣo 'vagamo 'syeti phalataḥ sākṣipratyakṣatvam /
analyzed: pratyakṣaḥ sya iti phalataḥ sākṣi pratyakṣa tvam
translated: It is called 'perception' because it is the direct apprehension of the self.

original: mayedaṃ viditvam ato naṣṭam idānīm atra mamājñānam iti hi sārvalaukikaḥ sākṣyanubhavaḥ /
analyzed: mayā idam atas naṣṭam idānīm atra mama ajñānam iti hi sārvalaukikaḥ sākṣī anubhavaḥ
translated: The common experience of the world is that one knows 'I knew this before, but now my ignorance of it is destroyed.'

original: evaṃ lokānubhavasiddhatve 'pi tajjñānaṃ dharmyaṃ dharmād anapetam anekajanmasaṃcitaniṣkāmadharmaphalam /
analyzed: evam loka anubhava siddha tve tat jñānam dharmyam dharmāt an apetam aneka janma saṃcita niṣkāma dharma phalam
translated: Thus, even though that knowledge is established by worldly experience, it is 'dharmic,' not apart from dharma, the fruit of the desireless dharma accumulated over many births.

original: tarhi duḥsampādaṃ syān nety āha /
analyzed: tarhi duḥsampādam syāt na iti āha
translated: If so, it would be difficult to accomplish. No, he says.

original: susukhaṃ kartuṃ gurūpadarśitavicārasahakṛtena vedāntavākyena sukhena kartuṃ śakyaṃ na deśakālādivyavadhānam apekṣate pramāṇavastuparatantratvāj
analyzed: su sukham kartum guru upadarśita vicāra sahakṛtena vedānta vākyena sukhena kartum śakyam na deśa kāla ādi vyavadhānam apekṣate pramāṇa vastu paratantra tvāt
translated: It is very easy to do, because it can be done easily with the help of the Vedanta texts pointed out by the teacher. It does not depend on place, time, etc.,

original: jñānasya /🔽evam anāyāsasādhyatve svalpaphalatvaṃ syād atyāyāsasādhyānām eva karmaṇāṃ mahāphalatvadarśanād iti nety āha avyayam /
analyzed: jñānasya  evam anāyāsa sādhya tve su alpa phala tvam syāt atyāyāsa sādhyānām eva karmaṇām mahā phala tva darśanāt iti na iti āha avyayam
translated: because knowledge depends on the object of valid cognition.🔽Thus, even though it is accomplished without effort, it would have a small result, because only actions accomplished with great effort are seen to have great results. No, he says, it is imperishable.

original: evam anāyāsasādhyasyāpy asya phalato vyahto nāstīty avyayam akṣayaphalam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: evam anāyāsa sādhyasya api asya phalataḥ na asti iti avyayam akṣaya phalam iti arthaḥ
translated: Thus, even though it is accomplished without effort, it has no decay in terms of its result. The meaning is that it has an inexhaustible result.

original: karmaṇā tv atimahatām api kṣayiphalatvam eva yo vā etad akṣaraṃ gārgy aviditvāsmil
analyzed: karmaṇā tu ati mahatām api kṣayi phala tvam eva yaḥ vai etat akṣaram gārgi a viditvā asmin
translated: Even for those of extremely great deeds, the result is only perishable. O Gārgya, one who, not knowing this imperishable syllable,

original: loke juhoti yajate tapas tapyate bahūni varṣasahasrāṇy antavad evāsya tad bhavati
analyzed: loke juhoti yajate tapaḥ tapyate bahūni varṣa sahasrāṇi antavat eva asya tat bhavati
translated: Even for those of extremely great deeds, the result is only perishable. He who, O Garga, without knowing this imperishable Brahman, offers sacrifices, worships, and performs austerities in this world for many thousands of years, that (good deed) of his becomes limited (in effect).

original: iti BAU / / śruteḥ /
analyzed: iti bau śruteḥ
translated: Thus it is said in the Bauddha scriptures.

original: tasmāt sarvotkṛṣṭatvāc chraddheyam evātmajñānam ////
analyzed: tasmāt sarva utkṛṣṭa tvāt śraddheyam eva ātma jñānam
translated: Therefore, because of its being the most excellent of all, the knowledge of the Self is to be believed in.

original: viśvanāthaḥ kiṃ ca /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ kim ca
translated: And what else?

original: idaṃ jñānaṃ rājavidyā vidyā upāsanā vividhā eva bhaktayaḥ tāsāṃ rājā /
analyzed: idam jñānam rāja vidyā vidyā upāsanāḥ vividhāḥ eva bhaktayaḥ tāsām rājā
translated: This knowledge is the king of royal knowledge, the king of various kinds of worship and devotion.

original: rājadantāditvād paranipātaḥ /
analyzed: rājadanta ādi tvāt para nipātaḥ
translated: The suffix 'paranipa' is added because it ends in 'raj' like 'rajadanta' (royal tooth).

original: guhyānāṃ rājeti bhaktimātram evātiguhyaṃ tasya bahuvidhasyāpi rājā iti atiguhyatamam /
analyzed: guhyānām rājā iti bhakti mātram eva ati guhyam tasya bahuvidhasya api rājā iti ati guhyatamam
translated: The king of secrets means that devotion alone is extremely secret, and it is the king of that which has many varieties, thus it is the most secret of all.

original: pavitram idam iti sarvapāpaprāyaścittatvāt tvaṃ padārtahjñānāc ca sakāśād api pāvitryakaram /
analyzed: pavitram idam iti sarva pāpa prāyaścitta tvāt tvam ca sakāśāt api pāvitryakaram
translated: This is pure, because it is the expiation for all sins. And the word 'tvam' (you) is purer than even knowledge.

original: anekajanmasahasrasañcitānāṃ sarveṣām api pāpānāṃ sthūlasūkṣmāvasthānāṃ tatkāraṇasya cājñānasya ca sadya evocchedakam /
analyzed: aneka janma sahasra sañcitānām sarveṣām api pāpānām sthūla sūkṣma avasthānām tad kāraṇasya ca ajñānasya ca sadyas eva ucchedakam
translated: It immediately destroys all sins, gross and subtle, accumulated over many thousands of births, and also the ignorance which is their cause.

original: ataḥ sarvottamaṃ pāvanam idam eva iti madhusūdana sarasvatīpādāḥ /
analyzed: atas sarva uttamam pāvanam idam eva iti madhusūdana sarasvatī pādāḥ
translated: Therefore, the feet of Madhusudana Sarasvati say that this is the most excellent and purifying.

original: pratyakṣa evāvagamo 'nubhavo yasya tat /
analyzed: pratyakṣaḥ eva avagamaḥ nubhavaḥ yasya tat
translated: That which has direct experience as its basis is direct experience.

original: bhaktiḥ pareśānubhavo viraktir
translated: Devotion is the experience of the Supreme Lord, detachment

original: anyatra caiṣa trika ekakālaḥ /🔽prapadyamānasya yathāśnataḥ syus
analyzed: anyatra ca eṣa trikaḥ eka kālaḥ  prapadyamānasya yathā aśnataḥ syuḥ
translated: And this triad is at one time for one who is devoted.🔽For one who is devoted, there is satisfaction, nourishment, and the removal of hunger,

original: tuṣṭiḥ puṣṭiḥ kṣudapāyo 'nughāsam // BhP / /
analyzed: tuṣṭiḥ puṣṭiḥ kṣudh apāyaḥ nughāsam
translated: With each morsel, as for one who is eating.

original: ity ekādaśoketḥ pratipadam eva bhajanānurūpabhagavadanubhavalābhāt /
analyzed: iti pratipadam eva bhajana anurūpa bhagavat anubhava lābhāt
translated: Thus, in the eleventh chapter, one attains the experience of the Lord in accordance with one's devotion at every step.

original: dharmyaṃ dharmād anapetaṃ sarvadharmākaraṇe 'pi sarvadharmasiddheḥ
analyzed: dharmyam dharmāt an apetam sarva dharma akaraṇe sarva dharma siddheḥ
translated: It is righteous, not apart from dharma, because it leads to the accomplishment of all dharma even when all other duties are not performed.

original: yathā taror mūlaniṣecanena
analyzed: yathā taroḥ mūla niṣecanena
translated: Just as by sprinkling water at the root of a tree,

original: tṛpyanti tatskandhabhujopaśākhāḥ /
analyzed: tṛpyanti tad skandha bhuja upaśākhāḥ
translated: Its trunk, branches, and twigs are satisfied,

original: prāṇopahārāc ca yathendriyāṇāṃ
analyzed: prāṇa upahārāt ca yathā indriyāṇām
translated: And just as by offering life, the senses

original: tathaiva sarvārhaṇam acyutejyā //
analyzed: tathā eva sarva arhaṇam acyuta ijyā
translated: Are satisfied in the same way, the worship of all is the worship of the imperishable Lord.

original: BhP / / iti nāradokteḥ /
translated: Thus it is said by Narada.

original: kartuṃ susukham iti karmajñānādāv iva nātra ko 'pi kāravāṅmānasakleśātiśayaḥ śravaṇakīrtanādibhakteḥ śrotrādīndriyavyāpāramātratvāt
analyzed: kartum su sukham iti karma jñāna ādau iva na atra kaḥ pi kāra vāc mānasa kleśa atiśayaḥ śravaṇa kīrtana ādi bhakteḥ śrotra ādi indriya vyāpāra mātra tvāt
translated: To perform is very easy, because unlike in the case of ritual and knowledge, etc., there is no excess of mental or physical exertion in devotion like hearing and chanting, as it is merely the activity of the sense of hearing, etc.

original: avyayaṃ karmajñānādivan na naśvaraṃ nirguṇatvāt ////
analyzed: avyayam karma jñāna ādi vat na naśvaram nirguṇa tvāt
translated: It is imperishable, like the knowledge of action etc., not perishable, because of being without qualities.

original: baladevaḥ rājavidyeti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ rāja vidyā iti
translated: Balarama says The royal knowledge

original: vidyānāṃ śāṇḍilyavaiśvānaradaharādiśabdapūrvāṇāṃ rājā rājavidyā /
analyzed: vidyānām śāṇḍilya vaiśvānara dahara ādi śabda pūrvāṇām rājā rāja vidyā
translated: The king of the vidyas, which are preceded by words like Shandilya, Vaishvanara, and Dhara, is the royal knowledge.

original: guhyānāṃ jīvātmayāthātmyādirahasyānāṃ rājā rājaguhyam idaṃ bhaktirūpaṃ jñānam /
analyzed: guhyānām jīvātma yāthātmya ādi rahasyānām rājā rāja guhyam idam bhakti rūpam jñānam
translated: The king of the secrets, which are the mysteries of the true nature of the individual self and so on, is this knowledge in the form of devotion, which is the royal secret.

original: rājadantāditvād upasarjanasya paranipātaḥ /
analyzed: rājadanta ādi tvāt upasarjanasya para nipātaḥ
translated: Due to being like the royal teeth, the subordinate word is placed after the other word.

original: tathātve pratipādayituṃ viśinaṣṭi uttamaṃ pavitraṃ liṅgadehaparyantasarvapāpapraśamanāt /
analyzed: tathātve pratipādayitum viśinaṣṭi uttamam pavitram liṅga deha paryanta sarva pāpa praśamanāt
translated: To explain that, it is distinguished as the best purifier, because it pacifies all sins up to the end of the body.

original: yad uktaṃ pādme
analyzed: yat uktam pādme
translated: As said in the Padma Purana:

original: aprārabdhaphalaṃ pāpaṃ kūṭaṃ bījaṃ phalonmukham /
analyzed: a prārabdha phalam pāpam kūṭam bījam phala unmukham
translated: The sin whose fruit has not yet begun, the seed that is about to bear fruit,

original: krameṇaiva pralīyante viṣṇubhaktiratātmanām // iti /
analyzed: krameṇa eva pralīyante viṣṇu bhakti rata ātmanām iti
translated: Gradually dissolves away for those whose minds are devoted to Vishnu.

original: kramo 'tra parṇaśatakavedhavad bodhyaḥ /
analyzed: kramaḥ tra parṇa śataka vedha vat bodhyaḥ
translated: The sequence here should be understood like the piercing of a hundred leaves.

original: pratyakṣāvagamam avagamyata ity avagamo viṣayaḥ /
analyzed: pratyakṣa avagamam avagamyate iti avagamaḥ viṣayaḥ
translated: The object is that which is understood, which is directly perceived.

original: sa yasmin pratyakṣe 'sti śravaṇādike 'bhyastyamāne tasmiṃs tadviṣayaḥ puruṣottamo 'ham āvirbhavāmi /
analyzed: sa yasmin pratyakṣe sti śravaṇa ādike bhyastyamāne tasmin tad viṣayaḥ puruṣottamaḥ ham āvirbhavāmi
translated: When that is present in the direct perception, which is being practiced, in that I, the best of men, manifest myself as the object of that.

original: evam āha sūtrakāraḥ prakāśaś ca karmaṇy abhyāsāt iti /
analyzed: evam āha sūtrakāraḥ prakāśaḥ ca karmaṇi abhyāsāt iti
translated: Thus has the author of the Sutras said: 'And illumination is easy to perform by practice' (Ka. 1.2.7).

original: dharmyaṃ dharmād anapetaṃ guruśuśrūṣādidharmair nityaṃ puṣyamāṇam /
analyzed: dharmyam dharmāt an apetam guru śuśrūṣā ādi dharmaiḥ nityam puṣyamāṇam
translated: It is righteous, not divorced from Dharma, always nourished by the duties of serving the teacher and so on.

original: śrutiś ca ācāryavān puruṣo veda ity ādyā /
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca ācāryavān puruṣaḥ veda iti ādyā
translated: And the Shruti declares, 'A person who has a teacher knows' (Tai. 2.1.1), and so on.

original: kartuṃ susukhaṃ sukhasādhyam /
analyzed: kartum su sukham sukha sādhyam
translated: It is easy to perform, easy to accomplish.

original: śrotrādivyāpāramātratvāt tulasīpātrāmbuculukamātropakaraṇatvāc ca /
analyzed: śrotra ādi vyāpāra mātra tvāt tulasī pātra ambu culuka mātra upakaraṇa tvāt ca
translated: Because it consists merely of the functioning of the ears, etc., and because it requires only a handful of water in a basil leaf cup.

original: avyayam avināśimokṣe 'pi tasyānuvṛtteḥ /
analyzed: avyayam a vināśi mokṣe pi tasya anuvṛtteḥ
translated: It is imperishable, because it continues even in the imperishable state of liberation.

original: evaṃ vakṣyati bhaktyā mām abhijānāti ity ādinā /
analyzed: evam vakṣyati bhaktyā mām abhijānāti iti ādinā
translated: Thus he will say later on, 'By devotion one knows Me' (11.54), and so on.

original: karmayogādikaṃ tu nedṛśam ato 'sya rājavidyātvam /
analyzed: karma yoga ādikam tu nā īdṛśam atas sya rāja vidyā tvam
translated: But Karma-yoga, etc., are not like this. Therefore, this (knowledge) is the knowledge of kings.

original: tatrāhuḥ rājñāṃ vidyā /
analyzed: tatra āhuḥ rājñām vidyā
translated: In this regard, they say: It is the knowledge of kings.

original: rājñāṃ guhyam iti rājñām ivodāracetasāṃ kāruṇikānām iva divam api tucchīkurvatām iyaḥ vidyā na tu śīghraṃ putrādilipsayā devān abhyarcatāṃ 🔽dīnacetasāṃ karmiṇām /
analyzed: rājñām guhyam iti rājñām iva udāra cetasām kāruṇikānām iva divam api tucchīkurvatām iyaḥ vidyā na tu śīghram putra ādi lipsayā devān abhyarcatām 🔽dīna cetasām karmiṇām
translated: It is the secret of kings, like the knowledge of kings, of magnanimous people, of compassionate people, who make even heaven insignificant, but not of the ritualists of small minds who worship the gods with the desire for sons, etc. quickly.

original: rājāno hi mahāratnādisampad apy anihnuvānāḥ svamantraṃ yathātiyatnān nihnūyate tathānyāṃ vidyām anihnuvānā madbhaktā etām atiyatnān nihnuvīrann
analyzed: rājānaḥ hi mahā ratna ādi sampad api a nihnuvānāḥ sva mantram yathā ati yatnāt nihnūyate tathā anyām vidyām a nihnuvānāḥ mad bhaktāḥ etām ati yatnāt nihnuvīran  /
translated: For, kings, even though not denying the possession of great jewels etc., deny their own counsel with great effort; in the same way, my devotees, not denying other knowledge, would deny this with great effort.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: samānam anyat ////
analyzed: samānam anyat
translated: The rest is similar.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣā dharmasyāsya paraṃtapa /
analyzed: aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣāḥ dharmasya asya paraṃtapa
translated: Men who lack faith in this dharma, O scorcher of foes,

original: aprāpya māṃ nivartante mṛtyusaṃsāravartmani ////
analyzed: a prāpya mām nivartante mṛtyu saṃsāra vartmani
translated: return without attaining Me, on the path of worldly existence with death.

original: śrīdharaḥ nanv evam asyātisukaratve ke nāma saṃsāriṇaḥ syuḥ /
translated: [Sridhar says:] If it is so easy, then who would be worldly?

original: tatrāha aśraddadhānā iti /
analyzed: tatra āha aśraddadhānāḥ iti
translated: To that [the Lord] says, Men who lack faith.

original: asya bhaktisahitajñānalakṣaṇasya /
analyzed: asya bhakti sahita jñāna lakṣaṇasya
translated: In this dharma characterized by knowledge accompanied by devotion.

original: dharmasyeti karmaṇi ṣaṣṭhī /
analyzed: dharmasya iti karmaṇi ṣaṣṭhī
translated: The genitive case is used in of this dharma.

original: imaṃ dharmam aśraddadhānā āstikyenāsvīkurvanta upāyāntarair matprāptaye kṛtaprayatnā api mām aprāpya mṛtyuyukte saṃsāravartmani nimitte
analyzed: imam dharmam aśraddadhānāḥ āstikyena asvīkurvantaḥ upāya antaraiḥ mad prāptaye kṛta prayatnāḥ api mām a prāpya mṛtyu yukte saṃsāra vartmani nimitte
translated: Those who lack faith in this dharma, who do not accept it with devotion, who strive to attain Me by other means, return without attaining Me, on the path of worldly existence with death as the cause.

original: nivartante /
analyzed: nivartante
translated: They turn back.

original: mṛtyuvyāpte saṃsāramārge paribhramantīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: mṛtyu vyāpte saṃsāra mārge paribhramanti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they wander on the path of worldly existence pervaded by death.

original: madhusūdanaḥ evam asya sukaratve sarvotkṛṣṭatve ca sarve 'pi kuto 'tra na pravartante /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ evam asya sukara tve sarva utkṛṣṭa tve ca sarve na pravartante
translated: Madhusudana: Thus, if it is easy and the best of all, then why do not all engage in it?

original: tathā ca na ko 'pi saṃsārī syād ity ata āha aśraddadhānā iti /
analyzed: tathā ca na kaḥ pi saṃsārī syāt iti atas āha aśraddadhānāḥ iti
translated: And thus, there would be no one in the world of transmigration. Therefore, it is said, without faith.

original: asyātmajñānākhyasya dharmasya svarūpe sādhane phale ca śāstrapratipādite 'pi aśraddadhānā
analyzed: asya ātma jñāna ākhyasya dharmasya svarūpe sādhane phale ca śāstra pratipādite aśraddadhānā
translated: Even though the nature, means, and results of this dharma called knowledge of the Self are taught in the scriptures, those without faith

original: vedavirodhikuhetudarśanadūṣitāntaḥkaraṇatayā prāmāṇyam amanyamānāḥ pāpakāriṇo
analyzed: veda virodhi ku hetu darśana dūṣita antaḥkaraṇa tayā prāmāṇyam a manyamānāḥ pāpa kāriṇaḥ
translated: are sinners whose minds are corrupted by seeing false arguments that contradict the Vedas.

original: 'surasampadam ārūḍhāḥ svamatikalpitenopāyena kathaṃcid yatamānā api śāstravihitopāyābhāvād
analyzed: sura sampadam ārūḍhāḥ sva mati kalpitena upāyena kathaṃcid yatamānāḥ api śāstra vihita upāya abhāvāt
translated: Not considering it authoritative, they strive somehow by means of their own imagined methods, but due to the absence of the means taught in the scriptures,

original: aprāpya māṃ matprāptisādhanam apy alabdhvā nivartante niścayena vartante /
analyzed: a prāpya mām mad prāpti sādhanam api a labdhvā nivartante niścayena vartante
translated: they do not attain Me, nor do they obtain the means to attain Me, and they certainly turn away.

original: kva mṛtyuyukte saṃsāravartmani sarvadā jananamaraṇaprabandhena nārakitiryagādiyoniṣv eva bhramantīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: kva mṛtyu yukte saṃsāra vartmani sarvadā janana maraṇa prabandhena nāraki tiryak ādi yoniṣu eva bhramanti iti arthaḥ
translated: Where, on the path of worldly existence, which is always connected with death, do they wander only in the wombs of hell-beings, animals, and so on? This is the meaning.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanv evam asyātisukhakaratve sati ko nāma saṃsārī syāt /
translated: Visvanatha: Now, if it is so easy, then who would be a worldly being?

original: tatrāha aśraddadhānā iti /
analyzed: tatra āha aśraddadhānāḥ iti
translated: To that, it is said, without faith.

original: asyeti karmaṇi ṣaṣṭhī ārṣī /
analyzed: asya iti karmaṇi ṣaṣṭhī ārṣī
translated: The genitive case in the word asya is in the Vedic style.

original: imaṃ dharmam aśraddadhānāḥ śāstravākyaiḥ pratipāditaṃ bhakteḥ sarvotkarṣaṃ stutyarthavādam eva manyamānā āstikyena na svīkurvanti ye /
analyzed: imam dharmam aśraddadhānāḥ śāstra vākyaiḥ pratipāditam bhakteḥ sarva utkarṣam stuti arthavādam eva manyamānāḥ āstikyena na svīkurvanti ye
translated: Those who do not have faith in this religion, who consider the statement of the scriptures that devotion is the best of all as mere eulogy, do not accept it with conviction.

original: ta upāyāntarair matprāptaye kṛtaprayatnā api mām aprāpya mṛtyuvyāpte saṃsāravartmani nitarām atiśayena vartante ////
analyzed: te upāya antaraiḥ mad prāptaye kṛta prayatnāḥ api mām a prāpya mṛtyu vyāpte saṃsāra vartmani nitarām atiśayena vartante
translated: They, though making efforts to attain Me by other means, do not attain Me and continue to wander on the path of worldly existence, which is pervaded by death, to a very great extent.

original: baladevaḥ nanv evaṃ sukare dharme sthite na ko 'pi saṃsāred iti cet tatrāha aśraddadhānā iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu evam sukare dharme sthite na kaḥ saṃsāret iti ced tatra āha aśraddadhānāḥ iti
translated: Balarama: If it is argued that if the religion is so easy, then no one would be in worldly existence, then He says those who do not have faith etc.

original: dharmasyeti karmaṇi ṣaṣṭhī /
analyzed: dharmasya iti karmaṇi ṣaṣṭhī
translated: The genitive case in the word dharmasya is in the locative case.

original: imaṃ madbhaktilakṣaṇaṃ dharmam śrutyādiprasiddhaprabhāvam apy aśraddadhānā dṛḍhaviśvāsena tam agṛhṇataḥ stutimātram evaitad iti ye manyante /
analyzed: imam mad bhakti lakṣaṇam dharmam śruti ādi prasiddha prabhāvam api aśraddadhānāḥ dṛḍha viśvāsena tam agṛhṇataḥ stuti mātram eva etat iti ye manyante
translated: Even though this religion characterized by devotion to Me is well-known from the Vedas etc., those who do not accept it with firm faith, who consider it as mere praise,

original: te matprāptaye sādhanāntarāṇy anutiṣṭhanto 'pi bhaktyavahelanān mām aprāpya mṛtyuyukte saṃsāravartmani nitarām vartante ////🔽BhG /
analyzed: te mad prāptaye sādhana antarāṇi anutiṣṭhantaḥ api bhakti avahelanāt mām a prāpya mṛtyu yukte saṃsāra vartmani nitarām vartante 🔽bhg
translated: they, though practicing other means to attain Me, do not attain Me due to neglecting devotion and continue to wander on the path of worldly existence, which is pervaded by death, to a very great extent.

original: mayā tatam idaṃ sarvaṃ jagad avyaktamūrtinā /
analyzed: mayā tatam idam sarvam jagat avyakta mūrtinā
translated: 5.19 This entire world is pervaded by Me, who have an unmanifest form.

original: matsthāni sarvabhūtāni na cāhaṃ teṣv avasthitaḥ ////
analyzed: mad sthāni sarva bhūtāni na ca aham teṣu avasthitaḥ
translated: All beings abide in Me, but I do not abide in them.

original: śrīdharaḥ tad evaṃ vaktavyatayā prastutasya jñānasya stutyā śrotāram abhimukhīkṛtya tad eva jñānaṃ kathayati mayeti dvābhyām /
translated: Sri Sridhara: Having thus made the listener receptive by praising the knowledge that was introduced as something to be spoken about, He now speaks of that knowledge itself in two verses, beginning with by Me.

original: avyaktā 'tīndriyā mūrtiḥ svarūpaṃ yasya /
analyzed: avyaktā tīndriyā mūrtiḥ svarūpam yasya
translated: He who has an unmanifest, supersensible form.

original: tādṛśena mayā kāraṇabhūtena sarvam idaṃ jagat tataṃ vyāptam /
analyzed: tādṛśena mayā kāraṇa bhūtena sarvam idam jagat tatam vyāptam
translated: By Me, who am such and am the cause, this entire world is pervaded, is filled.

original: tat sṛṣṭvā tad evānuprāviśat ity ādi śruteḥ /
analyzed: tat sṛṣṭvā tat eva anuprāviśat iti ādi śruteḥ
translated: As is said in the Upanisads: Having created that, He entered it.

original: ataeva kāraṇabhūte mayi tiṣṭhantīti matsthāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni carācarāṇi /
analyzed: ataeva kāraṇa bhūte mayi tiṣṭhanti iti mad sthāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni carācarāṇi
translated: For this very reason, all beings, moving and unmoving, abide in Me, who am the cause.

original: evam api ghaṭādiṣu kāryeṣu mṛttikeva teṣu bhūteṣu nāham avasthitaḥ /
analyzed: evam api ghaṭa ādiṣu kāryeṣu mṛttikā iva teṣu bhūteṣu na aham avasthitaḥ
translated: Even so, I do not abide in those beings, just as clay does not abide in its effects, such as pots.

original: ākāśavad asaṅgatvāt ////🔽madhusūdanaḥ tad evaṃ vaktavyatayā pratijñātasya jñānasya vidhimukhenetaraniṣedhamukhena ca stutyābhimukhīkṛtam arjunaṃ prati tad evāha
analyzed: ākāśa vat a saṅga tvāt  madhusūdanaḥ tat evam vaktavya tayā pratijñātasya jñānasya vidhi mukhena itara niṣedha mukhena ca stutya abhimukhīkṛtam arjunam prati tat eva āha
translated: Because of non-attachment, like space.

original: dvābhyām mayeti /
analyzed: dvābhyām mayā iti
translated: Madhusudana: Having thus made Arjuna receptive by praising the knowledge that was promised as something to be spoken about, both by way of injunction and by way of the negation of other paths, He now speaks of that knowledge itself in two verses, beginning with by Me.🔽By Me etc.

original: idaṃ jagat sarvaṃ bhūtabhautikatatkāraṇarūpaṃ dṛśyajātaṃ madajñānakalpitaṃ
analyzed: idam jagat sarvam bhūta bhautika tad kāraṇa rūpam dṛśya jātam mad ajñāna kalpitam
translated: This entire world consisting of the elements, the objects of the elements and their causes, the visible creation, is imagined by my ignorance.

original: māyādhiṣṭhānena paramārthasatā sadrūpeṇa sphuraṇarūpeṇa ca tataṃ vyāptaṃ rajjukhaṇḍeneva
analyzed: māyā adhiṣṭhānena paramārtha satā sat rūpeṇa sphuraṇa rūpeṇa ca tatam vyāptam rajju khaṇḍena iva
translated: It is pervaded, i.e., filled, by me, who am the supreme reality, by my existence and by my manifestation, just as a piece of rope is filled by the piece of rope itself.

original: tadajñānakalpitaṃ sarpadhārādi /
analyzed: tat ajñāna kalpitam sarpa dhārā ādi
translated: The snake, the rope, etc., imagined in it are imagined by ignorance.

original: tvayā vāsudevena paricchinnena sarvaṃ jagat kathaṃ vyāptaṃ pratyakṣavirodhād iti
analyzed: tvayā vāsudevena paricchinnena sarvam jagat katham vyāptam pratyakṣa virodhāt iti
translated: How can the entire world be pervaded by you, Vāsudeva, who are limited, because of the contradiction with perception?

original: nety āha avyaktā sarvakaraṇāgocarībhūtā svaprakāśādvayacaitanyasadānandarūpā
analyzed: na iti āha avyaktā sarva karaṇa a gocarībhūtā sva prakāśa advaya caitanya sat ānanda rūpā
translated: No, he says. I am the unmanifest, i.e., beyond the reach of all the senses, of the nature of eternal consciousness and bliss, which is self-luminous and non-dual.

original: mūrtir yasya tena mayā vyāptam idaṃ sarvaṃ na tv anena dehenety arthaḥ /
analyzed: mūrtiḥ yasya tena mayā vyāptam idam sarvam na tu anena dehena iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that this entire world is pervaded by me, who have such a form, and not by this body.

original: ata eva santīva sphurantīva madrūpeṇa sthitāni matsthāni sarvabhūtāni sthāvarāṇi jaṅgamāni ca /
analyzed: atas eva santi iva sphuranti iva mad rūpeṇa sthitāni mad sthāni sarva bhūtāni sthāvarāṇi jaṅgamāni ca
translated: For this very reason, all beings, both moving and unmoving, appear as if existing, as if shining, as if abiding in my form, as if abiding in me.

original: paramārthatas tu na ca naivāhaṃ teṣu kalpiteṣu bhūtesv
analyzed: paramārthataḥ tu na ca nā eva aham teṣu kalpiteṣu bhūtesu
translated: But in reality, I do not abide in those beings that are imagined,

original: avasthitaḥ kalpitākalpitayoḥ sambandhāyogāt /
analyzed: avasthitaḥ kalpita a kalpitayoḥ sambandha ayogāt
translated: because it is impossible for the imagined and the un-imagined to be related.

original: ataevoktaṃ yatra yad adhyastaṃ tatkṛtena guṇena doṣeṇa vāṇumātreṇāpi na sa sambadhyata iti ////
analyzed: ataeva uktam yatra yat adhyastam tad kṛtena guṇena doṣeṇa vā aṇu mātreṇa api na sa sambadhyate iti
translated: Therefore it is said that what is superimposed on what is not connected with it even by an atom of the quality or defect produced by it.

original: viśvanāthaḥ yad dāsyabhaktāv etanmātraṃ madaiśvaryajñānaṃ madbhaktair apekṣitavyam ity āha saptabhiḥ /🔽avyaktā 'tīndriyā mūrtiḥ svarūpaṃ yasya tena mayā kāraṇabhūtena sarvam idaṃ jagat tataṃ vyāptam /🔽ataeva matsthāni mayi kāraṇabhūte pūrṇacaitanyasvarūpe sthitāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni carācarāṇi santi /🔽evam api ghaṭādiṣu svakāryeṣu mṛgādivatteṣu bhūteṣu nāham avasthito 'saṅgatvāt ////🔽baladevaḥ atha svabhaktyuddīpakam adbhutasvaiśvaryam āha mayeti /
analyzed: avyaktā tīndriyā mūrtiḥ svarūpam yasya tena mayā kāraṇa bhūtena sarvam idam jagat tatam vyāptam  ataeva mad sthāni mayi kāraṇa bhūte pūrṇa caitanya svarūpe sthitāni sarvāṇi bhūtāni cara acarāṇi santi  evam api ghaṭa ādiṣu sva kāryeṣu mṛga ādi vat teṣu bhūteṣu na aham avasthitaḥ saṅga tvāt
translated: Visvanatha: The Lord says in seven verses that this much knowledge of His opulence, which is the cause of His being a servant and devotee, should be desired by His devotees.

original: avyaktā indriyāgrāhyā mūrtiḥ svarūpaṃ yasya tena mayā sarvam idaṃ jagat tataṃ dhartuṃ niyantuṃ ca vyāptam /
analyzed: avyaktā indriya agrāhyā mūrtiḥ svarūpam yasya tena mayā sarvam idam jagat tatam dhartum niyantum ca vyāptam
translated: By Me, by whom this entire world is pervaded, by whom this world is filled, by whom this world is sustained, by whom this world is withdrawn at the time of dissolution, by whom this world is created again and again, by whom this world is protected, by whom this world is granted boons, by whom this world is glorified, by whom this world is made to dance, by whom this world is made to tremble, by whom this world is made to laugh, by whom this world is made to cry, by whom this world is made to be born, by whom this world is made to die, by whom this world is made to be happy, by whom this world is made to be miserable, by whom this world is made to be angry, by whom this world is made to be lustful, by whom this world is made to be greedy, by whom this world is made to be deluded, by whom this world is made to be fearful, by whom this world is made to be proud, by whom this world is made to be envious, by whom this world is made to be jealous, by whom this world is made to be deceitful, by whom this world is made to be cruel, by whom this world is made to be sinful, by whom this world is made to be a thief, by whom this world is made to be a drunkard, by whom this world is made to be a fool, by whom this world is made to be a sinner, by whom this world is made to be a heretic, by whom this world is made to be a non-believer, by whom this world is made to be a non-devotee, by whom this world is made to be a non-devotee of the Lord, by whom this world is made to be a non-devotee of the Vedas, by whom this world is made to be a non-devotee of the scriptures, by whom this world is made to be a non-devotee of the Puranas, by whom this world is made to be a non-devotee of the Itihasas, by whom this world is made to

original: ataeva sarvāṇi carācarāṇi bhūtāni vyāpake dhārake niyāmake ca mayi sthitāni bhavantīti teṣāṃ sthitis tadadhīnā nety arthaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva sarvāṇi carācarāṇi bhūtāni vyāpake dhārake niyāmake ca mayi sthitāni bhavanti iti teṣām sthitiḥ tad adhīnā na iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, all the moving and unmoving beings are established in Me, who am the all-pervading, supporting and regulating principle. The meaning is that their existence is dependent on Him.

original: iha nikhilajagadantaryāmiṇā svāṃśenāntaḥ praviśya niyacchāmi dadhāmi cety uktam /
analyzed: iha nikhila jagat antaryāmiṇā sva aṃśena antar praviśya niyacchāmi dadhāmi ca iti uktam
translated: Here it is said that He, who is the inner controller of the entire world, enters within as a part and restrains and supports.

original: āha caivaṃ śrutiḥ yaḥ pṛthivyāṃ tiṣṭhat ity ādinā /🔽ihāpi vakṣyati viṣṭabhyāham idaṃ kṛtsnam ity ādi ////
analyzed: āha ca evam śrutiḥ yaḥ pṛthivyām tiṣṭhat iti ādinā  iha api vakṣyati viṣṭabhya aham idam kṛtsnam iti ādi
translated: And the Shruti says thus: He who abides in the earth... etc.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Here also He will say: I support this entire world... etc.🔽BhG 9.6

original: na ca matsthāni bhūtāni paśya me yogam aiśvaram /
analyzed: na ca mad sthāni bhūtāni paśya me yogam aiśvaram
translated: And the beings are not established in Me. See My divine Yoga.

original: bhūtabhṛn na ca bhūtastho mamātmā bhūtabhāvanaḥ ////
analyzed: bhūta bhṛt na ca bhūta sthaḥ mama ātmā bhūta bhāvanaḥ
translated: The soul, which is the supporter of beings, is not situated in beings, but is the creator of the beings.

original: śrīdharaḥ kiṃ ca na ceti /
analyzed: ca   ca
translated: Shridhara says: What is more, not so, etc.

original: na ca mayi sthitāni bhūtāni /
analyzed: na ca mayi sthitāni bhūtāni
translated: The beings are not established in Me.

original: asaṅgatvād eva mama /
analyzed: a saṅga tvāt eva mama
translated: Because of My being unattached.

original: nanu tarhi vyāpakatvam āśrayatvaṃ ca pūrvoktaṃ viruddham ity āśaṅkyāha paśyeti /
analyzed: nanu tarhi vyāpaka tvam āśraya tvam ca pūrva uktam viruddham iti āśaṅkya āha paśya iti
translated: But then, is not what was said earlier about being all-pervading and being the support contradictory? With this doubt in mind, He says: See, etc.

original: me mama aiśvaryam asādhāraṇaṃ yogaṃ yuktim aghaṭanaghaṭanācāturyaṃ paśya /
analyzed: me mama aiśvaryam asādhāraṇam yogam yuktim a ghaṭana ghaṭana a cāturyam paśya
translated: See My divine Yoga, My extraordinary skill in arranging the unarranged.

original: madīyayogamāyāvaibhavasyāvirtarkyatvān na kiñcid viruddham ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: madīya yoga māyā vaibhavasya āvis tarkya tvāt na kiñcid viruddham iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: nothing is contradictory, because the greatness of my yoga-māyā is inconceivable.

original: anyad apy āścaryaṃ paśyety āha bhūteti /🔽bhūtāni bibharti dhārayatīti bhūtabhṛt /
analyzed: anyat api āścaryam paśya iti āha bhūta iti  bhūtāni bibharti dhārayati iti bhūta bhṛt
translated: He says, Look at another wonder with the word bhūta.🔽Bhūta-bharat means he supports, he sustains the elements.

original: bhūtāni bhāvayati pālayatīti bhūtabhāvanaḥ /
analyzed: bhūtāni bhāvayati pālayati iti bhūtabhāvanaḥ
translated: Bhūta-bhāvan means he nourishes, he protects the elements.

original: evaṃ bhūto 'pi mamātmā paraṃ svarūpaṃ bhūtastho na bhavatīti /
analyzed: evam bhūtaḥ pi mama ātmā param sva rūpam bhūta sthaḥ na bhavati iti
translated: Even though he is such, my Self, the supreme nature, does not dwell in the elements.

original: ayaṃ bhāvaḥ yathā dehaṃ bibhrat pālayaṃś ca jīvo 'haṅkāreṇa tatsaṃśliṣṭas tiṣṭhaty evam ahaṃ bhūtāni dhārayan pālayann api teṣu na tiṣṭhāmi
analyzed: ayam bhāvaḥ yathā deham bibhrat pālayan ca jīvaḥ haṅkāreṇa tad saṃśliṣṭaḥ tiṣṭhati evam aham bhūtāni dhārayan pālayan api teṣu na tiṣṭhāmi
translated: The idea is this: just as the individual soul, while supporting and protecting the body, remains attached to it through egoism, in the same way, while I sustain and protect the elements, I do not dwell in them.

original: nirahaṅkāratvād iti ////
analyzed: nirahaṅkāra tvāt iti
translated: Because I am free from egoism.

original: madhusūdanaḥ ataeva na ceti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ ataeva na ca iti
translated: Madhusudana: For this very reason, not so etc.

original: diviṣṭha ivāditye kalpitāni jalacalanādīni mayi kalpitāni bhūtāni paramārthato mayi na santi /
analyzed: diviṣṭhe iva āditye kalpitāni jala calana ādīni mayi kalpitāni bhūtāni paramārthataḥ mayi na santi
translated: The activities of the elements imagined in me, like the movements of water etc. imagined in the sun residing in the sky, do not really exist in me.

original: tvam arjunaḥ prākṛtīṃ manuṣyabuddhiṃ hitvā paśya paryālocaya me yogaṃ prabhāvam aiśvaram aghaṭanaghaṭanācāturyaṃ māyāvina iva mamāvalokayety
analyzed: tvam arjunaḥ prākṛtīm manuṣya buddhim hitvā paśya paryālocaya me yogam prabhāvam aiśvaram a ghaṭana ghaṭana a cāturyam māyāvinaḥ iva mama avalokaya iti
translated: O Arjuna, having given up your natural human understanding, look, contemplate, my yoga, my power, my skill in creating what was not there, like a magician.

original: arthaḥ /
analyzed: arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: look at me.

original: nāhaṃ kasyacid ādheyo nāpi kaasyacid ādhāras tathāpy ahaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu mayi ca sarvāṇi bhūtānīti mahatīyaṃ māyā /
analyzed: na aham kasyacid ādheyaḥ na api kasyacid ādhāraḥ tathā api aham sarveṣu bhūteṣu mayi ca sarvāṇi bhūtāni iti mahatī iyam māyā
translated: I am not the object of anyone's possession, nor am I the possessor of anyone. Still, this is a great illusion that all beings are in me and I am in all beings.

original: yato bhūtāni sarvāṇi kāryāṇy upādānatayā bibharti dhārayati poṣayatīti ca bhūtabhṛt /
analyzed: yatas bhūtāni sarvāṇi kāryāṇi upādāna tayā bibharti dhārayati poṣayati iti ca bhūtabhṛt
translated: Because He sustains, supports, and nourishes all beings as their material cause, He is the supporter of all beings.

original: bhūtāni sarvāṇi kartṛtayotpādayatīti bhūtabhāvanaḥ /
analyzed: bhūtāni sarvāṇi kartṛtayā utpādayati iti bhūtabhāvanaḥ
translated: Because He produces all beings as their agent, He is the creator of all beings.

original: evam abhinnanimittopādānabhūto 'pi mamātmā mama parmaārthasvarūpabhūtaḥ saccidānandaghano
analyzed: evam abhinna nimitta upādāna bhūtaḥ pi mama ātmā mama saccidānanda ghanaḥ
translated: Thus, although my Self is the undivided cause and material cause, it is my supreme reality, consisting of existence, consciousness, and bliss.

original: 'saṅgādvitīyasvarūpatvāc ca bhūtasthaḥ paramārthato na bhūtasambandhī svapnadṛg
analyzed: saṅga advitīya svarūpa tvāt ca bhūta sthaḥ paramārthataḥ na bhūta sambandhī svapna dṛś
translated: And because of being of the nature of being unattached and without a second, although existing in beings in reality, it is not related to beings, like the dreamer of a dream.

original: iva na paramārthataḥ svakalpitasambandhīty
analyzed: iva na paramārthataḥ sva kalpita sambandhi iti
translated: It is not related to what is imagined in reality.

original: arthaḥ / mamātmeti rāhoḥ śira itivat kalpanayā ṣaṣṭhī ////
analyzed: arthaḥ mama ātmā iti rāhoḥ śiraḥ iti vat kalpanayā ṣaṣṭhī
translated: This is the meaning. The genitive case in my Self is used figuratively, like in the head of Rahu.

original: viśvanāthaḥ tata eva mayi sthitāny api bhūtāni na matsthāni mamāsaṅgatvād eveti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ tatas eva mayi sthitāni api bhūtāni na mad sthāni mama asaṅga tvāt eva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Visvanatha: Therefore, although the beings exist in Me, they do not exist in Me, because of My being unattached. This is the meaning.

original: nanu tarhi tava jagadvyāpakatvam jagadāśrayatvaṃ ca pūrvoktaṃ viruddham ity āha paśya me yogam aiśvaram asādhāraṇaṃ yogaiśvaryam aghaṭitaghaṭanācāturyamayam
analyzed: nanu tarhi tava jagat vyāpaka tvam jagat āśraya tvam ca pūrva uktam viruddham iti āha paśya me yogam aiśvaram asādhāraṇam yoga aiśvaryam a ghaṭita ghaṭana a cāturya mayam
translated: But then, your being all-pervading and the support of the world, as stated earlier, are contradictory, he says: Behold my yoga, my supremacy, my extraordinary yoga-mastery, consisting of the skill in accomplishing the impossible.

original: anyad apy āścaryaṃ paśyety āha bhūtāni bibharti dhārayatīti bhūtabhṛt /
analyzed: anyat api āścaryam paśya iti āha bhūtāni bibharti dhārayati iti bhūta bhṛt
translated: See another wonder as well, he says: The supporter of beings, who sustains and holds them.

original: bhūtāni bhāvayati pālayatīti bhūtabhāvanaḥ /
analyzed: bhūtāni bhāvayati pālayati iti bhūtabhāvanaḥ
translated: The nourisher of beings, who fosters and protects them.

original: evaṃ bhūto 'pi mamātmā bhūtastho na bhavatīti mameti bhagavati dehadehivibhāgābhāvāt /
analyzed: evam mama ātmā bhūta sthaḥ na bhavati iti mama iti bhagavati deha dehi vibhāga abhāvāt
translated: Even though he is such, my Self does not dwell in beings, because of the absence of the distinction between the body and the embodied one in the Lord, as in Rahu's head.

original: rāhoḥ śiraḥ itivad abhede 'pi ṣaṣṭhī /
analyzed: rāhoḥ śiraḥ iti vat abhede pi ṣaṣṭhī
translated: Even though there is non-difference, the genitive case is used as in Rahu's head.

original: ayaṃ bhāvaḥ yathā jīvo dehaṃ dadhat pālayann api tasmin āsaktyā dehastha eva bhavati /
analyzed: ayam bhāvaḥ yathā jīvaḥ deham dadhat pālayan api tasmin āsaktyā deha sthaḥ eva bhavati
translated: The idea is this: Just as the individual soul, though holding and protecting the body, becomes identified with it due to attachment,

original: evam ahaṃ bhūtāni dadhat pālayann api māyikasarvabhūtaśarīro 'pi na tatrastho niḥsaṅgatvād iti ////
analyzed: evam aham bhūtāni dadhat pālayan api māyika sarva bhūta śarīraḥ u pi na tatrasthaḥ niḥsaṅga tvāt iti
translated: so also I, though holding and protecting beings, though the body of all beings by Maya, am not there due to detachment.

original: baladevaḥ nanv atiguruṃ bhāraṃ vahatas te mahān khedaḥ syād iti cet tatrāha na ceti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu ati gurum bhāram vahataḥ te mahān khedaḥ syāt iti ced tatra āha na ca iti
translated: Balarama: If it is argued that you would have great fatigue from bearing an extremely heavy burden, he says: Not so.

original: ghaṭādāv udakādīnīva bhārabhūtāni cabhūtāni saṃsṛṣṭāni mayi na santi /
analyzed: ghaṭa ādau udaka ādīni iva bhāra bhūtāni ca bhūtāni saṃsṛṣṭāni mayi na santi
translated: The elements, which are like water etc. in a pot, and which are the bearers of the burden, are not combined in Me, as in a pot.

original: tarhi matsthāni saarvabhūtānītyuktiviruddheteti mayi na santi /
analyzed: tarhi mad sthāni sa arva bhūtāni iti ukti viruddha ita iti mayi na santi
translated: If it is argued that then the statement that all beings abide in Me is contradicted, the answer is: They do not exist in Me.

original: tarhi matsthāni sarvabhūtānītyuktir viruddheteti cet tatraha paśyeti /
analyzed: tarhi mad sthāni sarva bhūtāni iti uktiḥ viruddhā ita iti ced tatra ha paśya iti
translated: If it is argued that then the statement that all beings abide in Me is contradicted, the answer is: See, etc.

original: mamaiśvaraṃ madasādhāraṇaṃ yogaṃ paśya jānīhi yujyate 'nena durghaṭeṣu kāryeṣu iti nirukter yogo 'vicintyaśaktivapuḥ satyasaṅkalpatālakṣaṇo
analyzed: mama aiśvaram mad asādhāraṇam yogam paśya jānīhi yujyate nena durghaṭeṣu kāryeṣu iti nirukteḥ yogaḥ vicintya śakti vapuḥ satya saṅkalpa tā lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: See, know, My divine power, which is not common to others, which is Yoga, which is connected with Me, which is the inconceivable power, which is characterized by the truth of resolve,

original: dharamas tam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: dharamaḥ tam iti arthaḥ
translated: which is the support of the earth, etc. This is the meaning.

original: etad eva visphuṭayati bhūtabhṛd iti bhūtabhṛt bhūtānāṃ dhārakaḥ pālakaś cāhaṃ bhūtastho bhūtasaṃpṛkto naiva bhavāmi /
analyzed: etat eva visphuṭayati bhūta bhṛt iti bhūta bhṛt bhūtānām dhārakaḥ pālakaḥ ca aham bhūta sthaḥ bhūta saṃpṛktaḥ na eva bhavāmi
translated: He makes this very clear with the words the supporter of beings, etc. I am the supporter and protector of beings, but I do not exist as one connected with beings.

original: yato mām ātmā mana eva bhūtabhāvanaḥ satyasaṅkalpatā lakṣaṇenaiśvareṇa yogenaivāhaṃ bhūtānāṃ dhāraṇaṃ pālanaṃ ca karomi /
analyzed: yatas mām ātmā manaḥ eva bhūta bhāvanaḥ satya saṅkalpa tā lakṣaṇena aiśvareṇa yogena eva aham bhūtānām dhāraṇam pālanam ca karomi
translated: Because I, the Self, the mind itself, the creator of beings, by means of divine power characterized by the truth of resolve, alone perform the support and protection of beings.

original: na tu svamūrtivyāpāreṇety arthaḥ
analyzed: na tu sva mūrti vyāpāreṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: not by the function of My own form.

original: śrutiś caivam āha etasya vā akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi sūryācandram asau vidhṛtau
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca evam āha etasya vai akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi sūryācandram asau vidhṛtau
translated: And the Veda also says thus: O Gargi, the sun and the moon are held in the governance of this imperishable one, and they stand.

original: tiṣṭhata etasya vā akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi dyāv āpṛthivyau vidhṛte tiṣṭhataḥ BAU / / ity ādinā /
analyzed: tiṣṭhataḥ etasya vai akṣarasya praśāsane gārgi dyau āpṛthivyau vidhṛte tiṣṭhataḥ bau iti ādinā
translated: O Gargi, the heaven and earth are held in the governance of this imperishable one, and they stand.

original: yadyapi svarūpān na mano bhinnaṃ /
analyzed: yadi api svarūpāt na manaḥ bhinnam
translated: Even though the mind is not different from its own nature,

original: tathāpi sattā satīty ādivad viśeṣād vāstavaṃ bhedakāryam ādāyaiva tathoktaṃ bodhyam ////
analyzed: tathā api sattā satī iti ādi vat viśeṣāt vāstavam bheda kāryam ādāya eva tathā uktam bodhyam
translated: nevertheless, like existence and existent, it should be understood that it is said to be so, taking up the real effect of difference due to the distinction.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: yathākāśasthito nityaṃ vāyuḥ sarvatrago mahān /
analyzed: yathā ākāśa sthitaḥ nityam vāyuḥ sarvatragaḥ mahān
translated: Just as the wind, though all-pervading and great, always abides in space,

original: tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni matsthānīty upadhāraya ////
analyzed: tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mad sthāni iti upadhāraya
translated: so know that all beings abide in Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ asaṃśliṣṭayor apy ādhārādheyabhāvaṃ dṛṣṭāntenāha yayeti /
translated: Sridhar says: He illustrates the relation of support and supported between two things that are not in contact, with the example yaya.

original: avakāśaṃ vināvasthānānupapatter nityam ākāśe sthito vāyuḥ sarvatrago 'pi mahān api nākāśena saṃśliṣyate /
analyzed: avakāśam vinā avasthāna anupapatteḥ nityam ākāśe sthitaḥ vāyuḥ sarvatragaḥ mahān api na ākāśena saṃśliṣyate
translated: The wind, which cannot exist without space, always abides in space, though it is all-pervading and great, it does not come in contact with space.

original: niravayavatvena saṃśleṣāyogāt /
analyzed: niravayava tvena saṃśleṣa ayogāt
translated: Because it cannot come in contact due to being partless.

original: tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mayi sthitānīti jānīhi ////
analyzed: tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mayi sthitāni iti jānīhi
translated: Know that all beings abide in Me in the same way.

original: madhusūdanaḥ asaṃśliṣṭayor apy ādhārādheyabhāvaṃ dṛṣṭāntenāha yatheti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ asaṃśliṣṭayoḥ api ādhāra ādheya bhāvam dṛṣṭāntena āha yathā iti
translated: The Lord gives an example of the relation of support and the supported even between two things that are not in contact: 11.5 As the wind, though unattached, always moves in space, so all beings exist in Me, though I am unattached.

original: yathaivāsaṅgasvabhāva ākāśe sthito nityaṃ sarvadotpattisthitisaṃhārakāleṣu vātīti vāyuḥ sarvadā calanasvabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: yathā eva asaṅga svabhāvaḥ ākāśe sthitaḥ nityam sarvadā utpatti sthiti saṃhāra kāleṣu vāti iti vāyuḥ sarvadā calana svabhāvaḥ
translated: As the wind, though of the nature of unattached, always moves in space, which is of the nature of unattached, at all times, during the periods of creation, maintenance and dissolution, so all beings, beginning with space, exist in Me, who am of the nature of unattached, though without contact.

original: ataeva sarvatra gacchatīti sarvatragaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva sarvatra gacchati iti sarvatragaḥ
translated: And for that very reason, it goes everywhere, so it is all-pervading.

original: mahān parimāṇataḥ /
analyzed: mahān parimāṇataḥ
translated: It is great in size.

original: etādṛśo 'pi na na kadāpy ākāśena saha saṃsṛjyate /
analyzed: etādṛśaḥ na na kadāpi ākāśena saha saṃsṛjyate
translated: Even such as it is, it is never mixed with space.

original: tathaivāsaṅgasvabhāve mayi saṃśleṣam antareṇaiva sarvāṇi bhūtāny ākāśādīni mahānti sarvatragāni ca sthitāni nāpi sthitānīty upadhāraya vimṛśyāvadhāraya
analyzed: tathā eva asaṅga svabhāve mayi saṃśleṣam antareṇa eva sarvāṇi bhūtāni ākāśa ādīni mahānti sarvatragāni ca sthitāni na api sthitāni iti upadhāraya vimṛśya avadhāraya
translated: In the same way, understand, reflect and ascertain, that all beings, beginning with space, exist in Me, who am of the nature of unattached, though without contact, and that they do not exist.

original: viśvanāthaḥ asaṅge mayi bhūtāni sthitāny api na sthitāni /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ asaṅge mayi bhūtāni sthitāni api na sthitāni
translated: Visvanatha: Beings exist in Me, who am unattached, but they do not exist.

original: teṣv apy ahaṃ sthito 'pi na sthita ity atra dṛṣṭāntam āha yatheti /
analyzed: teṣu api aham na sthitaḥ iti atra dṛṣṭāntam āha yathā iti
translated: And I exist in them, but I do not exist. The Lord gives an example of this: 11.5 As the wind, though unattached, always moves in space, so all beings exist in Me, though I am unattached.

original: yathaivāsaṅgasvabhāve ākāśe nityaṃ vātīti vāyuḥ sarvadā calanasvabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: yathā eva asaṅga svabhāve ākāśe nityam vāti iti vāyuḥ sarvadā calana svabhāvaḥ
translated: As the wind, though of the nature of unattached, always moves in space, which is of the nature of unattached,

original: ataeva sarvatra gacchatīti sarvatrago mahān parimāṇataḥ yathā svākāśasya asaṅgatvāt tatra sthito 'pi na sthitaḥ /
analyzed: ataeva sarvatra gacchati iti sarvatragaḥ mahān parimāṇataḥ yathā su ākāśasya a saṅga tvāt tatra sthitaḥ u pi na sthitaḥ
translated: Therefore, it is all-pervading, great in size, just as its own space is unattached, so one dwelling there is not dwelling.

original: ākāśo 'pi vāyau sthito 'pi na sthito 'saṅgatvād eva tathaivāsaṅgasvabhāve mayi sarvāṇi bhūtāni ākāśādīni mahānti sarvatragāni sthitāni nāpi
analyzed: ākāśaḥ pi vāyau sthitaḥ pi na sthitaḥ saṅga tvāt eva tathā eva asaṅga svabhāve mayi sarvāṇi bhūtāni ākāśa ādīni mahānti sarvatragāni sthitāni na api
translated: Even space, though dwelling in air, is not dwelling, for the very reason of its unattached nature. In the same way, all beings, beginning with space, are dwelling in Me, who am of the nature of unattachedness, and yet they are not

original: sthitānīty upadhāraya vimṛśya niścinu /
analyzed: sthitāni iti upadhāraya vimṛśya niścinu
translated: dwelling. Understand this, conclude this after reflection.

original: nanu tarhi paśya me yogam aiśvaram iti bhagavaduktaṃ yogaiśvaryasyātarkyatvaṃ kathaṃ siddham abhūt /
analyzed: nanu tarhi paśya me yogam aiśvaram iti bhagavat uktam yoga aiśvaryasya atarkya tvam katham siddham abhūt
translated: But then, how was the impossibility of reasoning about the supremacy of yoga established, as stated by the Lord: Behold My yoga of supremacy?

original: dṛṣṭāntalābhāt /
analyzed: dṛṣṭānta lābhāt
translated: [It was established] by the attainment of an example.

original: ucyate ākāśasya jaḍatvā evāsaṅgatvam /
analyzed: ucyate ākāśasya jaḍa tvāt eva asaṅga tvam
translated: It is said that the unattachedness of space is due to its very inertness.

original: cetanasya tv asaṅgatvaṃ jagadadhiṣṭhānādhiṣṭhātṛtve parameśvaraṃ vinā nānyatrāstīty atarkyatvaṃ siddham
analyzed: cetanasya tu asaṅga tvam jagat adhiṣṭhāna adhiṣṭhātṛ tve parameśvaram vinā na anyatra asti iti atarkya tvam siddham
translated: But the unattachedness of the conscious [Self] exists nowhere else but in the Supreme Lord, who is the ruler of the world as its foundation. Therefore, the impossibility of reasoning [about the Lord] is established

original: eva / tad apy ākāśadṛṣṭānto lokabuddhipraveśārtha eva jñeyaḥ ////
analyzed: eva tat api ākāśa dṛṣṭāntaḥ loka buddhi praveśa arthaḥ eva jñeyaḥ
translated: itself. Moreover, that example of space should be known as being for the entry of the understanding of the people alone.

original: baladevaḥ carācarāṇāṃ sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ matsaṅkalpāyattā sthitir vṛttiś cety atra dṛṣṭāntam āha yatheti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ cara acarāṇām sarveṣām bhūtānām mad saṅkalpa āyattā sthitiḥ vṛttiḥ ca iti atra dṛṣṭāntam āha yathā iti
translated: And Balarāma says: As to the statement that the existence and activity of all beings, moving and non-moving, depend on My will, He gives an example: As....

original: yathā nirālambe mahaty ākāśe nirālambo mahān vāyuḥ sthitaḥ sarvatra gacchati /
analyzed: yathā nirālambe mahati ākāśe nirālambaḥ mahān vāyuḥ sthitaḥ sarvatra gacchati
translated: As the great, supportless wind moves everywhere in the great, supportless sky,

original: tasya tasya ca nirālambatayā sthitir matsaṅkalpād eva pravṛttiś cety antaryāmibrāhmaṇāt yad bhīṣā vātaḥ pavate iti śrutyantarāc copadhārayeti /
analyzed: tasya tasya ca nirālamba tayā sthitiḥ mad saṅkalpāt eva pravṛttiḥ ca iti antaryāmibrāhmaṇāt yat bhīṣā vātaḥ pavate iti śruti antarāt ca upadhāraya iti
translated: and its existence and activity depend only on My will, one should understand this from the Antaryāmi-Brāhmaṇa and from another Śruti passage: 'By fear of Him the wind blows' (Tai. U. 2.8).

original: tathā sarvāṇi sthiracarāṇi bhūtāni matsthāni tair ansaṃtuṣṭe mayi sthitāni mayaiva saṅkalpamātreṇa dhṛtāni nityamitāni cety upadhāraya /
analyzed: tathā sarvāṇi sthira carāṇi bhūtāni mad sthāni taiḥ an saṃtuṣṭe mayi sthitāni mayā eva saṅkalpa mātreṇa dhṛtāni nitya mitāni ca iti upadhāraya
translated: Similarly, one should understand that all beings, moving and non-moving, exist in Me, are content with Me, abide in Me, and are always sustained by Me alone by My mere will.

original: anyathā ākāśādīni vibhraṃśerann iti ////
analyzed: anyathā ākāśa ādīni vibhraṃśeran iti
translated: Otherwise, the sky and so on would be scattered.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG 9.7

original: sarvabhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṃ yānti māmikām /
analyzed: sarva bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtim yānti māmikām
translated: All beings, O son of Kunti, return to My nature at the end of a kalpa.

original: kalpakṣaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛjāmy aham ////
analyzed: kalpa kṣaye punar tāni kalpa ādau visṛjāmi aham
translated: And at the beginning of a kalpa, I again emit them.

original: śrīdharaḥ tad evam asaṅgasyaiva yogamāyayā sthitihetutvam uktam /
translated: Śrīdhara: Thus it has been said that only He, who is free from attachment, is the cause of existence by His Yogic Maya.

original: tayaiva sṛṣṭiprayalahetutvaṃ cāha sarveti /
analyzed: tayā eva sṛṣṭi prayala hetutvam ca āha sarva iti
translated: And by that alone He is the cause of creation etc. He says this by (the words) 'all these'.

original: kalpakṣaye pralayakāle sarvāṇi bhūtāni prakṛtiṃ yānti /
analyzed: kalpa kṣaye pralaya kāle sarvāṇi bhūtāni prakṛtim yānti
translated: At the time of the dissolution of the Kalpa, all beings go to Prakṛti.

original: triguṇātmikāyāṃ māyāyāṃ līyante /
analyzed: triguṇa ātmikāyām māyāyām līyante
translated: They merge into Māyā, which consists of the three guṇas.

original: punaḥ kalpādau sṛṣṭikāle tāni visṛjāmi viśeṣeṇa sṛjāmi ////
analyzed: punar kalpa ādau sṛṣṭi kāle tāni visṛjāmi viśeṣeṇa sṛjāmi
