translated: Again, at the beginning of the Kalpa, at the time of creation, I create them in particular, I create them in a special way.

original: madhusūdanaḥ evam utpattikāle sthitikāle ca kalpitena prapañcenāsaṅgasyātmano 'saṃśleṣam uktvā pralaye 'pi tam āha sarvetei /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ evam utpatti kāle sthiti kāle ca kalpitena prapañcena asaṅgasya ātmanaḥ saṃśleṣam uktvā pralaye tam āha
translated: Madhusudana: Having thus described the non-attachment of the Self, which is unassociated with the world imagined to exist at the time of creation and at the time of maintenance, He says that it is so even at the time of dissolution by (the words) 'all these'.

original: sarvāṇi bhūtāni kalpakṣaye pralayakāle māmikāṃ macchaktitvena kalpitāṃ prakṛtiṃ triguṇātmikāṃ māyāṃ svakāraṇabhūtāṃ yānti tatraiva sūkṣmarūpeṇa
analyzed: sarvāṇi bhūtāni kalpa kṣaye pralaya kāle māmikām mad śakti tvena kalpitām prakṛtim triguṇa ātmikām māyām sva kāraṇa bhūtām yānti tatra eva sūkṣma rūpeṇa
translated: All beings, at the time of dissolution of the Kalpa, go to My Prakṛti, which is imagined to be My power, which is the cause of all, which consists of the three guṇas, and which is Māyā, in the form of subtle elements.

original: līyanta ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: līyante iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they merge there itself.

original: he kaunteyety uktārtham /
analyzed: he kaunteya iti ukta artham
translated: O son of Kunti, the meaning of this has been explained.

original: punas tāni kalpādau sargakāle visṛjāmi prakṛtāv avibhāgāpannāni vyanajmi ahaṃ sarvajñaḥ sarvaśaktir īśvaraḥ ////
analyzed: punar tāni kalpa ādau sarga kāle visṛjāmi prakṛtau avibhāga āpannāni vyanajmi aham sarvajñaḥ sarva śaktiḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: Again, at the beginning of the Kalpa, at the time of creation, I create those (beings) which have become undifferentiated in Prakṛti. I manifest them. I am the omniscient, omnipotent Lord.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanv adhunā dṛśyamāny etāni bhūtāni tvayi sthitānīty avagamyate /
translated: Visvanatha: Now it is understood that these beings which are seen now exist in You.

original: mahāpralaye kva yāsyantīty apekṣāyām āha sarveti /
analyzed: mahāpralaye kva yāsyanti iti apekṣāyām āha sarvā iti
translated: When the question arises as to where they will go at the time of the Great Dissolution, the Lord says, 'All of them', etc.

original: māmikāṃ madīyāṃ mama triguṇātmikāyāṃ māyāśaktau līyanta ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: māmikām madīyām mama triguṇa ātmikāyām māyā śaktau līyante iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they merge into My Maya Shakti, which consists of the three gunas.

original: punaḥ kalpakṣaye pralayānte sṛṣṭikāle tāni viśeṣeṇa sṛjāmi ////
analyzed: punar kalpa kṣaye pralaya ante sṛṣṭi kāle tāni viśeṣeṇa sṛjāmi
translated: Again, at the end of the dissolution, at the time of creation, I specially create those (elements).

original: baladevaḥ svasaṅkalpād eva bhūtānāṃ sthitir uktā /
analyzed: baladevaḥ sva saṅkalpāt eva bhūtānām sthitiḥ uktā
translated: Balarama has said that the existence of beings is by My own will.

original: atha tasmād eva teṣāṃ sargapralayāv āha sarveti /
analyzed: atha tasmāt eva teṣām sarga pralayau āha sarva iti
translated: Now, from that very (will), He speaks of the creation and dissolution of those (beings) with the words 'All of them', etc.

original: he kaunteya /
analyzed: he kaunteya
translated: O son of Kunti!

original: kalpakṣaye caturmukhāvasānakāle sarvāṇi bhūtāni matsaṅkalpād eva māmikāṃ prakṛtiṃ yānit /
analyzed: kalpa kṣaye caturmukha avasāna kāle sarvāṇi bhūtāni mad saṅkalpāt eva māmikām prakṛtim
translated: At the time of the dissolution of the Kalpa, at the end of the world, all beings, by My will alone, go into My own Prakriti.

original: prakṛtiśaktike mayi vilīyante kalpādau punas tāny aham eva bahu syām iti saṅkalpamātreṇa vaividhyena sṛjāmi ////
analyzed: prakṛti śaktike mayi vilīyante kalpa ādau punar tāni aham eva bahu syām iti saṅkalpa mātreṇa vaividhyena sṛjāmi
translated: They merge into Me, who is endowed with the power of Prakriti. At the beginning of the Kalpa, I again create those (beings) in various ways, merely by the will, 'Let me be many'.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: The Blessed Lord said --

original: prakṛtiṃ svām avaṣṭabhya visṛjāmi punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: prakṛtim svām avaṣṭabhya visṛjāmi punar punar
translated: Embracing My own Nature, I send forth again and again

original: bhūtagrāmam imaṃ kṛtsnam avaśaṃ prakṛter vaśāt ////
analyzed: bhūta grāmam imam kṛtsnam avaśam prakṛteḥ vaśāt
translated: this entire host of beings, helpless, under the sway of Prakriti.

original: śrīdharaḥ nanv asaṅgo nirvikāraś ca tvaṃ kathaṃ sṛjasīty apekṣāyām āha prakṛtim iti /
translated: Sridhar says -- Now, how can You, who are detached and changeless, create? Anticipating this question, the Lord says 'Prakriti' etc.

original: svāṃ svīyāṃ svādhīnāṃ prakṛtim avaṣṭabhyādhiṣṭhāya /🔽pralaye līnaṃ santaṃ caturvidham imaṃ sarvaṃ bhūtagrāmaṃ karmādiparavaśaṃ punaḥ punar vividhaṃ sṛjāmi /🔽viśeṣeṇa sṛjāmi iti vā /🔽katham / prakṛter vaśāt prācīnakarmanimittatattatsvabhāvavaśāt ////
analyzed: svām svīyām sva adhīnām prakṛtim avaṣṭabhya adhiṣṭhāya  pralaye līnam santam caturvidham imam sarvam bhūta grāmam karma ādi paravaśam punar punar vividham sṛjāmi  viśeṣeṇa sṛjāmi iti vā  katham prakṛteḥ vaśāt prācīna karma nimitta tad tad svabhāva vaśāt
translated: 13.20 Having controlled, having taken control of, His own, His own, His controlled, Prakriti, and having made Him, who is merged at the time of dissolution, this entire fourfold group of beings, which is under the control of Karma and so on, I create again and again in various ways.🔽Or, I create in particular.🔽How? By the power of Prakriti, by the power of the nature of each one due to the Karma of the past.

original: madhusūdanaḥ kiṃnimittā parameśvarastheyaṃ sṛṣṭir na tāvat svabhogārthā tasya sarvasākṣibhūtacaitanyamātrasya bhoktṛtvābhāvāt tathātve 🔽vā saṃsāritveneśvaratvavyāghātāt /🔽nāpy anyo bhoktā yad artheyaṃ sṛṣṭiḥ /🔽cetanāntarābhāvāt /🔽īśvarasyaiva sarvatra jīvarūpeṇa sthitatvāt /🔽acetanasya cābhoktṛtvāt /🔽ataeva nāpavargārthāpi sṛṣṭiḥ /🔽bandhābhāvād apavargavirodhitvāc cety ādyanupapattiḥ sṛṣṭer māyāmayatvaṃ sādhayantī
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ kiṃnimittā parameśvara sthā iyam sṛṣṭiḥ na tāvat sva bhoga arthā tasya sarva sākṣi bhūta caitanya mātrasya bhoktṛ tva abhāvāt tathātve 🔽vā saṃsāri tvena īśvara tva vyāghātāt 🔽na api anyaḥ bhoktā yat arthā iyam sṛṣṭiḥ 🔽cetanā antara abhāvāt 🔽īśvarasya eva sarvatra jīva rūpeṇa sthita tvāt 🔽acetanasya ca abhoktṛ tvāt 🔽ataeva na apavarga arthā api sṛṣṭiḥ 🔽bandha abhāvāt apavarga virodhi tvāt ca iti ādi anupapattiḥ sṛṣṭeḥ māyā maya tvam sādhayantī

original: nāsmākaṃ pratikūleti na parihartavyety abhipretya māyāmayatvān mithyātvaṃ prapañcasya
analyzed: na asmākam pratikūlā iti na parihartavyā iti abhipretya māyā maya tvāt mithyātvam prapañcasya
translated: The meaning is that it should not be avoided, thinking that it is not opposed to us. The falsity of the world is due to its being illusory.

original: vaktum ārabhate tribhiḥ prakṛtim iti /
analyzed: vaktum ārabhate tribhiḥ prakṛtim iti
translated: Having in mind that the world is not adverse to us, and that it should not be rejected, he begins to speak of the unreality of the world due to its being made of illusion, with the three verses beginning with Prakriti.🔽He says:

original: prakṛtiṃ māyākhyām anirvacanīyāṃ svāṃ svasmin kalpitām avaṣṭabhya svasattāsphūrtibhyāṃ
analyzed: prakṛtim māyā ākhyām anirvacanīyām svām svasmin kalpitām avaṣṭabhya sva sattā sphūrtibhyām
translated: Relying on my own nature called Maya, which is indescribable and imagined within myself, making it firm through my own existence and manifestation,

original: dṛḍhīkṛtya tasyāḥ prakṛter māyāyā vaśād avidyāsmitārāgadveṣābhiniveśakāraṇāvaraṇavikṣepātmakaśaktiprabhāvāj
analyzed: dṛḍhīkṛtya tasyāḥ prakṛteḥ māyāyāḥ vaśāt avidyā asmitā rāga dveṣa abhiniveśa kāraṇa āvaraṇa vikṣepa ātmaka śakti prabhāvāt
translated: and by the power of that Prakṛti, Maya, due to the power of the Śaktis (energies) in the form of ignorance, pride, attachment, aversion, and firm adherence, which are the causes of obscuration and distraction,

original: jāyamānam imaṃ sarvapramāṇasaṃnidhāpitaṃ bhūtagrāmam ākāśādibhūtasamudāyam ahaṃ
analyzed: jāyamānam imam sarva pramāṇa saṃnidhāpitam bhūta grāmam ākāśa ādi bhūta samudāyam aham
translated: I repeatedly emit, like a magician, this entire group of beings presented by all means of knowledge, the collection of elements beginning with space,

original: māyāvīva punaḥ punar visṛjāmi vividhaṃ sṛjāmi kalpanāmātreṇa svapnadṛg iva ca svapnaprapañcam // //
analyzed: māyāvī iva punar punar visṛjāmi vividham sṛjāmi kalpanā mātreṇa svapna dṛś iva ca svapna prapañcam
translated: and create it in various ways merely by imagination, like one seeing a dream creating the details of a dream.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanv asaṅgo nirvikāraś ca tvaṃ kathaṃ sṛjasīty apekṣāyām āha prakṛtim iti /
translated: Viśvanātha: Now, how can you, who are unattached and changeless, create? Anticipating this question, he says Prakṛti.

original: svāṃ svīyām avaṣṭabhyādhiṣṭhāya prakṛter vaśāt svīyasvabhāvavaśāt prācīnakarmanimittād iti yāvat /
analyzed: svām svīyām avaṣṭabhya adhiṣṭhāya prakṛteḥ vaśāt svīya svabhāva vaśāt prācīna karma nimittāt iti yāvat
translated: Relying on my own, my own nature, by the power of Prakṛti, by the power of my own nature, by the power of past karma, up to this extent.

original: avaśaṃ karmādiparatantram ////
analyzed: avaśam karma ādi paratantram
translated: Avashyam, necessarily, means being dependent on the will of another, such as karma, etc.

original: baladevaḥ prakṛtim iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ prakṛtim iti
translated: Being powerless, it is dependent on the will of others, such as Karma.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.

original: svām ātmīyāṃ triguṇāṃ prakṛtim avaṣṭabhyādhiṣṭhāya saṅkalpamātreṇa mahadādyān manā pariṇamayyemaṃ caturvidham bhūtagrāmaṃ visṛjāmi punaḥ 🔽punaḥ kāle kāle /
analyzed: svām ātmīyām triguṇām prakṛtim avaṣṭabhya adhiṣṭhāya saṅkalpa mātreṇa mahat ādyān manā pariṇamayya imam caturvidham bhūta grāmam visṛjāmi punar  punar kāle kāle
translated: The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.

original: kīdṛśam ity āha prakṛteḥ prācīnakarmavāsanāyā vaśāt prabhāvād avaśaṃ paratantraṃ🔽tathā cācintyaśakter asaṅgasvabhāvasya mama saṅkalpamātreṇa tat tat kurvato na🔽tatsaṃsargagandho na ca ko 'pi khedaleśa iti // //
analyzed: kīdṛśam iti āha prakṛteḥ prācīna karma vāsanāyāḥ vaśāt prabhāvāt avaśam paratantram  tathā ca acintya śakteḥ asaṅga svabhāvasya mama saṅkalpa mātreṇa tat tat kurvataḥ na  tad saṃsarga gandhaḥ na ca kaḥ pi kheda leśaḥ iti
translated: The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.

original: BhG /🔽na ca māṃ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanaṃjaya /
analyzed: bhg  na ca mām tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanaṃjaya
translated: The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.

original: udāsīnavad āsīnam asaktaṃ teṣu karmasu ////
analyzed: udāsīna vat āsīnam asaktam teṣu karmasu
translated: The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.

original: śrīdharaḥ nanv evaṃ nānāvidhāni karmāṇi kurvatas tava jīvavadbandhaḥ kathaṃ na syād iti /🔽ata āha na ca mām iti /
analyzed: atas āha na ca mām iti
translated: The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.🔽The powerful Lord, by His own will, creates the universe again and again.

original: tāni viśvasṛṣṭyādīni karmāṇi māṃ na nibadhnanti /
analyzed: tāni viśva sṛṣṭi ādīni karmāṇi mām na nibadhnanti
translated: The powerful

original: karmāsaktir hi baddhahetuḥ sā cāptakāmatvān mama nāsti /
analyzed: karma āsaktiḥ hi baddha hetuḥ sā ca āpta kāma tvāt mama nā asti
translated: For attachment to action is the cause of bondage, and that does not exist in me because I have attained my goal.

original: ata udāsīnatvānupapatter udāsīnavat sthitam ity uktam ////
analyzed: atas udāsīna tva anupapatteḥ udāsīna vat sthitam iti uktam
translated: Therefore, because of the impossibility of neutrality, it is said that I remain as if neutral.

original: madhusūdanaḥ ataḥ na ceti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ atas na ca iti
translated: Madhusudana: Therefore, it is said not so.

original: na ca naiva sṛṣṭisthitipralayākhyāni tāni māyāvineva svapnadṛśeva ca mayā kriyamāṇāni
analyzed: na ca nā eva sṛṣṭi sthiti pralaya ākhyāni tāni māyāvinā iva svapna dṛśā iva ca mayā kriyamāṇāni
translated: And those called creation, maintenance, and dissolution are not performed by me as if by a magician or by one seeing a dream.

original: māṃ nibandhnanti anugrahanigrahābhyāṃ na sukṛtaduṣkṛtabhāginaṃ kurvanti mithyābhūtatvāt /
analyzed: mām nibandhnanti anugraha nigrahābhyām na sukṛta duṣkṛta bhāginam kurvanti mithyā bhūta tvāt
translated: They do not bind me, they do not make me a partaker of good and evil deeds by way of favor and punishment, because they are false.

original: he dhanañjaya yudhiṣṭhirarājasūyārthaṃ sarvān rājño jitvā dhanam āhṛtavān iti mahān prabhāvaḥ sūcitaḥ protsāhanārtham /
analyzed: he dhanañjaya yudhiṣṭhira rājasūya artham sarvān rājñaḥ jitvā dhanam āhṛtavān iti mahān prabhāvaḥ sūcitaḥ protsāhana artham
translated: O Dhananjaya, for the sake of Yudhishthira's Rajasuya sacrifice, you have conquered all kings and brought wealth, thus your great power is indicated for encouragement.

original: tāni karmāṇi kuto na badhnanti tatrāha udāsīnavad āsīnam /
analyzed: tāni karmāṇi kutas na badhnanti tatra āha udāsīna vat āsīnam
translated: From where do those actions not bind? There it is said: remaining as if neutral.

original: yathā kaścid upekṣako dvayor vivadamānayor jayaparājayāsaṃsargī tatkṛtaharṣaviṣādābhyām asaṃsṛṣṭo nirvikāra āste tadvan nirvikāratayāsīnam
analyzed: yathā kaścid upekṣakaḥ dvayoḥ vivadamānayoḥ jaya parājaya asaṃsargī tad kṛta harṣa viṣādābhyām asaṃsṛṣṭaḥ nirvikāraḥ āste tadvat nirvikāra tayā āsīnam
translated: Just as a certain indifferent person, not connected with the victory or defeat of two disputing parties, untouched by the joy and sorrow caused by that, remains without change, so I remain without change.

original: dvayor vivadamānayor ihābhāvād upekṣakatvamātrasādharmyeṇa vatipratyayaḥ /
analyzed: dvayoḥ vivadamānayoḥ iha abhāvāt upekṣaka tva mātra sādharmyeṇa vati pratyayaḥ
translated: The suffix 'vati' is used in the sense of mere indifference, because of the absence of any dispute between the two.

original: ataeva nirvikāratvāt teṣu sṛṣṭyādikarmasv asaktam ahaṃ karomīty abhimānalakṣeṇa saṅgena rahitaṃ māṃ na nibadnanti karmāṇīti yuktam eva /
analyzed: ataeva nirvikāra tvāt teṣu sṛṣṭi ādi karmasu asaktam aham karomi iti abhimāna lakṣeṇa saṅgena rahitam mām na karmāṇi iti yuktam eva
translated: And for this very reason, because of being changeless, it is proper that the actions such as creation etc. do not bind Me, who am free from attachment in the form of the notion of 'I am doing'.

original: anyasyāpi hi kartṛtvābhāve phalasaṅgābhāve ca karmāṇi na bandhakāraṇānīty uktam anena /
analyzed: anyasya api hi kartṛ tva abhāve phala saṅga abhāve ca karmāṇi na bandha kāraṇāni iti uktam anena
translated: For it has been said by this (verse) that actions are not the cause of bondage even for another, if he is devoid of the status of an agent and of attachment to the results.

original: tadubhayasattve tu kośakāra iva karmabhir badhyate mūḍha ity abhiprāyaḥ ////
analyzed: tad ubhaya sattve tu kośakāraḥ iva karmabhiḥ badhyate mūḍhaḥ iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: But the idea is that if both (the status of an agent and attachment to the results) exist, then the deluded one is bound by actions like a silkworm.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanv evaṃ ca nānākarmāṇi kurvatas tava jīvavadbandhaḥ kathaṃ na syād /
translated: Visvanatha: Well, if you are performing various actions in this way, how is it that you are not bound like an individual?

original: ata āha na ceti /
analyzed: atas āha na ca iti
translated: To this he says 'na ca' (and not).

original: tāni sṛṣṭyādīni /
analyzed: tāni sṛṣṭi ādīni
translated: Those (actions) such as creation etc.

original: karmāsaktir hi baddhahetuḥ sā cāptakāmatvān mama nāsti /
analyzed: karma āsaktiḥ hi baddha hetuḥ sā ca āpta kāma tvāt mama nā asti
translated: For attachment to actions is the cause of bondage, and that does not exist in Me because I have attained all that is to be attained.

original: udāsīnavad iti /
analyzed: udāsīna vat iti
translated: As a neutral person.

original: anya udāsīno yathā vivadamānānāṃ duḥkhaśokādisaṃsṛṣṭo na bhavati tathaivāham ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: anyaḥ udāsīnaḥ yathā vivadamānānām duḥkha śoka ādi saṃsṛṣṭaḥ na bhavati tathā eva aham iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: just as another neutral person is not mixed with the sorrow, grief etc. of those who are disputing, so am I.

original: baladevaḥ nanu viṣamāṇi sṛṣṭipoālanalakṣaṇāni vaiṣamyādinā tvāṃ badhnīyur iti cet tatrāha na ceti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu viṣamāṇi vaiṣamya ādinā tvām badhnīyuḥ iti ced tatra āha na ca iti
translated: Balarama: If it be said that the uneven acts such as creation, protection, and dissolution would bind You by inequality, etc., then He says, not so, etc.

original: tāni viṣamasṛṣṭyādīni karmāṇi na mayi vaiṣamyādiprasañjayanti /
analyzed: tāni viṣama sṛṣṭi ādīni karmāṇi na mayi vaiṣamya ādi prasañjayanti
translated: Those uneven acts such as creation, etc. do not impel inequality, etc. in Me.

original: tatra hetugarbhaviśeṣaṇam udāsīnavad iti /
analyzed: tatra hetu garbha viśeṣaṇam udāsīna vat iti
translated: The reason is stated by the qualifying word as if indifferent.

original: jīvānāṃ devamānavatiryagādibhāve tattadabhyudayatāratamye ca teṣāṃ pūrvārjitāni karmāṇy eva kāraṇāni /
analyzed: jīvānām deva mānava tiryak ādi bhāve tad tad abhyudaya tāratamye ca teṣām pūrva arjitāni karmāṇi eva kāraṇāni
translated: In the states of gods, men, animals, etc. of the living beings, and in the gradation of their prosperity, their own previously accumulated actions are the causes.

original: ahaṃ tu teṣu viṣameṣu karmasv audāīnyena sthito 'sakta iti na mayi vaiṣamyādidoṣagandhaḥ /
analyzed: aham tu teṣu viṣameṣu karmasu audāīnyena sthitaḥ saktaḥ iti na mayi vaiṣamya ādi doṣa gandhaḥ
translated: But I remain indifferent to those uneven acts, being unattached. Therefore, the taint of inequality, etc. does not touch Me.

original: evam āha sūtrakāraḥ vaiṣamyanairghṛṇye na Vs / / / ity ādinā /🔽udāsīnatve kartṛtvaṃ na siddhyed ata uktam udāsīnavad iti ////
analyzed: evam āha sūtra kāraḥ vaiṣamya nairghṛṇye iti ādinā  udāsīna tve kartṛ tvam na siddhyet atas uktam udāsīna vat iti
translated: Thus the author of the aphorisms says, Inequality and cruelty do not apply to Him... etc.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: If it be said that agency is not established in one who is indifferent, therefore it is said as if indifferent.🔽BhG 9.7

original: mayādhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sacarācaram /
analyzed: mayā adhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sacarācaram
translated: The world is created by Nature under My supervision.

original: hetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate ////
analyzed: hetunā anena kaunteya jagat viparivartate
translated: By this reason, O son of Kunti, the world revolves.

original: śrīdharaḥ tad evopapādayati mayeti /
analyzed: eva
translated: Sridhar: He explains that very thing by By Me etc.

original: mayādhyakṣeṇādhiṣṭhātrā nimittabhūtena prakṛtiḥ sacarācaraṃ viśvaṃ sūyate janayati /
analyzed: mayā adhyakṣeṇa adhiṣṭhātrā nimitta bhūtena prakṛtiḥ sacarācaram viśvam sūyate janayati
translated: By Me, as the Ruler, the Controller, the Cause, Nature produces this universe consisting of moving and non-moving beings.

original: anena madadhiṣṭhānena hetunedaṃ jagad viparivartate punaḥ punar jāyate /
analyzed: anena mad adhiṣṭhānena hetunā idam jagat viparivartate punar punar jāyate
translated: By this, by My control, this world revolves again and again, is born again and again.

original: sannidhimātreṇādhiṣṭhātṛtvāt kartṛtvam udāsīnatvaṃ cāviruddham iti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: sannidhi mātreṇa adhiṣṭhātṛ tvāt kartṛ tvam udāsīna tvam ca aviruddham iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that because of the mere presence of the Controller, the state of being the agent and the state of being indifferent are not contradictory.

original: madhusūdanaḥ bhūtagrāmam imaṃ visṛjāmy udāsīnavad āsīnam iti ca parasparaviruddham iti śaṅkāparihārārthaṃ punar māyāmayatvam eva prakaṭayati 🔽mayeti /
analyzed: mayā iti
translated: To remove the doubt that He sends forth this manifold creation as if He were an unconcerned spectator, and He remains as if unconcerned, are mutually contradictory, He again reveals His being of the nature of Maya.

original: mayā sarvatodṛśimātrasvarūpeṇāvikriyeṇādhyakṣeṇa niyantrā bhāsakenāvabhāsitā prakṛtis
analyzed: mayā sarvatodṛśi mātra svarūpeṇa avikriyeṇa adhyakṣeṇa niyantrā bhāsakena avabhāsitā prakṛtiḥ
translated: By Me, as the Ruler, the Controller, the Illuminator, the Manifestor, by Me as the unchanging one whose nature is the mere seer on all sides, Nature,

original: triguṇātmikā sattvāsattvādibhir anirvācyā māyā sūyata utpādayati sacarācaraṃ jagan
analyzed: triguṇa ātmikā sattva asattva ādibhiḥ anirvācyā māyā sūyate utpādayati sacarācaram jagan
translated: which consists of the three gunas, which is indescribable as being or non-being etc., which is Maya, produces, gives birth to, this world consisting of moving and non-moving beings,

original: māyāvinādhiṣṭhiteva māyā kalpitagajaturagādikam /
analyzed: māyā vinā adhiṣṭhitā iva māyā kalpita gaja turaga ādikam
translated: like Maya, which is controlled by a magician, produces the imagined elephants, horses etc.

original: na tv ahaṃ svakāryamāyābhāsanam antareṇa karomi vyāpārāntaram /
analyzed: na tu aham sva kārya māyā bhāsanam antareṇa karomi vyāpāra antaram
translated: But I do not perform any other operation except manifesting My own creation, Maya.

original: hetunā nimittenānenādhyakṣatvena he kaunteya /
analyzed: hetunā nimittena anena adhyakṣa tvena he kaunteya
translated: O son of Kunti, by this reason, by this being the presiding deity,

original: jagat sacarācaraṃ viparivartate vividhaṃ parivartate janmādivināśāntaṃ dityāder iva kartṛtvābhāvād udāsīnavad āsīnam ity uktam iti na virodhaḥ
analyzed: jagat sacarācaram viparivartate vividham parivartate janma ādi vināśa antam diti ādeḥ iva kartṛ tva abhāvāt udāsīna vat āsīnam iti uktam iti na virodhaḥ
translated: the world with its moving and unmoving beings revolves in various ways, i.e. it undergoes various changes from birth to destruction, as if it were a doer, like Diti and others. Therefore, it is said to be as if indifferent, as if seated. There is no contradiction.

original: tad uktam 🔽asya dvaitendrajālasya yad upādānakāraṇam /
analyzed: tat uktam  asya dvaita indrajālasya yat upādānakāraṇam
translated: This is stated:🔽The ignorance which is the material cause of this magic show of duality,

original: ajñānaṃ tad upāśritya brahma kāraṇam ucyate // iti /
analyzed: ajñānam tat upāśritya brahma kāraṇam ucyate iti
translated: Relying on that, Brahman is said to be the cause.

original: śrutismṛtivādāś cātrārthe sahasraśa udāhāryāḥ ////
analyzed: śruti smṛti vādāḥ ca atra arthe sahasraśas udāhāryāḥ
translated: And thousands of statements from the Vedas and Smritis should be cited in this matter.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanu sṛṣṭyādikartus tavedam audāsīnyaṃ na pratyemīty ata āha mayeti /
analyzed: na pratyemi iti atas āha   iti
translated: Visvanatha: Well, I do not accept this indifference of yours who are the creator of creation etc. Therefore, He says maya (by Me).

original: adhyakṣeṇa mayā nimittabhūtena prakṛtiḥ sacarācaraṃ jagat sūyate /
analyzed: adhyakṣeṇa mayā nimitta bhūtena prakṛtiḥ sacarācaram jagat sūyate
translated: By Me, the presiding deity, Prakriti gives birth to the world with its moving and unmoving beings.

original: prakṛtir eva jagat janayati /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ eva jagat janayati
translated: Prakriti itself gives birth to the world.

original: mamātrādhyakṣatāmātram /
analyzed: mama atra adhyakṣa tā mātram
translated: I am merely the presiding deity.

original: yathā kasyacid ambarīṣāder iva bhūpateḥ prakṛtibhir eva rājyakṛtyaṃ nirvāhyate /
analyzed: yathā kasyacid ambarīṣa ādeḥ iva bhūpateḥ prakṛtibhiḥ eva rājya kṛtyam nirvāhyate
translated: Just as the affairs of the kingdom are carried out by the subjects themselves of some king like Ambarisha.

original: atrodāsīnasya bhūpateḥ sattāmātram iti yathā tasya rājasiṃhāsane sattāmātreṇa vinā prakṛtibhiḥ kim api na śakyate kartum /
analyzed: atrā udāsīnasya bhūpateḥ sattā mātram iti yathā tasya rāja siṃhāsane sattā mātreṇa vinā prakṛtibhiḥ kim api na śakyate kartum
translated: Here, the meaning is that just as the mere existence of a neutral king is not sufficient for his subjects to do anything,

original: tathaiva mamādhiṣṭhānalakṣaṇam adhyakṣatvaṃ vinā prakṛtir api jaḍā kim api kartuṃ na śaknotīti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva mama adhiṣṭhāna lakṣaṇam adhyakṣa tvam vinā prakṛtiḥ api jaḍā kim api kartum na śaknoti iti bhāvaḥ
translated: similarly, without my overlordship characterized by supervision, even Prakṛti, being inert, cannot do anything.

original: anena madadhiṣṭhānena hetunedaṃ jagat viparivartate punaḥ punar jāyate ////
analyzed: anena mad adhiṣṭhānena hetunā idam jagat viparivartate punar punar jāyate
translated: By this, the meaning is that this world revolves again and again due to my supervision.

original: baladevaḥ tat pratipādayati mayeti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ tat pratipādayati mayā iti
translated: Balarāma explains that with the word mayā (by Me).

original: satyasaṅkalpena prakṛtyadhyakṣeṇa mayā sarveśvareṇa jīvapūrvapūrvakarmānuguṇatayā vīkṣitā prakṛtiḥ sacarācaraṃ jagat sūyate janayati
analyzed: satya saṅkalpena prakṛti adhyakṣeṇa mayā sarveśvareṇa jīva pūrva pūrva karma anuguṇa tayā vīkṣitā prakṛtiḥ sacarācaram jagat sūyate janayati
translated: Prakṛti, being viewed by Me, the all-powerful one with true resolve, gives birth to this moving and non-moving world in accordance with the previous actions of the individual souls.

original: viṣamaguṇā satī anena jīvapūrvakarmānuguṇena madvīkṣaṇena hetunā taj jagad viparivartate punaḥ punar udbhavati /
analyzed: viṣama guṇā satī anena jīva pūrva karma anuguṇena mad vīkṣaṇena hetunā tat jagat viparivartate punar punar udbhavati
translated: Although having discordant qualities, by this cause of My viewing in accordance with the previous actions of the individual souls, that world revolves again and again, being born repeatedly.

original: he kaunteya /
analyzed: he kaunteya
translated: O son of Kunti!

original: śrutiś caivam āha
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca evam āha
translated: And the Śruti also says this:

original: vikārajananīm ajñām aṣṭarūpām ajāṃ dhruvām /
analyzed: vikāra jananīm ajñām aṣṭa rūpām ajām dhruvām
translated: The ignorant Prakṛti, having eight forms, unborn and eternal,

original: dhyāyate 'dhyāsitā tena tanyate preritā punaḥ /
analyzed: dhyāyate dhyāsitā tena tanyate preritā punar
translated: It is meditated upon by Him, being thus contemplated; it is expanded by Him, being thus impelled;

original: sūyate puruṣārthaṃ ca tenaivādhiṣṭhitā jagat //
analyzed: sūyate puruṣa artham ca tena eva adhiṣṭhitā jagat
translated: and it is evolved by Him, being thus controlled, the world.

original: iti sannidhimātreṇādhiṣṭhātṛtvāt kartṛtvam udāsaniṃ ca na viruddham /
analyzed: iti sannidhi mātreṇa adhiṣṭhātṛ tvāt kartṛ tvam udāsanim ca na viruddham
translated: Thus, because of the mere presence, there is the state of being the controller, and the state of being the creator is not contradicted.

original: yathā sannidhimātreṇagandhaḥ kṣobhāya jāyate ity ādi smaraṇāc caitad evaṃ madadhiṣṭhātṛmātraṃ khalu prekṛter apekṣyam /
analyzed: yathā sannidhi mātreṇa gandhaḥ kṣobhāya jāyate iti ādi smaraṇāt ca etat evam mad adhiṣṭhātṛ mātram khalu prekṛteḥ apekṣyam
translated: And this is so because of the remembrance beginning with the smell arises for the agitation by the mere presence (11.10). Thus, the mere control by Me is to be expected of Prakṛti.

original: madvinā kim api kartuṃ na sā prabhavet na hy asati rājñaḥ siṃhāsanādhiṣṭhātṛtve tadamātyāḥ kārye prabhavaḥ ////
analyzed: mat vinā kim api kartum na sā prabhavet na hi asati rājñaḥ siṃhāsana adhiṣṭhātṛ tve tad amātyāḥ kārye prabhavaḥ
translated: Without Me, she is not able to do anything. For, when there is no control by the king over the throne, his ministers are not able to do anything.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: avajānanti māṃ mūḍhā mānuṣīṃ tanum āśritam /
analyzed: avajānanti mām mūḍhāḥ mānuṣīm tanum āśritam
translated: The deluded ones disregard Me, who have resorted to a human body,

original: paraṃ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūtamaheśvaram ////
analyzed: param bhāvam a jānantaḥ mama bhūta maheśvaram
translated: not knowing My supreme nature, which is the great Lord of all beings.

original: śrīdharaḥ nanv evaṃbhūtaṃ parameśvaraṃ tvāṃ kim iti kecin nādriyante /
translated: Śrīdhara: Well, why do some people not respect You, who are such a supreme Lord?

original: tatrāha avajānantīti dvābhyām /
analyzed: tatra āha avajānanti iti dvābhyām
translated: In response, He says by two verses, The deluded ones disregard Me.

original: sarvabhūtamaheśvararūpaṃ madīyaṃ paraṃ bhāvaṃ tattvam ajānanto mūḍhā mūrkhā mām avajānanti mām avamanyante /
analyzed: sarva bhūta maheśvara rūpam madīyam param bhāvam tattvam a jānantaḥ mūḍhāḥ mūrkhāḥ mām avajānanti mām avamanyante
translated: The deluded ones, the foolish ones, who do not know My supreme nature, My reality, which is the great Lord of all beings, disregard Me, despise Me.

original: avajñāne hetuḥ śuddhasattvamayīm api tanuṃ bhaktecchāvaśān manuṣyākārām āśritavantam iti ////
analyzed: avajñāne hetuḥ śuddha sattva mayīm api tanum bhakta icchā vaśāt manuṣya ākārām āśritavantam iti
translated: The cause of contempt is that, although He has assumed a body consisting of pure Sattvaguṇa, out of His desire to bless His devotees, He has assumed a human form.

original: madhusūdanaḥ evaṃ nityaśuddhabuddhamuktasvabhāvaṃ sarvajantūnām ātmānam ānandaghanam anantam api santam avajānantīti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ evam nitya śuddha buddha mukta svabhāvam sarva jantūnām ātmānam ānanda ghanam anantam api santam avajānanti iti
translated: Madhusudana: Thus, although the Self of all beings is of the nature of eternal purity, knowledge, and freedom, and is full of bliss and infinite, they despise it.

original: avajānanti māṃ sākṣād īśvaro 'yam iti nādriyante nindanti vā mūḍhā avivekino janāḥ /🔽teṣām avajñāhetuṃ bhramaṃ sūcayati mānuṣīṃ tanum āśritaṃ manuṣyatayā pratīyamānāṃ
analyzed: avajānanti mām sākṣāt īśvaraḥ yam iti nā ādriyante nindanti vā mūḍhāḥ avivekinaḥ janāḥ  teṣām avajñā hetum bhramam sūcayati mānuṣīm tanum āśritam manuṣya tayā pratīyamānām
translated: The deluded, non-discriminating people regard Me as merely a human being, and do not respect Me as the Lord, or even criticize Me.🔽To indicate the delusion that is the cause of their contempt, He says: Who has assumed a human form, who has taken up an embodiment out of His own will, for the purpose of blessing His devotees, and is perceived as human.

original: mūrtim ātmecchayā bhaktānugrahārthaṃ gṛhītavantaṃ manuṣyatayā pratīyamānena dehena
analyzed: mūrtim ātma icchayā bhakta anugraha artham gṛhītavantam manuṣya tayā pratīyamānena dehena
translated: With a body that is perceived as human,

original: vyavaharantam iti yāvat /
analyzed: vyavaharantam iti yāvat
translated: He is engaged in worldly activities, up to this point.

original: tataś ca manuṣyo 'yam iti bhrāntyācchāditāntaḥkaraṇā mama paraṃ bhāvaṃ prakṛṣṭaṃ
analyzed: tatas ca manuṣyaḥ yam iti bhrāntyā ācchādita antaḥkaraṇā mama param bhāvam prakṛṣṭam
translated: And therefore, with their inner being obscured by the delusion that He is a human being, they do not know My supreme nature,

original: paāramarthikaṃ tattvaṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ mahāntarm īśvaram ajānanto yan nādriyante nindanti🔽vā tadanurūpam eva mūḍhatvasya // //
analyzed: tattvam sarva bhūtānām īśvaram a jānantaḥ yat na ādriyante nindanti 🔽vā tad anurūpam eva mūḍha tvasya
translated: the highest truth, the great Lord within all beings. Not respecting or even criticizing Him is indeed befitting of their delusion.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanu ca satyam anantakoṭibrahmāṇḍavyāpī saccidānandavigrahaḥ kāraṇārṇavaśāyī mahāpuruṣaḥ svaprakṛtyā jagat sṛjatīti
translated: Visvanatha: Well, it is true that the great Purusha, who pervades countless universes, whose form is existence, knowledge and bliss, who lies in the ocean of causality, creates the world by His own nature,

original: yaḥ prasiddhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ prasiddhaḥ
translated: and is well known.

original: sa eva hi bhavān /
analyzed: saḥ eva hi bhavān
translated: He is indeed You.

original: kintu vasudevasūnos taveyaṃ mānuṣī tanur ity etadaṃśenaiva kecit tava nikarṣaṃ vadantīty ata āha avajānantīti /
analyzed: kintu vasudeva sūnoḥ tava iyam mānuṣī tanuḥ iti etad aṃśena eva kecid tava nikarṣam vadanti iti atas āha avajānanti iti
translated: But some say that You are inferior, on the part of this human body of Yours, the son of Vasudeva. Therefore, He says, Disregarding...

original: mama mānuṣyās tanor asyā paraṃ bhāvaṃ kāraṇārṇavaśāyimahāpuruṣādibhyo 'py utkṛṣṭaṃ svarūpam ajānanta eva te /
analyzed: mama mānuṣyāḥ tanoḥ param bhāvam kāraṇa arṇava śāyi mahāpuruṣa ādibhyaḥ pi utkṛṣṭam sva rūpam a jānantaḥ eva te
translated: They, not knowing the supreme nature of this human body of Mine, which is My true form, superior even to the great Purusha who lies in the ocean of causality,

original: kīdṛśam / bhūtaṃ satyaṃ yad brahma tac ca tan maheśvaraṃ ceti /
analyzed: kīdṛśam bhūtam satyam yat brahma tat ca tat maheśvaram ca iti
translated: what is that nature? It is the truth, Brahman, and that is also the great Lord.

original: tan maheśvarapadaṃ satyāntaravyāvartakam atra jñeyam yukte kṣmādāvṛte bhūtam iti amaraḥ /
analyzed: tat maheśvara padam satya antara vyāvartakam atra jñeyam yukte kṣmāt āvṛte bhūtam iti amaraḥ
translated: The word maheshvara should be understood here as excluding other truths. Bhut means united with earth etc. according to Amarakosha.

original: tam ekaṃ govindaṃ saccidānandavigrahaṃ vṛndāvanasurabhūruhabhāvanāsīnaṃ satataṃ samarudgaṇo 'haṃ paramayā stutyā toṣayāmi iti GTU 🔽śruteḥ /ENDNOTE
analyzed: tam ekam govindam saccidānanda vigraham vṛndāvana sura bhūruha bhāvanā āsīnam satatam sa marut gaṇaḥ ham paramayā stutyā toṣayāmi iti 🔽śruteḥ endnote
translated: I, along with the Maruts, always please that one Govinda, whose form is existence, knowledge and bliss, who is seated in the form of a tree in the fragrant forest of Vrndavana, with the highest praise. Thus it is known.

original: narākṛti parabrahma iti smṛteś ca /
analyzed: nara ākṛti para brahma iti smṛteḥ ca
translated: And because of the Smṛti text, “The Supreme Brahman in human form.”

original: mamāsyā mānuṣyās tanoḥ saccidānandamayatvaṃ madabhijṇabhaktair ucyata eva /
analyzed: mama asyāḥ mānuṣyāḥ tanoḥ saccidānanda maya tvam mad abhijṇa bhaktaiḥ ucyate eva
translated: My human body is verily of the nature of existence, knowledge and bliss, as is declared by my devotees who know me.

original: tathā sarvabrahmāṇḍavyāpitvaṃ ca bālye yanmātrā śrīyaśodayā dṛṣṭam eva /
analyzed: tathā sarva brahmāṇḍa vyāpi tvam ca bālye yad mātrā śrī yaśodayā dṛṣṭam eva
translated: Similarly, my pervading the entire universe was seen by mother Yaśodā in my childhood itself.

original: yad vā mānuṣīṃ tanum eva viśinaṣṭi param utkṛṣṭaṃ bhāvaṃ sattāṃ viśuddhaṃ sattvaṃ saccidānandasvarūpam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: yat vā mānuṣīm tanum eva viśinaṣṭi param utkṛṣṭam bhāvam sattām viśuddham sattvam saccidānanda svarūpam iti arthaḥ
translated: Or, he specifies my human body itself: “The supreme, excellent nature, existence, pure goodness, the nature of existence, knowledge and bliss.” This is the meaning.

original: bhāvaḥ sattā svabhāvābhiprāyaḥ ity amaraḥ /
analyzed: bhāvaḥ sattā svabhāva abhiprāyaḥ iti amaraḥ
translated: The Amarakośa says, “Bhāva means existence, natural disposition.”

original: paraṃ bhāvam api viśinaṣṭi mama bhūtamaheśvaraṃ mama sṛjyāni bhūtāni ye brahmādyās teṣām api mahāntam īśvaram /
analyzed: param bhāvam api viśinaṣṭi mama bhūta maheśvaram mama sṛjyāni bhūtāni ye brahma ādyāḥ teṣām api mahāntam īśvaram
translated: He specifies the supreme nature also: “The great Lord of all beings. I am the great Lord of all beings, such as Brahmā, who are created by me.”

original: tasmāt jīvasyeva mama parameśvarasya tanur na bhinnā /
analyzed: tasmāt jīvasya iva mama parameśvarasya tanuḥ na bhinnā
translated: Therefore, like the individual soul, my body, the Supreme Lord’s, is not different.

original: tanur evāham /
analyzed: tanuḥ eva aham
translated: The body itself is I.

original: aham eva tanuḥ sākṣād brahmaiva śābdaṃ brahma dadhad vapuḥ BhP / / iti madabhijñaśukokter iti bhavādṛśais tu viśvasyatām iti bhāvaḥ
analyzed: aham eva tanuḥ sākṣāt brahma eva śābdam brahma dadhat vapuḥ bhp iti mad abhijña śuka ukteḥ iti bhavādṛśaiḥ tu viśvasyatām iti bhāvaḥ
translated: I am that body itself. The body that bears the Vedic Brahman. As said by Śuka who knows me. Thus, let it be accepted by people like you. This is the meaning.

original: baladevaḥ nanv īdṛśamahimānaṃ tvāṃ kim iti kecin nādriyante /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu īdṛśa mahimānam tvām kim iti kecid na ādriyante
translated: Balarāma: But why do some people not revere You who have such greatness?

original: tatrāha avajānantīti /
analyzed: tatra āha avajānanti iti
translated: There, He says, They disregard Me (11.41).

original: bhūtamaheśvaraṃ nikhilajagadekasvāminaṃ satyasaṅkalpaṃ sarvajñaṃ mahākāruṇikaṃ ca māṃ mūḍhās te 'vajānanti /
analyzed: bhūta maheśvaram nikhila jagat eka svāminam satya saṅkalpam sarvajñam mahā kāruṇikam ca mām mūḍhāḥ te
translated: Those fools disregard Me, the real great Lord, the sole master of the entire world, whose resolve is true, who am omniscient and greatly compassionate.

original: atra prakāraṃ darśayan viśinaṣṭi mānuṣīm iti mānuṣasanniveśinīṃ mānuṣaceṣṭābahulāṃ
analyzed: atra prakāram darśayan viśinaṣṭi mānuṣīm iti mānuṣa sanniveśinīm mānuṣa ceṣṭā bahulām
translated: Here, showing the way, He specifies with assuming a human body (11.41). A human form means having human arrangement, full of human activities.

original: tanuṃ śrīmūrtim āśritaṃ tādātmyasambandhena nityaṃ prāptaṃ mām itararājakumāratulyaḥ
analyzed: tanum śrī mūrtim āśritam tādātmya sambandhena nityam prāptam mām itara rāja kumāra tulyaḥ
translated: I am always attained by the relation of identity with that, but some people, equal to other princes,

original: kaścid ugrapuṇyo manuṣyo 'yam iti buddhyāvamanyanta ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kaścid ugra puṇyaḥ manuṣyaḥ yam iti buddhyā avamanyante iti arthaḥ
translated: think, This is just a human being with great merit, and disrespect Me with that idea. This is the meaning.

original: mānuṣī tanuḥ khalu pāñcabhautikyena na ca bhagavattanus tādṛk saccidānandarūpāya kṛṣṇāya iti /
analyzed: mānuṣī tanuḥ khalu pāñcabhautikyena na ca bhagavat tanuḥ tādṛś saccidānanda rūpāya kṛṣṇāya iti
translated: Indeed, a human body is made of the five elements and is not the Lord's body, as in Salutations to Kṛṣṇa, whose form is existence, knowledge and bliss.

original: tam ekaṃ govindaṃ saccidānandavigraham iti śravaṇāt /
analyzed: tam ekam govindam saccidānanda vigraham iti śravaṇāt
translated: Because it is heard that He is the one Govinda, whose form is existence, knowledge and bliss.

original: tathātve tadavajñātṝṇāṃ mauḍhyāndhyayogād brahmādivandyatvāyogāc ca /
analyzed: tathātve tad avajñātṝṇām mauḍhya āndhya yogāt brahma ādi vandya tva ayogāt ca
translated: If it were so, then those who disregard Him would be foolish and blind, and because they are not fit to be worshipped by Brahmā and others.

original: evaṃ buddhis teṣāṃ kuto yayā te mūḍhā bhaṇyante /
analyzed: evam buddhiḥ teṣām kutas yayā te mūḍhāḥ bhaṇyante
translated: How can they have that kind of understanding by which they are said to be fools?

original: tatrāha param iti /
analyzed: tatra āha param iti
translated: There, he says 'supreme'.

original: param asādhāraṇaṃ bhāvaṃ svabhāvam ajānantaḥ mānuṣākṛtes tasya jñānānndātmatvasarveśatvamokṣadatvādisvabhāvānabhijñānād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: param asādhāraṇam bhāvam svabhāvam a jānantaḥ mānuṣa ākṛteḥ tasya jñāna annda ātma tva sarva īśa tva mokṣa da tva ādi svabhāva anabhijñānāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Not knowing the supreme, extraordinary nature, which is one's own nature, means not knowing its nature as the bliss of knowledge in human form, as the lord of all, as the giver of liberation, and so on.

original: evaṃ ca sati tanum āśritam ity uktiviśeṣavibhātaṃ bhedakāryam ādāya bodhyā /
analyzed: evam ca sati tanum āśritam iti ukti viśeṣa vibhātam bheda kāryam ādāya bodhyā
translated: And in that case, the effect of difference, indicated by the specific statement 'taking up a body', should be understood.

original: yat tu vasudevasūnor dvārakādhipateḥ sūtikāgṛhāvirbhūtam eva svarūpaṃ naijaṃ caturbhujatvāt
analyzed: yat tu vasudeva sūnoḥ dvārakā adhipateḥ sūtikāgṛha āvirbhūtam eva sva rūpam naijam catur bhuja tvāt
translated: But the natural form of the son of Vasudeva, the lord of Dvārakā, which manifested in the delivery room, is indeed his own, because of having four arms.

original: tato vrajaṃ gacchataḥ svarūpaṃ tu mānuṣaṃ dvibhujatvād ata uktam babhūva prākṛtaḥ śiśuḥ itivat /
analyzed: tatas vrajam gacchataḥ sva rūpam tu mānuṣam dvi bhuja tvāt atas uktam babhūva prākṛtaḥ śiśuḥ itivat
translated: Therefore, when going to Vraja, his form is human, because of having two arms, and hence it is said 'he became an ordinary child', like that.

original: asti tanniravadhānam mānuṣīṃ tanum āśritam iti tadukteḥ /
analyzed: asti tat niravadhānam mānuṣīm tanum āśritam iti tad ukteḥ
translated: That is not entirely correct, because it is said 'taking up a human body',

original: tenaiva rūpeṇa caturbhujena iti pārthavākyāc ca tasmān mānuṣyasaṃniveśitvam eva
analyzed: tena eva rūpeṇa catur bhujena iti pārtha vākyāt ca tasmāt mānuṣya saṃniveśi tvam eva
translated: and also because of the statement by Arjuna 'in that very form with four arms'. Therefore,🔽his body is said to have the nature of humanity,

original: tattanor manuṣyatvam ity uktam yatrāvatīrṇaṃ kṛṣṇākhyaṃ paraṃ brahma narākṛti iti
analyzed: tad tanoḥ manuṣya tvam iti uktam yatra avatīrṇam kṛṣṇa ākhyam param brahma nara ākṛti iti
translated: where the supreme Brahman named Kṛṣṇa has descended in human form,

original: śrīvaiṣṇave / gūḍhaṃ
analyzed: śrīvaiṣṇave gūḍham
translated: in the Śrīvaiṣṇava. Hidden,

original: paraṃ brahma manuṣyaliṅgam iti śrībhāgavate ca /
analyzed: param brahma manuṣya liṅgam iti śrībhāgavate ca
translated: And in the Śrīmad Bhāgavata it is said: The Supreme Brahman in human form.

original: manuṣyaceṣṭāprācyuryāc ca tasyās tattvam /
analyzed: manuṣya ceṣṭā prācyuryāt ca tasyāḥ tattvam
translated: And its truth is established by the fact that it acts like a human being.

original: yathā manuṣyo 'pi rājā devavat siṃhavac ca viceṣṭanān nṛdevo nṛsiṃhaś ca vyapadiśyate /
analyzed: yathā manuṣyaḥ u pi rājā deva vat siṃha vat ca viceṣṭanāt nṛdevaḥ nṛsiṃhaḥ ca vyapadiśyate
translated: Just as a human being is called a god among men or a lion among men because of his actions like a god or a lion,

original: tasmād dvibhujaś caturbhujaś ca sa manuṣyabhāvenoktahetudvayād vyapadiśyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt dvi bhujaḥ catur bhujaḥ ca sa manuṣya bhāvena ukta hetu dvayāt vyapadiśyaḥ
translated: therefore, he should be referred to as a human being, for the two reasons stated, whether he has two arms or four arms.

original: na khalu bhujabhūmnā pareśatvam /
analyzed: na khalu bhuja bhūmnā para īśa tvam
translated: Certainly, supremacy is not due to the number of arms.

original: kārtavīryādau vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: kārtavīrya ādau vyabhicārāt
translated: Because of the fallacy of over-extension in the case of Kārtavīrya and others.

original: vibhucaitanyatvaṃ jagaj janmādihetutvaṃ vā paraśatvam /
translated: Supremacy is either being all-pervading consciousness or being the cause of the creation etc. of the world.

original: tac ca dvibhuje tasminn asty eva tac chrutaṃ na ca dvibhujatvaṃ sādi
analyzed: tat ca dvi bhuje tasmin asti eva tat śrutam na ca dvi bhuja tvam sādi
translated: And that certainly exists in him with two arms. That is heard. And having two arms is not a fault.

original: satpuṇḍarīkanayanaṃ meghābhaṃ vaidyutāmbaram /
analyzed: sat puṇḍarīka nayanam megha ābham vaidyuta ambaram
translated: Having eyes like beautiful lotuses, having a complexion like a cloud or lightning,

original: dvibhujaṃ maunamudrāḍhyaṃ vanamālinam īśvaram // GTU /
analyzed: dvi bhujam mauna mudrā āḍhyam vanamālinam īśvaram
translated: the Lord with two arms, bearing the gesture of silence, wearing a garland of forest flowers.

original: iti tasyānādisiddhatvaśravaṇāt prākṛtaḥ śiśur ity atra prakṛtyā svarūpeṇaiva vyaktaḥ śiśur ity evārthaḥ /
analyzed: iti tasya anādisiddha tva śravaṇāt prākṛtaḥ śiśuḥ iti atra prakṛtyā sva rūpeṇa eva vyaktaḥ śiśuḥ iti eva arthaḥ
translated: Thus, because it is heard that he is eternally existent, the meaning of an ordinary child here is that he is manifest as a child by his very nature.

original: tasmād vaidūryamaṇau nānārūpāṇi iva tasmin dvibhujatvādīni yugapat siddhāny eva yathārucyupāsyānīti śāntoditatvanityoditatvakalpanā dūrotsāritā
analyzed: tasmāt vaidūrya maṇau nānā rūpāṇi iva tasmin dvi bhuja tva ādīni yugapad siddhāni eva yathāruci upāsyāni iti śānta udita tva nitya udita tva kalpanā dūra utsāritā
translated: Therefore, just as various colors are present in a lapis lazuli gem, the states of having two arms, etc. are simultaneously established in Him. They should be worshipped according to one's preference. Thus, the notions of being tranquil or manifest, or being eternally manifest, are far removed.

original: BhG /🔽moghāśā moghakarmāṇo moghajñānā vicetasaḥ /
analyzed: bhg  mogha āśāḥ mogha karmāṇaḥ mogha jñānāḥ vicetasaḥ
translated: BhG.🔽Their hopes are futile, their actions are futile, their knowledge is futile, their minds are confused,

original: rākṣasīm āsurīṃ caiva prakṛtiṃ mohinīṃ śritāḥ ////
analyzed: rākṣasīm āsurīm ca eva prakṛtim mohinīm śritāḥ
translated: They have resorted to the demoniac and the demon-like nature, which is deluding.

original: śrīdharaḥ kiṃ ca moghāśā iti /
analyzed: ca   iti
translated: Śrīdhara: What is more, their hopes are futile, etc.

original: matto 'nyad devatāntaraṃ kṣipraṃ phalaṃ dāsyatīty evaṃ bhūtā moghā niṣphalaivāśā yeṣāṃ te /
analyzed: mattaḥ devatā antaram kṣipram phalam dāsyati iti evam bhūtāḥ moghā niṣphalā eva āśā yeṣām te
translated: Their hopes are futile, i.e., fruitless, in the sense that they think, Some deity other than Me will quickly bestow fruits.

original: ataeva madvimukhatvān moghāni niṣphalāni karmāṇi yeṣāṃ te /
analyzed: ataeva mad vimukha tvāt moghāni niṣphalāni karmāṇi yeṣām te
translated: For this very reason, their actions are futile, i.e., fruitless, because they turn away from Me.

original: mogham eva nānākutarkāśritaṃ śāstrajñānaṃ yeṣāṃ te /
analyzed: mogham eva nānā kutarka āśritam śāstra jñānam yeṣām te
translated: Their knowledge of scriptures based on various sophistries is futile.

original: ataeva vicetaso vikṣiptacittāḥ /
analyzed: ataeva vicetasaḥ vikṣipta cittāḥ
translated: For this very reason, their minds are confused, i.e., distracted.

original: sarvatra hetuḥ rākṣasīṃ tāmasīṃ hiṃsādipracurām āsurīṃ ca rājasīṃ kāmadarpādibahulāṃ mohinīṃ buddhibhraṃśakarīṃ prakṛtiṃ svabhāvaṃ śritā
analyzed: sarvatra hetuḥ rākṣasīm tāmasīm hiṃsā ādi pracurām āsurīm ca rājasīm kāma darpa ādi bahulām mohinīm buddhi bhraṃśa karīm prakṛtim svabhāvam śritā  /
translated: The reason everywhere is that they have resorted to, i.e., taken up, a nature, a disposition, which is deluding, which causes confusion of the intellect, which is demoniac, full of violence, etc., and which is demon-like, full of desire, pride, etc.🔽They have resorted to, i.e., taken up, a nature, a disposition, which is deluding, which causes confusion of the intellect, which is demoniac, full of violence, etc., and which is demon-like, full of desire, pride, etc.🔽They have resorted to, i.e., taken up, a nature, a disposition, which is deluding, which causes confusion of the intellect, which is demoniac, full of violence, etc., and which is demon-like, full of desire, pride, etc.🔽They have resorted to, i.e., taken up, a nature, a disposition, which is deluding, which causes confusion of the intellect, which is demoniac, full of violence, etc., and which is demon-like, full of desire, pride, etc.🔽They have resorted to, i.e., taken up, a nature, a disposition, which is deluding, which causes confusion of the intellect, which is demoniac, full of violence, etc., and which is demon-like, full of desire, pride, etc.

original: āśritāḥ santaḥ /🔽mām avajānantīti pūrveṇānvayaḥ ////
analyzed: āśritāḥ santaḥ 🔽mām avajānanti iti pūrveṇa anvayaḥ
translated: They have resorted to, i.e., taken up, a

original: madhusūdanaḥ te ca bhagavadavajñānanindanajanitamahāduritapratibaddhabuddhayo nirantaraṃ nirayanivāsārhā eva moghāśā iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ te ca bhagavat avajñāna nindana janita mahā durita pratibaddha buddhayaḥ nirantaram niraya nivāsa arhāḥ eva mogha āśāḥ iti
translated: And they, whose intellects are fettered by the great sin born of disrespect and censure of the Lord, are indeed deluded in their hopes, being fit only for continuous residence in hell.

original: īśvaram antareṇa karmāṇy eva naḥ phalaṃ dāsyantīty evaṃrūpā moghā niṣphalaivāśā phalaprārthanā yeṣāṃ te /
analyzed: īśvaram antareṇa karmāṇi eva naḥ phalam dāsyanti iti evaṃrūpā moghā niṣphalā eva āśā phala prārthanā yeṣām te
translated: And they are of vain hopes, i.e. their hopes are vain, fruitless, in the form, 'The actions themselves will give us the fruit, without God.'

original: ataeveśvaravimukhatvān moghāni śramamātrarūpāṇy agnihotrādīni karmāṇi yeṣāṃ te /
analyzed: ataeva īśvara vimukha tvāt moghāni śrama mātra rūpāṇi agnihotra ādīni karmāṇi yeṣām te
translated: And for that very reason, their actions such as Agnihotra etc. are vain, being mere labour, because they are averse to God.

original: tathā mogham īśvarāpratipādakakutarkaśāstrajanitaṃ jñānaṃ yeṣāṃ te /🔽kuta evaṃ yato vicetaso bhagavadavajñānajanitaduritapratibaddhavivekavijñātāḥ /
analyzed: tathā mogham īśvara a pratipādaka kutarka śāstra janitam jñānam yeṣām te  kutas evam yatas vicetasaḥ bhagavat avajñāna janita durita pratibaddha viveka vijñātāḥ
translated: Similarly, their knowledge is vain, born of the false reasoning of the scriptures which do not teach God.🔽How is this so? Because they are of deluded minds, their discrimination being obstructed by the sin born of disrespect for God.

original: kiṃ ca te bhagavadavajñānavaśād rākṣasīṃ tāmasīm avihitahiṃsāhetudveṣapradhānām
analyzed: kim ca te bhagavat avajñāna vaśāt rākṣasīm tāmasīm a vihita hiṃsā hetu dveṣa pradhānām
translated: And moreover, they are indeed those who have resorted to a nature which is stupefying,🔽the demoniac, which is of the mode of darkness, characterized by hatred, the cause of unprescribed violence,

original: āsurīṃ ca rājasīṃ śāstrānabhyanujñātaviṣayabhogaheturāgapradhānāṃ ca mohinīṃ
analyzed: āsurīm ca rājasīm śāstra anabhyanujñāta viṣaya bhoga hetu rāga pradhānām ca mohinīm
translated: and the Asuric, which is of the mode of passion, characterized by attachment, the cause of enjoyment of objects not sanctioned by the scriptures,

original: śāstrīyajñānabhraṃśahetuṃ prakṛtiṃ svabhāvam āśritā eva bhavanti / tataś
analyzed: śāstrīya jñāna bhraṃśa hetum prakṛtim svabhāvam āśritāḥ eva bhavanti tatas
translated: and which is the cause of the loss of scriptural knowledge. Therefore,

original: ca trividhaṃ narakasyedaṃ dvāraṃ nāśanam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: ca trividham narakasya idam dvāram nāśanam ātmanaḥ
translated: And this threefold is the door to hell, the destroyer of the self.

original: kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhaḥ ity uktanarakadvārabhāgitayā narakayātanām eva te satatam anubhavantīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: kāmaḥ krodhaḥ tathā lobhaḥ iti ukta naraka dvāra bhāgi tayā naraka yātanām eva te satatam anubhavanti iti arthaḥ
translated: Desire, anger, and greed - being associated with the parts of the door to hell as stated, the meaning is that they constantly experience the torments of hell.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanu ye mānuṣīṃ māyāmayīṃ tanum āśrito 'yam īśvara iti matvā tvām avajānanti /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ nanu ye mānuṣīm māyā mayīm tanum āśritaḥ yam īśvaraḥ iti matvā tvām avajānanti
translated: Visvanatha: Well, those who, considering that this Lord has resorted to a human body full of illusion, disregard you,

original: teṣāṃ kā gatis tatrāha moghāśā iti /
analyzed: teṣām kā gatiḥ tatra āha mogha āśāḥ iti
translated: what is their end? In that regard, he says, Moghashah (having vain desires).

original: yadi bhaktā api syus tad api moghāśā bhavanti /
analyzed: yadi bhaktāḥ api syuḥ tat api mogha āśāḥ bhavanti
translated: Even if they are devotees, they have vain desires.

original: matsālokyādim abhivāñchitaṃ na prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: mad sālokya ādim abhivāñchitam na prāpnuvanti
translated: They do not attain the desired heaven with me, etc.

original: yadi te karmiṇas tadā moghakarmāṇaḥ karmaphalaṃ svargādikaṃ na labhante /
analyzed: yadi te karmiṇaḥ tadā mogha karmāṇaḥ karma phalam svarga ādikam na labhante
translated: If they are ritualists, then their rituals are vain, they do not obtain the fruits of rituals such as heaven.

original: yadi te jñāninas tarhi moghajñānā jñānaphalaṃ mokṣaṃ na vidanti /
analyzed: yadi te jñāninaḥ tarhi mogha jñānāḥ jñāna phalam mokṣam na vidanti
translated: If they are knowers of Brahman, then their knowledge is vain, they do not attain the fruits of knowledge, liberation.

original: tarhi te kiṃ prāpunvantīty ata āha rākṣasīm iti /
analyzed: tarhi te kim prāpunvanti iti atas āha rākṣasīm iti
translated: Then what do they attain? In that regard, he says, Rakshasi (of the nature of demons).

original: te rākṣasīṃ prakṛtiṃ rākṣasānāṃ svabhāvaṃ śritāḥ prāptā bhavantīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: te rākṣasīm prakṛtim rākṣasānām svabhāvam śritāḥ prāptāḥ bhavanti iti arthaḥ
translated: They have resorted to the nature of demons, they have attained the nature of demons, is the meaning.

original: baladevaḥ nanu pāñcabhautikamānuṣatanum ānugrapuṇyaḥ purutejāḥ ko 'py ayam iti bhāvena tvām avajānatāṃ kā gatiḥ syāt tatrāha mogheti
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu pāñcabhautika mānuṣa tanum puru tejāḥ kaḥ pi ayam iti bhāvena tvām avajānatām kā gatiḥ syāt tatra āha mogha iti
translated: What is the fate of those who, thinking, This is some ordinary human being with a body composed of the five elements, disrespect you, O Lord? To that he says Moghāśāḥ (those with futile hopes).

original: yadi te īśvarabhaktā api syus tad api moghāśā niṣphalamokṣavāñchāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: yadi te īśvara bhaktāḥ api syuḥ tat api mogha āśāḥ niṣphala mokṣa vāñchāḥ syuḥ
translated: Even if they are devotees of God, they will have futile hopes, desires for fruitless liberation.

original: yadi te 'gnihotrādikarmaniṣṭhās tadā moghakarmāṇaḥ pariśramarūpāgnihotrādikāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: yadi te gnihotra ādi karma niṣṭhāḥ tadā mogha karmāṇaḥ pariśrama rūpa agnihotra ādikāḥ syuḥ
translated: If they are devoted to the rites of Agnihotra and so on, then they will have futile rites, Agnihotra and so on in the form of exertion.

original: yadi te jñānāya vedāntādiśāstrapariśīlanas tadā moghajñānā niṣphalatadbodhāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: yadi te jñānāya vedānta ādi śāstra pariśīlanaḥ tadā mogha jñānāḥ niṣphala tad bodhāḥ syuḥ
translated: If they study the Vedanta and other scriptures for knowledge, then they will have futile knowledge, fruitless understanding of that.

original: evaṃ kutaḥ / yatas te vicetasaḥ /
analyzed: evam kutas yatas te vicetasaḥ
translated: Why is it so? Because they are vicetasas (those with divided minds).

original: nityasiddhamanuṣyasaṃniveśisākṣātparabrahmamadavajñājanitapāpapratibaddhavivekajñānā ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: nitya siddha manuṣya saṃniveśi sākṣāt para brahma mada vajñā janita pāpa pratibaddha viveka jñānāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they have obstructed discriminating knowledge due to the sin generated by the pride and disrespect towards the Supreme Brahman, which is always present in human beings.

original: ataevam uktaṃ bṛhadvaiṣṇave
analyzed: ataevam uktam bṛhadvaiṣṇave
translated: For this very reason it is said in the Brihad-Vishnu Purana:

original: yo vetti bhautikaṃ dehaṃ kṛṣṇasya paramātmanaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vetti bhautikam deham kṛṣṇasya paramātmanaḥ
translated: He who considers the physical body of Krishna, the Supreme Self,

original: sa sarvasmād bahiṣkāryaḥ śrautasmārt avidhānataḥ /
analyzed: sa sarvasmāt bahiṣkāryaḥ śrauta smārt avidhānataḥ
translated: he should be excluded from all, according to the injunctions of the Vedas and Smritis.

original: mukhaṃ tasyāvalokyāpi sacelaṃ snānam ācaret // iti /
analyzed: mukham tasya avalokya api sa celam snānam ācaret iti
translated: Even by looking at his face, one should bathe along with one's clothes.

original: tarhi te kiṃ phalaṃ labhante /
analyzed: tarhi te kim phalam labhante
translated: Then what fruit do they attain?

original: tatrāha rākṣasīṃ hiṃsādipracurām tāmasīm āsurīṃ kāmagarvādipracurāṃ rājasīṃ mohinīṃ vivekavilopinṃ prakṛtiṃ svabhāvaṃ śritā narake nivāsārhās 🔽tiṣṭhanti ////
analyzed: tatra āha rākṣasīm hiṃsā ādi pracurām tāmasīm āsurīm kāma garva ādi pracurām rājasīm mohinīm viveka vilopinm prakṛtim svabhāvam śritāḥ narake nivāsa arhāḥ  tiṣṭhanti
translated: There it is said: They have resorted to the nature which is full of violence etc., which is full of desire, pride etc., which is Rajas, which is deluding, which destroys discrimination, which deserves to dwell in hell.🔽They remain...

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad Gita 9.30)

original: mahātmānas tu māṃ pārtha daivīṃ prakṛtim āśritāḥ /
analyzed: mahātmānaḥ tu mām pārtha daivīm prakṛtim āśritāḥ
translated: But the great souls, O son of Prtha, who have resorted to the divine nature,

original: bhajanty ananyamanaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam ////
analyzed: bhajanti an anya manasaḥ jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam
translated: Worship Me with a mind free from attachment, knowing Me to be the beginning of all beings and the imperishable one.

original: śrīdharaḥ ke tarhi tvām ārādhayantīti /
analyzed: śrīdharaḥ ke tarhi tvām ārādhayanti iti
translated: Sri Sridhara: But who are they that worship You?

original: ata āha mahātmāna iti /
analyzed: atas āha mahātmānaḥ iti
translated: To this he says: The great souls etc.

original: mahātmānaḥ kāmādyanabhibhūtacittāḥ /
analyzed: mahātmānaḥ kāma ādi an abhibhūta cittāḥ
translated: The great souls are those whose minds are not overcome by desire etc.

original: ataeva madhvyatirekena nāsty anyasmin mano yeṣām /
analyzed: ataeva madhu vyatirekena na asti anyasmin manaḥ yeṣām
translated: And for that very reason, they have no mind in anything else except Me.

original: te tu bhūtādiṃ jagatkāraṇam avyayaṃ ca māṃ jñātvā bhajanti ////
analyzed: te tu bhūtādim jagat kāraṇam avyayam ca mām jñātvā bhajanti
translated: But they worship Me, knowing Me to be the beginning of all beings and the imperishable one.

original: madhusūdanaḥ bhagavadvimukhānāṃ phalakāmanāyās tatprayuktasya nityanaimittikakāmyakarmānuṣṭhānasya
translated: Madhusudana: Since the desire for results of those who are averse to the Lord, the performance of obligatory, occasional and desired rites prompted by that,

original: tatprayuktasya śāstrīyajñānasya ca vaiyarthyāt pāralaukikaphalatatsādhanaśūnyās te /
analyzed: tad prayuktasya śāstrīya jñānasya ca vaiyarthyāt pāralaukika phala tad sādhana śūnyāḥ te
translated: and the scriptural knowledge prompted by that are useless, they are devoid of the means and results pertaining to the next world.

original: nāpy aihalaukikaṃ kiṃcit phalam asti teṣāṃ vivekavijñānaśūnyatayā vicetaso hi te /
analyzed: nā api aihalaukikam kiṃcid phalam asti teṣām viveka vijñāna śūnya tayā vicetasaḥ hi te
translated: Nor do they have any worldly benefit, because they are devoid of the knowledge of discrimination, for they are senseless.

original: ataḥ sarvapuruṣārthabāhyāḥ śocyā eva sarveṣāṃ te varākā ity uktam /
analyzed: atas sarva puruṣa artha bāhyāḥ śocyāḥ eva sarveṣām te varākāḥ iti uktam
translated: Therefore, they are excluded from all human goals. They are pitiable wretches, thus it has been said.

original: adhunā ke sarvapuruṣārthabhājo 'śocyā ye bhagavadekaśaraṇā ityucyate mahātmāna iti /
analyzed: adhunā ke sarva puruṣa artha bhājaḥ śocyāḥ ye bhagavat eka śaraṇāḥ iti ucyate mahātmānaḥ iti
translated: Now, who are those who enjoy all human goals, who are not to be grieved over, who are solely devoted to the Lord? It is said: the great souls.

original: mahān anekajanmakṛtasukṛtaiḥ saṃskṛtaḥ kṣudrakāmādyanabhibhūta ātmāntaḥkaraṇaṃ
analyzed: mahān aneka janma kṛta sukṛtaiḥ saṃskṛtaḥ kṣudra kāma ādi an abhibhūtaḥ ātma antaḥkaraṇam
translated: Those whose inner mind is great, purified by many good deeds done in many births, not overwhelmed by petty desires etc.,

original: yeṣāṃ te 'ataeva abhayaṃ sattvasaṃśuddhiḥ ity ādivakṣyamāṇāṃ daivīṃ sāttvikīṃ prakṛtim āśritāḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām te ataeva abhayam sattva saṃśuddhiḥ iti ādi vakṣyamāṇām daivīm sāttvikīm prakṛtim āśritāḥ
translated: and for that very reason, who have taken refuge in the divine, sattvic nature that will be described later as fearlessness, purity of heart, etc.

original: ataevānyasmin madvyatirikte nāsti mano yeṣāṃ te bhūtādiṃ sarvajagatkāraṇam avyayam avināśinaṃ ca mām īśvaraṃ jñātvā bhajanti sevante ////
analyzed: ataeva anyasmin mad vyatirikte na asti manaḥ yeṣām te bhūtādim sarva jagat kāraṇam avyayam avināśinam ca mām īśvaram jñātvā bhajanti sevante
translated: And for that very reason, those whose mind is not in anything else except Me, who know Me, the cause of all the world beginning with the elements, to be the imperishable, undecaying Lord, worship, serve Me.

original: viśvanātha tasmād ye mahātmāno yādṛcchikamadbhaktakṛpayā mahātmatvaṃ prāptās te tu mānuṣā api daivīṃ prakṛtiṃ devānāṃ svabhāvaṃ prāptāḥ
analyzed: viśvanātha tasmāt ye mahātmānaḥ yādṛcchika mad bhakta kṛpayā mahātma tvam prāptāḥ te tu mānuṣāḥ api daivīm prakṛtim devānām svabhāvam prāptāḥ
translated: O Viśvanātha, therefore, those great souls who have attained greatness by the grace of My chance devotees, though human, have attained the divine nature, the nature of the gods.

original: satto māṃ mānuṣākāram eva bhajante /
analyzed: sattaḥ mām mānuṣa ākāram eva bhajante
translated: The beings worship Me in the form of a man alone.

original: na vidyate 'nyatra jñānakarmāṇy akāmanādau mano yeṣāṃ te /
analyzed: na vidyate nyatra jñāna karmāṇi a kāmanā ādau manaḥ yeṣām te
translated: Those who do not have the mind elsewhere, i.e., who do not have the mind in knowledge and action, in the absence of desire etc.

original: māṃ bhūtādiṃ mayā tatam idaṃ sarvaṃ ity ādi madaiśvaryajñānena bhūtānāṃ brahmādistambaparyantānāṃ kāraṇam /
analyzed: mām bhūtādim mayā tatam idam sarvam iti ādi mad aiśvarya jñānena bhūtānām brahma ādi stamba paryantānām kāraṇam
translated: I am the cause of all beings, from Brahma down to a blade of grass, by the knowledge of My lordship, as stated in This all is pervaded by Me etc.

original: avyayaṃ saccidānandavigrahatvād anaśvaraṃ jñātveti mamāvyayatve madbhaktair etāvanmātraṃ majjñānam apekṣitavyam /
analyzed: avyayam saccidānanda vigraha tvāt anaśvaram jñātvā iti mama avyaya tve mad bhaktaiḥ etāvat mātram mad jñānam apekṣitavyam
translated: Knowing Me to be imperishable, i.e., knowing Me to be imperishable by virtue of having a body of existence, knowledge and bliss, My devotees should expect only this much knowledge of Me.

original: iyam eva tvaṃ padārthajñānakarmādyanapekṣā bhaktir ananyā sarvaśreṣṭhā rājavidyā rājaguhyam iti draṣṭavyam ////
analyzed: iyam eva tvam padārtha jñāna karma ādi anapekṣā bhaktiḥ ananyā sarva śreṣṭhā rāja vidyā rāja guhyam iti draṣṭavyam
translated: But this very devotion, which does not depend on the knowledge of the meaning of the word that, on knowledge, action etc., is the best, the knowledge of kings, the secret of kings. This should be seen.

original: baladevaḥ tarhi ke tvām ādiryante /
analyzed: baladevaḥ tarhi ke tvām ādiryante
translated: Balarama: Then who are those who worship You as the first?

original: tatrāha mahātmāna iti /🔽ye narākṛtiparabrahmamattattvavit satprasaṅgena tādṛśamanniṣṭhayā vistīrṇāgādhamanaso
analyzed: tatra āha mahātmānaḥ iti  ye sat prasaṅgena tādṛśa manniṣṭhayā vistīrṇa agādha manasaḥ
translated: To that he says great souls.🔽Those men who, by association with the good, by devotion to such a one as Me, have minds that are vast and deep,

original: madīye 'pi sahasraśīrṣādyākāre 'rucayas te manuṣyā api daivīṃ prakṛtim āśritāḥ
analyzed: madīye sahasra śīrṣa ādi ākāre rucayaḥ te manuṣyāḥ api daivīm prakṛtim āśritāḥ
translated: and who have no liking even for My forms like the thousand-headed one, they, though human, have resorted to the divine nature.

original: santo narākṛtiṃ māṃ madhyabhūtādividhirudrādisarvakāraṇam avyayaṃ nityaṃ ca🔽jñātvā niścitya bhajanti sevante /
analyzed: santaḥ nara ākṛtim mām madhya bhūta ādi vidhi rudra ādi sarva kāraṇam avyayam nityam ca  jñātvā niścitya bhajanti sevante
translated: The good men, knowing Me, who am the cause of all, beginning with the elements, the regents of the quarters, Rudra, etc., who am imperishable and eternal, and having ascertained (this), worship, serve Me.

original: ananyamanaso narākāra eva mayi nikhātacittāḥ ////
analyzed: an anya manasaḥ nara ākāre eva mayi nikhāta cittāḥ
translated: With their minds fixed on Me alone, with their hearts fixed on Me alone, who am of the form of a man.

original: BhG /🔽satataṃ kīrtayanto māṃ yatantaś ca dṛḍhavratāḥ /
analyzed: bhg  satatam kīrtayantaḥ mām yatantaḥ ca dṛḍha vratāḥ
translated: (10)🔽Always glorifying Me, and striving, and of firm vows,

original: namasyantaś ca māṃ bhaktyā nityayuktā upāsate // //
analyzed: namasyantaḥ ca mām bhaktyā nitya yuktāḥ upāsate  /
translated: And worshipping Me with devotion, ever-attached, they serve (Me).

original: śrīdharaḥ teṣāṃ bhajanaprakāram āha satatam iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: āha   iti
translated: The two verses beginning with always describe the way in which they worship.

original: satataṃ sarvadā stotramantrādibhiḥ kīrtayantaḥ kecin mām upāsate sevante /🔽dṛḍhāni vratāni niyamā yeṣāṃ tādṛśāḥ santaḥ /
analyzed: satatam sarvadā stotra mantra ādibhiḥ kīrtayantaḥ kecid mām upāsate sevante  dṛḍhāni vratāni niyamāḥ yeṣām tādṛśāḥ santaḥ
translated: Some serve Me by always glorifying Me with hymns, prayers, etc.

original: yatantaś ca īśvarapūjādiṣu indiryopasaṃhārādiṣu prayatnaṃ kurvantaḥ /🔽kecid bhaktyā namasyantaḥ praṇamantaś ca /
analyzed: yatantaḥ ca īśvara pūjā ādiṣu indirya upasaṃhāra ādiṣu prayatnam kurvantaḥ  kecid bhaktyā namasyantaḥ praṇamantaḥ ca
translated: Those who have firm vows, who are engaged in the control of the senses in the worship of God and other (duties),🔽and who are always devoted, serve Me without interruption.

original: anye nityayuktā anavaratam avahitā sevante /
analyzed: anye nitya yuktāḥ anavaratam avahitā sevante
translated: Others serve Me with devotion and by worshipping Me with prostrations.

original: bhaktyeti nityayuktā iti ca kīrtanādiṣv api draṣṭavyam ////
analyzed: bhaktyā iti nitya yuktāḥ iti ca kīrtana ādiṣu api draṣṭavyam
translated: With devotion and ever-attached should be understood to apply to glorification and other (acts of service) as well.

original: madhusūdanaḥ te kena prakāreṇa bhajantīty ucyate dvābhyām satatam iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ te kena prakāreṇa bhajanti iti ucyate dvābhyām satatam iti
translated: By what means do they worship? This is being stated by the next two verses.

original: satataṃ sarvadā brahmaniṣṭhaṃ gurum upasṛtya vedāntavākyavicāreṇa gurūpasadanetarakāle
analyzed: satatam sarvadā brahma niṣṭham gurum upasṛtya vedānta vākya vicāreṇa guru upasadana itara kāle
translated: Always, at all times, having approached the guru who is devoted to Brahman, at times other than attending on the guru,

original: ca praṇavajapopaniṣadāvartanādibhir māṃ sarvopaniṣatpratipādyaṃ brahmasvarūpaṃ
analyzed: ca praṇava japa upaniṣad āvartana ādibhiḥ mām sarva upaniṣad pratipādyam brahma svarūpam
translated: by means of the repetition of the Pranava (Om), the recitation of the Upanishads, and so on, they proclaim Me, who am the Brahman, the nature of Brahman taught in all the Upanishads,

original: kīrtayanto vedāntaśāstrādhyayanarūpaśravaṇavyāpāraviṣayīkurvanta iti yāvat /
analyzed: kīrtayantaḥ vedānta śāstra adhyayana rūpa śravaṇa vyāpāra viṣayīkurvantaḥ iti yāvat
translated: and make Me the object of the activity of hearing in the form of studying the Vedanta scriptures.

original: tatha dṛḍhavratā dṛḍhāni pratipakṣaiś cālayitum aśakyāni ahiṃsāsatyāsteyabrahmacaryāparigrahādīni vratāni yeṣāṃ te śamadamādisādhanasampannā
analyzed: dṛḍha vratāḥ dṛḍhāni pratipakṣaiḥ cālayitum aśakyāni ahiṃsā satya asteya brahmacarya aparigraha ādīni vratāni yeṣām te śama dama ādi sādhana sampannāḥ
translated: Thus, they who have firm vows, whose vows of non-violence, truth, non-stealing, celibacy, non-acceptance, and so on are unshakable by counteragents, are endowed with the means such as tranquility, self-control, and so on.

original: iti yāvat /🔽tathā coktaṃ patañjalinā ahiṃsāstayāsteyabrahmacaryāparigrahā yamāḥ Ys / te ty jātideśakālasamayānavacchinnāḥ sārvabhaumā mahāvratam
analyzed: iti yāvat  tathā ca uktam patañjalinā ahiṃsā staya asteya brahmacarya aparigrahāḥ yamāḥ te jāti deśa kāla samaya anavacchinnāḥ sārvabhaumāḥ mahāvratam
translated: Thus far.

original: Ys / iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: And this is stated by Patanjali: Non-violence, truth, non-stealing, celibacy, and non-acceptance are the yamas (restraints). They are not limited by caste, place, time, or occasion. They are universal and constitute the great vow.

original: jātyā brāhmaṇatvādikayā deśena tīrtyādinā kālena caturdaśyādinā samayena yajñādyanyatvenānavacchinnā ahiṃsādayaḥ
analyzed: jātyā brāhmaṇa tva ādikayā deśena tīrti ādinā kālena caturdaśī ādinā samayena yajña ādi anyatvena anavacchinnāḥ ahiṃsā ādayaḥ
translated: Non-violence etc., which are not limited by caste such as being a Brahmin, by place such as a holy place, by time such as the fourteenth day, or by occasion such as being other than a sacrifice,

original: sārvabhaumāḥ kṣiptamūḍhavikṣiptabhūmiṣv api bhāvyamānāḥ kasyām api jātau kasminn
analyzed: sārvabhaumāḥ kṣipta mūḍha vikṣipta bhūmiṣu api bhāvyamānāḥ kasyām api jātau kasmin
translated: are universal. Even when being cultivated in the stages of the distracted, deluded, and scattered, they are cultivated in some caste, in some place,

original: api deśe kasminn api kāle yajñādiprayojane 'pi hiṃsāṃ na kariṣyāmīty evaṃrūpeṇa
analyzed: api deśe kasmin api kāle yajña ādi prayojane hiṃsām na kariṣyāmi iti evaṃrūpeṇa
translated: in some time, even in the purpose of a sacrifice etc., with the form I will not do violence. In this way,

original: kiṃcid apy aparyudasya sāmānyena pravṛttā ete mahāvratam ity ucyante ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kiṃcid api a paryudasya sāmānyena pravṛttāḥ ete mahāvratam iti ucyante iti arthaḥ
translated: without excluding anything, they are engaged in a general way. These are called the great vows. This is the meaning.

original: tathā namasyantaś ca māṃ kāyavāṅmanobhir namaskurvantaś ca māṃ bhagavantaṃ vāsudevaṃ sakalakalyāṇaguṇanidhānam iṣṭadevatārūpeṇa gururūpeṇa 🔽ca sthitam / cakārāt
analyzed: tathā namasyantaḥ ca mām kāya vāc manobhiḥ namaskurvantaḥ ca mām bhagavantam vāsudevam sakala kalyāṇa guṇa nidhānam iṣṭadevatā rūpeṇa guru rūpeṇa  ca sthitam cakārāt
translated: Similarly, those who bow to Me, who pay homage to Me, Lord Vāsudeva, the abode of all auspicious qualities, who is present in the form of the desired deity and in the form of the guru, with body, speech, and mind. By the word ca (and),

original: śravaṇaṃ kīrtanaṃ viṣṇoḥ smaraṇaṃ pādasevanam /
analyzed: śravaṇam kīrtanam viṣṇoḥ smaraṇam pāda sevanam
translated: listening, glorifying Viṣṇu, remembering His feet,

original: arcanaṃ vandanaṃ dāsyaṃ sakhyam ātmanivedanam // BhP / /
analyzed: arcanam vandanam dāsyam sakhyam ātma nivedanam
translated: worshipping, bowing down, servitude, friendship, and offering oneself,

original: iti vandanasahacaritaṃ śravaṇādy api bodhavyam /
analyzed: iti vandana sahacaritam śravaṇa ādi api bodhavyam
translated: one should understand that listening etc. are also to be done along with bowing down.

original: arcanaṃ pādasevanam ity api gururūpe tasmin sukaram eva /
analyzed: arcanam pāda sevanam iti api guru rūpe tasmin sukaram eva
translated: Worship and service of the feet are also quite easy in that form of the Guru.

original: atra mām iti punar vacanaṃ saguṇarūpaparāmarśārtham /
analyzed: atra mām iti punar vacanam sa guṇa rūpa parāmarśa artham
translated: Here, the repetition of me is for the purpose of referring to the form with qualities.

original: anyathā vaiyarthyaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anyathā vaiyarthya prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, it would be meaningless.

original: tathā bhaktyā madviṣayeṇa pareṇa premṇā nityayuktāḥ sarvadā saṃyuktāḥ etena sarvasādhanapauṣkalyaṃ pratibandhakābhāvaś ca darśitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā bhaktyā mad viṣayeṇa pareṇa premṇā nitya yuktāḥ sarvadā saṃyuktāḥ etena sarva sādhana pauṣkalyam pratibandhaka abhāvaḥ ca darśitaḥ
translated: Thus, they are always connected with supreme devotion towards me, with great love. This shows the abundance of all means and the absence of obstacles.

original: yasya deve parā bhaktiḥ yathā deve tathā gurau /
analyzed: yasya deve parā bhaktiḥ yathā deve tathā gurau
translated: He who has supreme devotion to God, and likewise to the Guru,

original: tasyaite kathitā hy arthāḥ prakāśante mahātmanaḥ // ŚvetU /
analyzed: tasya ete kathitāḥ hi arthāḥ prakāśante mahātmanaḥ
translated: for him these truths are revealed, O Sveta, by the great Self.

original: patañjalinā coktaṃ tataḥ pratyakcetanādhigamo 'py antarāyābhāvaś ca Ys / iti /
analyzed: patañjalinā ca uktam tatas antarāya abhāvaḥ ca iti
translated: And it is said by Patanjali: Then, the realization of the inward-turned consciousness and the absence of obstacles.

original: tata īśvarapraṇidhānāt pratyakcetanasya tvaṃpoadalakṣyasyādhigamaḥ sākṣātkāro bhavati /
analyzed: tatas īśvara praṇidhānāt pratyak cetanasya tvaṃpoada lakṣyasya adhigamaḥ sākṣātkāraḥ bhavati
translated: From that, from the meditation on God, there is the realization, the direct experience, of the inward-turned consciousness, which is the object of the pronoun you.

original: antarāyāṇāṃ vighnānāṃ cābhāvo bhavatīti sūtrasyārthaḥ /
analyzed: antarāyāṇām vighnānām ca abhāvaḥ bhavati iti sūtrasya arthaḥ
translated: And there is the absence of obstacles, of hindrances. This is the meaning of the aphorism.

original: tad evaṃ śamadamādisādhanasampannā vedāntaśravaṇamananaparāyaṇāḥ parameśvare
analyzed: tat evam śama dama ādi sādhana sampannāḥ vedānta śravaṇa manana parāyaṇāḥ parameśvare
translated: Thus, endowed with the means such as tranquility, self-control, etc., devoted to listening to and reflecting on the Vedanta, in the Supreme Lord,

original: paramagurau premṇā namaskārādinā ca vigatavighnāḥ paripūrṇasarvasādhanāḥ santo
analyzed: parama gurau premṇā namaskāra ādinā ca vigata vighnāḥ paripūrṇa sarva sādhanāḥ
translated: Having become free from obstacles by the worship etc. of the supreme guru with love, and having become endowed with all the means fully,

original: mām upāsate vijātīyapratyayānantaritena sajātīyapratyayapravāheṇa śravaṇamananottarabhāvinā
analyzed: mām upāsate vijātīya pratyaya anantaritena sajātīya pratyaya pravāheṇa śravaṇa manana uttara bhāvinā
translated: they meditate on me with a stream of cognitions of the same kind, not interrupted by cognitions of a different kind, which comes after hearing and reflection.

original: satataṃ cintayanti mahātmānaḥ /
analyzed: satatam cintayanti mahātmānaḥ
translated: And the great souls always think of me.

original: anena nididhyāsanaṃ caramasādhanaṃ darśitam /
analyzed: anena nididhyāsanam carama sādhanam darśitam
translated: By this, meditation is shown to be the final means.

original: etādṛśasādhanapauṣkalye sati yad vedāntavākyajam akhaṇḍagocaraṃ sākṣātkārarūpam
analyzed: etādṛśa sādhana pauṣkalye sati yat vedānta vākya jam akhaṇḍa gocaram sākṣātkāra rūpam
translated: When there is an abundance of such means, the knowledge that arises from the Vedanta statements, which has an undivided object, which is in the form of direct experience,

original: ahaṃ brahmāsmīti jñānaṃ tatsarvaśaṅkākalaṅkāspaṣṭaṃ sarvasādhanaphalabhūtaṃ
analyzed: aham brahma asmi iti jñānam tat sarva śaṅkā kalaṅka aspaṣṭam sarva sādhana phala bhūtam
translated: I am Brahman, which is free from all doubts and blemishes, which is the fruit of all the means,

original: svotpattimātreṇa dīpa iva tamaḥ sakalam ajñānaṃ tatkāryaṃ ca nāśayatīti nirapekṣam🔽eva sākṣānmokṣahetur na tu bhūmijayakrameṇa bhrūmadhye prāṇapraveśanaṃ mūrdhanyayā🔽nāḍyā prāṇotkramaṇam arcirādimārgeṇa
analyzed: sva utpatti mātreṇa dīpaḥ iva tamaḥ sakalam ajñānam tad kāryam ca nāśayati iti nirapekṣam  eva sākṣāt mokṣa hetuḥ na tu bhūmi jaya krameṇa bhrū madhye prāṇa praveśanam mūrdhanyayā  nāḍyā prāṇa utkramaṇam arciḥ ādi mārgeṇa
translated: destroys all ignorance and its effects like darkness by a lamp merely by its arising.
