Thus it is independent,🔽and is the direct cause of liberation, and not by the process of conquering the stages of earth, by the entry of prana into the middle of the eyebrows,🔽by the exhalation of prana through the suṣumnā nerve, by going to the world of Brahman through the path of light etc.,

original: brahmalokagamanaṃ tadbhogāntakālavilambaṃ vā pratīkṣate /
analyzed: brahma loka gamanam tad bhoga anta kāla vilambam vā pratīkṣate
translated: or by waiting for the end of the enjoyment there or for the delay in time.

original: ato yatprākpratijñātam idaṃ tu te guhyatamaṃ pravakṣyāmy uanasūyave jñānam iti tad etad uktam /
analyzed: atas yat prāk pratijñātam idam tu te guhyatamam pravakṣyāmi uanasūyave jñānam iti tat etat uktam
translated: Therefore, what was promised earlier, But this, the most secret knowledge, I shall explain to one who is not a critic, that has been stated.

original: phalaṃ cāsyāśubhān mokṣaṇaṃ prāg uktam evetīha punar noktam /
analyzed: phalam ca asya aśubhāt mokṣaṇam prāk uktam eva iti iha punar na uktam
translated: And the result of this, liberation from misfortune, has been stated earlier only, so it is not stated again here.

original: evam atrāyaṃ gambhīro bhagavato 'bhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: evam atra ayam gambhīraḥ bhagavataḥ bhiprāyaḥ
translated: Thus, this is the profound intention of the Blessed Lord here.

original: uttānārthyas tu prakaṭa eva ////
analyzed: uttānārthyaḥ tu prakaṭaḥ eva
translated: But the explicit meaning is indeed clear.

original: viśvanāthaḥ bhajantīty uktam /
translated: Viśvanātha: It has been said they worship.

original: tadbhajanam eva kim ity ata āha satataṃ sadeti nātra karmayoga iva kāladeśapātraśuddhādyapekṣā kartavyety arthaḥ /
analyzed: tad bhajanam eva kim iti atas āha satatam sadā iti na atra karma yogaḥ iva kāla deśa pātra śuddha ādi apekṣā kartavyā iti arthaḥ
translated: What is that worship? To that, he says always, with the mind etc. The meaning is that here, unlike in Karma-yoga, there is no need to consider time, place, the purity of the recipient, etc. in what is to be done.

original: na deśaniyamas tatra na kālaniyamas tatha /
analyzed: na deśa niyamaḥ tatra na kāla niyamaḥ
translated: There is no restriction of place, nor restriction of time,

original: nocchiṣṭhādau niṣedho ' sti śrīharer nāmni lubdhaka // iti smṛteḥ /
analyzed: na ucchiṣṭha ādau niṣedhaḥ sti śrī hareḥ nāmni lubdhakaḥ iti smṛteḥ
translated: there is no prohibition regarding remnants etc. in the name of Lord Hari.

original: yatanto yatamānaḥ /
analyzed: yatantaḥ yatamānaḥ
translated: Striving means making efforts.

original: yathā kuṭumbapālanārthaṃ dīnā gṛhasthā dhanikadvārādau dhanārthaṃ yatante /
analyzed: yathā kuṭumba pālana artham dīnāḥ gṛhasthāḥ dhanika dvāra ādau dhana artham yatante
translated: Just as poor householders strive at the door of the rich for wealth in order to maintain their families,

original: tathaiva madbhaktāḥ kīrtanādibhaktiprāptyarthaṃ bhaktasabhādau yatante / prāpya ca bhaktim adhīyamānam śāstram paṭhata iva punaḥ punar
analyzed: tathā eva mad bhaktāḥ kīrtana ādi bhakti prāpti artham bhakta sabhā ādau yatante prāpya ca bhaktim adhīyamānam śāstram paṭhate iva punar punar
translated: Similarly, my devotees strive in the assembly of devotees etc. for attaining devotion through glorification etc. And having attained devotion, they repeatedly study the scriptures that are being taught, as if reading them.

original: abhyasyanti ca /
analyzed: abhyasyanti ca
translated: And they practice them.

original: etāvanti nāmagrahaṇāni /
analyzed: etāvanti nāmagrahaṇāni
translated: There are so many repetitions of names.

original: etāvatyaḥ praṇatayaḥ /
analyzed: etāvatyaḥ praṇatayaḥ
translated: There are so many salutations.

original: etāvatyaḥ paricaryāś cāvaśyakartavyā ity evaṃ dṛḍhāni vratāni niyamā yeṣāṃ te / yad vā /
analyzed: etāvatyaḥ paricaryāḥ ca avaśya kartavyāḥ iti evam dṛḍhāni vratāni niyamāḥ yeṣām te yat vā
translated: There are so many services that must be performed. Those who have such firm vows, or

original: dṛḍhāny apatitāny ekādaśyādivratāni niyamā yeṣāṃ te //
analyzed: dṛḍhāni a patitāni ekādaśī ādi vratāni niyamāḥ yeṣām te
translated: those whose vows, such as Ekadashi, are firm and unbroken.

original: namasyantaś ca cakāraḥ śravaṇapādasevanādyanuktasarvabhaktisaṅgrahārthaḥ /
analyzed: namasyantaḥ ca cakāraḥ śravaṇa pāda sevana ādi anukta sarva bhakti saṅgraha arthaḥ
translated: And the word and in worshipping is for the purpose of including all devotion not mentioned, such as listening, serving, and attending.

original: nityayuktā bhāvinaṃ mannityasaṃyogam ākāṅkṣanta āśaṃsāyāṃ bhūtavac ceti vartamāne 'pi bhūtakālikaḥ ktapratyayaḥ /
analyzed: nitya yuktāḥ bhāvinam mad nitya saṃyogam ākāṅkṣante āśaṃsāyām bhūta vat ca iti vartamāne pi bhūta kālikaḥ ktapratyayaḥ
translated: And being always devoted, desiring future constant association with Me, the aorist suffix is used even in the present tense, as if past, in āśamsāyāṃ bhūtavac ca.

original: atra māṃ kīrtayanta eva mām upāsata iti matkīrtanādikam eva madupāsanam iti vākyārthaḥ / ato
analyzed: atra mām kīrtayantaḥ eva mām upāsate iti mad kīrtana ādikam eva mad upāsanam iti vākya arthaḥ
translated: Here, the meaning of the sentence is that by merely glorifying Me, they worship Me. Thus, glorification of Me and so on is itself worship of Me. Therefore,

original: mām iti na paunruktyam āśaṅkanīyam ////
analyzed: mām iti na paunruktyam āśaṅkanīyam
translated: Me should not be suspected of being redundant.

original: baladevaḥ bhaktiprakāram āha satatam iti dvayena /
translated: Lord Balarama describes the way of devotion with two verses beginning with Always.

original: satataṃ sarvadā deśakālādiviśuddhinairapekṣeṇa māṃ kīrtayantaḥ sudhāmadhurāṇi
analyzed: satatam sarvadā deśa kāla ādi viśuddhi nairapekṣeṇa mām kīrtayantaḥ sudhā madhurāṇi
translated: Always, without any regard for purity of place, time, etc., they glorify Me.

original: mama kalyāṇaguṇakarmānubandhīni govindagovardhanoddharaṇādīni nāmāny uccair uccārayanto mām upāsate /
analyzed: mama kalyāṇa guṇa karma anubandhīni govinda govardhana uddharaṇa ādīni nāmāni uccais uccārayantaḥ mām upāsate
translated: They loudly chant My names, which are connected with My auspicious qualities and deeds, such as Govinda, Govardhana-uddharaṇa (the lifter of the mountain Govardhana), etc., and worship Me.

original: namasyantaśc a madarcanāniketeṣu gatvā dhūlipaṅkāpteṣu bhūtaleṣu daṇḍavatpraṇipatanto bhaktyā prītibhareṇa /
analyzed: namasyantaḥ c mad arcanā niketeṣu gatvā dhūli paṅka āpteṣu bhū taleṣu daṇḍa vat praṇipatantaḥ bhaktyā prīti bhareṇa
translated: And they bow down to Me. Having gone to the places of My worship, on the dusty and muddy ground, they prostrate themselves like rods, with devotion and an abundance of love.

original: kīrtayanto mām upāsata iti matkīrtanādikam eva madupāsanam iti vākyārthaḥ /
analyzed: kīrtayantaḥ mām upāsate iti mad kīrtana ādikam eva mad upāsanam iti vākya arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that glorifying Me and so on is itself the worship of Me.

original: ato mām iti na paunaruktyam /
analyzed: atas mām iti na paunaruktyam
translated: Therefore, to Me is not a repetition.

original: caśabdo 'nuktānāṃ śravaṇārcanavandanādīnāṃ samuccāyakaḥ /
analyzed: caśabdaḥ n uktānām śravaṇa arcana vandana ādīnām samuccāyakaḥ
translated: The word ca (and) indicates the inclusion of other unmentioned things like hearing, worshipping, and bowing down.

original: yatantaḥ samānāśayaiḥ sādhubhiḥ sārdhaṃ matsvarūpaguṇādiyāthātmyanirṇayāya yatamānāḥ /
analyzed: yatantaḥ samāna āśayaiḥ sādhubhiḥ sārdham mad sva rūpa guṇa ādi yāthātmya nirṇayāya yatamānāḥ
translated: Striving, with those of equal aspiration, along with good people, they are trying to determine the nature of My form, qualities, etc.

original: dṛḍhavratā dṛḍhāny askhalitāny ekādaśījanmāṣṭamyupoṣaṇādīni vratāni yeṣāṃ te /
analyzed: dṛḍha vratāḥ dṛḍhāni a skhalitāni ekādaśī janma aṣṭamī upoṣaṇa ādīni vratāni yeṣām te
translated: They are of firm vows, they have firm, unerring vows such as fasting on Ekadashi and Janmashtami.

original: nityayuktā bhāvinaṃ
analyzed: nitya yuktāḥ bhāvinam
translated: Always devoted, they are always engaged in the future.

original: mannityasaṃyogaṃ vāñchantaḥ āśaṃsāyāṃ bhūtavac ca Pāṇ / / iti sūtrād vartamāne 'pi bhūtakālikaktapratyayaḥ ////
analyzed: mat nitya saṃyogam vāñchantaḥ āśaṃsāyām bhūta vat ca pāṇ iti sūtrāt vartamāne pi bhūta kālika kta pratyayaḥ
translated: Or, desiring the connection with the word 'my', the optative ending is used in the present tense also, according to the sutra 'Ashamsayaṃ bhūtavat ca pāṇi' (Panini 3.2.1).

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: jñānayajñena cāpy anye yajanto mām upāsate /
analyzed: jñāna yajñena ca api anye yajantaḥ mām upāsate
translated: Others worship Me by the sacrifice of knowledge, meditating on Me.

original: ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśvatomukham ////
analyzed: eka tvena pṛthak tvena bahudhā viśvatomukham
translated: As one, as separate, in many ways, with face turned everywhere.

original: śrīdharaḥ kiṃ ca jñāneti /
analyzed: ca
translated: Śrīdhara: What is more, others worship Me by the sacrifice of knowledge.

original: vāsudevaḥ sarvam ity evaṃ sarvātmatvadarśanaṃ jñānam /
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti evam sarva ātma tva darśanam jñānam
translated: Knowledge is the realization that Vāsudeva is all, that He is the Self of all.

original: tad eva yajñaḥ /
analyzed: tat eva yajñaḥ
translated: That itself is the sacrifice.

original: tena jñānayajñena māṃ yajantaṃ pūjayanto 'nye 'py upāsate /
analyzed: tena jñāna yajñena mām yajantam pūjayantaḥ nye pi upāsate
translated: Others worship Me by that sacrifice of knowledge, by worshipping Me.

original: tatrāpi kecid ekatvenābhedabhāvanayā /
analyzed: tatra api kecid ekatvena abheda bhāvanayā
translated: Among them, some meditate on Me as one, with the thought of non-difference.

original: kecit pṛthaktvena pṛthagbhāvanayā dāso 'ham iti /
analyzed: kecid pṛthaktvena pṛthak bhāvanayā dāsaḥ ham iti
translated: Some as separate, with the thought of separateness, as 'I am His servant'.

original: kecit tu viśvatomukhaṃ sarvātmakaṃ māṃ bahudhā brahmarudrādirūpeṇopāsate ////
analyzed: kecid tu viśvatomukham sarva ātmakam mām bahudhā brahma rudra ādi rūpeṇa upāsate
translated: But some worship Me as having face turned everywhere, as the Self of all, in many ways, in the forms of Brahmā, Rudra, etc.

original: madhusūdanaḥ idānīṃ ye evam uktaśravaṇamanananididhyāsanāsamarthās te 'pi vividhā uttamā madhyamā mandāś ceti sarve 'pi svānurūpyeṇa mām
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ idānīm ye evam ukta śravaṇa manana nididhyāsana asamarthāḥ te vividhāḥ uttamāḥ madhyamāḥ mandāḥ ca iti sarve sva ānurūpyeṇa mām
translated: Madhusūdana: Now, even those who are incapable of listening, reflecting, and meditating as described above, all of them, being of various kinds, superior, middling, and inferior, worship Me according to their capacity,

original: upāsata ity āha jñānayajñeneti /
analyzed: upāsate iti āha jñāna yajñena iti
translated: says 'by the sacrifice of knowledge'.

original: anye pūrvoktasādhanānuṣṭhānāsamarthā jñānayajñena tvaṃ vā aham asmi bhagavo devate
analyzed: anye pūrva ukta sādhana anuṣṭhāna asamarthāḥ jñāna yajñena tvam vai aham asmi bhagavaḥ devate
translated: Others, who are unable to perform the aforesaid means, worship Me through the knowledge-sacrifice, which is the meditation on the identity of the self and God as taught in the scriptures, such as You are indeed I, O Lord, O God,

original: ahaṃ vai tvam asi ity ādiśrutyuktam ahaṅgrahopāsanaṃ jñānaṃ sa eva parameśvarayajanarūpatvād yajñas tena /
analyzed: aham vai tvam asi iti ādi śruti uktam ahaṅgraha upāsanam jñānam saḥ eva parameśvara yajana rūpa tvāt yajñaḥ tena
translated: I am indeed You and so on. That knowledge is the sacrifice, since it has the form of worshipping the Supreme Lord.

original: cakāra evārthe /
analyzed: cakāraḥ eva arthe
translated: The word eva (indeed) has the sense of only.

original: apiśabdaḥ sādhanāntaratyāgārthaḥ /
analyzed: api śabdaḥ sādhana antara tyāga arthaḥ
translated: The word api (even) has the sense of renouncing other means.

original: kecit sādhanāntaranispṛhāḥ santa upāsyopāsakābhedacintārūpeṇa jñānayajñenaikatvena bhedavyāvṛttyā mām evopāsate cintayanty uttamāḥ /
analyzed: kecid sādhana antara nispṛhāḥ santaḥ upāsya upāsaka abheda cintā rūpeṇa jñāna yajñena ekatvena bheda vyāvṛttyā mām eva upāsate cintayanti uttamāḥ
translated: Some, who are detached from other means, worship Me as one through the knowledge-sacrifice in the form of meditating on the non-difference between the object of worship and the worshipper. The best ones think of Me as non-different.

original: anye tu kecin madhyamāḥ pṛthaktvenopāsyopāsakayor bhedena ādityo brahmety ādeśaḥ ChāU / / ity ādiśrutyuktena pratīkopāsanarūpeṇa jñānayajñena
analyzed: anye tu kecid madhyamāḥ pṛthaktvena upāsya upāsakayoḥ bhedena ādityaḥ brahma iti ādeśaḥ chāu iti ādi śruti uktena pratīka upāsana rūpeṇa jñāna yajñena
translated: But others, who are middling, worship Me as different through the knowledge-sacrifice in the form of symbolic worship as taught in the scriptures such as The sun is Brahman and so on.

original: mām evopāsate /🔽anye tv ahaṅgrahopāsane
analyzed: mām eva upāsate  anye tu ahaṅgraha upāsane
translated: They worship Me as different.🔽But others, who are unable to meditate on the identity of the self and God

original: pratīkopāsane vāsamarthāḥ kecin mandā kāṃcid anyāṃ devatāṃ copāsīnāḥ kānicit karmāṇi vā kurvāṇā bahudhā tais tair bahubhiḥ prakārair viśvarūpaṃ
analyzed: pratīka upāsane vā asamarthāḥ kecid mandā kāṃcid anyām devatām ca upāsīnāḥ kānicid karmāṇi vā kurvāṇāḥ bahudhā taiḥ taiḥ bahubhiḥ prakāraiḥ viśva rūpam
translated: or on symbolic worship, some who are inferior, worship some other deity or perform some rites, in many ways through those many methods, the universal form of🔽Me, which is difficult to attain.

original: sarvātmānaṃ māma evopāsate /
analyzed: sarva ātmānam mām aḥ eva upāsate
translated: They worship Me alone as the Self of all.

original: tena tena jñānayajñeneti uttarottarāṇāṃ krameṇa pūrvapūrvabhūmilābhaḥ ////
analyzed: tena tena jñāna yajñena iti uttara uttarāṇām krameṇa pūrva pūrva bhūmi lābhaḥ
translated: By that and that knowledge-sacrifice, means that each subsequent stage is attained by the previous stage.

original: viśvanāthaḥ tad evam atrādhyāye pūrvādhyāye cānanyabhakta eva mahātmaśabdavācya ārtādisarvabhaktebhyo nyūnāḥ /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ tat evam atra adhyāye pūrva adhyāye ca ananya bhaktaḥ eva mahātma śabda vācyaḥ ārta ādi sarva bhaktebhyaḥ nyūnāḥ
translated: Visvanatha: Thus, in this chapter and the previous chapter, only the devotee who is not devoted to anything else is called great soul, and he is superior to all devotees, including the distressed one.

original: ahaṅgrahopāsakāḥ pratīkopāsakā viśvarūpopāsakās tān darśayati jñānayajñeneti /
analyzed: ahaṅgraha upāsakāḥ pratīka upāsakāḥ viśvarūpa upāsakāḥ tān darśayati jñāna yajñena iti
translated: He shows those who worship the individual soul, those who worship the symbol, and those who worship the universal form, with by the knowledge-sacrifice.

original: anye na mahātmanaḥ pūrvoktasādhanānuṣṭhānāsamarthaḥ ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: anye na mahātmanaḥ pūrva ukta sādhana anuṣṭhāna asamarthaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Others are not great souls, meaning they are not able to practice the previously mentioned means.

original: jñānayajñena tvaṃ vā aham asmi bhagavo devatā ahaṃ vai tvam asi ity ādi śrutyuktam ahaṅgrahopāsanaṃ jñānam /
analyzed: jñāna yajñena tvam vai aham asmi bhagavaḥ devatā aham vai tvam asi iti ādi śruti uktam ahaṅgraha upāsanam jñānam
translated: The knowledge-sacrifice is the knowledge of self-identification mentioned in the scriptures such as I am you, O Lord, the deity and You are I.

original: sa eva parameśvarayajanarūpatvād yajñas tena /
analyzed: saḥ eva parameśvara yajana rūpa tvāt yajñaḥ tena
translated: That itself is a sacrifice in the form of worshipping the Supreme Lord. By that.

original: cakāra evārthe /
analyzed: cakāraḥ eva arthe
translated: The word eva (only) has the meaning of ca (and).

original: api śabdaḥ sādhanāntaratyāgārthaḥ /
analyzed: api śabdaḥ sādhana antara tyāga arthaḥ
translated: The word api (even) has the meaning of renouncing other means.

original: ekatvena upāsyopāsakayor abhedacintanarūpeṇa /
analyzed: eka tvena upāsya upāsakayoḥ abheda cintana rūpeṇa
translated: As one, means in the form of contemplating the non-difference between the object of worship and the worshipper.

original: tato 'pi nyūnā anye pṛthaktvena bhedacintanarūpeṇa ādityo brahmetyādeśaḥ ChāU / / ity ādi śrutyuktena pratīkopāsanena jñānayajñena🔽anye tato 'pi mandā bahudhā bahubhiḥ prakārair viśvatomukhaṃ viśvarūpaṃ sarvātmānaṃ
analyzed: nyūnāḥ anye pṛthaktvena bheda cintana rūpeṇa ādityaḥ brahma iti ādeśaḥ chāu iti ādi śruti uktena pratīka upāsanena jñāna yajñena  anye mandāḥ bahudhā bahubhiḥ prakāraiḥ viśvatomukham viśva rūpam sarva ātmānam
translated: Others, who are still less advanced, by the knowledge-sacrifice in the form of symbolic worship described in the Upanisadic texts such as The sun is Brahman (Chand. 3.19.1), etc.

original: māma evopāsate iti madhusūdanasarasvatīpādānāṃ vyākhyā /
analyzed: mām eva upāsate iti madhusūdana sarasvatī pādānām vyākhyā
translated: Others, who are still less advanced, worship Me alone in many ways, with many methods, as having faces everywhere, as having universal forms, as the universal Self. This is the explanation of the feet of Madhusudana Sarasvati.

original: atra nādevo devam arcayet iti tāntrikadṛṣṭyā gopālo 'ham iti bhāvanāvattve yā gopālopāsanā sā ahaṅgrahopāsanā /🔽tathā yaḥ parameśvaro viṣṇuḥ sa hi sūrya eṣa nānyaḥ /🔽sa hi indra eva nānyaḥ /
analyzed: atra na adevaḥ devam arcayet iti tāntrika dṛṣṭyā gopālaḥ ham iti bhāvanāvat tve yā gopāla upāsanā sā ahaṅgraha upāsanā  tathā yaḥ parameśvaraḥ viṣṇuḥ sa hi sūryaḥ eṣa na anyaḥ  sa hi indraḥ eva na anyaḥ
translated: Here, from the Tantric point of view that one should not worship a deity other than one's own, the worship of Gopala, which is like the contemplation I am Gopala, is the worship of the sense of I.

original: sa hi soma eva nānyaḥ ity evaṃ bhedenaikasyā eva bhagavadvibhūter yā upāsanā sā pratīkopāsanā /
analyzed: sa hi somaḥ eva na anyaḥ iti evam bhedena ekasyāḥ eva bhagavat vibhūteḥ yā upāsanā sā pratīka upāsanā
translated: Similarly, the worship of the one and only Lord Vishnu as the sun, as Indra, and as Soma, considering them to be non-different from Him, is symbolic worship.

original: viṣṇuḥ sarva iti samastavibhūtyupāsanā viśvarūpopāsaneti jñānayajñasya traividhyam /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ sarvaḥ iti samasta vibhūti upāsanā viśva rūpa upāsanā iti jñāna yajñasya traividhyam
translated: The threefold division of the knowledge-sacrifice is: the worship of all the divine manifestations as Vishnu is all, the worship of the universal form, and the worship of the universal form.

original: yad vā ekatvena pṛthaktvena ity eka eva ahaṅgrahopāsanā gopālo 'haṃ gopālasya dāso 'ham ity ubhayabhāvanāmayī samudragāminī nadīva samudrabhinno
analyzed: yat vai ekatvena pṛthaktvena iti ekaḥ eva ahaṅgraha upāsanā gopālaḥ ham gopālasya dāsaḥ ham iti ubhaya bhāvanā mayī samudra gāminī nadī iva
translated: Or, in the singular and plural, the meditation on the single I-principle is like a river flowing into the ocean, the river being different from the ocean.

original: 'bhinnā ceti /
analyzed: bhinnā ca iti
translated: Or, in oneness and in separateness. The one meditation on the Self is like a river flowing to the ocean, with the ocean being both different and non-different.

original: tadā ca jñānayajñasya traividhyam ////
analyzed: tadā ca jñāna yajñasya traividhyam
translated: And then there is the threefoldness of the knowledge sacrifice.

original: baladevaḥ evaṃ kevalasvarūpaniṣṭhān kīrtanādiśuddhabhaktipradhānān mahātmaśabditān abhidhāya guṇībhūtatatkīrtanādijñānapradhānān
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam kevala sva rūpa niṣṭhān kīrtana ādi śuddha bhakti pradhānān mahātma śabditān abhidhāya guṇībhūta tad kīrtana ādi jñāna pradhānān
translated: Balarama: Having thus mentioned the great souls who are solely devoted to the nature of the Supreme, who are primarily engaged in pure devotion like glorification, and who are called great souls, he now mentions the devotees who are primarily engaged in knowledge,🔽with glorification etc. as secondary,

original: bhaktān āha jñāneti /
analyzed: bhaktān āha jñāna iti
translated: with the word jñana (knowledge).

original: pūrvato 'nye kecana bhaktāḥ pūrvoktena kīrtanādijñānayajñena ca yajanto mām upāsate /
analyzed: pūrvatas nye kecana bhaktāḥ pūrva uktena kīrtana ādi jñāna yajñena ca yajantaḥ mām upāsate
translated: Some other devotees than those mentioned before, who worship Me with the knowledge sacrifice of glorification etc. mentioned before,

original: tatra prakāram āha bahudhā bahuprakāreṇa pṛthaktvena prapañcākāreṇa pradhānamahadādyātmanā viśvatomukham indrādidaivatātmanā cāvasthitaṃ
analyzed: tatra prakāram āha bahudhā bahu prakāreṇa pṛthaktvena prapañca ākāreṇa pradhāna mahat ādi ātmanā viśvatomukham indra ādi daivata ātmanā ca avasthitam
translated: He describes the mode there: In many ways, in many modes, in separateness, in the form of the universe, in the form of the primary elements like Mahat, and in the form of the deities like Indra,

original: mām ekatvenopāsate /
analyzed: mām eka tvena upāsate
translated: they worship Me as one.

original: ayam atra niṣkarṣaḥ sūkṣmacidacicchaktimān satyasaṅkalpaḥ kṛṣṇo bahu syām iti
analyzed: ayam atra niṣkarṣaḥ sūkṣma cit acit śaktimān satya saṅkalpaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ bahu syām iti
translated: The essence here is this: Krishna, who possesses subtle consciousness and insentient powers, whose will is true, becomes many,🔽thinking Let me become many.

original: svīyena saṅkalpena sthūlacidacicchaktimān eka eva brahmādistambāntavicitrajagadrūpatayāvatiṣṭhata
analyzed: svīyena saṅkalpena sthūla cit acit śaktimān ekaḥ eva brahma ādi stamba anta vicitra jagat rūpa tayā avatiṣṭhata
translated: By His own will, He, the one Brahman, exists in the form of the diverse world beginning with Brahman and ending with the tuft of grass, as the possessor of the gross and subtle powers of consciousness and non-consciousness.

original: ity anusandhinā tādṛśasya mama kīrtanādinā ca mām upāsata iti // //
analyzed: iti anusandhinā tādṛśasya mama kīrtana ādinā ca mām upāsate iti
translated: Thus, with this understanding, they worship Me, by glorifying Me and so on.

original: BhG /🔽ahaṃ kratur ahaṃ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣadham
analyzed: bhg  aham kratuḥ aham yajñaḥ svadhā aham aham auṣadham
translated: BhG 9.17

original: mantro 'ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṃ hutam ////
analyzed: mantraḥ ham aham eva ājyam aham agniḥ aham hutam
translated: I am the sacrifice, I am the sacrificial offering, I am the sacred chant, I am the oblation, I am the fire, I am the offering.🔽BhG 9.18

original: pitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: pitā aham asya jagataḥ mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ
translated: I am the father of this world, the mother, the sustainer, the grandsire.

original: vedyaṃ pavitram oṃkāra ṛk sāma yajur eva ca ////🔽gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣī nivāsaḥ śaraṇaṃ suhṛt /
analyzed: vedyam pavitram oṃkāraḥ ṛc sāma yajuḥ eva ca  gatiḥ bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣī nivāsaḥ śaraṇam suhṛd
translated: I am the object of knowledge, the purifying, the syllable Om, the Rik, the Saman, and the Yajus.🔽BhG 9.19🔽I am the support, the protector, the lord, the witness, the abode, the refuge, the friend.

original: prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṃ nidhānaṃ bījam avyayam ////
analyzed: prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānam nidhānam bījam avyayam
translated: I am the origin, the dissolution, the support, the abode, the imperishable seed.🔽BhG 9.20

original: tapāmy aham ahaṃ varṣaṃ nigṛhṇāmy utsṛjāmi ca /🔽amṛtaṃ caiva mṛtyuś ca sad asac cāham arjuna ////
analyzed: tapāmi aham aham varṣam nigṛhṇāmi utsṛjāmi ca  amṛtam ca eva mṛtyuḥ ca sat asat ca aham arjuna
translated: I burn and I rain, I hold and I release.

original: śrīdharaḥ sarvātmatāṃ prapañcayati ahaṃ kratur iti caturbhiḥ /🔽kratuḥ śrauto 'gniṣṭomādiḥ /🔽yajñaḥ smārtaḥ pañcamahāyajñādiḥ /
analyzed: 🔽kratuḥ śrautaḥ gniṣṭoma ādiḥ 🔽yajñaḥ smārtaḥ pañcamahāyajña ādiḥ
translated: I am immortality and also death, O Arjuna, I am what is to be desired and also the desirer, and I am the one who is to be known, as well as the knowledge.

original: svadhā pitryarthaṃ śrāddhādiḥ /
analyzed: svadhā pitryartham śrāddha ādiḥ
translated: Svadha is for the ancestors, such as the sraddha (offering of food to the manes).

original: auṣadham auṣadhiprabhavam annam /
analyzed: auṣadham auṣadhi prabhavam annam
translated: Medicinal herbs are food produced from herbs.

original: bheṣajaṃ vā /🔽mantro yājyapurodhovākyādiḥ /
analyzed: bheṣajam vā  mantraḥ yājya purodhaḥ vākya ādiḥ
translated: Or medicine.🔽Mantras are the words of the priest and the sacrificer.

original: ājyaṃ homādisādhanam /🔽agnir āhavanīyādiḥ /
analyzed: ājyam homa ādi sādhanam  agniḥ āhavanīya ādiḥ
translated: The clarified butter is the means of offering oblations.🔽The fire is the ahavaniya (sacrificial fire).

original: hutaṃ homaḥ /
analyzed: hutam homaḥ
translated: The oblation is the offering.

original: etat sarvam aham eva ////
analyzed: etat sarvam aham eva
translated: All this I am myself.

original: kiṃ ca piteti /
analyzed: kim ca pitā iti
translated: And what else? I am the father.

original: dhātā karmaphalavidhātā /
analyzed: dhātā karma phala vidhātā
translated: The creator is the ordainer of the fruits of actions.

original: vedyaṃ jñeyaṃ vastu /
analyzed: vedyam jñeyam vastu
translated: The knowable is the object of knowledge.

original: pavitraṃ śodhakam /
analyzed: pavitram śodhakam
translated: The pure is the purifier.

original: prāyaścittātmakaṃ vā /
analyzed: prāyaścitta ātmakam vā
translated: Or it is like a penance.

original: oṅkāraḥ praṇavaḥ /
analyzed: oṅkāraḥ praṇavaḥ
translated: The syllable Om is the Pranava (sacred syllable).

original: ṛgādayo vedāś cāham eva /
analyzed: ṛk ādayaḥ vedāḥ ca aham eva
translated: The Vedas beginning with the Rig Veda are I myself.

original: spaṣṭam anyat ////
analyzed: spaṣṭam anyat
translated: The rest is clear.

original: kiṃ ca gatir iti /
analyzed: kim ca gatiḥ iti
translated: And what else? I am the goal.

original: gamyata iti gatiḥ phalam /
analyzed: gamyate iti gatiḥ phalam
translated: That which is to be reached is the goal, the result.

original: bhartā poṣaṇakartā /
analyzed: bhartā poṣaṇa kartā
translated: The supporter is the nourisher.

original: prabhur niyantā /
analyzed: prabhuḥ niyantā
translated: The lord is the controller.

original: sākṣī śubhāśubhadraṣṭā /
analyzed: sākṣī śubha aśubha draṣṭā
translated: The witness is the seer of good and bad.

original: nivāso bhogasthānam /
analyzed: nivāsaḥ bhoga sthānam
translated: The abode is the place of enjoyment.

original: śaraṇaṃ rakṣakaḥ /🔽suhṛd dhitakartā /
analyzed: śaraṇam rakṣakaḥ  suhṛd hita kartā
translated: The refuge is the protector.🔽The well-wisher is the doer of good.

original: prakarṣeṇa bhavaty aneneti prabhavaḥ sraṣṭā /
analyzed: prakarṣeṇa bhavati anena iti prabhavaḥ sraṣṭā
translated: That by which one becomes supreme is the origin, the creator.

original: pralīyate 'neneti pralayaḥ saṃhartā /🔽tiṣṭhaty asminn iti sthānam ādhāraḥ /
analyzed: pralīyate nena iti pralayaḥ saṃhartā  tiṣṭhati asmin iti sthānam ādhāraḥ
translated: That by which one dissolves is dissolution, the destroyer.🔽That in which one abides is the abode, the support.

original: nidhīyate 'sminn iti nidhānaṃ layasthānam /
analyzed: nidhīyate smin iti nidhānam laya sthānam
translated: That in which one is deposited is the treasure, the place of rest.

original: bījaṃ kāraṇam /
analyzed: bījam kāraṇam
translated: The seed is the cause.

original: tathāpy avyayam avināśi /
analyzed: tathā api avyayam avināśi
translated: And yet I am imperishable, undecaying.

original: na tu brīhyādibījavan naśvaram ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: na tu brīhi ādi bīja vat naśvaram iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: I am not perishable like the seed of rice etc.

original: kiṃ ca tapāmy aham iti /
analyzed: kim ca tapāmi aham iti
translated: And what is more, I burn.

original: ādityātmanā sthitvā nidāghakāle tapāmi jagatas tāpaṃ karomi /
analyzed: āditya ātmanā sthitvā nidāgha kāle tapāmi jagataḥ tāpam karomi
translated: Having remained as the sun, I burn, I heat the world, during the hot season.

original: vṛṣṭisamaye ca varṣam utsṛjāmi vimuñcāmi /
analyzed: vṛṣṭi samaye ca varṣam utsṛjāmi vimuñcāmi
translated: And during the rainy season, I release, I let loose, rain.

original: kadācit tu varṣaṃ nigṛhṇāmy ākarṣāmi /
analyzed: kadācid tu varṣam nigṛhṇāmi ākarṣāmi
translated: But sometimes I hold back, I attract, rain.

original: amṛtaṃ jīvanaṃ mṛtyuś ca nāśaḥ /
analyzed: amṛtam jīvanam mṛtyuḥ ca nāśaḥ
translated: Immortality is life, and death is destruction.

original: sat sthūlaṃ dṛśyam /
analyzed: sat sthūlam dṛśyam
translated: The existent is the gross, the visible.

original: asac ca sūkṣmadṛśyam /
analyzed: asat ca sūkṣma dṛśyam
translated: And the non-existent is the subtle, the invisible.

original: etaṃ sarvam aham eveti /
analyzed: etam sarvam aham eva iti
translated: All this I am alone.

original: evaṃ matvā mām eva bahudhopāsata iti pūrvenaivānvayaḥ ////
analyzed: evam matvā mām eva bahudhā upāsate iti pūrvena eva anvayaḥ
translated: Having known this, they worship Me in many ways. The connection is with the previous verse.

original: madhusūdanaḥ yadi bahudhopāsate tarhi kathaṃ tvām evety āśaṅkyātmano viśvarūpatvaṃ prapañcayati caturbhiḥ aham iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ yadi bahudhā upāsate tarhi katham tvām eva iti āśaṅkya ātmanaḥ viśva rūpa tvam prapañcayati caturbhiḥ aham iti
translated: Madhusudana: If they worship in many ways, then how is it that they worship You alone? With this doubt, He explains the universal form of the Self with four verses beginning with I.

original: sarvasvarūpo 'ham iti vaktavye tat tad ekadeśakathanam avayutyānuvādena vaiśvānare dvādaśakapāle 'ṣṭākapālatvādikathanavat /
analyzed: sarva sva rūpaḥ ham iti vaktavye tat tat eka deśa kathanam avayutya anuvādena vaiśvānare dvādaśa kapāle ṣṭākapāla tva ādi kathana vat
translated: When it should be said that I am the form of all, the mention of this and that part is like the mention of the eight-pan-nature in the twelve-pan fire offering to the universal Self.

original: kratuḥ śrauto 'gniṣṭomādiḥ /
analyzed: kratuḥ śrautaḥ gniṣṭoma ādiḥ
translated: The sacrifice is the Vedic ritual beginning with the Agniṣṭoma.

original: yajñāḥ smārto vaiśvadevādir mahāyajñatvena śrutismṛtiprasiddhaḥ /
analyzed: yajñāḥ smārtaḥ vaiśvadeva ādiḥ mahā yajña tvena śruti smṛti prasiddhaḥ
translated: Sacrifices are those prescribed by the Smritis, such as the Vaisvadeva, which are well-known from the Vedas and Smritis as great sacrifices.

original: svadhā 'nnaṃ pitṛbhyo dīyamānam /
analyzed: svadhā nnam pitṛbhyaḥ dīyamānam
translated: Svādhas are the food offered to the ancestors.

original: auṣadham auṣadhiprabhavam annaṃ sarvaiḥ prāṇibhir bhujyamānaṃ bheṣajaṃ vā /
analyzed: auṣadham auṣadhi prabhavam annam sarvaiḥ prāṇibhiḥ bhujyamānam bheṣajam vā
translated: Medicines are the food produced from herbs, which is enjoyed by all living beings, or they are remedies.

original: mantro yājyāpuronuvākyādir yenoddiśya havir dīyate devebhyaḥ /
analyzed: mantraḥ yājyā puronuvākyā ādiḥ yena uddiśya haviḥ dīyate devebhyaḥ
translated: Mantras are the Yajyas, Puronuvakyas, etc., by which the oblations are offered to the gods.

original: ājyaṃ ghṛtaṃ sarvahavir upalakṣaṇam idam /
analyzed: ājyam ghṛtam sarva haviḥ upalakṣaṇam idam
translated: The clarified butter is ghee, and this refers to all the oblations.

original: agnir āhavanīyādir haviṣprakṣepādhikaraṇam /
analyzed: agniḥ āhavanīya ādiḥ haviḥ prakṣepa adhikaraṇam
translated: The fire is the Ahavaniya, etc., which is the receptacle for the oblations.

original: hutaṃ havanaṃ haviṣprakṣepaḥ etat sarvam ahaṃ parameśvara eva /
analyzed: hutam havanam haviḥ prakṣepaḥ etat sarvam aham parameśvaraḥ eva
translated: The oblation is the offering, the pouring of the oblation. All this I am, the Supreme Lord.

original: etad ekaikajñānam api bhagavadupāsanam iti kathayituṃ pratyekam ahaṃśabdaḥ
analyzed: etat ekaika jñānam api bhagavat upāsanam iti kathayitum pratyekam aham śabdaḥ
translated: In order to say that each of these knowledges is the worship of the Lord, the word I is used individually.

original: kriyākārakaphalajātaṃ kim api bhagavad atiriktaṃ nāstīti saumāyārthaḥ ////
analyzed: kriyā kāraka phala jātam kim api bhagavat atiriktam na asti iti saumāya arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is nothing apart from the Lord, such as action, agent, or result.

original: kiṃ ca / asya jagataḥ sarvasya prāṇijātasya pitā janayitā /
analyzed: kim ca asya jagataḥ sarvasya prāṇi jātasya pitā janayitā
translated: Moreover, he is the father of this entire world, of all living beings, the begetter.

original: mātā janayitrī /
analyzed: mātā janayitrī
translated: The mother is the one who gives birth.

original: dhātā poṣayitā tattatkarmaphalavidhātā vā /
analyzed: dhātā poṣayitā tad tad karma phala vidhātā vā
translated: The sustainer is the one who nourishes or ordains the results of their respective actions.

original: pitāmahaḥ pituḥ pitā /
analyzed: pitāmahaḥ pituḥ pitā
translated: The grandfather is the father's father.

original: vedyaṃ vedayitavyaṃ vastu /
analyzed: vedyam vedayitavyam vastu
translated: The object to be known and experienced.

original: pūyate 'neneti pavitraṃ pāvanaṃ śuddhihetur gaṅgāsnānagāyatrījapādi /
analyzed: pūyate nena iti pavitram pāvanam śuddhi hetuḥ gaṅgā snāna gāyatrī japa ādi
translated: That by which one is purified is the sacred, the purifying, the cause of purity, such as bathing in the Ganges, repeating the Gayatri mantra, etc.

original: veditavye brahmaṇi vedanasādhanam oṃkāraḥ /
analyzed: veditavye brahmaṇi vedana sādhanam oṃkāraḥ
translated: The syllable Om is the means of knowing Brahman, which is to be known.

original: niyatākṣarapādā ṛk /🔽gītiviśiṣṭā saiva sāma /
analyzed: niyata akṣara pādā ṛc  gīti viśiṣṭā sā eva sāma
translated: A Rik verse is that which has fixed syllables and feet.🔽The same, when distinguished by melody, is a Saman chant.

original: sāmapadaṃ tu gītimātrasyaivābhidhāyakam ity anyat /
analyzed: sāma padam tu gīti mātrasya eva abhidhāyakam iti anyat
translated: But the word Saman denotes only melody, so it is different.

original: gītirahitam aniyatākṣaraṃ yajuḥ /
analyzed: gīti rahitam aniyata akṣaram yajuḥ
translated: A Yajus formula is that which lacks melody, has irregular syllables, and is not a Rik.

original: etat trividhaṃ mantrajātaṃ karmopayogi /
analyzed: etat trividham mantra jātam karma upayogi
translated: This threefold class of mantras is useful for rituals.

original: cakārād atharvāṅgiraso 'pi gṛhyante /
analyzed: cakārāt atharva aṅgirasaḥ pi gṛhyante
translated: By the word ca (and), the Atharva-Angirasa mantras are also included.

original: evakāro 'ham evety avadhāraṇārthaḥ ////
analyzed: eva kāraḥ ham eva iti avadhāraṇa arthaḥ
translated: The word eva (only) has the meaning of restriction, as in I alone.

original: kiṃ ca gatir iti /
analyzed: kim ca gatiḥ iti
translated: Moreover, what is the goal?

original: gamyata iti gatiḥ karmaphalam /
analyzed: gamyate iti gatiḥ karma phalam
translated: The goal is that which is to be reached, the result of action.

original: brahmā viśvasṛjo dharmo mahān avyaktam eva ca /
analyzed: brahmā viśvasṛjaḥ dharmaḥ mahān avyaktam eva ca
translated: Brahma, the creator of the universe, Dharma, Mahat, and the unmanifest -

original: uttamāṃ sāttvikīm etāṃ gatim āhur manīṣiṇaḥ //
analyzed: uttamām sāttvikīm etām gatim āhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The wise ones call this the highest, the goal of the sattva-type.

original: ity Manu / evaṃ manvādyuktam /
analyzed: iti manu evam manu ādi uktam
translated: Thus it is stated by Manu and others.

original: bhartā poṣṭā sukhasādhanasyaiva dātā /
analyzed: bhartā poṣṭā sukha sādhanasya eva dātā
translated: The supporter is the provider of happiness and its means.

original: prabhuḥ svāmī madīyo 'yam iti svīkartā /
analyzed: prabhuḥ svāmī madīyaḥ yam iti svīkartā
translated: The lord is the owner, the one who accepts as this is mine.

original: sākṣī sarvaprāṇināṃ śubhāśubhadraṣṭā /
analyzed: sākṣī sarva prāṇinām śubha aśubha draṣṭā
translated: The witness is the seer of the good and bad of all beings.

original: nivasanty asminn iti nivāso bhogasthānam /
analyzed: nivasanti asmin iti nivāsaḥ bhoga sthānam
translated: It is a place of enjoyment because they dwell in it.

original: śīryate duḥkham asminn iti śaraṇaṃ prapannānām ārtihṛt /
analyzed: śīryate duḥkham asmin iti śaraṇam prapannānām ārti hṛt
translated: It is a refuge because misery is destroyed for those who have taken refuge in it.

original: suhṛt pratyupakārānapekṣaḥ sannupakārī /
analyzed: suhṛd pratyupakāra anapekṣaḥ san upakārī
translated: A friend is one who helps without expecting anything in return.

original: prabhava utpattiḥ /
analyzed: prabhavaḥ utpattiḥ
translated: Origination is the source.

original: pralayo vināśaḥ /
analyzed: pralayaḥ vināśaḥ
translated: Dissolution is destruction.

original: sthānaṃ sthitḥ /🔽yad vā prakarṣeṇa bhavanty aneneti prabhavaḥ sraṣṭā /
analyzed: sthānam sthitḥ  yat vā prakarṣeṇa bhavanti anena iti prabhavaḥ sraṣṭā
translated: Abiding is persistence.🔽Or, it is the source because they originate by it in an eminent way.

original: prakarṣeṇa līyante 'neneti pralayaḥ saṃhartā /
analyzed: prakarṣeṇa līyante nena iti pralayaḥ saṃhartā
translated: It is dissolution because they dissolve by it in an eminent way.

original: tiṣṭhanty asminn iti sthānam ādhāraḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhanti asmin iti sthānam ādhāraḥ
translated: It is abiding because they abide in it.🔽A treasure is that in which a thing that is to be enjoyed at a certain time is deposited as something to be enjoyed at another time. It is the subtle form, the basis of all things, the place of dissolution.

original: nidhīyate nikṣipyate tatkālabhogyatayā kālāntaropabhogyaṃ vastv asminn iti nidhānaṃ sūkṣmarūpasarvavastvadhikaraṇaṃ pralayasthānam iti 🔽yāvat /
analyzed: nidhīyate nikṣipyate tad kāla bhogya tayā kāla antara upabhogyam vastu asmin iti nidhānam sūkṣma rūpa sarva vastu adhikaraṇam pralaya sthānam iti  yāvat
translated: This is the extent.

original: śaṅkhapadmādinidhir vā /
analyzed: śaṅkha padma ādi nidhiḥ vā
translated: Or it is a treasure like a conch, a lotus, etc.

original: bījam utpattikāraṇam /
analyzed: bījam utpatti kāraṇam
translated: The seed is the cause of origination.

original: avyayam avināśi na tu brīhyādivad vinaśvaram /
analyzed: avyayam avināśi na tu brīhi ādi vat vinaśvaram
translated: It is imperishable, not perishable like rice, etc.

original: tenānādyanantaṃ yat kāraṇaṃ tad apy
analyzed: tena anādi anantam yat kāraṇam tat api
translated: Therefore, that which is the beginningless and endless cause, that also

original: aham eveti pūrveṇaiva sambandhaḥ ////
analyzed: aham eva iti pūrveṇa eva sambandhaḥ
translated: I alone. The connection is with the previous (verse).

original: kiṃ ca tapāmy aham iti /
analyzed: kim ca tapāmi aham iti
translated: Moreover, I burn, etc.

original: tapāmy aham ādityaḥ san /
analyzed: tapāmi aham ādityaḥ san
translated: I burn as the sun.

original: tataś ca tāpavaśād ahaṃ varṣaṃ pūrvavṛṣṭirūpaṃ rasaṃ pṛthivyā nigṛhṇāmy ākarṣāmi kaiścid raśmibhir aṣṭasu māseṣu /
analyzed: tatas ca tāpa vaśāt aham varṣam pūrva vṛṣṭi rūpam rasam pṛthivyāḥ nigṛhṇāmi ākarṣāmi kaiścid raśmibhiḥ aṣṭasu māseṣu
translated: And then, due to the heat, I hold back, attract, the water in the form of rain, the essence, of the earth, with some rays, during the eight months.

original: punas tam eva nigṛhītaṃ rasaṃ caturṣu māseṣu kaiścid raśmibhir utsṛjāmi ca vṛṣṭirūpeṇa prakṣipāmi ca bhūmau /
analyzed: punar tam eva nigṛhītam rasam caturṣu māseṣu kaiścid raśmibhiḥ utsṛjāmi ca vṛṣṭi rūpeṇa prakṣipāmi ca bhūmau
translated: And again, I release that very held back essence, and pour it out on the earth in the form of rain, with some rays, during the four months.

original: amṛtaṃ ca devānāṃ sarvaprāṇināṃ jīvanaṃ vā /
analyzed: amṛtam ca devānām sarva prāṇinām jīvanam vā
translated: And nectar is the life of the gods, or of all living beings.

original: evakārasyāham ity anena sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: eva kārasya aham iti anena sambandhaḥ
translated: The word eva is connected with aham.

original: mṛtyuś ca martyānāṃ sarvaprāṇināṃ vināśo vā /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ ca martyānām sarva prāṇinām vināśaḥ vā
translated: And death is the destruction of mortals, or of all living beings.

original: sat yat sambandhitayā yad vidyate tat tatra sat /
analyzed: sat yat sambandhi tayā yat vidyate tat tatra sat
translated: That which exists in relation to something is existent there.

original: asac ca yatsambandhitayā yac ca vidyate tat tatrāsat /
analyzed: asat ca yad sambandhi tayā yat ca vidyate tat tatra asat
translated: And that which exists in relation to something non-existent is non-existent there.

original: etaṃ sarvam aham eva he 'rjuna /
analyzed: etam sarvam aham eva he rjuna
translated: All this, I alone, O Arjuna.

original: tasmāt sarvātmānaṃ māṃ viditvā svasvādhikārānusāreṇa bahubhiḥ prakārair mām evopāsata ity upapannam ////
analyzed: tasmāt sarva ātmānam mām viditvā sva sva adhikāra anusāreṇa bahubhiḥ prakāraiḥ mām eva upāsate iti upapannam
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that, knowing Me as the Self of all, one should worship Me in many ways according to one's own duties.

original: viśvanāthaḥ bahudhopāsate kathaṃ tvām evety āśaṅkyātmano viśvarūpatvaṃ prapañcayati caturbhiḥ /
translated: Visvanatha: How do they worship You in many ways? With four verses, He elaborates on His own universal form.

original: kratuḥ śrauto 'gniṣṭomādiḥ yajñaḥ smārto vaiśvadevādiḥ /
analyzed: kratuḥ śrautaḥ gniṣṭoma ādiḥ yajñaḥ smārtaḥ vaiśvadeva ādiḥ
translated: Kratu is the Vedic sacrifice like Agniṣṭoma etc. Yajña is the Smārta sacrifice like Vaiśvadeva etc.

original: auṣadham auṣadhiprabhavam annam /🔽pitā vyaṣṭisamaṣṭisarvajagadutpādanāt /
analyzed: auṣadham auṣadhi prabhavam annam  pitā vyaṣṭi samaṣṭi sarva jagat utpādanāt
translated: Medicine is food derived from herbs.🔽Father, because He creates the individual and universal universe.

original: mātā jagato 'sya svakukṣimadhya eva dhāraṇāt /
analyzed: mātā jagataḥ sya sva kukṣi madhye eva dhāraṇāt
translated: Mother, because He sustains the world within His own womb.

original: dhātā jagato 'sya poṣaṇāt /
analyzed: dhātā jagataḥ sya poṣaṇāt
translated: Creator, because He nourishes the world.

original: pitāmahaḥ jagat sraṣṭuḥ brahmaṇo 'pi janakatvāt /
analyzed: pitāmahaḥ jagat sraṣṭuḥ brahmaṇaḥ pi janaka tvāt
translated: Grandfather, because He is the progenitor even of Brahmā, the creator of the universe.

original: vedyaṃ jñeyaṃ vastu /
analyzed: vedyam jñeyam vastu
translated: The knowable is the object of knowledge.

original: pavitraṃ śodhakaṃ vastu /
analyzed: pavitram śodhakam vastu
translated: The pure is the purifying object.

original: gatiḥ phalam /
analyzed: gatiḥ phalam
translated: The goal is the fruit.

original: bhartā patiḥ /
analyzed: bhartā patiḥ
translated: The supporter is the husband.

original: prabhur niyantā /
analyzed: prabhuḥ niyantā
translated: The lord is the controller.

original: sākṣī śubhāśubhadraṣṭā /
analyzed: sākṣī śubha aśubha draṣṭā
translated: The witness is the observer of good and bad.

original: nivāsa āspadam /
analyzed: nivāsa āspadam
translated: The abode is the shelter.

original: śaraṇaṃ vipadbhyas trātā /🔽suhṛn nirupādhihitakārī /
analyzed: śaraṇam vipadbhyaḥ trātā  suhṛd nirupādhi hita kārī
translated: The refuge is the protector from calamities.🔽The well-wisher is the one who acts for the benefit without any ulterior motive.

original: prabhavādyāḥ sṛṣṭisaṃhārasthitayaḥ kriyāś cāham /
analyzed: prabhava ādyāḥ sṛṣṭi saṃhāra sthitayaḥ kriyāḥ ca aham
translated: I am the creator, annihilator, and preserver of the universe.

original: nidhānaṃ nidhiḥ padmaśaṅkhādiḥ /
analyzed: nidhānam nidhiḥ padma śaṅkha ādiḥ
translated: The treasure is the hidden wealth like lotuses, conch shells, etc.

original: bījaṃ kāraṇam /
analyzed: bījam kāraṇam
translated: The seed is the cause.

original: avyayam avināśi na tu brīhyādivan naśvaram ////
analyzed: avyayam avināśi na tu brīhi ādi vat naśvaram
translated: The imperishable is that which does not perish, unlike rice etc. which perish.

original: ādityo bhūtvā nidāghe tapāmi prāvṛṣi varṣam utsṛjāmi /
analyzed: ādityaḥ bhūtvā nidāghe tapāmi prāvṛṣi varṣam utsṛjāmi
translated: Becoming the sun, I heat in summer and release rain in the rainy season.

original: kadācic caiva graharūpeṇa varṣaṃ nigṛhṇāmi ca /
analyzed: kadācid ca eva graha rūpeṇa varṣam nigṛhṇāmi ca
translated: Sometimes I also withhold rain in the form of a planet.

original: amṛtaṃ mokṣaṃ mṛtyuḥ saṃsāraḥ /
analyzed: amṛtam mokṣam mṛtyuḥ saṃsāraḥ
translated: Immortality is Liberation; death is worldly existence.

original: sad asat sthūlasūkṣmaḥ /
analyzed: sat asat sthūla sūkṣmaḥ
translated: The existent and the non-existent are the gross and the subtle.

original: etat sarvam aham eveti matvā viśvatomukhaṃ mām upāsata iti pūrvenānvayaḥ ////
analyzed: etat sarvam aham eva iti matvā viśvatomukham mām upāsate iti pūrvena anvayaḥ
translated: Knowing that all this is verily I, one should worship Me, who am facing all directions. This is the connection with the previous verse.

original: baladevaḥ aham eva jagarūpatayāvasthita ity etat pradarśayati aham iti caturbhiḥ /🔽kratur jyotiṣṭomādiḥ śrauto /
analyzed: kratuḥ jyotiṣṭoma ādiḥ śrautaḥ
translated: The Lord displays that He Himself exists in the form of Jagat (the universe) with four verses beginning with I am.🔽The sacrifice is the Vedic sacrifice like Jyotiṣṭoma etc.

original: yajño vaiśvadevādiḥ smārtaḥ /
analyzed: yajñaḥ vaiśvadeva ādiḥ smārtaḥ
translated: The sacrifice is the Smārta sacrifice like Vaiśvadeva etc.

original: svadhā pitrarthe śrāddhādiḥ /
analyzed: svadhā pitṛ arthe śrāddha ādiḥ
translated: The oblation is the Śrāddha etc. for the manes.

original: auṣadham bheṣajam auṣadhiprabhavam annaṃ vā /
analyzed: auṣadham bheṣajam auṣadhi prabhavam annam vā
translated: The medicine is the remedy or the food produced from herbs.

original: mantro yājyāpuro nu vākyādir yenoddiśya havir devebhyo dīyate /🔽ājyaṃ ghṛtahomādisādhanam /🔽agnir homādikāraṇam āhavanīyādiḥ /
analyzed: mantraḥ yājyā puras nu vākya ādiḥ yena uddiśya haviḥ devebhyaḥ dīyate  ājyam ghṛta homa ādi sādhanam  agniḥ homa ādi kāraṇam āhavanīya ādiḥ
translated: The mantra is the Yājyā, Puronuvākyā etc., by which the oblation is offered to the gods after being dedicated.🔽The clarified butter is the means of ghee-offering etc.🔽The fire is the Āhavanīya etc., the cause of oblation etc.

original: hutaṃ homo haviḥprakṣepaḥ /
analyzed: hutam homaḥ haviḥ prakṣepaḥ
translated: The oblation is the offering of oblation, the throwing of oblation.

original: etat sarvātmanāham evāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: etat sarva ātmanā aham eva āsthitaḥ
translated: I am all this in every way.

original: pitāham iti /
analyzed: pitā aham iti
translated: I am the father.

original: asya sthiracarasya jagatas tatra tatra pitṛtvena mātṛtvena pitāmahatvena cāham eva sthitaḥ /
analyzed: asya sthira carasya jagataḥ tatra tatra pitṛ tvena mātṛ tvena pitāmaha tvena ca aham eva sthitaḥ
translated: In this world of the moving and unmoving, I exist as the father, the mother and the grandfather in various places.

original: dhātā dhārakatvena poṣakatvena ca tatra tatra sthito rājādiś cāham eva cidacicchaktimatas
analyzed: dhātā dhāraka tvena poṣaka tvena ca tatra tatra sthitaḥ rāja ādiḥ ca aham eva cit acit śaktimataḥ
translated: I am the creator, the sustainer, and the nourisher, existing in various forms such as the king, etc.

original: tadantaryāmiṇo mat teṣām anatirekāt vedyaṃ jñeyaṃ vastu pavitraṃ śuddhikaraṃ gaṅgādivāri /
analyzed: tad antaryāmiṇaḥ mat teṣām anatirekāt vedyam jñeyam vastu pavitram śuddhi karam gaṅgā ādi vāri
translated: I am the purifier, the object of knowledge, the pure thing, like the water of the Ganges, of those who are not separate from me, the inner controller of that.

original: jñeye brahmaṇi jñānahetur oṅkāraḥ sarvavedabījabhūtaḥ / ṛgādis🔽trividho vedaś caśabdād atharva ca grāhyam /
analyzed: jñeye brahmaṇi jñāna hetuḥ oṅkāraḥ sarva veda bīja bhūtaḥ ṛk ādiḥ  trividhaḥ vedaḥ caśabdāt atharva ca grāhyam
translated: The syllable Om, which is the cause of knowledge of Brahman, the object of knowledge, and is the seed of all the Vedas, is I.

original: teṣu niyatākṣaraḥ pādā ṛk /🔽saiva gītiviśiṣṭā sāma /
analyzed: teṣu niyata akṣaraḥ pādāḥ ṛc  sā eva gīti viśiṣṭā sāma
translated: The Vedas, which are of three kinds, should be understood to include the Rig, Yajur, Sama, and Atharva Vedas, as indicated by the word etc. in the text.🔽Among them, the Rig Veda consists of verses with fixed number of syllables.🔽The same Rig Veda, when accompanied by melody, is the Sama Veda.

original: sāmapadaṃ tu gītimātrasyaiva vācakam ity anyat /
analyzed: sāma padam tu gīti mātrasya eva vācakam iti anyat
translated: However, the word Sama is a mere synonym for melody.

original: gītiśūnyam amitākṣaraṃ yajuḥ /
analyzed: gīti śūnyam amita akṣaram yajuḥ
translated: The Yajur Veda is that which is devoid of melody and has an indefinite number of syllables.

original: etat trividhaṃ karmopayogimantrajātam aham evety arthaḥ /
analyzed: etat trividham karma upayogi mantra jātam aham eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that I alone am this threefold collection of mantras useful for ritual.

original: gatiḥ sādhyasādhanabhūtā gamyata iyam anayā ca iti nirukteḥ /
analyzed: gatiḥ sādhya sādhana bhūtā gamyate iyam anayā ca iti nirukteḥ
translated: Gati is that which is to be reached and by which one reaches, according to the Nirukta (a Vedic lexicon).

original: bhartā patiḥ /
analyzed: bhartā patiḥ
translated: The supporter is the husband.

original: prabhur niyantā /
analyzed: prabhuḥ niyantā
translated: The lord is the controller.

original: sākṣī śubhāśubhadraṣṭā /
analyzed: sākṣī śubha aśubha draṣṭā
translated: The witness is the observer of good and bad.

original: nivāso bhogasthānaṃ nivasaty atra iti nirukteḥ /
analyzed: nivāsaḥ bhoga sthānam nivasati atra iti nirukteḥ
translated: The abode is the place of enjoyment, as it is explained by the Nirukta (a Vedic lexicon) that it resides here.

original: śaraṇaṃ prapannārtihṛta śīrṣyate duḥkham asmin iti nirukteḥ /
analyzed: śaraṇam prapanna ārti hṛta śīrṣyate duḥkham asmin iti nirukteḥ
translated: The refuge is that in which one takes shelter, as it is explained by the Nirukta (a Vedic lexicon) that one's head is protected from suffering in this (refuge).

original: suhṛn nimittahitakṛt /
analyzed: suhṛd nimitta hita kṛt
translated: The well-wisher is the one who does good for the sake of a friend.

original: prabhavādyāḥ svargapralayasthitayaḥ kriyāḥ /
analyzed: prabhava ādyāḥ svarga pralaya sthitayaḥ kriyāḥ
translated: The actions of creation, sustenance, and dissolution are performed by the Supreme Lord.

original: nidhānaṃ nidhir mahāpadmādir navavidhaḥ /
analyzed: nidhānam nidhiḥ mahāpadma ādiḥ navavidhaḥ
translated: The treasure is the nine kinds of treasure such as the great lotus.

original: bījaṃ kāraṇam avyayam avināśi /
analyzed: bījam kāraṇam avyayam avināśi
translated: The seed is the imperishable cause, which is not destroyed.

original: na tu brīhyādivad vināśi /
analyzed: na tu brīhi ādi vat vināśi
translated: But it is not destroyed like rice etc.

original: tapāmīti / sūryarūpeṇāham eva nidāghe jagat tapāmi /
analyzed: tapāmi iti sūrya rūpeṇa aham eva nidāghe jagat tapāmi
translated: I heat - in the form of the sun, I heat the world in summer.

original: prāvṛṣi varṣam jalaṃ visṛjāmi megharūpeṇa varṣaṃ nigṛhṇāmi ākarṣāmi /
analyzed: prāvṛṣi varṣam jalam visṛjāmi megha rūpeṇa varṣam nigṛhṇāmi ākarṣāmi
translated: In the rainy season, I release water as rain in the form of clouds, and I attract the rain.

original: amṛtaṃ mokṣaṃ /
analyzed: amṛtam mokṣam
translated: The nectar is liberation.

original: mṛtyuḥ saṃsāraḥ /🔽sat sthūlaṃ /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ saṃsāraḥ  sat sthūlam
translated: Death is worldly existence.🔽The existent is gross.

original: asat sūkṣmam /
analyzed: asat sūkṣmam
translated: The non-existent is subtle.

original: etat sarvam aham eva tathā caivaṃ bahuvidhanāmarūpāvasthanikhilajagadrūpatayā
analyzed: etat sarvam aham eva tathā ca evam bahuvidha nāma rūpa avastha nikhila jagat rūpa tayā
translated: All this I am alone, and thus existing in the form of the entire world with many kinds of names and forms,

original: sthita eka eva śaktimān vāsudeva ity ekatvānusandhinā jñānayajñena caike yajanto
analyzed: sthitaḥ ekaḥ eva śaktimān vāsudevaḥ iti ekatva anusandhinā jñāna yajñena ca eke
translated: I alone am the powerful Vāsudeva. Those who worship Me through the knowledge sacrifice, by meditating on the oneness [of all with Me],

original: mām upāsate // //🔽BhG /
analyzed: mām upāsate  bhg
translated: worship Me thus.

original: traividyā māṃ somapāḥ pūtapāpā
analyzed: traividyā mām soma pāḥ pūta pāpā
translated: The three Vedas, the Soma-drinkers, their sins purified,

original: yajñair iṣṭvā svargatiṃ prārthayante /🔽te puṇyam āsādya surendralokam
analyzed: yajñaiḥ iṣṭvā svargatim prārthayante  te puṇyam āsādya sura indra lokam
translated: having worshipped Me through sacrifices, seek heaven.🔽Having attained that merit, the world of Indra, the lord of the gods,

original: aśnanti divyān divi devabhogān ////
analyzed: aśnanti divyān divi deva bhogān
translated: they enjoy divine pleasures in heaven.

original: śrīdharaḥ tad evam avajānanti māṃ mūḍhā ity ādi ślokadvayena kṣipraphalāśayā devatāntaraṃ yajanto māṃ nādriyanta ity abhaktā darśitāḥ /
translated: Sridhara: Thus, in the two verses beginning with The deluded ones disregard Me, the non-devotees are shown, who, desiring quick results, worship other deities and do not honor Me.

original: mahātmānas tu māṃ pārthety ādinā ca madbhaktā uktāḥ /
analyzed: mahātmānaḥ tu mām pārtha iti ādinā ca mad bhaktāḥ uktāḥ
translated: But the great souls are spoken of as My devotees in the verses beginning with But, O son of Prtha...

original: tatraikatvena pṛthaktvena vā ye parameśvaraṃ na bhajanti teṣāṃ janmamṛtyupravāho durvāra ity āha traividyā iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: tatra ekatvena pṛthaktvena vā ye parameśvaram na bhajanti teṣām janma mṛtyu pravāhaḥ durvāraḥ iti āha traividyāḥ iti dvābhyām
translated: Among them, it is said that the stream of birth and death of those who do not worship the Supreme Lord either as one or as separate is irresistible, with the two verses beginning with The Trividyas.

original: ṛg yajuḥ sāma lakṣaṇās tisro vidyāyeṣāṃ te trividyāḥ /
analyzed: ṛc yajuḥ sāma lakṣaṇāḥ tisraḥ vidyā yeṣām te tri vidyāḥ
translated: They who have the three lores characterized by the Rig, Yajur, and Sama Vedas are the Trividyas.

original: trividyā eva traividyāḥ /
analyzed: tri vidyāḥ eva traividyāḥ
translated: They who have the three lores are the Trividyas.

original: svārthe taddhitaḥ /
analyzed: sva arthe taddhitaḥ
translated: The secondary suffix is used in the sense of the primary.

original: trisro vidyā adhīyate jānanti vā /
analyzed: trisraḥ vidyāḥ adhīyate jānanti vā
translated: They study or know the three lores.

original: traividyā vedatrayoktakarmaparāḥ ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: traividyāḥ veda traya ukta karma parāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: they are devoted to the rituals enjoined by the three Vedas.

original: vedatrayavihitayajñair mām iṣṭvā mamaiva rūpaṃ devatānataram ity ajānanto 'pi vastuta indrādirūpeṇa mām eveṣṭvā sampūjya /
analyzed: veda traya vihita yajñaiḥ mām iṣṭvā mama eva rūpam devatā anataram iti a jānantaḥ vastutas indra ādi rūpeṇa mām eva iṣṭvā sampūjya
translated: Even though they do not know that I am the form of God, other than Myself, by worshipping Me alone in the form of Indra and other gods, in reality,

original: yajñaśeṣaṃ somaṃ pibantīti somapāḥ /
analyzed: yajña śeṣam somam pibanti iti soma pāḥ
translated: they drink the Soma, the remainder of the sacrifice, so they are Soma-drinkers.

original: tenaiva pūtapāpāḥ śodhitakalmaṣāḥ santaḥ svargatiṃ svargaṃ prati gatiṃ
analyzed: tena eva pūta pāpāḥ śodhita kalmaṣāḥ santaḥ svargatim svargam prati gatim
translated: By that alone, having their sins purified, their faults cleansed, those who seek heaven, a course to heaven,

original: ye prārthayante te puṇyaphalarūpaṃ surendralokaṃ svargam āsādya prāpya /
analyzed: ye prārthayante te puṇya phala rūpam sura indra lokam svargam āsādya prāpya
translated: having attained, having reached, the world of Indra, heaven, which is the fruit of merit.

original: divi svarge /
analyzed: divi svarge
translated: In heaven, in the celestial region.

original: divyānuttamān devānāṃ bhogān /
analyzed: divyān uttamān devānām bhogān
translated: The divine, excellent enjoyments of the gods.

original: aśnanti bhuñjate ////🔽madhusūdanaḥ evam ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā ceti trividhā api niṣkāmāḥ santo bhagavantam upāsīnāḥ sattvaśuddhijñānotpattidvāreṇa krameṇa
analyzed: aśnanti bhuñjate  madhusūdanaḥ evam ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā ca iti trividhāḥ api niṣkāmāḥ santaḥ bhagavantam upāsīnāḥ sattva śuddhi jñāna utpatti dvāreṇa krameṇa
translated: They eat, they enjoy.

original: mucyante /🔽ye tu sakāmāḥ santo na kenāpi prakāreṇa bhagavantam upāsate kintu svasvakāmasādhanāni
analyzed: mucyante  ye tu sa kāmāḥ santaḥ na kena api prakāreṇa bhagavantam upāsate kintu sva sva kāma sādhanāni
translated: Madhusudana: Thus, even those who are free from desires, who worship the Lord in three ways - as one, as different, and in many ways - are liberated gradually through the purification of the mind and the arising of knowledge.🔽But those who, while having desires, do not worship the Lord in any way, but rather perform only those desirable actions that are the means of accomplishing their own desires,

original: kāmyāny eva karmāṇy anutiṣṭhanti te sattvaśodhakābhāvena jñānasādhanam anadhirūṇāḥ
analyzed: kāmyāni eva karmāṇi anutiṣṭhanti te sattva śodhaka abhāvena jñāna sādhanam
translated: being devoid of the means of knowledge due to the absence of the purifier of the mind,

original: punaḥ punar janmamaraṇaprabandhena sarvadā saṃsāraduḥkham evānubhavantīty āha
analyzed: punar punar janma maraṇa prabandhena sarvadā saṃsāra duḥkham eva anubhavanti iti āha
translated: always experience only the suffering of worldly existence through the continuous cycle of birth and death, thus (the Lord) says

original: traividyeti dvābhyām /
analyzed: traividyā iti dvābhyām
translated: with the two (verses) beginning with those who are learned in the three Vedas.

translated: Those who have the three lores characterized by the Rig Veda, Yajur Veda, and Sama Veda, which are the means of attaining the offices of Hotri, Adhvaryu, and Udgatri,
