original: viśvanāthaḥ evaṃ trividhopāsanāvanto 'pi bhaktā eva mām eva parameśvaraṃ jānanto mucyante /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ evam bhaktāḥ eva mām eva parameśvaram jānantaḥ mucyante
translated: Visvanatha: Even those who have the three kinds of devotion, if they know Me alone as the Supreme Lord, they are liberated.

original: ye tu karmiṇas te na mucyanta evety āha dvābhyāṃ traividyā iti /
analyzed: ye tu karmiṇaḥ te na mucyante eva iti āha dvābhyām traividyāḥ iti
translated: But those who are ritualists are not liberated at all. With two verses [the Lord] says, Those who are devoted to the three Vedas...

original: ṛgyajuḥsāmalakṣaṇās tisro vidyā adhīyante jānanti vā traividyā vedatrayoktakarmaparā ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: ṛk yajuḥ sāma lakṣaṇāḥ tisraḥ vidyāḥ adhīyante jānanti vā traividyāḥ veda traya ukta karma parāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Those who study or know the three kinds of knowledge characterized by the Rig, Yajur, and Sama Vedas are called those who are devoted to the three Vedas. The meaning is: they are devoted to the rituals mentioned in the three Vedas.

original: yajñair mām iṣṭvendrādayo mamaiva rūpāṇi ity ajānanto 'pi vastuta indrādirūpeṇa mām eveṣṭvā yajñaśeṣaṃ somaṃ pibantīti somapās te puṇyaṃ
analyzed: yajñaiḥ mām iṣṭvā indra ādayaḥ mama eva rūpāṇi iti a jānantaḥ vastutas indra ādi rūpeṇa mām eva iṣṭvā yajña śeṣam somam pibanti iti soma pāḥ te puṇyam
translated: Not knowing that Indra and others are My own forms, they worship Me as Indra and others, and drink the Soma which is the remainder of the sacrifice. They are Soma drinkers. They attain

original: baladevaḥ evaṃ svabhaktānāṃ vṛttam abhidhāya teṣām eva viśeṣaṃ bodhayituṃ svavimukhānāṃ vṛttim āha traividyā iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam sva bhaktānām vṛttam abhidhāya teṣām eva viśeṣam bodhayitum sva vimukhānām vṛttim āha traividyāḥ iti dvābhyām
translated: Balarama: Having thus described the conduct of His devotees, in order to point out their special qualities, [the Lord] describes the conduct of those who are averse to Him with two verses beginning with Those who are devoted to the three Vedas...

original: tisṝṇāṃ vidyānāṃ samāhāras trividyaṃ /
analyzed: tisṝṇām vidyānām samāhāraḥ trividyam
translated: The compound trividyam is a collection of the three kinds of knowledge.

original: tad ye 'dhīyante vidanti ca te traividyāḥ /
analyzed: tat ye dhīyante vidanti ca te traividyāḥ
translated: Those who study and know that are those who are devoted to the three Vedas.

original: tad adhīte tad veda iti sūtrād aṇ /
analyzed: tat adhīte tat veda iti sūtrāt aṇ
translated: From the sutra tad adhite tad veda [Panini 1.1.64], the suffix an is added.

original: ṛgyajuḥsāmoktakarmaparā ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: ṛk yajuḥ sāma ukta karma parāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: they are devoted to the rituals mentioned in the Rig, Yajur, and Sama Vedas.

original: trayīvihitair jyotiṣṭomādibhir yajñair mām iṣṭvendrādayo mamaiva rūpāṇy avidvanto 'pi vastutas tattadrūpeṇāvasthitaṃ mām evāradhyety arthaḥ
analyzed: trayī vihitaiḥ jyotiṣṭoma ādibhiḥ yajñaiḥ mām iṣṭvā indra ādayaḥ mama eva rūpāṇi avidvantaḥ vastutas tad tad rūpeṇa avasthitam mām eva āradhya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that, by means of sacrifices enjoined by the three Vedas, such as the Jyotiṣṭoma, etc., Indra and others, not knowing Me, worship only Me, although in reality I abide in the form of each of them.

original: somapā yajñaśeṣaṃ somaṃ pibantaḥ /
analyzed: soma pāḥ yajña śeṣam somam pibantaḥ
translated: The Soma-drinkers, who drink the Soma, the remainder of the sacrifice.

original: pūtapāpā vinaṣṭsvargādiprāptivirodhakalmaṣāḥ santo ye svargatiṃ prārthayante te puṇyam ity ādi visphuṭārthaḥ /
analyzed: pūta pāpāḥ vinaṣṭa svarga ādi prāpti virodha kalmaṣāḥ santaḥ ye svar gatim prārthayante te puṇyam iti ādi visphuṭa arthaḥ
translated: Those whose sins are purified, who have destroyed the impurity that obstructs the attainment of heaven, etc., who desire to go to heaven, they obtain merit, etc. The meaning is clear.

original: mayaiva dattam iti śeṣaḥ ////
analyzed: mayā eva dattam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is: given by Me alone.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: te taṃ bhuktvā svargalokaṃ viśālaṃ
analyzed: te tam bhuktvā svarga lokam viśālam
translated: Having enjoyed that vast heavenly world,

original: kṣīṇe puṇye martyalokaṃ viśanti /
analyzed: kṣīṇe puṇye martya lokam viśanti
translated: when their merit is exhausted, they enter the world of mortals.

original: evaṃ trayīdharmam anuprapannā
analyzed: evam trayī dharmam anuprapannā
translated: Thus, those who follow the dharma of the three Vedas,

original: gatāgataṃ kāmakāmā labhante ////🔽śrīdharaḥ tataś ca te tam iti /
analyzed: gata āgatam kāma kāmāḥ labhante
translated: those who desire sensual pleasures obtain coming and going.

original: te svargakāmās taṃ prārthitaṃ vipulaṃ svargalokaṃ tatsukhaṃ bhuktvā bhogaprāpake puṇye kṣīṇe sati martyalokaṃ viśanti /
analyzed: te svarga kāmāḥ tam prārthitam vipulam svarga lokam tat sukham bhuktvā bhoga prāpake puṇye kṣīṇe sati martya lokam viśanti
translated: Śrīdhara: And then, they, who desire heaven, having enjoyed that desired vast heavenly world, that happiness, when the merit that brings about the enjoyment is exhausted, they enter the world of mortals.

original: punar apy evam eva vedatrayavihitaṃ dharmam anugatāḥ kāmakāmā bhogān kāmayamānā gatāgataṃ yātāyātaṃ labhante ////
analyzed: punar api evam eva veda traya vihitam dharmam anugatāḥ kāma kāmāḥ bhogān kāmayamānāḥ gata āgatam yāta āyātam labhante
translated: Again, in the same way, they who follow the dharma enjoined by the three Vedas, who desire sensual pleasures, who are desirous of enjoyments, obtain going and coming, going and returning.

original: madhusūdanaḥ tataḥ kim aniṣṭam iti tadāha te tam iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ tatas kim aniṣṭam iti tat āha te tam iti
translated: Madhusudana: What is the undesirable thing that follows from that? He says that:

original: te sakāmās taṃ kāmyena puṇyena prāptaṃ viśālaṃ vistīrṇaṃ svargalokaṃ bhuktvā tadbhogajanake
analyzed: te sa kāmāḥ tam kāmyena puṇyena prāptam viśālam vistīrṇam svarga lokam bhuktvā tad bhoga janake
translated: They, who are desirous of sensual pleasures, having enjoyed the vast, extensive world of heaven, which is attained by that meritorious act done with a desire for sensual pleasures,

original: puṇye kṣīṇe sati taddehanāśāt punar dehagrahaṇāya martyalokaṃ viśanti punar garbhavāsādiyātanā
analyzed: puṇye kṣīṇe sati tad deha nāśāt punar deha grahaṇāya martya lokam viśanti punar garbha vāsa ādi yātanā
translated: when that merit which causes those enjoyments is exhausted, they enter the mortal world to take up a body again, due to the destruction of that body. They experience

original: anubhavantīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: anubhavanti iti arthaḥ
translated: the sufferings of dwelling in the womb again and again, is the meaning.

original: punaḥ punar evam uktaprakāreṇa /
analyzed: punar punar evam ukta prakāreṇa
translated: Again and again, in the manner described.

original: hiḥ prasiddhyarthaḥ /
analyzed: hiḥ prasiddhi arthaḥ
translated: Hi is for well-known fact.

original: traidharmyaṃ hautrādhvaryavaudgātradharmatrayāha jyotirṣṭomādikaṃ kāmyaṃ karma /
analyzed: traidharmyam hautra ādhvaryava audgātra dharma traya āha jyotirṣṭoma ādikam kāmyam karma
translated: The three kinds of dharma are the three kinds of dharma of the Hotra, Adhvaryu and Udgata priests. The Jyotistoma and other sacrifices are meritorious acts done with a desire for sensual pleasures.

original: trayīdharmam iti pāṭhe 'pi trayyā vedatrayeṇa pratipāditaṃ dharmam iti sa evārthaḥ /
analyzed: trayī dharmam iti pāṭhe trayyā veda trayeṇa pratipāditam dharmam iti saḥ eva arthaḥ
translated: Even in the reading trayyadharma, the meaning is the same: the dharma taught by the three Vedas.

original: anupapannā anādau saṃsāre pūrvapratipattyapekṣayānuśabdaḥ /
analyzed: anupapannāḥ anādau saṃsāre pūrva pratipatti apekṣayā anuśabdaḥ
translated: The word anu (after) is used in the sense of requiring prior understanding in the beginningless cycle of birth and death.

original: pūrvapratipattyanantaraṃ manuṣyalokam āgatya punaḥ pratipannāḥ /
analyzed: pūrva pratipatti anantaram manuṣya lokam āgatya punar pratipannāḥ
translated: Having attained the human world after the previous attainment, they are reborn again.

original: kāmakāmā divyān bhogān kāmayamānā evaṃ gatāgataṃ labhante karma kṛtvā svargaṃ yānti tata āgatya punaḥ karma kurvantīty
analyzed: kāma kāmāḥ divyān bhogān kāmayamānāḥ evam gatāgatam labhante karma kṛtvā svargam yānti tatas āgatya punar karma kurvanti iti
translated: Those who desire sense objects, desiring divine enjoyments, obtain such comings and goings, having performed actions they go to heaven, then come back, and perform actions again.

original: evaṃ garbhavāsādiyātanāpravāhas teṣām aniśam anuvartata ity abhiprāyaḥ ////
analyzed: evam garbha vāsa ādi yātanā pravāhaḥ teṣām aniśam anuvartate iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The idea is that for them the stream of sufferings such as dwelling in the womb continues uninterrupted.

original: viśvanāthaḥ gatāgataṃ punaḥ punar mṛtyujanmanī ////
translated: Viśvanātha: Comings and goings are repeated deaths and births.

original: baladevaḥ tataś ca te tam iti te svargaprārthakāḥ prārthitaṃ taṃ svargalokaṃ
analyzed: baladevaḥ tatas ca te tam iti te svarga prārthakāḥ prārthitam tam svarga lokam
translated: Balarāma: And then they, those who desire heaven, having obtained the desired heavenly world,

original: bhuktvā tatprāpake puṇye kṣīṇe sati martyalokaṃ viśanti pañcāgnividyoktarītyā
analyzed: bhuktvā tad prāpake puṇye kṣīṇe sati martya lokam viśanti pañcāgni vidyā ukta rītyā
translated: having enjoyed it, when the merit that brought it is exhausted, enter the mortal world, in the manner described in the Pañcāgni Vidyā.

original: bhuvi brāhmaṇādijanmāni labhante punar apy evam eva trayīvihitaṃ dharmam anutiṣṭhantaḥ
analyzed: bhuvi brāhmaṇa ādi janmāni labhante punar api evam eva trayī vihitam dharmam anutiṣṭhantaḥ
translated: They obtain births as Brahmins and others on earth. Again, in the same way, observing the Dharma enjoined by the three Vedas,

original: kāmakāmāḥ svargabhogecchavo gatāgataṃ labhante saṃsarantīty arthaḥ // //
analyzed: kāma kāmāḥ svarga bhoga icchavaḥ gatāgatam labhante saṃsaranti iti arthaḥ
translated: those who desire sense objects, who desire the enjoyment of heaven, obtain comings and goings, which means they transmigrate.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG 8.5

original: ananyāś cintayanto māṃ ye janāḥ paryupāsate /
analyzed: an anyāḥ cintayantaḥ mām ye janāḥ paryupāsate
translated: Those people who worship Me, thinking of nothing else,

original: teṣāṃ nityābhiyuktānāṃ yogakṣemaṃ vahāmy aham ////
analyzed: teṣām nitya abhiyuktānām yogakṣemam vahāmi aham
translated: I carry the yoga and kshema of those who are ever devoted to Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ madbhaktās tu matprasādena kṛtārthā bhavantīty āha ananyāḥ iti /
analyzed: tu
translated: Śrīdhara: But My devotees, by My grace, become successful. The Lord says this in Ananyāḥ, etc.

original: ananyā nāsti madvyatirekeṇānyat kāmayaṃ yeṣāṃ te /
analyzed: ananyā na asti mad vyatirekeṇa anyat kāmayam yeṣām te
translated: Those who do not have any desire other than Me are ananyāḥ.

original: tathābhūtā ye janā māṃ cintayantaḥ sevante teṣāṃ nityābhiyuktānāṃ sarvadā madekaniṣṭhānāṃ yogaṃ dhanādilābhaṃ kṣemaṃ ca tatpālanaṃ mokṣaṃ 🔽vā /
analyzed: tathābhūtāḥ ye janāḥ mām cintayantaḥ sevante teṣām nitya abhiyuktānām sarvadā mad ekaniṣṭhānām yogam dhana ādi lābham kṣemam ca tad pālanam mokṣam  vā
translated: I carry the yoga, the acquisition of wealth, etc., and the kshema, the protection of that, or liberation, of those people who are such, who serve Me by thinking of Me, who are ever devoted, who are always solely devoted to Me.

original: tair aprārthitam apy aham eva vahāmi prāpayāmi ////
analyzed: taiḥ a prārthitam api aham eva vahāmi prāpayāmi
translated: Even though they do not pray for it, I Myself carry it, I Myself bring it about.

original: madhusūdanaḥ niṣkāmāḥ samyagdarśinas tu ananyā iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ niṣkāmāḥ samyak darśinaḥ tu ananyāḥ iti
translated: Madhusūdana: But those who are desireless and have perfect knowledge are ananyāḥ.

original: anyo bhedadṛṣṭiviṣayo na vidyate yaṣāṃ te 'nanyāḥ sarvādvaitadarśinaḥ sarvabhoganiḥspṛhāḥ /
analyzed: anyaḥ bheda dṛṣṭi viṣayaḥ na vidyate yaṣām te sarva advaita darśinaḥ sarva bhoga niḥspṛhāḥ
translated: Those who have no other object of the vision of difference are ananyāḥ, who see the non-duality of all, who are indifferent to all enjoyments.

original: aham eva bhagavān vāsudevaḥ sarvātmā na madvyatiriktaṃ kiṃcid astīti jñātvā tam
analyzed: aham eva bhagavān vāsudevaḥ sarva ātmā na mad vyatiriktam kiṃcid asti iti jñātvā tam
translated: Knowing that I Myself, Lord Vāsudeva, am the Self of all, and that nothing exists apart from Me, those people who always think of that

original: eva pratyañcaṃ sadā cintayanto māṃ nārāyaṇam ātatvena ye janāḥ sādhanacatuṣṭayasampannāḥ
analyzed: eva pratyañcam sadā cintayantaḥ mām nārāyaṇam ye janāḥ sādhana catuṣṭaya sampannāḥ
translated: Me, Nārāyaṇa, as the ultimate reality, who are endowed with the four means [of yoga],

original: saṃnyāsinaḥ pari sarvato 'navacchinnatayā paśyanti te madananyatayā kṛtakṛtyā eveti śeṣaḥ /
analyzed: saṃnyāsinaḥ pari sarvatas nava chinna tayā paśyanti te mad ananya tayā kṛtakṛtyāḥ eva iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The renunciates see them as not limited in any way at all. The rest is: They are indeed contented by being non-different from Me.

original: advaitadarśananiṣṭhānām atyantaniṣkāmānāṃ teṣāṃ svayam aprayatamānāṃ kathaṃ yogakṣemau
analyzed: advaita darśana niṣṭhānām atyanta niṣkāmānām teṣām svayam a prayatamānām katham yogakṣemau
translated: How can there be yoga and kshema for them, who are extremely desireless and devoted to the realization of non-duality, and who do not strive on their own?

original: syātām ity ata āha teṣāṃ nityābhiyuktānāṃ nityam anavaratam ādareṇa dhyāne vyāpṛtānāṃ🔽dehayātrāmātrārtham apy aprayatamānānāṃ yogaṃ ca kṣemaṃ ca /
analyzed: syātām iti atas āha teṣām nitya abhiyuktānām nityam anavaratam ādareṇa dhyāne vyāpṛtānām  dehayātrā mātrā artham api aprayatamānānām yogam ca kṣemam ca
translated: To this He says: For them, who are always engaged, who are always and uninterruptedly absorbed in meditation with reverence,🔽I carry yoga and kshema, even for the sake of mere bodily sustenance, for those who do not strive.

original: alabdhasya lābhaṃ labdhasya parirakṣaṇaṃ ca śarīrasthityarthaṃ yogakṣemam akāmayamānānām api vahāmi prāpayāmy ahaṃ sarveśvaraḥ /
analyzed: a labdhasya lābham labdhasya parirakṣaṇam ca śarīra sthiti artham yogakṣemam a kāmayamānānām api vahāmi prāpayāmi aham sarva īśvaraḥ
translated: I, the Lord of all, bring to them, who do not desire yoga and kshema - acquisition of what is not obtained and preservation of what is obtained - for the sake of bodily existence.

original: teṣāṃ jñānī nityayukta ekabhaktir viśiṣyate /
analyzed: teṣām jñānī nitya yuktaḥ eka bhaktiḥ viśiṣyate
translated: Among them, the knower who is always devoted and has single devotion is distinguished.

original: priyo hi jñānino 'tyartham ahaṃ sa ca mama priyaḥ //
analyzed: priyaḥ hi jñāninaḥ tyartham aham sa ca mama priyaḥ
translated: For I am very dear to the knower, and he is dear to Me.

original: Gītā / iti hy uktam /
analyzed: gītāḥ iti hi uktam
translated: Thus it has been said.

original: yadyapi sarveṣām api yogakṣemaṃ vahati bhāgavāṃs tathāpy anyeṣāṃ prayatnam utpādya taddvārā vahati jñānināṃ tu tadarthaṃ prayatnam utpādya
analyzed: yadi api sarveṣām api yogakṣemam vahati bhāgavān tathā api anyeṣām prayatnam utpādya tad dvārā vahati jñāninām tu tad artham prayatnam utpādya
translated: Although the Supreme Lord carries the welfare and prosperity of all, still He carries it through the efforts of others in the case of those who are not jnanis. But in the case of jnanis, He carries it by producing in them the effort for that purpose.

original: vahatīti viśeṣaḥ ////
analyzed: vahati iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: This is the difference.

original: viśvanāthaḥ madananyabhaktānāṃ sukhaṃ tu na karmaprāpyaṃ kintu maddattam evety āha ananyā iti /
analyzed: tu na
translated: Visvanatha: As for the happiness of those who are devotees exclusively of Me, it is not attained through karma, but is given by Me alone. Thus He says, ananyah, not for others, i.e. not for the sake of others.

original: nityam eva sadaivābhiyuktānāṃ paṇḍitānām iti tad anye nityam apaṇḍitā iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: nityam eva sadā eva abhiyuktānām paṇḍitānām iti tat anye nityam apaṇḍitāḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Nitya, always, means constantly. Abhiyujknanam, of the learned. The idea is that others are always unlearned.

original: yad vā nityasaṃyogaspṛhāvatāṃ yogo dhanādilābhaḥ kṣemaṃ tatpālanaṃ ca tair tair
analyzed: yat vā nitya saṃyoga spṛhāvatām yogaḥ dhana ādi lābhaḥ kṣemam tad pālanam ca taiḥ taiḥ
translated: Or, nitya-samyoga-sprihavatam, of those who desire constant association, i.e. yoga, the acquisition of wealth etc., and ksema, its protection, by various means.

original: anapekṣitam apy aham eva vahāmy atra karomīty aprayujya vahāmīti prayogāt teṣāṃ śarīrapoṣaṇabhāro
analyzed: an apekṣitam api aham eva vahāmi atra karomi iti a prayujya vahāmi iti prayogāt teṣām śarīra poṣaṇa bhāraḥ
translated: Although not desired by them, I alone carry it, i.e. I do it. Here, by using the word vaham, I carry, instead of the usual pra-yuji, I employ, the idea is that the burden of nourishing their bodies

original: mayaivohyate yathā svakalatraputrādipoṣaṇabhāro gṛhastheneti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: mayā eva uhyate yathā sva kalatra putra ādi poṣaṇa bhāraḥ gṛhasthena iti bhāvaḥ
translated: is carried by Me alone, just as the burden of nourishing one's own wife, children etc. is carried by a householder.

original: na ca anyeṣām iva teṣām api yogakṣemaṃ karmaprāpyam evety ata ātmārāmasya sarvetodāsīnasya parameśvarasya tava kiṃ tadvahaneneti vācyam
analyzed: na ca anyeṣām iva teṣām api yogakṣemam karma prāpyam eva iti atas ātma ārāmasya sarva itas udāsīnasya parameśvarasya tava kim tad vahanena iti vācyam
translated: For you, the Supreme Lord, who are self-satisfied and indifferent to everything, what is the use of carrying them?

original: bhaktir asya bhajanaṃ tad ihāmutropādhinairāsyenāmuṣmin manaḥkalpanam etad eva naiṣkarmyam /🔽iti śruter madanyabhaktānāṃ niṣkāmatvena naiṣkarmyāt teṣu dṛṣṭaṃ
analyzed: bhaktiḥ asya bhajanam tat iha amutra upādhi nairāsyena amuṣmin manaḥ kalpanam etat eva naiṣkarmyam  iti śruteḥ mad anya bhaktānām niṣkāma tvena naiṣkarmyāt teṣu dṛṣṭam
translated: Bhakti (devotion) to Him is serving Him, which is the mental conception of Him in this world and the next, renouncing all other means. This itself is the state of being free from action.

original: sukhaṃ maddattam eva /
analyzed: sukham mad dattam eva
translated: By the Vedic text, the happiness seen in them, who are devotees of someone other than Me, is due to their being free from desires and being free from action.🔽It is given by Me alone.

original: tatra mama sarvatrodāsīnasyāpi svabhaktavātsalyam eva hetur jñeyaḥ /
analyzed: tatra mama sarvatra udāsīnasya api sva bhakta vātsalyam eva hetuḥ jñeyaḥ
translated: There, even though I am indifferent to everything, the cause should be known as only My affection for My devotees.

original: na caivaṃ tvayi sveṣṭadeve svanirvāhabhāraṃ dadānās te bhaktāḥ premaśūnyā iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam tvayi sva iṣṭadeve sva nirvāha bhāram dadānāḥ te bhaktāḥ prema śūnyāḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that those devotees, who give the burden of their own sustenance to you, their desired God, are devoid of love.

original: tair mayi svabhārasya sarvathaivānarpaṇāt mayaiva svecchayā grahaṇāt /
analyzed: taiḥ mayi sva bhārasya sarvathā eva anarpaṇāt mayā eva sva icchayā grahaṇāt
translated: Because they have not at all given their burden to Me, but have been taken by Me alone by My own will.

original: na ca saṅkalpamātreṇa viśvasṛṣṭyādi kartuṃ mamāyaṃ bhāro jñeyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca saṅkalpa mātreṇa viśva sṛṣṭi ādi kartum mama ayam bhāraḥ jñeyaḥ
translated: And this burden of Mine should not be known as creating the universe etc. merely by resolve.

original: yad vā bhaktajanāsaktasya mama svabhogyakāntābhāravahanam iva tadīyayogakṣemavahanam atisukhapradam iti ////
analyzed: yat vā bhakta jana āsaktasya mama sva bhogya kāntā bhāra vahanam iva tadīya yogakṣema vahanam ati sukha pradam iti
translated: Or, it is like the carrying of the burden of one's own wife, which is very pleasant for one who is devoted to one's own people, so also is the carrying of their yoga and kshema (protection and preservation) very pleasant for me.

original: baladevaḥ atha svabhaktānāṃ viśeṣaa nirūpayati ananyā iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ atha sva bhaktānām nirūpayati ananyā iti
translated: Balarama. Now, he describes the special qualities of his devotees, beginning with Ananyah.

original: ye janā ananyā madekaprayojanā māṃ cintayanto dhyāyantaḥ paritaḥ kalyāṇaguṇaratnāśrayatayā
analyzed: ye janāḥ ananyāḥ mad eka prayojanāḥ mām cintayantaḥ dhyāyantaḥ paritas kalyāṇa guṇa ratna āśraya tayā
translated: Those people who are devoted solely to me, who think of me, meditate on me, and worship me by resorting to me as the abode of auspicious qualities,

original: vicitrādbhutalīlāpīyūṣāśrayatayā divyavihbūtyāśrayatayā copāsate bhajanti teṣāṃ
analyzed: vicitra adbhuta līlā pīyūṣa āśraya tayā divya vihbūti āśraya tayā ca upāsate bhajanti teṣām
translated: as the abode of nectar-like wonderful pastimes, and as the abode of divine bliss,

original: nityaṃ sarvadaiva mayy abhiyuktānāṃ vismṛtadehayātrāṇām aham eva yogakṣemam annādyāharaṇaṃ
analyzed: nityam sarvadā eva mayi abhiyuktānām vismṛta dehayātrāṇām aham eva yogakṣemam annādya āharaṇam
translated: for them who are always engaged in me, who have forgotten the course of their bodies, I myself carry their yoga and kshema, the acquisition of food and other necessities,

original: tatsaṃrakṣaṇaṃ ca vahāmi /
analyzed: tad saṃrakṣaṇam ca vahāmi
translated: and their protection.

original: atra karomīty anuktvā vahāmīty uktis tu tatpoṣaṇabhāro mayaiva voḍhavyo gṛhasthasyeva kuṭumbapoṣaṇabhāra iti vyanakti /
analyzed: atra karomi iti an uktvā vahāmi iti uktiḥ tu tad poṣaṇa bhāraḥ mayā eva voḍhavyaḥ gṛhasthasya iva kuṭumba poṣaṇa bhāraḥ iti vyanakti
translated: Here, instead of saying I do, he says I carry, indicating that the burden of nourishing them should be borne by me alone, like the burden of nourishing a householder's family.

original: evam āha sūtrakāraḥ svāminaḥ phalaśruter ity ātreyaḥ Vs / / iti /
analyzed: evam āha sūtra kāraḥ svāminaḥ phala śruteḥ iti ātreyaḥ iti
translated: The author of the sutras says this: Because the result is stated for the master, says Atreya.

original: atrāhuḥ teṣāṃ nityaṃ mayā sārdham abhiyogaṃ vāñchatāṃ yogaṃ matprāptilakṣaṇaṃ kṣemaṃ ca matto 'punarāvṛttilakṣaṇam aham eva vahāmi /
analyzed: atra āhuḥ teṣām nityam mayā sārdham abhiyogam vāñchatām yogam mad prāpti lakṣaṇam kṣemam ca mattaḥ punarāvṛtti lakṣaṇam aham eva vahāmi
translated: Here they say: I myself carry those who desire to have constant union with Me, and the yoga which is characterized by attainment of Me, and the peace which is characterized by non-return to this world from Me.

original: teṣāṃ matprāpaṇabhāro mamaiva
analyzed: teṣām mad prāpaṇa bhāraḥ mama eva
translated: The burden of bringing them to Me is Mine alone,

original: na tv arcirāder devagaṇasyeti /
analyzed: na tu arciḥ ādeḥ deva gaṇasya iti
translated: not of the group of gods such as Agni and others.

original: evam evābhidhāsyati dvādaśe ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi ity ādidvayena /
analyzed: evam eva abhidhāsyati dvādaśe ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi iti ādi dvayena
translated: In the same way, it will be stated in the twelfth chapter by the two verses beginning with But those who offer all actions to Me...

original: sūtrakāro 'py evam āha viśeṣaṃ ca darśayati Vs / / iti ////
analyzed: sūtrakāraḥ pi evam āha viśeṣam ca darśayati iti
translated: The author of the sutra also says the same and shows the distinction.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg

original: ye 'py anyadevatābhaktā yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi anya devatā bhaktāḥ yajante śraddhayā anvitāḥ
translated: Even those who are devoted to other deities and worship with faith,

original: te 'pi mām eva kaunteya yajanty avidhipūrvakam ////
analyzed: te pi mām eva kaunteya yajanti avidhi pūrvakam
translated: they too, O son of Kunti, worship Me alone, though not according to the rules.🔽(Vs. 11)

original: śrīdharaḥ nanu ca tvadvyatirekeṇa vastuto devatāntarasyābhāvādindrādisevino 'pi tvadbhaktā eveti kathaṃ te gatāgataṃ labheran /
translated: Sri Sridhara: But if there are no other deities apart from You in reality, then those who serve Indra and others are Your devotees themselves. How can they attain coming and going?

original: tatrāha ye 'pīti /
analyzed: tatra āha ye pi iti
translated: To that, He says Even those...

original: śraddhayopetā bhaktāḥ santo ye janā anyadevatā indrādirūpā yajante te 'pi mām eva yajantīti satyaṃ kintu avidhipūrvakam /
analyzed: śraddhayā upetāḥ bhaktāḥ santaḥ ye janāḥ anya devatāḥ indra ādi rūpāḥ yajante te pi mām eva yajanti iti satyam kintu avidhi pūrvakam
translated: It is true that those people who are devoted and have faith and worship other deities in the form of Indra and others, they too worship Me alone. But not according to the rules.

original: mokṣaprāpakaṃ vidhiṃ vinā yajanti /
analyzed: mokṣa prāpakam vidhim vinā yajanti
translated: They worship without the means that lead to liberation.

original: atas te punar āvartante ////
analyzed: atas te punar āvartante
translated: Therefore, they return again and again.

original: madhusūdanaḥ nanv anyā api devatās tvam eva tvadvyatiriktasya vastvantarasyābhāvāt /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ nanu anyāḥ api devatāḥ tvam eva tvad vyatiriktasya vastu antarasya abhāvāt
translated: Madhusudana: But other deities are You alone, because there is no other entity apart from You.

original: tathā ca devatāntarabhaktā api tvām eva bhajanta iti na ko 'pi viśeṣaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tathā ca devatā antara bhaktāḥ api tvām eva bhajante iti na kaḥ pi viśeṣaḥ syāt
translated: And thus, even the devotees of other deities worship You alone. So there would be no difference at all.

original: tena gatāgataṃ kāmakāmā vasurudrādityādibhaktā labhante /
analyzed: tena gatāgatam kāma kāmāḥ vasu rudra āditya ādi bhaktāḥ labhante
translated: Therefore, those who desire worldly pleasures and heaven attain return and rebirth.

original: ananyāś cintayanto māṃ tu kṛtakṛtyā iti katham uktaṃ tatrāha ye 'pīti /
analyzed: ananyāḥ cintayantaḥ mām tu kṛtakṛtyāḥ iti katham uktam tatra āha ye pi iti
translated: And those who are not solely devoted to Me, thinking of Me, are not successful. How is this stated? There he says:

original: yathā madbhaktā mām eva yajanti tathā ye 'nyadevatānāṃ vasvādīnāṃ bhaktā yajante jyotiṣṭomādibhiḥ śraddhayāstikyabuddhyā 'nvitāḥ /
analyzed: yathā mad bhaktāḥ mām eva yajanti tathā ye nyadevatānām vasu ādīnām bhaktāḥ yajante jyotiṣṭoma ādibhiḥ śraddhayā āstikya buddhyā nvitāḥ
translated: Just as My devotees worship Me alone, so also those who are devotees of other deities, such as the Vasus, Rudras, Adityas, etc., worship with faith, with the understanding of devotion.

original: te 'pi madbhaktā iva he kaunteya tattaddevatārūpeṇa sthitaṃ mām eva yajanti pūjayanti /
analyzed: te pi mad bhaktāḥ iva he kaunteya tat tat devatā rūpeṇa sthitam mām eva yajanti pūjayanti
translated: They also, like My devotees, O son of Kunti, worship Me alone, abiding in the form of those deities.

original: avidhipūrvakam avidhir ajñānaṃ tatpūrvakaṃ sarvātmatvena mām ajñātvā madbhinnatvena vastvādīn kalapayitvā yajantīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: avidhi pūrvakam avidhiḥ ajñānam tad pūrvakam sarva ātma tvena mām a jñātvā mad bhinna tvena vastu ādīn kalapayitvā yajanti iti arthaḥ
translated: They worship without the means, i.e., not knowing Me as the Self of all, they imagine entities, etc., as different from Me, and worship.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanu ca jñānayajñena cāpy anye ity anena tvayā svasyaivopāsanā trividhoktā /
translated: Viśvanātha: Objection: By the verse Others worship Me through the sacrifice of knowledge (11.43), You have described Your own worship as threefold.

original: tatra bahudhā viśvatomukham iti tṛtīyāyā upāsanāyā jñāpanārtham /
analyzed: tatra bahudhā viśvatomukham iti tṛtīyāyāḥ upāsanāyāḥ jñāpana artham
translated: There, the third type of worship is indicated by the words manifold, facing all directions (11.43).

original: ahaṃ kratur ahaṃ yajñaḥ ity ādi svasya viśvarūpatvaṃ darśitaṃ /
analyzed: aham kratuḥ aham yajñaḥ iti ādi svasya viśva rūpa tvam darśitam
translated: The verse I am the sacrifice, I am the offering, I am the fire, I am the mantra, I am the offering substance, I am the father, the mother, the support (11.46) shows Your own universal form.

original: ataḥ karmayogena karmāṅgabhūtendrādiyājakās tathā prādhānyenaiva devatāntarabhaktā api tvadbhaktā eva /
analyzed: atas karma yogena karma aṅga bhūta indra ādi yājakāḥ tathā prādhānyena eva devatā antara bhaktāḥ api tvad bhaktāḥ eva
translated: Therefore, those who worship Indra and other deities as the primary deities, while performing actions as a means of worship, are indeed Your devotees.

original: kathaṃ tarhi te na mucyante /
analyzed: katham tarhi te na mucyante
translated: Then how is it that they are not liberated?

original: yad uktaṃ tvayā gatāgataṃ kāmakāmā labhante iti /
analyzed: yat uktam tvayā gata āgatam kāma kāmāḥ labhante iti
translated: As You have said, Those who desire enjoyments obtain them through Me, and then return again (11.44).

original: antavat tu phalaṃ teṣām iti ca /🔽tatrāha ye 'pīti satyaṃ mām eva yajantīti /
analyzed: antavat tu phalam teṣām iti ca  tatra āha ye pi iti satyam mām eva yajanti iti
translated: And But their fruits are limited (11.45).

original: kintv avidhipūrvakam matprāpakaṃ vidhiṃ vinaiva yajanty ataḥ punar āvartante ////
analyzed: kintu avidhi pūrvakam mad prāpakam vidhim vinā eva yajanti atas punar āvartante
translated: In that regard, He says Those who worship Me (11.45), but not in accordance with the injunctions (11.45), without the injunction leading to Me, they return again and again (11.45).

original: baladevaḥ nanv indrādiyājino 'pi vastutas tvadyājina eva teṣāṃ kuto gatāgatam iti cet tatrāha ye 'pīti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu vastutas tvad yājinaḥ eva teṣām kutas gatāgatam iti ced tatra āha ye pi iti
translated: Balarāma: If it is asked, Even those who worship Indra and others are actually Your worshippers. Then how is it that they return again and again? (11.45), He says Those who worship Me (11.45).

original: ye janā anyadevatābhaktāḥ kevaleṣv indrādiṣu bhaktimantaḥ śraddhayā ataeva phalapradā iti dṛḍhaviśvāsenopetāḥ santo yajante yajñais tān
analyzed: ye janāḥ anya devatā bhaktāḥ kevaleṣu indra ādiṣu bhaktimantaḥ śraddhayā ataeva phala pradāḥ iti dṛḍha viśvāsena upetāḥ santaḥ yajante yajñaiḥ tān
translated: Those people who are devoted to other deities, who are firmly convinced that only Indra and others are the bestowers of fruits, and who worship with faith,

original: arcayanti /
analyzed: arcayanti
translated: they worship Me.

original: te 'pi mām eva yajanti iti satyam etat /
analyzed: te pi mām eva yajanti iti satyam etat
translated: This is the truth that they worship Me alone.

original: kintv avidhipūrvakaṃ te yajanti yena vidhinā gatāgatanivartakā matprāptiḥ syāt taṃ vidhiṃ vinaiva /🔽atas tat te labhante ////
analyzed: kintu avidhi pūrvakam te yajanti yena vidhinā gata āgata nivartakā mad prāptiḥ syāt tam vidhim vinā eva  atas tat te labhante
translated: But they worship without the proper procedure, without the procedure by which there would be return from coming and going and attainment of Me.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Therefore, they do not obtain that.🔽BhG 9.24

original: ahaṃ hi sarvayajñānāṃ bhoktā ca prabhur eva ca /
analyzed: aham hi sarva yajñānām bhoktā ca prabhuḥ eva ca
translated: For I am the enjoyer as well as the Lord of all sacrifices.

original: na tu mām abhijānanti tattvenātaś cyavanti te ////
analyzed: na tu mām abhijānanti tattvena atas cyavanti te
translated: But they do not know Me in truth, and therefore they fall away.

original: śrīdharaḥ etad eva vivṛṇoti aham iti /🔽sarveṣāṃ yajñānāṃ tattaddevatārūpeṇāham eva bhoktā /
analyzed: eva           sarveṣām yajñānām tad tad devatā rūpeṇa aham eva bhoktā
translated: Sridhar says: He explains this very thing with I etc.

original: prabhuś ca svāmī /
analyzed: prabhuḥ ca svāmī
translated: I alone am the enjoyer and the Lord, in the form of each deity, of all sacrifices.

original: phaladātā cāpy aham evety arthaḥ /
analyzed: phala dātā ca api aham eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that I am also the giver of fruits.

original: evambhūtaṃ māṃ te tattvena yathāvan nābhijānanti /
analyzed: evambhūtam mām te tattvena yathāvat na abhijānanti
translated: They do not know Me in truth, as I am.

original: ataś cyavanti pracyavante punar āvartante /
analyzed: atas cyavanti pracyavante punar āvartante
translated: And therefore they fall away, they fall down and return again.

original: ye tu sarvadevatāsu mām evātaryāminaṃ paśyanto yajanti te tu nāvartante ////
analyzed: ye tu sarva devatāsu mām eva ataryāminam paśyantaḥ yajanti te tu na āvartante
translated: But those who worship Me alone, who am the inner controller, regarding Me alone as present in all the deities, they do not return.

original: madhusūdanaḥ avidhipūrvakatvaṃ vivṛṇvan phalapracyutim amīṣām āha aham hīti /
translated: Madhusudana, explaining the absence of injunctions, says that these people are deprived of the fruits (of their actions), saying, 'I alone'.

original: ahaṃ bhagavān vāsudeva eva sarveṣāṃ yajñānāṃ śrautānāṃ smārtānāṃ ca tattaddevatārūpeṇa bhoktā ca svenāntaryāmirūpeṇādhiyajñatvāt prabhuś
analyzed: aham bhagavān vāsudevaḥ eva sarveṣām yajñānām śrautānām smārtānām ca tad tad devatā rūpeṇa bhoktā ca svena antaryāmi rūpeṇa adhiyajña tvāt prabhuḥ
translated: It is well known that I, Lord Vāsudeva, am the enjoyer of all sacrifices, Vedic and Smārta, in the form of those respective deities, and as the inner controller, I am the Lord,

original: ca phaladātā ceti prasiddham etat /
analyzed: ca phala dātā ca iti prasiddham etat
translated: and the bestower of fruits.

original: devatāntarayājinas tu mām īdṛśaṃ tattvena bhoktṛtvena prabhutvena ca bhagavān vāsudeva
analyzed: devatā antara yājinaḥ tu mām īdṛśam tattvena bhoktṛ tvena prabhu tvena ca bhagavān vāsudeva
translated: But those who worship other deities do not know that the Lord Vāsudeva is such, as the enjoyer, the Lord,

original: eva vastvādirūpeṇa yajñānāṃ bhoktā svena rūpeṇa ca phaladātā na tadanyo 'sti🔽kaścid ārādhya ity evaṃrūpeṇa na jānanti /
analyzed: eva vastu ādi rūpeṇa yajñānām bhoktā svena rūpeṇa ca phala dātā na tad anyaḥ sti  kaścid ārādhyaḥ iti evaṃrūpeṇa na jānanti
translated: and the bestower of fruits in His own form, and that there is no one else to be worshipped in the form of the object etc. of sacrifices.

original: ato matsvarūpāparijñānān mahatāyāseneṣṭvāpi mayy anarpitakarmāṇas tattaddevalokaṃ
analyzed: atas mad sva rūpa aparijñānāt mahatā āyāsena iṣṭvā api mayi anarpita karmāṇaḥ tat tat deva lokam
translated: Therefore, due to not knowing My true nature, even after worshipping with great effort, they do not offer their actions to Me. Going to the respective world of the gods

original: dhūmādimārgeṇa gatvā tadbhogānte cyavanti pracyavante tadbhogajanakakarmakṣayāt
analyzed: dhūma ādi mārgeṇa gatvā tad bhoga ante cyavanti pracyavante tad bhoga janaka karma kṣayāt
translated: through the path of smoke etc., they fall down, i.e. slip down, at the end of enjoying that, due to the exhaustion of the actions that produce that enjoyment.

original: taddehādiviyuktāḥ punar dehagrahaṇāya manuṣyalokaṃ pratyāvartante /🔽ye tu tattaddevatāsu bhagavantam
analyzed: tad deha ādi viyuktāḥ punar deha grahaṇāya manuṣya lokam pratyāvartante  ye tu tad tad devatāsu bhagavantam
translated: They who are detached from the body etc. return to the human world to take up a body again.

original: eva sarvāntaryāmiṇaṃ paśyanto yajante te bhagavadarpitakarmāṇas tadvidyāsahitakarmavaśād
analyzed: eva sarva antaryāmiṇam paśyantaḥ yajante te bhagavat arpita karmāṇaḥ tad vidyā sahita karma vaśāt
translated: But those who, seeing the Lord alone as the inner controller of those deities, worship Him, they, their actions offered to the Lord, by the power of their actions along with the knowledge of Him,

original: arcirādimārgeṇa brahmalokaṃ gatvā tatrotpannasamyagdarśanās tadbhogānte mucyanta iti vivekaḥ // //
analyzed: arciḥ ādi mārgeṇa brahma lokam gatvā tatra utpanna samyak darśanāḥ tad bhoga ante mucyante iti vivekaḥ
translated: go to the world of Brahman by the path of light etc., and being born there with right knowledge, they are liberated at the end of that enjoyment. This is the discrimination.

original: viśvanāthaḥ avidhipūrvakatvaṃ evāha aham iti /
analyzed: eva āha   iti
translated: Visvanatha says that he states the absence of injunctions with the word I.

original: devatāntararūpeṇāham eva bhoktā prabhuḥ svāmī phaladātā cāham evati /
analyzed: devatā antara rūpeṇa aham eva bhoktā prabhuḥ svāmī phala dātā ca aham
translated: I alone am the enjoyer, the lord, the master, and the giver of fruits in the form of other deities.

original: māṃ tu tattvena na jānanti /
analyzed: mām tu tattvena na jānanti
translated: But they do not know Me as the truth.

original: yathā sūryasyāham upāsakaḥ /🔽sūrya eva mayi prasīdatu /
analyzed: yathā sūryasya aham upāsakaḥ  sūryaḥ eva mayi prasīdatu
translated: I am a worshipper of the sun.🔽May the sun alone be pleased with me.

original: sūrya eva madabhīṣṭaṃ phalaṃ dadātu /
analyzed: sūryaḥ eva mad abhīṣṭam phalam dadātu
translated: May the sun alone give me the desired fruits.

original: sūrya eva parameśvara iti teṣāṃ buddhiḥ /
analyzed: sūryaḥ eva parameśvaraḥ iti teṣām buddhiḥ
translated: The sun alone is the Supreme Lord. This is their understanding.

original: na tu parameśvaro nārāyaṇa eva sūryaḥ /
analyzed: na tu parameśvaraḥ nārāyaṇaḥ eva sūryaḥ
translated: But the Supreme Lord Narayana alone is the sun.

original: sa eva tādṛśaśraddhotpādakaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva tādṛśa śraddhā utpādakaḥ
translated: He alone is the producer of such faith.

original: sa eva mahyaṃ sūryopāsanāphalapradaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva mahyam sūrya upāsanā phala pradaḥ
translated: He alone is the giver of the fruits of my worship of the sun.

original: iti buddhiratas tattvato madabhijñānābhāvāt te cyavante /
analyzed: iti buddhiḥ atas tattvataḥ mad abhijñāna abhāvāt te cyavante
translated: Thus, due to the absence of the knowledge of My true nature, they fall away.

original: bhagavān nārāyaṇa eva sūryādirūpeṇārādhyate iti bhāvanayā viśvatomukhaṃ mām upāsīnās tu mucyanta eva /
analyzed: bhagavān nārāyaṇaḥ eva sūrya ādi rūpeṇa ārādhyate iti bhāvanayā viśvatomukham mām upāsīnāḥ tu mucyante eva
translated: But those who worship Me, who am omnipresent, with the idea that Lord Narayana alone is worshipped in the form of the sun etc., are indeed liberated.

original: tasmān madvibhūtiṣu sūryādiṣu pūjā madvibhūtijñānapūrvikaiva kartavyā /
analyzed: tasmāt mad vibhūtiṣu sūrya ādiṣu pūjā mad vibhūti jñāna pūrvikā eva kartavyā
translated: Therefore, worship of the sun etc., which are My manifestations, should be done only preceded by the knowledge of My manifestations.

original: na tv anyathā iti dyotitam ////
analyzed: na tu anyathā iti dyotitam
translated: It is not otherwise. This is what is indicated.

original: baladevaḥ avidhipūrvakatāṃ darśayati ahaṃ hīti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ avidhi pūrvakatām darśayati aham hi iti
translated: Balarama shows the absence of injunction by saying I alone.

original: aham evendrādirūpeṇa sarveṣāṃ yajñānāṃ bhoktā prabhuḥ svāmī pālakaḥ phaladaś cety evaṃ tattvena māṃ nābhijānanti /
analyzed: aham eva indra ādi rūpeṇa sarveṣām yajñānām bhoktā prabhuḥ svāmī pālakaḥ phala daḥ ca iti evam tattvena mām na abhijānanti
translated: They do not know Me as the true enjoyer, lord, master, protector and giver of fruits of all sacrifices in the form of Indra etc.

original: atas te cyavanti saṃsaranti ////🔽BhG /
analyzed: atas te cyavanti saṃsaranti  bhg
translated: Therefore, they fall away and transmigrate.

original: yānti devavratā devān pitṝn yānti pitṛvratāḥ /
analyzed: yānti deva vratāḥ devān pitṝn yānti pitṛ vratāḥ
translated: They who are devoted to the gods go to the gods, and they who are devoted to the manes go to the manes.

original: bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti madyājino 'pi mām ////
analyzed: bhūtāni yānti bhūta ijyāḥ yānti mad yājinaḥ u pi mām
translated: They who are devoted to the spirits go to the spirits, and they who worship Me go even to Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ tad evopapādayati yāntīti /
analyzed: eva
translated: Sridhar explains this by saying They who are devoted to the gods go to the gods.

original: deveṣv indrādiṣu vrataṃ niyamo yeṣāṃ te antavanto devān yānti /
analyzed: deveṣu indra ādiṣu vratam niyamaḥ yeṣām te antavantaḥ devān yānti
translated: Those who have the vow, the rule, in the gods such as Indra, go to the limited gods.

original: ataḥ punar āvartante /
analyzed: atas punar āvartante
translated: Therefore, they return again.

original: pitṝṣu vrataṃ yeṣāṃ śrāddhādikriyāparāṇāṃ te pitṝn yānti /
analyzed: pitṝṣu vratam yeṣām śrāddha ādi kriyā parāṇām te pitṝn yānti
translated: Those who are devoted to the manes, who are engaged in the rites of Śrāddha etc., go to the manes.

original: bhūteṣu vinārakamātṛpaṇādiṣu ijyā pūjā yeṣāṃ te bhūtejyā bhūtāni yānti /🔽māṃ yaṣṭuṃ śīlaṃ yeṣāṃ te madyājinaḥ /
analyzed: bhūteṣu vināraka mātṛ paṇa ādiṣu ijyā pūjā yeṣām te bhūta ijyāḥ bhūtāni yānti  mām yaṣṭum śīlam yeṣām te mad yājinaḥ
translated: Those who worship the Bhūtas, Vināyakas, Mātṛs, Paṇas etc., go to the Bhūtas.

original: te mām evākṣayaṃ paramānandasvarūpaṃ yānti ////
analyzed: te mām eva akṣayam parama ānanda sva rūpam yānti
translated: Those who are in the habit of worshipping Me, go to Me alone, who am imperishable and of the nature of supreme bliss.

original: madhusūdanaḥ devatāntarayājinām anāvṛttiphalābhāve 'pi tattaddevatāyām ānurūpakṣudraphalāvāptir dhruveti vadan bhagavadyājināṃ tebhyo
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ devatā antara yājinām anāvṛtti phala abhāve tad tad devatāyām ānurūpa kṣudra phala avāptiḥ dhruvā iti vadan bhagavat yājinām tebhyaḥ
translated: Even though there is no attainment of the fruit of non-return for those who worship other deities, the attainment of the corresponding small fruits in those respective deities is certain. Thus, pointing out the difference between them and those who worship the Lord, the Blessed One says:

original: vailakṣaṇyam āha yāntīti /
analyzed: vailakṣaṇyam āha yānti iti
translated: Those who go to the deities etc.

original: avidhipūrvakayājino hi trividhā antaḥkaraṇopādhiguṇatrayabhedāt /
analyzed: avidhi pūrvaka yājinaḥ hi trividhāḥ antaḥkaraṇa upādhi guṇatraya bhedāt
translated: For those who worship without injunctions are of three kinds, due to the difference in the three qualities of the internal organ.

original: tatra sāttvikā devavratāḥ /🔽devā vasurudrādityādayas tatsambandhivrataṃ balyupahārapradakṣiṇaprahvībhāvādirūpaṃ pūjanaṃ yeṣāṃ te tān eva devān yānti taṃ yathā
analyzed: tatra sāttvikāḥ deva vratāḥ  devāḥ vasu rudra āditya ādayaḥ tad sambandhi vratam bali upahāra pradakṣiṇa prahvī bhāva ādi rūpam pūjanam yeṣām te tān eva devān yānti tam yathā
translated: Among them, the Sāttvika ones are the devotees of the deities.

original: yathopāsate tad eva bhavati iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: yathā upāsate tat eva bhavati iti śruteḥ
translated: Those who worship the deities such as Vasus, Rudras, Ādityas etc. in the form of offerings, oblations, circumambulation, humility etc., go to those very deities. As it is said in the Vedas: Whatever one worships, that one becomes.

original: rājasās tu pitṛvratāḥ śrāddhādikriyābhir agniṣv āttādīnāṃ pitṝṇām ārādhakās tān eva pitṝn yānti /
analyzed: rājasāḥ tu pitṛ vratāḥ śrāddha ādi kriyābhiḥ agniṣu ātta ādīnām pitṝṇām ārādhakāḥ tān eva pitṝn yānti
translated: But those who are of the quality of passion, who are devoted to the manes, who worship the manes such as Agniṣvāttā etc. by Śrāddha and other rites, go to those very manes.

original: tathā tāmasā bhūtejyā yakṣarakṣovināyakamātṛgaṇādīnāṃ bhūtānāṃ pūjakās tāny eva bhūtāni yānti /
analyzed: tathā tāmasāḥ bhūta ijyāḥ yakṣa rakṣaḥ vināyaka mātṛ gaṇa ādīnām bhūtānām pūjakāḥ tāni eva bhūtāni yānti
translated: Similarly, those who are of the quality of darkness, who worship the Bhūtas such as Yakṣas, Rākṣasas, Vināyakas, Mātṛgaṇas etc., go to those very Bhūtas.

original: atra devapitṛbhūtaśabdānāṃ tatsambandhilakṣaṇayoṣṭramukhanyāyena samāsaḥ
analyzed: atra deva pitṛ bhūta śabdānām tad sambandhi lakṣaṇayā uṣṭra mukha nyāyena samāsaḥ
translated: Here, the compounds of the words deva, pitṛ, and bhūta are by the rule of the camel-faced one, by the definition of their connection.

original: madhyamapadalopisamāsānaṅgīkārān prakṛtivikṛtibhāvābhāvena ca tādarthyacaturthīsamāsāyogāt /
translated: Because the compound with the middle term dropped is not accepted, and because of the absence of the relation of original and modification, the compound with the fourth case in the sense of purpose is not possible.

original: ante ca pūjāvācījyāśabdaprayogāt pūrvaparyāyadvaye 'pi vrataśabdaḥ pūjāpara eva /
analyzed: ante ca pūjā avāci ijyā śabda prayogāt pūrva paryāya dvaye pi vrata śabdaḥ pūjā paraḥ eva
translated: And because the word jya, which denotes worship, is used at the end, the word vratam in the first two sections also means worship only.

original: evaṃ devatāntarārādhanasya tattaddevatārūpatvam antavat phalam uktvā bhagavadārādhanasya
analyzed: evam devatā antara ārādhanasya tad tad devatā rūpa tvam antavat phalam uktvā bhagavat ārādhanasya
translated: Thus, having stated that the worship of other deities has a limited result in the form of becoming that deity, he says that the worship of the Lord

original: bhagavadrūpatvam anantaṃ phalam āha māṃ bhagavantaṃ yaṣṭuṃ pūjayituṃ śīlaṃ yeṣāṃ
analyzed: bhagavat rūpa tvam anantam phalam āha mām bhagavantam yaṣṭum pūjayitum śīlam yeṣām
translated: has an unlimited result in the form of becoming the Lord: Those who have the habit of worshipping me, the Lord,

original: te madyājinaḥ sarvāsu devatāsu bhagavadbhāvadarśino bhagavadārādhanaparāyaṇā
analyzed: te mad yājinaḥ sarvāsu devatāsu bhagavat bhāva darśinaḥ bhagavat ārādhana parāyaṇā
translated: are the worshippers of me. They who see the Lord in all the deities, who are devoted to the worship of the Lord,

original: māṃ bhagavantam eva yānti /
analyzed: mām bhagavantam eva yānti
translated: They go to Me, the Supreme Lord alone.

original: samāne 'py āyāse bhagavantam anataryāmiṇam anantaphaladam anārādhya devatāntaram ārādhyāntavatphalaṃ yāntīty aho durdaivavaibhavam ajñānām
analyzed: samāne pi āyāse bhagavantam anataryāmiṇam ananta phala dam an ārādhya devatā antaram ārādhya antavat phalam yānti iti aho durdaiva vaibhavam ajñānām
translated: Even though the effort is the same, the ignorant ones, without worshipping Me, the Supreme Lord who is not an obstructionist and who bestows infinite fruits, worship other deities and attain limited fruits. Oh, the greatness of the misfortune of the ignorant!

original: ity abhiprāyaḥ ////🔽viśvanāthaḥ nanu ca tattaddevatāpūjāpaddhatau yo yo vidhir uktas tenaiva vidhinā sā sā devatā pūjyata eva /
analyzed: iti abhiprāyaḥ

original: tarhi tāṃ tāṃ devatāṃ tadbhaktāḥ prāpnuvanty eva ity ayaṃ nyāya eva ity āha yāntīti /
analyzed: tarhi tām tām devatām tad bhaktāḥ prāpnuvanti eva iti ayam nyāyaḥ eva iti āha yānti iti
translated: Viṣṇu is the Supreme Lord, the Supreme Person, the Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Goal.🔽Viṣṇu is the Supreme Lord, the Supreme Person, the Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Goal.🔽Viṣṇu is the Supreme Lord, the Supreme Person, the Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Goal.

original: tena tattaddevatānām api naśvaratvāt tattaddevatābhaktāḥ katham anaśvaro bhavantu /
analyzed: tena tad tad devatānām api naśvara tvāt tad tad devatā bhaktāḥ katham anaśvaraḥ bhavantu
translated: Viṣṇu is the Supreme Lord, the Supreme Person, the Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Goal.🔽Viṣṇu is the Supreme Lord, the Supreme Person, the Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Abode, the Supreme Goal.

original: ahaṃ tv anaśvaro nityo madbhaktā apy anaśvarāḥ iti te nityā eveti dyotitam /
analyzed: aham tu anaśvaraḥ nityaḥ mad bhaktāḥ api anaśvarāḥ iti te nityāḥ eva iti dyotitam
translated: Viṣṇu is the Supreme Lord, the Supreme

original: bhavān ekaḥ śiṣyate śeṣasaṃjñaḥ BhP / / iti /
analyzed: bhavān ekaḥ śiṣyate śeṣa saṃjñaḥ bhp  iti
translated: You alone remain, known as the Remainder.

original: eko nārāyaṇa evāsīn na brahmā na ca śaṅkaraḥ iti /
analyzed: ekaḥ nārāyaṇaḥ eva āsīt na brahmā na ca śaṅkaraḥ iti
translated: There was only one Nārāyaṇa, not Brahmā, nor Śaṅkara.

original: parārdhānte so 'budhyata goparūpo me purastād āvirbabhūva GTU / iti /
analyzed: parārdha ante saḥ budhyata gopa rūpaḥ me purastāt āvirbabhūva iti
translated: At the end of the Parārdha, he awoke. He appeared before me in the form of a cowherd.

original: na cyavante ca madbhaktā mahati pralaye 'pi SkandaP Kāśīkhaṇḍe ity ādi śrutismṛtibhyaḥ ////
analyzed: na cyavante ca mad bhaktāḥ mahati pralaye kāśīkhaṇḍe iti ādi śruti smṛtibhyaḥ
translated: And my devotees do not perish even at the great dissolution, O Skanda. Thus it is from the Śrutis and Smṛtis.

original: baladevaḥ vastuto mama tat tad devatādirūpatayā sthitatve 'pi tadrūpatayā majjñānābhāvād eva temāṃ nāpnuvantīty āha yāntīti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ vastutas mama tat tat devatā ādi rūpatayā sthita tve pi tad rūpatayā mad jñāna abhāvāt eva tā imām na āpnuvanti iti āha yānti iti
translated: Balarāma says: Although I actually exist in the form of those deities and others, they do not attain Me because of the absence of knowledge of Me in those forms. He says this in the verse beginning with yāntī (they go).

original: atrādyapaaryāye vrataśabdaḥ pūjābhidhāyī paratrejyāśabdāt /
analyzed: atra ādi apaaryāye vrata śabdaḥ pūjā abhidhāyī paratra ijyā śabdāt
translated: Here, in the first part, the word vratas (vows) denotes worship, because of the word yajñas (sacrifices) in the next part.

original: devavratā devapūjakāḥ sāttvikadarśapaurṇamāsyādikarmabhir indrādīn yajantas tān eva yānti /
analyzed: deva vratāḥ deva pūjakāḥ sāttvika darśa paurṇamāsī ādi karmabhiḥ indra ādīn yajantaḥ tān eva yānti
translated: Those who are devoted to gods, who worship gods by performing the Sāttvika rites of Darśa and Paurṇamāsa etc., go to those very gods.

original: pitṛvratā rājasāḥ śrāddhādikarmabhiḥ pitṝn yajantas tān eva yānti /
analyzed: pitṛ vratāḥ rājasāḥ śrāddha ādi karmabhiḥ pitṝn yajantaḥ tān eva yānti
translated: Those who are devoted to ancestors, who are of Rājasa nature and worship ancestors by performing Śrāddha etc., go to those very ancestors.

original: bhūtejyās tāmasās tattadbalibhir yakṣarakṣovināyakān pūjayantas tāny eva bhūtāni yānti /
analyzed: bhūta ijyāḥ tāmasāḥ tad tad balibhiḥ yakṣa rakṣaḥ vināyakān pūjayantaḥ tāni eva bhūtāni yānti
translated: Those who worship ghosts, who are of Tāmasa nature and worship Yakṣas, Rākṣasas and Vināyakas by offering them oblations, go to those very ghosts.

original: madyājinas tu nirguṇāḥ sulabhair dravyair mām arcayanto mām eva yānti /
analyzed: mad yājinaḥ tu nirguṇāḥ sulabhaiḥ dravyaiḥ mām arcayantaḥ mām eva yānti
translated: But those who are devoted to other gods, who are devoid of good qualities, who worship Me with easily available substances, they go to Me alone.

original: apir avadhāraṇe /
analyzed: apiḥ avadhāraṇe
translated: The word api (but) is for emphasis.

original: ayam arthaḥ indrādīnāṃ vayam upāsakās ta evāsmākam īśvarāḥ pūjābhiḥ prasīdantaḥ phalāny abhīṣātāni dadyur iti madanyadevasevakānāṃ bhāvanā
analyzed: ayam arthaḥ indra ādīnām vayam upāsakāḥ te eva asmākam īśvarāḥ pūjābhiḥ prasīdantaḥ phalāni abhīṣātāni dadyuḥ iti mad anya deva sevakānām bhāvanā
translated: The meaning is: We are worshippers of Indra and others, they alone are our lords. Being pleased by our worship, they will grant us the desired fruits. This is the thought of those who serve gods other than Me.

original: sarvaśaktiḥ sarveśvaro vāsudevas taddevatādirūpeṇāvasthito
analyzed: sarva śaktiḥ sarva īśvaraḥ vāsudevaḥ tad devatā ādi rūpeṇa avasthitaḥ
translated: Vasudeva, who is all-powerful and the lord of all, who is established in the form of their deity and so on,

original: 'smatsvāmī sulabhopacāraiḥ karmabhir ārādhitaḥ sarvāṇy asmadabhīṣṭāni dadyād iti matsevakānāṃ bhāvanā /
analyzed: smad svāmī sulabha upacāraiḥ karmabhiḥ ārādhitaḥ sarvāṇi asmad abhīṣṭāni dadyāt iti mad sevakānām bhāvanā
translated: is our lord. Being worshipped with rites whose means are easily available, he will grant us all our desired things. This is the thought of those who serve Me.

original: tataś ca samānāny eva karmāṇy anutiṣṭhanto 'pi devādisevino madbhāvanāvaimukhyāt
analyzed: tatas ca samānāni eva karmāṇi anutiṣṭhantaḥ deva ādi sevinaḥ mad bhāvanā vaimukhyāt
translated: And therefore, even while performing the same rites, those who serve gods and others, due to their aversion to the thought of Me,

original: tān nijeṣṭān evācirāyuṣo 'lpavibhūtīn āsādya taiḥ saha parimitān bhogān bhuktvā
analyzed: tān nija iṣṭān eva acira āyuṣaḥ lpa vibhūtīn āsādya taiḥ saha parimitān bhogān bhuktvā
translated: attain only those desired [gods] who have short lifespans and little power, and along with them enjoy only limited pleasures.

original: tadvināśe vinaśyanti /
analyzed: tad vināśe vinaśyanti
translated: And when they perish, they perish.

original: matsevinas tu mām anādinidhanaṃ satyasaṅkalpam anantavibhūtiṃ vijñānānandamayaṃ bhaktavatsalaṃ sarveśvaraṃ prāpya mattaḥ punar na nivartante
analyzed: mad sevinaḥ tu mām an ādi nidhanam satya saṅkalpam ananta vibhūtim vijñāna ānanda mayam bhakta vatsalam sarveśvaram prāpya mattaḥ punar na nivartante
translated: But those who serve Me, having attained Me who am without beginning or end, whose resolve is true, whose glory is infinite, who am full of knowledge and bliss, who am affectionate towards My devotees, who am the Lord of all, do not return from Me again.

original: mayā sākam anantāni sukhāni anubhavante maddhāmni divye vilasantīti ////
analyzed: mayā sākam anantāni sukhāni anubhavante mad dhāmni divye vilasanti iti
translated: They experience infinite bliss along with Me, they shine in My divine abode.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: patraṃ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ toyaṃ yo me bhaktyā prayacchati /
analyzed: patram puṣpam phalam toyam yaḥ me bhaktyā prayacchati
translated: He who offers Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit, or water,

original: tad ahaṃ bhaktyupahṛtam aśnāmi prayatātmanaḥ ////
analyzed: tat aham bhakti upahṛtam aśnāmi prayata ātmanaḥ
translated: I accept that, offered with devotion, from the one whose soul is purified.

original: śrīdharaḥ tad evaṃ svabhaktānām akṣayaphalam uktam /
translated: Shridhar: Thus, the imperishable fruit for one's devotees has been stated.

original: anāyāsatvaṃ ca svabhakter darśayati patram iti /🔽patrapuṣpādimātram api mahyaṃ bhaktyā prītyā yaḥ prayacchati tasy aprayatātmanaḥ
analyzed: anāyāsa tvam ca sva bhakteḥ darśayati patram iti  patra puṣpa ādi mātram api mahyam bhaktyā prītyā yaḥ prayacchati tasya aprayata ātmanaḥ
translated: And the absence of exertion in serving the Lord is shown by the word 'patra' (leaf) etc.🔽He who offers to Me with devotion, love, even just a leaf, a flower, etc., to the one whose soul is not purified,

original: śuddhacittasya niṣkāmabhaktasya tatpatrapuṣpādikaṃ bhaktyā tena upahṛtaṃ samarpitam aham aśnāmi /
analyzed: śuddha cittasya niṣkāma bhaktasya tat patra puṣpa ādikam bhaktyā tena upahṛtam samarpitam aham aśnāmi
translated: to the one whose mind is pure, to the one who is a devotee without desire, I accept that leaf, flower, etc., offered with devotion by him.

original: na hi mahāvibhūtipateḥ parameśvarasya mama kṣudradevatānām iva bahuvittasādhyayogādibhiḥ paritoṣaḥ syāt /
analyzed: na hi mahāvibhūti pateḥ parameśvarasya mama kṣudra devatānām iva bahu vitta sādhya yoga ādibhiḥ paritoṣaḥ syāt
translated: For, I, the Supreme Lord, the possessor of great majesty, will not be satisfied by the performance of Yoga, etc., which are to be accomplished with much wealth, like the petty deities.

original: kintu bhaktimātreṇa /
analyzed: kintu bhakti mātreṇa
translated: But by devotion alone.

original: ato bhaktena samarpitaṃ yat kiñcit patrādimātram api tadanugrahārtham evāśnāmīti bhāvaḥ ////🔽madhusūdanaḥ tad evaṃ devatāntarāṇi parityajyānantaphalatvād bhagavata evārādhanaṃ kartavyam atisukaratvāc cety āha patram iti /
analyzed: atas bhaktena samarpitam yat kiñcid patra ādi mātram api tad anugraha artham eva aśnāmi iti bhāvaḥ  madhusūdanaḥ tat evam devatā antarāṇi parityajya ananta phalatvāt bhagavataḥ eva ārādhanam kartavyam ati sukara tvāt ca iti āha patram iti
translated: Therefore, whatever, even just a leaf, etc., is offered by a devotee, I eat it only for His favor. This is the idea.

original: patraṃ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ toyam anyad vānāyāsalabhyaṃ yat kiṃcid vastu yaḥ kaścid api
analyzed: patram puṣpam phalam toyam anyat vā anāyāsa labhyam yat kiṃcid vastu yaḥ kaścid api
translated: Madhusudana: Having thus abandoned other deities, one should worship only the Lord, because of His infinite fruit and because of His extreme easiness, says (the Lord) with A leaf, a flower, a fruit, water, or whatever else is easily obtained without effort, whatever thing, by whatever person,

original: naro me mahyam anantamahāvibhūtipataye parameśvarāya bhaktyā na vāsudevāt param
analyzed: naraḥ me mahyam ananta mahā vibhūti pataye parameśvarāya bhaktyā na vāsudevāt param
translated: to Me, the Supreme Lord, the possessor of infinite great majesty, with devotion, not with the idea that there is nothing superior to Vasudeva,

original: asti kiṃcit iti buddhipūrvikayā prītyā pracchatīśvarāya bhṛtyavad upakalpayati matsvatvānā
analyzed: asti kiṃcid iti buddhi pūrvikayā prītyā pracchati īśvarāya bhṛtya vat upakalpayati
translated: but with the love that precedes the idea, There is nothing superior to Vasudeva, he offers to the Lord, like a servant, whatever is his own,

original: āspadadravyābhāvāt sarvasyāpi jagato mayaivārjitatvāt /
analyzed: āspada dravya abhāvāt sarvasya api jagataḥ mayā eva arjita tvāt
translated: because there is no substance that is not acquired by Me, since everything in the world is acquired by Me alone.

original: ato madīyam eva sarvaṃ mahyam arpayati janaḥ /
analyzed: atas madīyam eva sarvam mahyam arpayati janaḥ
translated: Therefore, the people offer to Me all that is theirs.

original: tasya prītyā prayacchataḥ prayatātmanaḥ śuddhabuddhes tatpatrapuṣpādituccham api vastu ahaṃ sarveśvaro 'śnāmi aśanavat prītyā svīkṛtya
analyzed: tasya prītyā prayacchataḥ prayata ātmanaḥ śuddha buddheḥ tad patra puṣpa ādi tuccham api vastu aham śnāmi aśana vat prītyā svīkṛtya
translated: I, the Lord of all, with a pure and enlightened mind, with a controlled self, out of love, give that thing, however insignificant it may be, like a leaf, a flower, etc., accepting it with love, as if it were food.

original: atra vācasyātyantatiraskārād aśanalakṣitena svīkāraviśeṣeṇa prītyatiśayahetutvaṃ vyajyate /🔽na ha vai devā aśnanti na pibanty etad evāmṛtaṃ
analyzed: atra vācasya atyanta tiraskārāt aśana lakṣitena svīkāra viśeṣeṇa prīti atiśaya hetutvam vyajyate  na ha vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti etat eva amṛtam
translated: Here, due to the complete disregard for words, the excess of love is expressed by a special acceptance indicated by eating.

original: dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti iti śruteḥ
translated: For it is said in the scriptures: The gods do not eat or drink. They are satisfied merely by seeing this nectar.

original: kasmāt tuccham api tad aśnāsi /
analyzed: kasmāt tuccham api tat aśnāsi
translated: But why do you eat even that insignificant thing?

original: yasmād bhaktyupahṛtaṃ bhaktyā prītyā samarpitaṃ tena prītyā samarpaṇaṃ matsvīkāranimittam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt bhakti upahṛtam bhaktyā prītyā samarpitam tena prītyā samarpaṇam mad svīkāra nimittam iti arthaḥ
translated: Because it is offered with devotion, presented with love. The meaning is that the offering with love is the cause of My acceptance.

original: atra bhaktyā prayacchatīty uktvā punar bhaktyupahṛtam iti vadann abhaktasya brāhmaṇatvatapasvitvādi matsvīkāranimittaṃ na bhavatīti parisaṅkhyāṃ
analyzed: atra bhaktyā prayacchati iti uktvā punar bhakti upahṛtam iti vadan abhaktasya brāhmaṇa tva tapasvi tva ādi mad svīkāra nimittam na bhavati iti parisaṅkhyām
translated: Here, after saying one gives with devotion, by saying offered with devotion again, he indicates a restriction that being a Brahmin, being an ascetic, etc. without devotion is not the cause of My acceptance.

original: sūcayati /
analyzed: sūcayati
translated: He indicates this.

original: śrīdāmabrāhmaṇānītataṇḍulakaṇabhakṣaṇavat prītiviśeṣapratibaddhabhakṣyābhakṣyavijñāno bāla iva mātrādyarpitaṃ patrapuṣpādi bhaktārpitaṃ
analyzed: śrīdāma brāhmaṇa ānīta taṇḍula kaṇa bhakṣaṇa vat prīti viśeṣa pratibaddha bhakṣya abhakṣya vijñānaḥ bālaḥ iva mātra ādi arpitam patra puṣpa ādi bhakta arpitam
translated: As a child, who has the knowledge of what is to be eaten and what is not to be eaten bound up with a particular liking, eats the rice grains brought by the brāhmaṇa Śrīdāmā, in the same way, I eat the leaves, flowers, etc. offered by the devotees,

original: sākṣād eva bhakṣayāmīti vā /🔽tena bhaktir eva matparitoṣanimittaṃ na tu devatāntaravad balyupahārādi bahuvittavyayāyāsasādhyaṃ kiṃcid iti devatāntaram apahāya mām
analyzed: sākṣāt eva bhakṣayāmi iti vā  tena bhaktiḥ eva mad paritoṣa nimittam na tu devatā antara vat bali upahāra ādi bahu vitta vyaya āyāsa sādhyam kiṃcid iti devatā antaram apahāya mām
translated: thinking, I eat them directly.

original: eva bhajetety abhiprāyaḥ ////
analyzed: eva bhajeta iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The idea is that devotion alone is the cause of My satisfaction, but not like other deities, which are attained by means of many expenses and efforts such as offerings, oblations, etc. Therefore, abandoning other deities, they should worship only Me.🔽Viṣṇudatta

original: viśvanāthaḥ varaṃ devāntarabhaktāvāyāsādhikyaṃ na tu madbhaktāv ity āha patram iti /
translated: Viśvanātha says: It is better to have more effort in devotion to other deities than in devotion to Me. He says so in the verse beginning with patra.

original: atra bhaktyeti karaṇam /
analyzed: atra bhaktyā iti karaṇam
translated: Here, bhaktyā is the instrument.

original: tṛtīyāyāṃ bhaktyupahṛtam iti paunaruktaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tṛtīyāyām bhakti upahṛtam iti paunaruktam syāt
translated: If it were the third case, offered with devotion, there would be a repetition.

original: ataḥ sahārthe tṛtīyā /
analyzed: a taḥ saha arthe tṛtīyā
translated: Therefore, the third case is in the sense of together.

original: bhaktyā sahito madbhaktā ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: bhaktyā sahitaḥ mad bhaktāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: those who are devoted to Me along with devotion.

original: tena madbhaktabhinno janas tātkālikyā bhaktyā yat prayacchati tat tenopahṛtam api patrapuṣpādikaṃ naivāśnāmīti dyotitam /
analyzed: tena mad bhakta bhinnaḥ janaḥ tātkālikyā bhaktyā yat prayacchati tat tena upahṛtam api patra puṣpa ādikam na eva aśnāmi iti dyotitam
translated: By this, it is indicated that I do not eat even the leaves, flowers, etc. offered by a person other than My devotee, even if they are offered with devotion lasting only for that moment.

original: tataś ca madbhakta eva patrādikaṃ yad dadāti tat tasyāham aśnāmi yathocitam upayuñje /
analyzed: tatas ca mad bhaktaḥ eva patra ādikam yat dadāti tat tasya aham aśnāmi yathocitam upayuñje
translated: And then, I, the Supreme Lord, eat that leaf etc. which is offered by My devotee, as is proper.

original: kīdṛśam / bhaktyopahṛtam /
analyzed: kīdṛśam bhaktyā upahṛtam
translated: What kind of leaf etc.? That which is offered with devotion.

original: na tu kasyacid anurodhādinā dattam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: na tu kasyacid anurodha ādinā dattam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: not that which is offered out of favoritism for someone.

original: kiṃ ca madbhaktasyāpy apavitraśarīratve sati nāśnāmīty āha prayatātmanaḥ śuddhaśarīrasyeti rajaḥsvalādayo vyāvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: kim ca mad bhaktasya api apavitra śarīra tve sati na aśnāmi iti āha prayata ātmanaḥ śuddha śarīrasya iti rajaḥsvalā ādayaḥ vyāvṛttāḥ
translated: Moreover, if My devotee also has an impure body, I do not eat it. Thus it is said: of one whose self is purified, i.e., whose body is pure. The menstrual discharge etc. are excluded.

original: yad vā prayatātmanaḥ śuddhāntaḥkaraṇasya madbhaktaṃ vinā nānyaḥ śuddhāntaḥkaraṇa iti /🔽dhautātmā puruṣaḥ kṛṣṇapādamūlaṃ
analyzed: yat vā prayata ātmanaḥ śuddha antaḥkaraṇasya mad bhaktam vinā na anyaḥ śuddha antaḥkaraṇaḥ iti  dhauta ātmā puruṣaḥ kṛṣṇa pāda mūlam
translated: Or, of one whose self is purified, i.e., whose inner being is pure. No one else except My devotee has a pure inner being.🔽As it is said by Parikshit: A man whose self is cleansed never leaves the foot of Krishna's feet.

original: na muñcati BhP / / iti parīkṣidukter matpādasevātyāgāsāmārthyam eva śuddhacittatvacihnam /
analyzed: na muñcati bhp iti parīkṣit ukteḥ mad pāda sevā tyāga asāmārthyam eva śuddha citta tva cihnam
translated: Thus, the inability to give up service to My feet is the sign of a pure mind.

original: ataḥ kvacit kāmakrodhādisattve 'pi utkhātadaṃṣṭroragadaṃśavat tasyākiṃcitkaratvaṃ jñeyam ////
analyzed: atas kvacid kāma krodha ādi sattve pi utkhāta daṃṣṭra uraga daṃśa vat tasya akiṃcitkara tvam jñeyam
translated: Therefore, even if lust, anger etc. exist somewhere, their ineffectiveness should be known like the bite of a snake whose fangs have been extracted.

original: baladevaḥ evam akṣayānantaphalatvān madbhaktiḥ kāryety uktvā sukhasādhyatvāc ca sā kāryety āha patram iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam akṣaya ananta phalatvāt mad bhaktiḥ kāryā iti uktvā sukha sādhya tvāt ca sā kāryā iti āha patram iti
translated: Balarama: Having said that devotion to Me should be performed because it has inexhaustible and endless fruits, He now says that it should be performed because it is easily accomplished, with the words a leaf etc.

original: patraṃ vā puṣpaṃ vānyad vā /
analyzed: patram vā puṣpam vā anyat vā
translated: Or a leaf, or a flower, or something else.

original: yat sulabhaṃ vastu yo bhaktyā prītibhareṇa me sarveśvarāya prayacchati /
analyzed: yat sulabham vastu yaḥ bhaktyā prīti bhareṇa me sarveśvarāya prayacchati
translated: Whatever easily available thing one offers to Me, the Lord of all, with devotion, with an abundance of love.

original: tasya bhaktyupahṛtaṃ prītyarpitaṃ tattadanantavibhūtiḥ pūrṇakāmo 'py aham aśnāmi yathocitam upabhuñje /
analyzed: tasya bhakti upahṛtam prīti arpitam tat tat ananta vibhūtiḥ aham aśnāmi yathocitam upabhuñje
translated: I, whose glory is infinite, whose desires are fulfilled, still eat that which is offered with devotion, offered with love, as befits Me.

original: tatprītyuditakṣuttṛṣṇaḥ san tadbhaktyāveśāt tat sarvam admīti vā /
analyzed: tad prīti udita kṣudh tṛṣṇaḥ san tad bhakti āveśāt tat sarvam admi iti vā
translated: As if having hunger and thirst arisen from that love, I eat it all out of that devotion.

original: tasya kīdṛśasyety āha prayatātmano viśuddhamanaso niṣkāmasyety arthaḥ /
analyzed: tasya kīdṛśasya iti āha prayata ātmanaḥ viśuddha manasaḥ niṣkāmasya iti arthaḥ
translated: Of what kind is he? He says: of one whose self is purified, whose mind is pure, who is desireless, this is the meaning.

original: tathīa ca niṣkāmeṇa madanuraktenārpitaṃ tad aśnāmi /
analyzed: ca niṣkāmeṇa mad anuraktena arpitam tat aśnāmi
translated: And thus, I eat that which is offered by one who is desireless, who is devoted to Me.

original: tadviparītenārpitaṃ tu nāśnāmīty uktam /
analyzed: tad viparītena arpitam tu na aśnāmi iti uktam
translated: But it is said that I do not eat that which is offered by one who is the opposite of that.

original: bhaktyā ity uktvāpi punar bhaktyupahṛtam ity uktir bhaktir eva mattoṣikā /
analyzed: bhaktyā iti uktvā api punar bhakti upahṛtam iti uktiḥ bhaktiḥ eva mad toṣikā
translated: Even after saying with devotion, the statement offered with devotion again indicates that devotion alone pleases Me.

original: na tu divjatvatapasvitvād iti sūcayati /
analyzed: na tu divja tva tapasvi tvāt iti sūcayati
translated: But not being a Brahmin or being an ascetic.

original: iha satatam ananyaḥ patram ity ādibhis tribhir uktā kīrtanādirūpaviśuddhabhaktir arpitaiva kriyeta / na
analyzed: iha satatam ananyaḥ patram iti ādibhiḥ tribhiḥ uktā kīrtana ādi rūpa viśuddha bhaktiḥ arpitā eva kriyeta na
translated: Here, the pure devotion in the form of glorification and so on, which is mentioned by the three verses beginning with a leaf, should be offered continuously without anything else.

original: tu kṛtvārpiteti /
analyzed: tu kṛtvā arpitā iti
translated: But not after doing it, it should be offered.

original: iti puṃsārpitā viṣṇau bhaktiś cen navalakṣaṇā /
analyzed: iti puṃsā arpitā viṣṇau bhaktiḥ ced nava lakṣaṇā
translated: If devotion to Lord Visnu, endowed with these nine qualities, is offered by a person,

original: kriyeta bhagavaty addhā tan manye 'dhītam uttamam BhP / /
analyzed: kriyeta bhagavati addhā tat manye dhītam uttamam bhp
translated: then I consider that to be the best study.

original: iti prahlādavākyāt /
analyzed: iti prahlāda vākyāt
translated: Thus, from the words of Prahlada.

original: atas tathātra nokteḥ ////
analyzed: atas tathā atra na ukteḥ
translated: Therefore, it is not mentioned here in the same way.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita.

original: yat karoṣi yad aśnāsi yaj juhoṣi dadāsi yat /
analyzed: yat karoṣi yat aśnāsi yat juhoṣi dadāsi yat
translated: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer as oblation, whatever you give,

original: yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva madarpaṇam ////
analyzed: yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva mad arpaṇam
translated: whatever austerity you perform, O son of Kunti, do that as an offering to Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ na ca patrapuṣpādikam api yajñārthapaśusomādidravyavan madartham evodyamair āpādya samarpaṇīyam /
analyzed: eva
translated: Sri Sridhara: And one should not collect flowers, leaves, etc. with efforts for the sake of worship, like animals, soma plants, etc. for the sake of sacrifice.

original: kiṃ tarhi / yat karoṣīti svabhāvataḥ śāstrato vā yat kiñcit karma karoṣi /
analyzed: kim tarhi yat karoṣi iti svabhāvataḥ śāstrataḥ vā yat kiñcid karma karoṣi
translated: What then? Whatever action you do naturally or by injunction,

original: tathā yad aśnāsi /🔽yaj juhoṣi /
analyzed: tathā yat aśnāsi  yat juhoṣi
translated: whatever you eat,🔽whatever you offer as oblation,

original: yad dadāsi /
analyzed: yat dadāsi
translated: whatever you give,

original: yat tapasyasi tapaḥ karoṣi /
analyzed: yat tapasyasi tapaḥ karoṣi
translated: whatever austerity you perform,

original: tat sarvaṃ mayy arpitaṃ yathā bhavaty evaṃ kuruṣva ////
analyzed: tat sarvam mayi arpitam yathā bhavati evam kuruṣva
translated: do all that as an offering to Me.

original: madhusūdanaḥ kīdṛśaṃ te bhajanaṃ tad āha yat karoṣīti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ kīdṛśam te bhajanam tat āha yat karoṣi iti
translated: Madhusudana: What kind of worship is that? He says: Whatever you do...

original: yat karoṣi śāstrād ṛte 'pi rāgāt prāptaṃ gamanādi yad aśnāsi svayaṃ tṛptyarthaṃ karmasiddhyarthaṃ vā /
analyzed: yat karoṣi śāstrāt ṛte rāgāt prāptam gamana ādi yat aśnāsi svayam tṛpti artham karma siddhi artham vā
translated: Whatever you do, even though not in accordance with the scriptures, out of attachment, such as going, etc., which you obtain, or which you eat for the sake of satisfaction or for the sake of accomplishing your duties,

original: tathā yaj juhoṣi śāstrabalān nityam agnihotrādihomaṃ nirvartayasi /
analyzed: tathā yat juhoṣi śāstra balāt nityam agnihotra ādi homam nirvartayasi
translated: and similarly, whatever you offer oblations, you perform the daily Agnihotra oblations and other oblations by the power of the scriptures,

original: śrautasmārtasarvahomopalakṣaṇam etat /
analyzed: śrauta smārta sarva homa upalakṣaṇam etat
translated: this is an illustration of all the oblations mentioned in the Vedas and Smritis.

original: tathā yad dadāsi atithibrāhmaṇādibhyo 'nnahiraṇyādi /
analyzed: tathā yat dadāsi atithi brāhmaṇa ādibhyaḥ nna hiraṇya ādi
translated: Similarly, whatever you give to guests, Brahmins, etc., such as food, gold, etc.,

original: tathā yat tapasyasi pratisaṃvatsaram ajñātaprāmādikapāpanivṛttaye cāndrāyaṇādi carasi ucchṛṅkhalapravṛttinirāsāya śarīrendriyasaṃghātaṃ
analyzed: tathā yat tapasyasi pratisaṃvatsaram ajñāta prāmādika pāpa nivṛttaye cāndrāyaṇa ādi carasi ucchṛṅkhala pravṛtti nirāsāya śarīra indriya saṃghātam
translated: and similarly, whatever austerities you perform, every year you practice Chandrayana and other penances for the sake of refraining from unknown and accidental sins, and for the sake of restraining unrestrained conduct, you restrain the aggregate of body and senses,

original: saṃyamayasīti vā /
analyzed: saṃyamayasi iti vā
translated: or you control them.

original: etac ca sarveṣāṃ nityanaimittikakarmaṇām upalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: etat ca sarveṣām nitya naimittika karmaṇām upalakṣaṇam
translated: And this is an illustration of all the obligatory and occasional duties.

original: tena yat tava prāṇisvabhāvavaśād vināpi śāstram avaśyambhāvi gamanāśanādi /
analyzed: tena yat tava prāṇi svabhāva vaśāt vinā api śāstram avaśyambhāvi gamana aśana ādi
translated: Therefore, whatever is inevitable for you by the nature of a living being, even without the scriptures, such as going, eating, etc.,

original: yac ca śāstravaśād avaśyambhāvi homadānādi he kaunteya tat sarvaṃ laukikaṃ vaidikaṃ ca karmānyenaiva nimittena kriyamāṇaṃ madarpaṇaṃ
analyzed: yat ca śāstra vaśāt avaśyambhāvi homa dāna ādi he kaunteya tat sarvam laukikam vaidikam ca karma anyena eva nimittena kriyamāṇam mad arpaṇam
translated: and whatever is inevitable by the power of the scriptures, such as oblations, giving, etc., O son of Kunti, all that worldly and Vedic action performed with another cause is dedicated to Me,

original: mayy arpitaṃ yathā syāt tathā kuruṣva /
analyzed: mayi arpitam yathā syāt tathā kuruṣva
translated: Do in such a way that it may be offered to Me.

original: ātmanepadena samarpakaniṣṭham eva samarpaṇaphalaṃ na tu mayi kiṃcid iti darśayati /
analyzed: ātmanepadena samarpaka niṣṭham eva samarpaṇa phalam na tu mayi kiṃcid iti darśayati
translated: By using the reflexive pronoun, the Lord shows that the result of offering is for the offerer himself, and not for Me.

original: avaśyambhāvināṃ karmaṇāṃ mayi paramagurau samarpaṇam eva madbhajanaṃ na tu tadarthaṃ pṛthagvyāpāraḥ kaścit kartavya ity abhiprāyaḥ ////
analyzed: avaśyambhāvinām karmaṇām mayi parama gurau samarpaṇam eva mad bhajanam na tu tad artham pṛthak vyāpāraḥ kaścid kartavyaḥ iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The idea is that the offering itself of the inevitable actions to Me, the Supreme Guru, is My worship, and not that for that purpose any separate activity is to be done.

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanu ca ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī ity ārabhya etāvatīṣu tvaduktāsu bhaktiṣu madhye khalv ahaṃ kāṃ bhaktiṃ karavai /
translated: Visvanatha: Well, among the various kinds of devotion beginning with the distressed, the seeker of knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the knower, which devotion should I practice?

original: ity apekṣāyāṃ bho arjuna sāmprataṃ tāvat tava karmajñānādīnāṃ tyaktum aśakyatvāt sarvotkṛṣṭāyāṃ kevalāyām ananyabhaktau nādhikāro nāpi nikṛṣṭāyāṃ
analyzed: iti apekṣāyām bho arjuna sāmpratam tāvat tava karma jñāna ādīnām tyaktum aśakya tvāt sarva utkṛṣṭāyām kevalāyām ananya bhaktau na adhikāraḥ na api nikṛṣṭāyām
translated: When this is the expectation, the Lord says: O Arjuna, since at present you are unable to give up action, knowledge, etc., you are not qualified for pure devotion, which is the best of all, nor for inferior devotion

original: sakāmabhaktau /
analyzed: sa kāma bhaktau
translated: which is motivated by the desire for results.

original: tasmāt tvaṃ niṣkāmāṃ karmajñānamiśrāṃ pradhānībhūtām eva bhaktiṃ kurv ity āha yat karoṣīti dvābhyām /
analyzed: tasmāt tvam niṣkāmām karma jñāna miśrām pradhānībhūtām eva bhaktim kuru iti āha yat karoṣi iti dvābhyām
translated: Therefore, you should practice devotion which is mixed with action and knowledge, and which is the most important. The Lord says this in two verses beginning with yat karoshi.

original: laukikaṃ vaidikaṃ vā yat karma tvaṃ karoṣi /
analyzed: laukikam vaidikam vā yat karma tvam karoṣi
translated: Whatever action you perform, whether it is worldly or Vedic,

original: yad aśnāsi vyavahārato bhojanapānādikaṃ yat karoṣi tat tapasyasi tapaḥ karoṣi tat sarvaṃ mayy evāpaṇaṃ yasya tad yathā syāt tathā kuru /
analyzed: yat aśnāsi vyavahārataḥ bhojana pāna ādikam yat karoṣi tat tapasyasi tapaḥ karoṣi tat sarvam mayi eva āpaṇam yasya tat yathā syāt tathā kuru
translated: Whatever you eat as part of your daily life, such as food and drink, whatever you do, you do as austerity, you perform austerity, do that as if it were all for Me.

original: na cāyaṃ niṣkāmakarmayyoga eva /
analyzed: na ca ayam niṣkāma karma yogaḥ eva
translated: And this is not only the yoga of karma without desire for fruits.

original: na tu bhaktiyoga iti vācyam /
analyzed: na tu bhakti yogaḥ iti vācyam
translated: Nor should it be said that it is the yoga of devotion.

original: niṣkāmakarmibhiḥ śāstravihitaṃ karmaiva bhagavaty arpyate /🔽na tu vyavahārikaṃ kim
analyzed: niṣkāma karmibhiḥ śāstra vihitam karma eva bhagavati arpyate  na tu vyavahārikam kim
translated: For those who perform karma without desire for fruits, only karma prescribed by the scriptures is offered to the Lord.

original: api kṛtam / tathaiva sarvatra dṛṣṭeḥ /
analyzed: api kṛtam tathā eva sarvatra dṛṣṭeḥ
translated: But nothing worldly is done at all. That is seen everywhere.

original: bhaktais tu svātmamanaḥprāṇendriyavyāpāramātram eva sveṣṭadeve bhagavaty arpyate /
analyzed: bhaktaiḥ tu sva ātma manaḥ prāṇa indriya vyāpāra mātram eva sva iṣṭadeve bhagavati arpyate
translated: But by the devotees, only the activities of the mind, life-breath and senses are offered to the Lord, their chosen deity.

original: yad uktaṃ bhaktiprakaraṇa eva
analyzed: yat uktam bhakti prakaraṇe eva
translated: As it is said in the chapter on devotion itself:

original: kāyena vācā manasendriyair vā
analyzed: kāyena vācā manasā indriyaiḥ vā
translated: Whatever one does with the body, speech, mind, senses,

original: buddhyātmanā vānusṛtasvabhāvāt /
analyzed: buddhi ātmanā vā anusṛta svabhāvāt
translated: or with the intellect and self, following one's own nature,

original: karoti yad yat sakalaṃ parasmai
