analyzed: karoti yat yat sakalam parasmai
translated: whatever one does entirely for the Supreme,

original: nārāyaṇāyeti samarpayet tam // BhP / / iti /
analyzed: nārāyaṇāya iti samarpayet tam bhp iti
translated: one should offer it to Narayana.

original: nanu ca juhoṣīti havanam idam arcanabhaktyaṅgabhūtaṃ viṣṇūddeśayakam eva /
analyzed: nanu ca juhoṣi iti havanam idam arcana bhakti aṅga bhūtam viṣṇu uddeśayakam eva
translated: But isn't this offering, mentioned in the word 'juhosi', an auxiliary to worship and devotion, and is meant only for Vishnu?

original: tapasyasīti /
analyzed: tapasyasi iti
translated: And the word 'tapasya' (austerity).

original: tapo 'py etad ekādaśyādivratarūpam eva /
analyzed: tapaḥ pi etat ekādaśī ādi vrata rūpam eva
translated: This austerity is also in the form of the Ekadashi vow and so on.

original: ata iyam ananyaiva bhaktiḥ kim iti nocyate /
analyzed: atas iyam ananyā eva bhaktiḥ kim iti nā ucyate
translated: Therefore, why is this very same devotion not mentioned?

original: satyam ananyā bhaktir hi kṛtvāpi na bhagavaty arpyate /
analyzed: satyam ananyā bhaktiḥ hi kṛtvā api na bhagavati arpyate
translated: It is true that devotion without any other purpose is indeed offered to the Lord.

original: kintu bhagavaty arpitaiva jñāyate /
analyzed: kintu bhagavati arpitā eva jñāyate
translated: But it is known to be offered to the Lord.

original: yad uktaṃ śrīprahlādena śravaṇaṃ kīrtanaṃ viṣṇoḥ smaraṇam ity atra iti puṃsārpitā🔽viṣṇau bhaktiś cen navalakṣaṇā kriyeta BhP / / ity asya vyākhyā ca śrīsvāmicaraṇānāṃ
analyzed: yat uktam śrī prahlādena śravaṇam kīrtanam viṣṇoḥ smaraṇam iti atra iti puṃsā arpitā  viṣṇau bhaktiḥ ced nava lakṣaṇā kriyeta bhp iti asya vyākhyā ca śrī svāmi caraṇānām
translated: As it is said by Sri Prahlada: Hearing, glorifying, remembering... If devotion to Vishnu is offered to the self...🔽And the explanation of this by Sri Swamicharanas:

original: bhagavati viṣṇau bhaktiḥ kriyate /
analyzed: bhagavati viṣṇau bhaktiḥ kriyate
translated: Devotion to Lord Vishnu is performed.

original: sā cārpitaivaa satī yadi kriyeta /
analyzed: sā ca arpitā eva satī yadi kriyeta
translated: And if that is offered to the Lord,

original: na tu kṛtā satī paścād arpyate ity ataḥ padyam idaṃ na kevalāyāṃ paryavased iti ////
analyzed: na tu kṛtā satī paścāt arpyate iti atas padyam idam na kevalāyām paryavaset iti
translated: but is not performed after being done, then this verse would not end only in the mere [devotion without any other purpose].

original: baladevaḥ satatam ity ādibhir nirapekṣāṇāṃ bhaktir mayā tvāṃ praty uktā /
analyzed: baladevaḥ satatam iti ādibhiḥ nirapekṣāṇām bhaktiḥ mayā tvām prati uktā
translated: Balarama says with always and so on that devotion without any other purpose is spoken by me to you.

original: tvayā tu pariniṣṭhitena kīrtanādikāṃ bhaktiṃ kurvatāpi lokasaṅgrahāya nikhilakarmārpaṇān mamāpi bhaktiḥ kāryeti bhāvenāh yad iti /
analyzed: tvayā tu pariniṣṭhitena kīrtana ādikām bhaktim kurvatā api loka saṅgrahāya nikhila karma arpaṇāt mama api bhaktiḥ kāryā iti bhāvena āh yat iti
translated: But even by you, who have attained perfection and perform devotion like glorification for the sake of gathering people, devotion to me should be performed by offering all actions. With this meaning, he says that and so on.

original: yat tvaṃ dehayātrāsādhakaṃ laukikaṃ karma karoṣi /
analyzed: yat tvam deha yātrā sādhakam laukikam karma karoṣi
translated: Whatever worldly action you perform for the sake of maintaining the body,

original: yac ca dehadhāraṇārtham annādikam aśnāsi /
analyzed: yat ca deha dhāraṇa artham anna ādikam aśnāsi
translated: and whatever food etc. you eat for the sake of sustaining the body,

original: tathā yaj juhoṣi vaidikam agnihotrādihomam anutiṣṭhasi /
analyzed: tathā yat juhoṣi vaidikam agnihotra ādi homam anutiṣṭhasi
translated: and likewise, whatever oblations you offer, performing Vedic fire sacrifices etc.,

original: yac ca satpātrebhyo 'nnahiraṇyādikaṃ dadāsi /
analyzed: yat ca sat pātrebhyaḥ nna hiraṇya ādikam dadāsi
translated: and whatever food, gold etc. you give to worthy recipients,

original: pratyabdam ajñātaduritakṣataye cāndrāyaṇādy ācarasi /
analyzed: pratyabdam ajñāta durita kṣataye cāndrāyaṇa ādi ācarasi
translated: and the lunar penance etc. you perform every year to atone for unknown sins,

original: tat sarvaṃ madarpaṇaṃ yathā syāt tathā kuruṣva /
analyzed: tat sarvam mad arpaṇam yathā syāt tathā kuruṣva
translated: do all that as an offering to Me.

original: tena mannimittasyāsya lokasya saṅkgrahāt tvayi matprasādo bhūyān bhāvīti /
analyzed: tena mad nimittasya asya lokasya saṅkgrahāt tvayi mad prasādaḥ bhūyān bhāvi iti
translated: By that, there will be greater grace on you from Me due to the acceptance of this world for My sake.

original: na ceyaṃ sarvakarmārpaṇarūypā bhaktiḥ saniṣṭhānām iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca iyam sarva karma arpaṇa rūypā bhaktiḥ saniṣṭhānām iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that this devotion of offering all actions is not for those who have attained perfection,

original: tair vaidikānām eva tatrārpyamāṇāt /
analyzed: taiḥ vaidikānām eva tatra arpyamāṇāt
translated: because only the Vedic ones are offered there by them.

original: kintu pariniṣṭhitānām eveyam /
analyzed: kintu pariniṣṭhitānām eva iyam
translated: But this is only for those who have attained perfection.

original: tair yat karoṣi ity ādi svāminirdeśena
analyzed: taiḥ yat karoṣi iti ādi svāmi nirdeśena
translated: By them, as stated by the master in Whatever you do etc.,

original: sarvakarmaṇāṃ tatrārpaṇāt /
analyzed: sarva karmaṇām tatra arpaṇāt
translated: all actions are offered there.

original: te hi svāmino lokasaṅgrahaṃ prayāsam apaninīṣavas tathā tāny ācarantas taṃ prasādayantīti ////
analyzed: te hi svāminaḥ loka saṅgraham prayāsam apaninīṣavaḥ tathā tāni ācarantaḥ tam prasādayanti iti
translated: For they, desiring to remove the effort of accepting the world, by acting in that way, please Him.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad Gita)

original: śubhāśubhaphalair evaṃ mokṣyase karmabandhanaiḥ /
analyzed: śubha aśubha phalaiḥ evam mokṣyase karma bandhanaiḥ
translated: In this way, you will be freed from the bonds of action, which are the results, good and bad, of actions.

original: saṃnyāsayogayuktātmā vimukto mām upaiṣyasi ////
analyzed: saṃnyāsa yoga yukta ātmā vimuktaḥ mām upaiṣyasi
translated: With your mind united with the yoga of renunciation, being freed, you will attain Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ evaṃ ca yat phalaṃ prāpsyasi tat śṛṇu śubhāśubheti /
analyzed: śṛṇu
translated: Śrīdhara: And listen to the result that you will attain. It is stated by good and bad...

original: evaṃ kurvan karmabandhanaiḥ karmanimittair iṣṭāniṣṭaphalairmukto bhaviṣyasi karmaṇāṃ mayi samarpitatvena tava tatphalasambandhānupapatteḥ
analyzed: evam kurvan karma bandhanaiḥ karma nimittaiḥ iṣṭa aniṣṭa phalaiḥ muktaḥ bhaviṣyasi karmaṇām mayi samarpita tvena tava tad phala sambandha anupapatteḥ
translated: By acting in this way, you will be freed from the bonds of action, which are the desirable and undesirable results of actions, because, by dedicating those actions to Me, you will not be connected with their results.

original: taiś ca vimuktaḥ san /
analyzed: taiḥ ca vimuktaḥ san
translated: And being freed from those,

original: saṃnyāsayogayuktātmā saṃnyāsaḥ karmaṇāṃ madarpaṇam /
analyzed: saṃnyāsa yoga yukta ātmā saṃnyāsaḥ karmaṇām mad arpaṇam
translated: with your mind united with the yoga of renunciation, one who has renounced actions to Me,

original: sa eva yogaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva yogaḥ
translated: that itself is yoga.

original: tena yukta ātmā cittaṃ yasya /
analyzed: tena yuktaḥ ātmā cittam yasya
translated: One whose mind is united with that,

original: tathābhūtas tvaṃ māṃ prāpsyasi ////
analyzed: tathābhūtaḥ tvam mām prāpsyasi
translated: such a one will attain Me.

original: madhusūdanaḥ etādṛśasya bhajanasya phalam āha śubhāśubheti /🔽evam anāyāsasiddhe 'pi sarvakarmasamarpaṇarūpe madbhajane sati śubhāśubhe iṣṭāniṣṭhe
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ etādṛśasya bhajanasya phalam āha śubha aśubha iti  evam anāyāsa siddhe sarva karma samarpaṇa rūpe mad bhajane sati śubha aśubhe iṣṭa aniṣṭhe
translated: Madhusūdana: The result of such worship is stated by good and bad...

original: phale yeṣāṃ taiḥ karmabandhanair bandharūpaiḥ karmabhir mokṣyase mayi samarpitaatvāt
analyzed: phale yeṣām taiḥ karma bandhanaiḥ bandha rūpaiḥ karmabhiḥ mokṣyase mayi samarpita a tvāt
translated: Even though worship of Me in the form of the dedication of all actions is accomplished without effort in this way, still, when there is worship of Me, you will be freed from the bonds of action, which are the results, good and bad, of actions, because they are dedicated to Me.

original: tava tatsambandhānupapatteḥ karmabhis tatphalaiś ca na saṃsrakṣyase /
analyzed: tava tad sambandha anupapatteḥ karmabhiḥ tad phalaiḥ ca na saṃsrakṣyase
translated: because of the impossibility of your having any connection with them, you will not be bound by actions and their results.

original: tataś ca saṃnyāsayogayuktātmā saṃnyāsaḥ sarvakarmaṇāṃ bhagavati samarpaṇaṃ sa
analyzed: tatas ca saṃnyāsa yoga yukta ātmā saṃnyāsaḥ sarva karmaṇām bhagavati samarpaṇam sa
translated: And then, with your mind purified by the yoga of renunciation, i.e., renunciation is the dedication of all actions to the Lord.

original: eva yoga iva cittaśodhakatvād yogas tena yuktaḥ śodhita ātmāntaḥkaraṇaṃ yasya sa
analyzed: eva yogaḥ iva citta śodhaka tvāt yogaḥ tena yuktaḥ śodhitaḥ ātmā antaḥkaraṇam yasya sa
translated: That itself is like yoga because it purifies the mind. One who is endowed with that, whose mind, the internal organ, is purified, is he.

original: tvaṃ tyaktasarvakarmā vā karmabandhanair jīvann eva vimuktaḥ san samyagdarśanenājñānāvaraṇanivṛttyā
analyzed: tvam tyakta sarva karmā vā karma bandhanaiḥ jīvan eva vimuktaḥ san samyak darśanena ajñāna āvaraṇa nivṛttyā
translated: You, having given up all actions, or even while remaining bound by actions, being liberated by perfect knowledge,

original: mām upaiṣyasi sākṣātkariṣyasy ahaṃ brahmāsmīti /
analyzed: mām upaiṣyasi sākṣātkariṣyasi aham brahma asmi iti
translated: will attain Me, will realize, 'I am Brahman.'

original: tataḥ prārabdhakarmakṣayāt patite 'smin śarīre videhakaivalyarūpaṃ mām upaiṣyasi /🔽idānīm api madrūpaḥ san sarvopādhinivṛttyā
analyzed: tatas prārabdha karma kṣayāt patite smin śarīre videha kaivalya rūpam mām upaiṣyasi  idānīm api mad rūpaḥ san sarva upādhi nivṛttyā
translated: Then, when this body falls due to the exhaustion of the prārabdha karma, you will attain Me, who am of the nature of the disembodied Kaivalya.

original: māyikabhedavyavahāraviṣayo na bhaviṣyasīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: māyika bheda vyavahāra viṣayaḥ na bhaviṣyasi iti arthaḥ
translated: Even now, being of My nature, you will not be the object of the dealings of the distinctions created by Māyā, due to the cessation of all limiting adjuncts. This is the meaning.

original: viśvanāthaḥ śubhāśubhaphalair anantaiḥ karmarūpair bandhanair vimokṣyase /
translated: Viśvanātha: You will be liberated from the bonds of actions in the form of good and bad fruits, which are endless.

original: bhaktir asya bhajanam /
analyzed: bhaktiḥ asya bhajanam
translated: Bhakti is the worship of Him.

original: tad ihāmutropādhinairāsyenaivāmuṣmin manaḥkalpanam /
analyzed: tat iha amutra upādhi nairāsyena eva amuṣmin manaḥ kalpanam
translated: By thus giving up all attachments to this world and the next, the mind is fixed on the next world.

original: etad eva ca naiṣkarmyam GTU / iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: etat eva ca naiṣkarmyam iti śruteḥ
translated: And this itself is the state of being free from action. Thus it is said in the Upanishad.

original: saṃnyāsaḥ karmaphalatyāgaḥ sa eva yogas tena yukta ātmā mano yasya saḥ /
analyzed: saṃnyāsaḥ karma phala tyāgaḥ saḥ eva yogaḥ tena yuktaḥ ātmā manaḥ yasya saḥ
translated: Renunciation is the giving up of the fruits of action. That itself is yoga. He whose mind is united with that,

original: na kevalaṃ mukta eva bhaviṣyasy api tu vimukto mukteṣv api viśiṣṭaḥ san mām upaiṣyasi sākṣāt paricarituṃ mannikaṭam eṣyasi
analyzed: na kevalam muktaḥ eva bhaviṣyasi api tu vimuktaḥ mukteṣu api viśiṣṭaḥ san mām upaiṣyasi sākṣāt paricaritum mad nikaṭam eṣyasi
translated: not only will you be liberated, but you will be liberated and distinguished even among the liberated, and will come to Me, will come near Me to serve Me directly.

original: muktānām api siddhānāṃ nārāyaṇaparāyaṇaḥ
analyzed: muktānām api siddhānām nārāyaṇa parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Even among the liberated sages, one who is devoted to Narayana

original: sudurlabhaḥ praśāntātmā koṭiṣv api mahāmune //
analyzed: su durlabhaḥ praśānta ātmā koṭiṣu api mahā mune
translated: is extremely rare, O great sage, even in millions.

original: BhP / / iti smṛteḥ /
analyzed: iti smṛteḥ
translated: Thus it is said in the Smriti.

original: muktiṃ dadāti karhicit sma na bhaktiyogam BhP / / iti śukokteḥ /
analyzed: muktim dadāti karhicit sma na bhakti yogam iti śuka ukteḥ
translated: Sometimes He grants liberation, but not devotion and yoga. Thus it is said by Suka.

original: mukteḥ sakāśād api sākṣān matpremasevāyā utkarṣo 'yam eveti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: mukteḥ sakāśāt api sākṣāt mad prema sevāyāḥ utkarṣaḥ yam evā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that this is the superiority of serving Me with love directly, even over liberation.

original: baladevaḥ īdṛśabhakteḥ phalam āha śubheti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ īdṛśa bhakteḥ phalam āha śubha iti
translated: Balarama states the result of such devotion with the word shubha (auspicious).

original: evaṃ mannideśakṛtāyāṃ sarvakarmārpaṇalakṣaṇāyāṃ bhaktau satyāṃ karmarūpair bandhanais tvaṃ mokṣyase /
analyzed: evam mad nideśa kṛtāyām sarva karma arpaṇa lakṣaṇāyām bhaktau satyām karma rūpaiḥ bandhanaiḥ tvam mokṣyase
translated: Thus, when there is devotion in the form of offering all actions as per My direction, you will be freed from the bonds in the form of actions.

original: kīdṛśair ity āha śubhetīṣṭāniṣṭaphalais tatprāptipratīpaiḥ prācīnair ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kīdṛśaiḥ iti āha śubha iti iṣṭa aniṣṭa phalaiḥ tad prāpti pratīpaiḥ prācīnaiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Of what kind? He says: by good and bad actions, i.e. by those which bring about the attainment of the desirable and the undesirable, respectively.

original: kīdṛśas tvam ity āha saṃnyāseti mayi karmārpaṇaṃ saṃnyāsaḥ /
analyzed: kīdṛśaḥ tvam iti āha saṃnyāsa iti mayi karma arpaṇam saṃnyāsaḥ
translated: What kind of person are you? He says: being devoted to Me, i.e. having offered actions to Me.

original: sa eva cittaviśodhakatvād yogas tadyukta ātmā mano yasya saḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva citta viśodhaka tvāt yogaḥ tad yuktaḥ ātmā manaḥ yasya saḥ
translated: And that itself is yoga because it purifies the mind. He whose Self, mind, is endowed with that,

original: na kevalaṃ mukta eva karmabhir bhaviṣyasy api tu vimuktaḥ san mām upaiṣyasi /
analyzed: na kevalam muktaḥ eva karmabhiḥ bhaviṣyasi api tu vimuktaḥ san mām upaiṣyasi
translated: not only will you be liberated from actions, but also, having become liberated, you will come to Me.

original: mukteṣu viśiṣṭaḥ san māṃ sākṣāt sevituṃ madantikaṃ prāpsyasi ////🔽BhG /
analyzed: mukteṣu viśiṣṭaḥ san mām sākṣāt sevitum mad antikam prāpsyasi  bhg
translated: Having become distinguished among the liberated, you will attain Me, come to My presence, to serve Me directly.🔽BhG 9.29

original: samo 'haṃ sarvabhūteṣu na me dveṣyo 'sti na priyaḥ /
analyzed: samaḥ ham sarva bhūteṣu na me dveṣyaḥ sti na priyaḥ
translated: I am the same to all beings; to Me there is none dear or undear.

original: ye bhajanti tu māṃ bhaktyā mayi te teṣu cāpy aham ////
analyzed: ye bhajanti tu mām bhaktyā mayi te teṣu ca api aham
translated: But those who worship Me with devotion, they are in Me, and I am in them.

original: śrīdharaḥ yadi bhaktebhya eva mokṣaṃ dadāsi nābhaktebhyas tarhi tavāpi kiṃ rādadveṣādikṛtaṃ vaiṣamyam asti /
analyzed: dadāsi na   tarhi   api
translated: Sridhar: If you give liberation only to the devotees and not to the non-devotees, then do you also have inequality created by love, hatred, etc.?

original: nety āha samo 'ham iti /
analyzed: na iti āha samaḥ ham iti
translated: No, says the Lord in Samam, etc.

original: samo 'haṃ sarveṣv api bhūteṣu /
analyzed: samaḥ ham sarveṣu api bhūteṣu
translated: I am the same to all beings.

original: ato me mama priyaś ca dveṣyaś ca nāsty eva /
analyzed: atas me mama priyaḥ ca dveṣyaḥ ca na asti eva
translated: Therefore, to Me there is none dear or undear.

original: evaṃ saty api ye māṃ bhajanti te bhaktā mayi vartante /
analyzed: evam sati api ye mām bhajanti te bhaktāḥ mayi vartante
translated: Even so, those who worship Me, they are the devotees, they abide in Me.

original: aham api teṣv anugrāhakatayā varte /
analyzed: aham api teṣu anugrāhaka tayā varte
translated: And I also abide in them as the bestower of grace.

original: ayaṃ bhāvaḥ yathā agneḥ svalevakeṣv eva tamaḥśītādiduḥkham apākurvato 'pi na vaiṣamyam /
analyzed: ayam bhāvaḥ yathā agneḥ sva levakeṣu eva tamaḥ śīta ādi duḥkham apākurvataḥ na vaiṣamyam
translated: The idea is this: Just as there is no inequality in the case of fire, which removes the misery of darkness, cold, etc., only in its own fuel,

original: yathā vā kalpavṛkṣasya /
analyzed: yathā vā kalpavṛkṣasya
translated: or just as in the case of the wish-fulfilling tree,

original: tathaiva bhaktapakṣapātino 'pi mama vaiṣamyaṃ nāsty eva /
analyzed: tathā eva bhakta pakṣapātinaḥ mama vaiṣamyam na asti eva
translated: in the same way, even though I am partial to My devotees, there is no inequality on My part at all.

original: kintu madbhakter evāyaṃ mahimeti ////
analyzed: kintu mad bhakteḥ eva ayam mahimā iti
translated: But this is the greatness of devotion to Me.

original: madhusūdanaḥ yadi bhaktān evānugṛhṇāsi nābhaktān /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ yadi bhaktān eva anugṛhṇāsi na abhaktān
translated: Madhusudana: If You favour only the devotees and not the non-devotees,

original: tato rāgadveṣavattvena kathaṃ parameśvaraḥ syā iti nety āha samo 'ham iti /
analyzed: tatas rāga dveṣavat tvena katham parameśvaraḥ syāḥ iti na iti āha samaḥ ham iti
translated: then how can You be the Supreme Lord, being possessed of attachment and aversion? To this He says: I am the same...

original: sarveṣu prāṇiṣu samas tulyo 'haṃ sadrūpeṇa sphuraṇarūpeṇānandarūpeṇa ca svābhāvikenaupādhikena cāntaryāmitvena /
analyzed: sarveṣu prāṇiṣu samaḥ tulyaḥ ham sat rūpeṇa sphuraṇa rūpeṇa ānanda rūpeṇa ca svābhāvikena aupādhikena ca antaryāmi tvena
translated: I am the same, i.e., equal, in all beings, in the form of existence, consciousness and bliss, both naturally and adventitiously, by being the immanent Self.

original: ato namama dveṣaviṣayaḥ prītiviṣayo vā kaścid asti sāvitrasyeva gaganamaṇḍalavyāpinaḥ prakāśāsya /
analyzed: atas na mama dveṣa viṣayaḥ prīti viṣayaḥ vā kaścid asti sāvitrasya iva gagana maṇḍala vyāpinaḥ prakāśā asya
translated: Therefore, I have no one as an object of aversion or affection, like the sun pervading the sky, which has no object of aversion or affection.

original: tarhi kathaṃ bhaktābhaktayoḥ phalavaiṣamyaṃ tatrāha ye bhajanti tu ye tu bhajanti sevante māṃ sarvakarmasamarpaṇarūpayā bhaktyā /
analyzed: tarhi katham bhakta abhaktayoḥ phala vaiṣamyam tatra āha ye bhajanti tu ye tu bhajanti sevante mām sarva karma samarpaṇa rūpayā bhaktyā
translated: Then how is there a difference in the results for the devotee and the non-devotee? There, he says: But those who serve me with devotion in the form of offering all actions,

original: abhaktāpekṣayā bhaktānāṃ viśeṣadyotanārthas tuśabdaḥ /
analyzed: abhakta apekṣayā bhaktānām viśeṣa dyotana arthaḥ tuśabdaḥ
translated: The word but is to emphasize the difference between the devotees and the non-devotees.

original: ko 'sau / mayi te ye madarpitair niṣkāmaiḥ karmabhiḥ śodhitāntaḥkaraṇās te nirastasamastarajastamomalasya
analyzed: mayi te ye mad arpitaiḥ niṣkāmaiḥ karmabhiḥ śodhita antaḥkaraṇāḥ te nirasta samasta rajaḥ tamaḥ malasya
translated: What is that? Those whose internal organs are purified by actions offered to me without desire, they,🔽by the increase of the internal organ which has removed all the impurities of rajas and tamas,

original: sattvodrekeṇātisvacchasyāntaḥkaraṇasya sadā madākārā vṛttim upainpanmānenotpādayanto
analyzed: sattva udrekeṇa ati svacchasya antaḥkaraṇasya sadā mad ākārāḥ vṛttim
translated: always attain a mode of activity that has the form of me, by that means they

original: mayi vartante / aham
analyzed: mayi vartante aham
translated: dwell in me. I also,

original: apy atisvacchāyāṃ tadīyacittavṛttau pratibimbitas teṣu varte /
analyzed: api ati svacchāyām tadīya citta vṛttau pratibimbitaḥ teṣu varte
translated: reflected in their very clear mental mode of activity, dwell in them.

original: cakāro 'vadhāraṇārthas ta eva mayi teṣv evāham iti /🔽svacchasya hi dravyasyāyam eva svabhāvo yena sambadhyate tadākāraṃ gṛhṇātīti /
analyzed: cakāraḥ te eva mayi teṣu eva aham iti  svacchasya hi dravyasya ayam eva svabhāvaḥ yena sambadhyate tad ākāram gṛhṇāti iti
translated: The word ca (and) is for specification, they alone in me, I alone in them.🔽For this is the nature of a clear substance, that it takes on the form of what it is connected with.

original: svacchadravyasambaddhasya ca vastuna eṣa eva svabhāvo yat tatra pratiphalatīti /
analyzed: svaccha dravya sambaddhasya ca vastunaḥ eṣaḥ eva svabhāvaḥ yat tatra pratiphalati iti
translated: And this is the very nature of an object connected with a clear substance, that it is reflected there.

original: tathāsvacchadravyasyāpy eṣa eva svabhāvo yat svasambaddhasyākāraṃ na gṛhṇātīti /
analyzed: tathā asvaccha dravyasya api eṣaḥ eva svabhāvaḥ yat sva sambaddhasya ākāram na gṛhṇāti iti
translated: Similarly, this is the very nature of a clear substance that it does not apprehend the form of what is connected to itself.

original: asvacchadravyasambaddhasya ca vastuna eṣa eva svabhāvo yat tatra na pratiphalatīti /
analyzed: asvaccha dravya sambaddhasya ca vastunaḥ eṣaḥ eva svabhāvaḥ yat tatra na pratiphalati iti
translated: And this is the very nature of a thing connected to an unclear substance that it does not reflect there.

original: yathā hi sarvatra vidyamāno 'pi sāvitraḥ prakāśaḥ svacche darpaṇādāv evābhivyajyate na tv asvacche ghaṭādau /
analyzed: yathā hi sarvatra vidyamānaḥ sāvitraḥ prakāśaḥ svacche darpaṇa ādau eva abhivyajyate na tu asvacche ghaṭa ādau
translated: For just as the light of the sun, though present everywhere, manifests only in a clear mirror, etc., but not in an unclear pot, etc.,

original: tāvatā na darpaṇe rajyati na vā dveṣṭi ghaṭam /
analyzed: tāvatā na darpaṇe rajyati na vā dveṣṭi ghaṭam
translated: to that extent the sun does not delight in the mirror or hate the pot.

original: evaṃ sarvatra samo 'pi svacche bhaktacitte 'bhivyajyamāno 'svacche cābhakticitte 'nabhivyajyamāno 'haṃ na rajyāmi kutracit /
analyzed: evam sarvatra samaḥ svacche bhakta citte bhivyajyamānaḥ svacche ca abhakti citte ham na rajyāmi kutracid
translated: In the same way, though equal everywhere, manifesting only in the clear mind of devotion and not manifesting in the unclear mind of non-devotion, I do not delight anywhere.

original: na vā dveṣmi kaṃcit /
analyzed: na vā dveṣmi kaṃcid
translated: Nor do I hate anyone.

original: sāmagrīmaryādayā jāyamānasya kāraysāparyanuyojyatvāt /
analyzed: sāmagrī maryādayā jāyamānasya
translated: Because what arises by the limit of the assemblage cannot be accused of doing.

original: vahnivat kalpataruvac cāvaiṣamyaṃ vyākhyeyam ////
analyzed: vahni vat kalpataru vat ca avaiṣamyam vyākhyeyam
translated: Like fire and like the wish-fulfilling tree, the absence of inequality should be explained.

original: viśvanātha nanu bhaktān eva vimuktīkṛtya svaṃ prāpayasi /
analyzed: eva
translated: Viśvanātha: Well, you liberate only the devotees and lead them to yourself,

original: na tv abhaktān iti cet tarhi tavāpi kiṃ rāgadveṣādikṛtaṃ vaiṣamyam asti /
analyzed: na tu abhaktān iti ced tarhi tava api kim rāga dveṣa ādi kṛtam vaiṣamyam asti
translated: but not the non-devotees. If so, then do you also have inequality created by attachment, aversion, etc.?

original: nety āha samo 'ham iti /
analyzed: na iti āha samaḥ ham iti
translated: No, says (the Lord), 'I am equal' (to all).

original: te bhaktā mayi vartante 'ham api teṣu varta iti vyākhyāne bhagavaty eva sarvajagad vartata eva /
analyzed: te bhaktāḥ mayi vartante ham api teṣu varte iti vyākhyāne bhagavati eva sarva jagat vartate eva
translated: When it is explained that 'they, the devotees, are attached to Me, and I am also attached to them', then the entire world indeed exists in the Lord.

original: bhagavān api sarvajagatsu vartata eveti nāsti viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān api sarva jagatsu vartate eva iti na asti viśeṣaḥ
translated: And the Lord also exists in the entire world. There is no difference.

original: tasmāt ye yathā māṃ prapadyante tāṃs tathaiva bhajāmy aham Gītā / iti nyāyena /
analyzed: tasmāt ye yathā mām prapadyante tān tathā eva bhajāmi aham gītā iti nyāyena
translated: Therefore, according to the principle stated in (the verse), 'In whatever way they approach Me, in just that way I worship them' (Gita 4.11),

original: mayi te āsaktā bhaktā vartante yathā tathāhamapi teṣv āsakta iti vyākhyeyam /
analyzed: mayi te āsaktāḥ bhaktāḥ vartante yathā tathā aham api teṣu āsaktaḥ iti vyākhyeyam
translated: it should be explained that 'they, the devotees, are attached to Me, and I am also attached to them in the same way'.

original: atra kalpavṛkṣādidṛṣṭāntas tv ekāṃśenaiva jñeyaḥ /🔽na hi kalpavṛkṣaphalākāṅkṣayā tad āśritā āsajjanti /
analyzed: atra kalpavṛkṣa ādi dṛṣṭāntaḥ tu eka aṃśena eva jñeyaḥ  na hi kalpavṛkṣa phala ākāṅkṣayā tat āśritāḥ āsajjanti
translated: Here, the example of the wish-fulfilling tree etc. should be understood only partially.🔽For those who depend on the wish-fulfilling tree are not attached to it with a desire for its fruits.

original: nāpi kalpavṛkṣaḥ svāśriteṣv āsaktaḥ /
analyzed: na api kalpavṛkṣaḥ sva āśriteṣu āsaktaḥ
translated: Nor is the wish-fulfilling tree attached to those who depend on it.

original: nāpi sa āśritasya vairiṇo dveṣṭi /
analyzed: na api saḥ āśritasya vairiṇaḥ dveṣṭi
translated: Nor does it hate its enemy who depends on it.

original: bhagavāṃs tu svabhaktavairiṇaṃ svahastenaiva hinasti /
analyzed: bhagavān tu sva bhakta vairiṇam sva hastena eva hinasti
translated: But the Lord himself destroys with his own hand the enemy of his devotee.

original: yad uktaṃ prahrādāya yadā druhyed dhaniṣye 'pi varorjitam BhP / / iti kecit
analyzed: yat uktam prahrādāya yadā druhyet dhaniṣye vara ūrjitam bhp  iti kecid
translated: As it is said (in the Bhagavata Purana), 'When he (the Lord) would offend Prahlada, I will also destroy the powerful one' (BhP 7.8.1). Some say this.

original: tu tukārasya bhinnopakramārthatvam ākhyāya bhaktavātsalyalakṣaṇaṃ tu vaiṣamyaṃ mayi vidyata eveti tac ca bhagavato bhūṣaṇaṃ /
analyzed: tu tukārasya bhinna upakrama artha tvam ākhyāya bhakta vātsalya lakṣaṇam tu vaiṣamyam mayi vidyate eva iti tat ca bhagavataḥ bhūṣaṇam
translated: But they explain that the word but has the meaning of introducing a new topic, and that there is indeed inequality in Me, which consists in affection for the devotee, and that this is an ornament of the Lord.

original: na tu dūṣaṇam iti vyācakṣate /
analyzed: na tu dūṣaṇam iti vyācakṣate
translated: But it is not a fault.

original: tathā hi bhagavato bhaktavātsalyam eva prasiddham /
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavataḥ bhakta vātsalyam eva prasiddham
translated: For thus, the Lord's affection for the devotee is well-known.

original: na tu jñānivātsalyaṃ yogivātsalyaṃ vā /
analyzed: na tu jñāni vātsalyam yogi vātsalyam vā
translated: But not affection for the wise, nor for the yogis.

original: yathā hy anyo janaḥ svadāseṣv eva vatsalo nānyadāseṣu /
analyzed: yathā hi anyaḥ janaḥ sva dāseṣu eva vatsalaḥ na anya dāseṣu
translated: For just as another person is affectionate only towards his own servants, not towards the servants of others,

original: tathaiva bhagavān api svabhakteṣv eva vatsalo na rudrabhakteṣu nāpi devībhakteṣv iti ////
analyzed: tathā eva bhagavān api sva bhakteṣu eva vatsalaḥ na rudra bhakteṣu nā api devī bhakteṣu iti
translated: in the same way, the Lord too is affectionate only towards His own devotees, not towards the devotees of Rudra, nor towards the devotees of the Goddess.

original: baladevaḥ nanu bhaktān eva vimocyāntikaṃ nayasi /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu bhaktān eva vimocya antikam nayasi
translated: Balarama: But you liberate only the devotees and take them to Yourself.

original: nābhaktān iti tavāpi kiṃ sarveśvarasya rāgadveṣakṛtaṃ vaiṣamyam asti /
analyzed: na abhaktān iti tava api kim sarveśvarasya rāga dveṣa kṛtam vaiṣamyam asti
translated: Not the non-devotees. So do You, the Lord of all, have inequality arising from attachment and aversion?

original: tatrāha samo 'ham iti /
analyzed: tatra āha samaḥ ham iti
translated: To that He says I am equal etc.

original: devamanuṣyatiryaksthāvarādiṣu jātyākṛtisvabhāvair viṣameṣu sarveṣu bhūteṣu tattatkarmānuguṇyena
analyzed: deva manuṣya tiryak sthāvara ādiṣu jāti ākṛti svabhāvaiḥ viṣameṣu sarveṣu bhūteṣu tad tad karma ānuguṇyena
translated: Among all beings, which are unequal due to their different species, forms, and natures, such as gods, humans, animals, plants, etc., according to their respective actions,

original: sṛṣṭipālanakṛt sarveśvaro 'haṃsamaḥ parjanya iva nānāvidheṣu tattadbījeṣu /
analyzed: sṛṣṭi pālana kṛt sarva īśvaraḥ haṃsamaḥ parjanyaḥ iva nānāvidheṣu tad tad bījeṣu
translated: The Lord of all, who creates and protects, is impartial towards all, like rain, towards various seeds.

original: na teṣu me ko 'pi dveṣyaḥ priyo vety arthaḥ /
analyzed: na teṣu me kaḥ dveṣyaḥ priyaḥ vā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that I have no enmity or affection towards them.

original: bhaktānām abhaktebhyo viśesaṃ bodhayitum iha tuśabdaḥ /
analyzed: bhaktānām abhaktebhyaḥ viśesam bodhayitum iha tuśabdaḥ
translated: The word 'but' is used here to point out the difference between devotees and non-devotees.

original: ye tu māṃ bhajanti śravaṇādibhaktibhir anukūlayanti /
analyzed: ye tu mām bhajanti śravaṇa ādi bhaktibhiḥ anukūlayanti
translated: But those who worship Me with devotional acts like listening, who favor Me,

original: te bhaktyānuraktyā mayi vartante /
analyzed: te bhaktyā anuraktyā mayi vartante
translated: they abide in Me with devotion, with love.

original: teṣv ahaṃ ca sarveśvaro 'pi bhaktyā varte /
analyzed: teṣu aham ca bhaktyā varte
translated: And I, the Lord of all, abide in them with devotion.

original: maṇisuvarṇanyāyena bhagavato 'pi bhakteṣu bhaktir asti /
analyzed: maṇi suvarṇa nyāyena bhagavataḥ u pi bhakteṣu bhaktiḥ asti
translated: By the principle of the gem and gold, the Lord also has devotion towards the devotees.

original: bahgavān bhaktabhaktimān ity ādi śrīśukavākyād iti premṇā mitho vartanaviśeṣo darśitaḥ /
analyzed: bahgavān bhakta bhaktimān iti ādi śrī śuka vākyāt iti premṇā mithas vartana viśeṣaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: It is shown by the statement of Sri Sukan that the Lord is devoted to the devotees. Thus the special mutual devotion is shown out of love.

original: anyathā tv aviśeṣāpattiḥ /
analyzed: tu
translated: Otherwise, there would be no difference.

original: tasya pratijñā tv īdṛśy
analyzed: tasya pratijñā tu īdṛśī
translated: His vow is understood to be just like this

original: evāvagamyate ye yathā mām ity ādinā /🔽kalpadrumadṛṣṭānto 'py atrāṃśika eva /
analyzed: eva avagamyate ye yathā mām iti ādinā
translated: by the statement 'those who worship Me as I am...' etc.🔽The example of the wish-fulfilling tree is also partial here.

original: tatra mithaḥ prītyaapratīteḥ pakṣapātāpratīteś ca /
analyzed: tatra mithas prītyā apratīteḥ pakṣapāta apratīteḥ ca
translated: Because mutual love and partiality are not seen there.

original: tathā ca sarvatrāviṣame 'pi mayi svāśritavātsalyalakṣaṇaṃ vaiṣamyam astīty uktam /
analyzed: tathā ca sarvatra aviṣame mayi sva āśrita vātsalya lakṣaṇam vaiṣamyam asti iti uktam
translated: And thus it is said that even in all that is not uneven, there is unevenness in Me, which is characterized by affection for those who depend on Me.

original: evam āha sūtrakāraḥ upapadyate cābhyupalabhyate ca Vs / / iti /
analyzed: evam āha sūtra kāraḥ upapadyate ca abhyupalabhyate ca iti
translated: And thus the author of the Śruti has said: And it is both possible and perceived.

original: nanu bhakter api karmatvānusāreṇa teṣu tadvātsalyān na tallakṣaṇe tad iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: But even if devotion is an object of action, it is not characterized by that affection for them, in accordance with the nature of an object of action.

original: cen maivam etat /
analyzed: ced mā evam etat
translated: If so, that is not so.

original: svarūpaśaktivṛtter bhakteḥ karmānyatvāt /
analyzed: sva rūpa śakti vṛtteḥ bhakteḥ karma anya tvāt
translated: Because devotion, which is the manifestation of one's own inherent power, is different from action.

original: śrutiś ca saccidānandaikarase bhaktiyoge tiṣṭhati GTU / iti /
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca saccidānanda eka rase bhakti yoge tiṣṭhati iti
translated: And the Śruti says: One who is established in the yoga of devotion, which is the essence of existence, consciousness and bliss.

original: na ca svarūpaprayuktatvād dūṣaṇam etad iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca sva rūpa prayukta tvāt dūṣaṇam etat iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that this is a fault because it is employed by one's own nature.

original: guṇaśreṣṭhatvena stūyamānatvāt ////
analyzed: guṇa śreṣṭha tvena stūyamāna tvāt
translated: Because it is praised as having the best qualities.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: api cet sudurācāro bhajate mām ananyabhāk /
analyzed: api ced su durācāraḥ bhajate mām an anya bhāj
translated: Even if a person of very bad conduct worships Me without being devoted to anything else,

original: sādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ ////
analyzed: sādhuḥ eva sa mantavyaḥ samyak vyavasitaḥ hi saḥ
translated: he should be considered righteous, for he is truly resolved.

original: śrīdhara / api ca madbhakter evāyam avitarkyaṃ prabhāva iti darśayann āha api ced iti /
analyzed: śrīdharaḥ api ca mad bhakteḥ eva ayam avitarkyam prabhāvaḥ iti darśayan āha api ced iti
translated: Śrīdhara: And in order to show that this is the inconceivable power of devotion to Me alone, he says Even if etc.

original: atyantaṃ durācāro 'pi naro yadyap apṛthaktvena pṛthagdevatāpi vāsudeva eveti buddhyā
analyzed: atyantam durācāraḥ naraḥ apṛthaktvena pṛthak devatā api vāsudevaḥ eva iti buddhyā
translated: Even a man of extremely bad conduct, if he worships Me with the thought that all the separate deities are none other than Vāsudeva,🔽without a separate self,

original: devatāntarabhaktim akurvan mām eva parameśvaraṃ bhajate tarhi sādhuḥ śreṣṭha eva sa mantavyaḥ /
analyzed: devatā antara bhaktim akurvan mām eva parameśvaram bhajate tarhi sādhuḥ śreṣṭhaḥ eva sa mantavyaḥ
translated: If, not worshipping other deities, he worships Me alone, the Supreme God, then he is to be considered the best, the most excellent.

original: yato 'sau samyagvyavasitaḥ parameśvarabhajanenaiva kṛtārtho bhaviṣyāmīti śobhanam adhyavasāyaṃ kṛtavān ////🔽madhusūdanaḥ kiṃ ca madbhakter evāyaṃ mahimā yat same 'pi vaiṣamyam āpādayati śṛṇu tanmahimānam api ced iti /
analyzed: yatas sau samyak vyavasitaḥ parameśvara bhajanena eva kṛtārthaḥ bhaviṣyāmi iti śobhanam adhyavasāyam kṛtavān  madhusūdanaḥ kim ca mad bhakteḥ eva ayam mahimā yat same vaiṣamyam āpādayati śṛṇu tad mahimānam api ced iti
translated: For he has made a good resolve, thinking, By worshipping the Supreme God alone I shall attain my goal.

original: yaḥ kaścit sudurācāro 'pi ced ajāmilādir ivānanyabhāk san māṃ bhajate kutaścid bhāgyodayāt sevate sa prāg asādhur api sādhur eva mantavyaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid ced ajāmila ādiḥ iva ananya bhāj san mām bhajate kutaścid bhāgya udayāt sevate sa prāk asādhuḥ api sādhuḥ eva mantavyaḥ
translated: Madhusudana: Moreover, this is the greatness of devotion to Me that it brings about equality even in inequality. Listen to that greatness: Even if someone is a great sinner, but like Ajāmila, has no other recourse, and worships Me, due to the rise of some good fortune, he is to be considered a saint, even though he was previously a bad person.

original: hi yasmāt samyagvyavasitaḥ sādhuniścayavān saḥ ////
analyzed: hi yasmāt samyak vyavasitaḥ sādhu niścayavān saḥ
translated: For he has made a good resolve, has a good decision.

original: viśvanātha /
analyzed: viśvanātha
translated: Visvanatha:

original: svabhakteṣv āsaktir mama svābhāviky eva bhavati /
analyzed: sva bhakteṣu āsaktiḥ mama svābhāvikī eva bhavati
translated: My attachment to My devotees is natural.

original: sā durācāre 'pi bhakte nāpayāti /
analyzed: sā durācāre pi bhakte na apayāti
translated: It does not leave even a bad devotee.

original: tam apy utkṛṣṭam eva karomīty āha api ced iti /
analyzed: tam api utkṛṣṭam eva karomi iti āha api ced iti
translated: I make him also excellent. Thus He says, Even if...

original: sudurācāraḥ parahiṃsā paradāraparadravyādigrahaṇaparāyaṇe 'pi māṃ bhajate cet /
analyzed: su durācāraḥ para hiṃsā para dāra para dravya ādi grahaṇa parāyaṇe mām bhajate ced
translated: Even if a person of very bad conduct, devoted to harming others, to taking others' wives, wealth, etc., worships Me.

original: kīdṛgbhajanavān ity ata āha /
analyzed: kīdṛś bhajanavān iti atas āha
translated: What kind of worshipper is he? To this He says:

original: ananyabhāk matto 'nyadevatāntaram /
analyzed: an anya bhāj mattaḥ
translated: Not devoted to anything else, not to any other deity than Me.

original: madbhakter anyat karmajñānādikam /
analyzed: mad bhakteḥ anyat karma jñāna ādikam
translated: Not devoted to any action, knowledge, etc. other than devotion to Me.

original: matkāmanāto 'nyāṃ rājyādikāmanāṃ na bhajate / sa sādhuḥ /
analyzed: mad kāmanātaḥ nyām rājya ādi kāmanām na bhajate sa sādhuḥ
translated: Not devoted to any desire for kingdom, etc. other than the desire for Me, he is a good person.

original: nanv etādṛśe kadācāre dṛṣṭe sati /
analyzed: nanu etādṛśe kadācāre dṛṣṭe sati
translated: But when such conduct is seen,

original: kathaṃ sādhutvam /
analyzed: katham sādhu tvam
translated: how can he be considered good?

original: tatrāha / mantavyo mananīyaḥ /
analyzed: tatra āha mantavyaḥ mananīyaḥ
translated: To this He says: He should be considered.

original: sādhutvenaiva sa jñeya iti yāvat /
analyzed: sādhu tvena eva sa jñeyaḥ iti yāvat
translated: He should be known as good, that is the meaning.

original: mantavyam iti vidhivākyam anyathā pratyavāyaḥ syāt /
analyzed: mantavyam iti vidhi vākyam anyathā pratyavāyaḥ syāt
translated: The statement should be considered is an injunction; otherwise there would be a prohibition.

original: atra madājñaiva pramāṇam iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: atra mad ājñā eva pramāṇam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that My command alone is the authority in this matter.

original: nanu tvāṃ bhajate ity etadaṃśena sādhuḥ paradārādigrahaṇāṃśenāsādhuś ca sa mantavyas tatrāha eveti /
analyzed: nanu tvām bhajate iti etad aṃśena sādhuḥ para dāra ādi grahaṇa aṃśena asādhuḥ ca sa mantavyaḥ tatra āha eva iti
translated: But he is to be considered good in the part where he worships You, and bad in the part where he takes another's wife, etc. To this He says: Only.

original: sarveṇāpy aṃśena sādhur eva mantavyaḥ /
analyzed: sarveṇa api aṃśena sādhuḥ eva mantavyaḥ
translated: He is to be considered only good in every part.

original: kadāpi tasyāsādhutvaṃ na draṣṭavyam iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: kadāpi tasya asādhu tvam na draṣṭavyam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that his badness should never be seen.

original: samyag vyavasitaṃ niścayo yasya saḥ /
analyzed: samyak vyavasitam niścayaḥ yasya saḥ
translated: He whose determination is correct.

original: dustyajena svapāpena narakaṃ tiryagyonir vā yāmi aikāntikaṃ śrīkṛṣṇabhajanaṃ tu naiva jihāsāmīti sa śobhanam adhyavasāyaṃ kṛtavān ity arthaḥ🔽baladevaḥ mama śuddhabhaktivaśyatālakṣaṇaḥ svabhāvo dustyaja eva /
analyzed: dustyajena sva pāpena narakam tiryagyoniḥ vā yāmi aikāntikam śrī kṛṣṇa bhajanam tu na eva jihāsāmi iti sa śobhanam adhyavasāyam kṛtavān iti arthaḥ  baladevaḥ mama śuddha bhakti vaśya tā lakṣaṇaḥ svabhāvaḥ dustyajaḥ eva
translated: The meaning is that he made the excellent resolve: 'I will go to hell or to the animal realm due to my incurable sin, but I will never give up exclusive devotion to Lord Kṛṣṇa.'

original: yad ahaṃ jugupsitakarmaṇy api bhakte 'nurajyaṃs tam utkarṣayāmīti pūrvārthaṃ puṣṇann āha api ced iti /
analyzed: yat aham jugupsita karmaṇi api bhakte nurajyan tam utkarṣayāmi iti pūrva artham puṣṇan āha api ced iti
translated: The meaning of the previous verse is being expanded upon by saying 'api ca' (and moreover), with the thought that my nature, characterized by being under the control of pure devotion, is indeed incurable.

original: ananyabhāk janaś cet sudurācāro 'tivigarhitakarmāpi san māṃ bhajate matkīrtanādibhir māṃ sevate tad api sa sādhur eva mantavyaḥ /
analyzed: ananya bhāj janaḥ ced su durācāraḥ ti vigarhita karmā api san mām bhajate mad kīrtana ādibhiḥ mām sevate tat api sa sādhuḥ eva mantavyaḥ
translated: Even if a person, though engaged in despicable actions, though of extremely reprehensible conduct, worships Me, serves Me through glorifying Me and so on, he should still be considered righteous.

original: matto 'nyāṃ devatāṃ na bhajty āśrayatīti madekāntī mām eva svāminaṃ paramapumarthaṃ ca jānann ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: mattaḥ nyām devatām na bhajti āśrayati iti mad ekāntī mām eva svāminam parama pumartham ca jānan iti arthaḥ
translated: He is one who does not worship any deity other than Me, who does not take refuge in any other deity. The meaning is that he knows Me alone as the Lord and the supreme human goal.

original: ubhayathā vartamāno 'pi sādhutvena sa pūjya iti bodhayitum evakāraḥ /
analyzed: ubhayathā vartamānaḥ api sādhu tvena sa pūjyaḥ iti bodhayitum eva kāraḥ
translated: The word 'eva' (only) is used to convey that he is to be worshipped as righteous even if he behaves in both ways.

original: tasya tathātve manane mantavya iti svanideśarūpo vidhiś ca darśitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya tathātve manane mantavyaḥ iti sva nideśa rūpaḥ vidhiḥ ca darśitaḥ
translated: And the injunction in the form of his own command, 'he should be considered thus', is also shown if he reflects in that way.

original: itarathā pratyavāyād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: itarathā pratyavāyāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that otherwise there would be a transgression.

original: ubhayathāpi vartamānasya sādhutvam evety atroktaṃ hetuṃ puṣṇann āha samyag iti /
analyzed: ubhayathā api vartamānasya sādhu tvam eva iti atra uktam hetum puṣṇan āha samyak iti
translated: In both cases, the one who is engaged is virtuous alone. To nourish the reason stated here, he says properly etc.

original: yad asau samyagvyavasito madekāntaniṣṭhārūpaśreṣṭhaniścayavān ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: yat asau samyak vyavasitaḥ mad ekānta niṣṭhā rūpa śreṣṭha niścayavān iti arthaḥ
translated: That he is properly resolved, i.e., endowed with the best form of ascertainment that is solely fixed on me, is the meaning.

original: evam uktaṃ nārasiṃhe
analyzed: evam uktam nārasiṃhe
translated: Thus it is said in the Narasimha Purana:

original: bhagavati ca harāv ananyacetā
analyzed: bhagavati ca harau an anya cetāḥ
translated: And in the blessed Hara, with mind fixed on none else,

original: bhṛśam alino 'pi virājate manuṣyaḥ /🔽na hi śaśakaluṣacchaviḥ kadācit
analyzed: bhṛśam alinā u pi virājate manuṣyaḥ  na hi śaśa kaluṣa chaviḥ kadācid
translated: a man, though greatly sinful, shines.🔽For the moon, with a spot like a hare, never attains

original: timiraparābhavatām upaiti candraḥ // iti ////
analyzed: timira parābhava tām upaiti candraḥ iti
translated: the state of being vanquished by darkness.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: kṣipraṃ bhavati dharmātmā śaśvacchāntiṃ nigacchati /
analyzed: kṣipram bhavati dharma ātmā śaśvat śāntim nigacchati
translated: He quickly becomes righteous-minded and attains eternal peace.

original: kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati ////
analyzed: kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati
translated: O son of Kunti, know that my devotee is never lost.

original: śrīdharaḥ nanu kathaṃ samīcīnādhyavasāyamātreṇa sādhur mantavyaḥ /
translated: Sridhar says: But how can one be considered virtuous merely by having proper ascertainment?

original: tatrāha kṣipram iti /
analyzed: tatra āha kṣipram iti
translated: To that he says quickly etc.

original: sudurācāro 'pi māṃ bhajan śīghraṃ dharmacitto bhavati /
analyzed: su durācāraḥ mām bhajan śīghram dharma cittaḥ bhavati
translated: Even one who is very wicked, by worshipping me, quickly becomes one whose mind is set on dharma.

original: tataś ca śaśvacchāntiṃ cittopaplavoparamarūpāṃ parameśvaraniṣṭhāṃ nitarāṃ gacchati prāpnoti /
analyzed: tatas ca śaśvat śāntim citta upaplava uparama rūpām parameśvara niṣṭhām nitarām gacchati prāpnoti
translated: And then he goes to, attains, eternal peace, which is the state of being fixed on the Supreme Lord, in the form of the cessation of mental agitation.

original: kutarkakarkaśavādino naitātmanyerann iti śaṅkākulam arjunaṃ protsāhayati he kaunteya
analyzed: kutarka karkaśa vādinaḥ iti śaṅkā ākulam arjunam protsāhayati he kaunteya
translated: To encourage Arjuna, who is anxious with the thought that those who speak harsh words with bad reasoning would not accept this in their mind, [the Lord] says: O son of Kunti,

original: paṭahādimahāghoṣapūrvakaṃ vivadamānānāṃ sabhāṃ gatvā bāhum utkṣipya niḥśaṅkaṃ
analyzed: paṭaha ādi mahā ghoṣa pūrvakam vivadamānānām sabhām gatvā bāhum utkṣipya niḥśaṅkam
translated: having gone to the assembly of disputants preceded by loud sounds of drums etc., having raised up your arm, fearlessly

original: pratijānīhi pratijñāṃ kuru /
analyzed: pratijānīhi pratijñām kuru
translated: make a declaration, make a vow.

original: katham / me parameśvarasya bhaktaḥ sudurācāro 'pi na praṇaśyati /
analyzed: katham me parameśvarasya bhaktaḥ su durācāraḥ na praṇaśyati
translated: How? That even a very wicked person who is My devotee does not perish.

original: api tu kṛtārtha eva bhavatīti /
analyzed: api tu kṛtārthaḥ eva bhavati iti
translated: But he becomes successful.

original: tataś ca te taṃ prauḍhivijṛmbhavidhvaṃsitakutarkāḥ santo niḥsaṃśayaṃ tvām eva gurutvenāśrayeran ////
analyzed: tatas ca te tam prauḍhi vijṛmbha vidhvaṃsita kutarkāḥ santaḥ niḥsaṃśayam tvām eva guru tvena āśrayeran
translated: And then, they, having their bad reasoning destroyed by the manifestation of your boldness, will certainly take refuge in you alone as their teacher.

original: madhusūdanaḥ asmād eva samyagvyavasāyāt sa hitvā durācāratāṃ kṣipram iti /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ asmāt eva samyak vyavasāyāt sa hitvā durācāra tām kṣipram iti
translated: Madhusudana: From this very right determination, he, having given up wickedness, quickly,

original: cirakālam adharmātmāpi madbhajanamahimnā kṣipraṃ śīghram eva bhavati dharmātmā dharmānugatcitto durācāratvaṃ jhaṭity eva tyaktvā sadācāro
analyzed: cira kālam adharma ātmā api mad bhajana mahimnā kṣipram śīghram eva bhavati dharma ātmā dharma anugat cittaḥ durācāra tvam jhaṭiti eva tyaktvā sat ācāraḥ
translated: even though he has been unrighteous for a long time, by the power of worshipping Me, becomes righteous, his mind following righteousness, having quickly given up wickedness, he becomes righteous,

original: bhavatīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: this is the meaning.

original: kiṃ ca śaśvan nityaṃ śāntiṃ viṣayabhogaspṛhānivṛttiṃ nigacchati nitarāṃ prāpnoty atinirvedāt /
analyzed: kim ca śaśvat nityam śāntim viṣaya bhoga spṛhā nivṛttim nigacchati nitarām prāpnoti ati nirvedāt
translated: Moreover, he who is devoted to Me, he always, constantly, attains peace, cessation of desire for sensual enjoyments, very well, very much, due to extreme detachment.

original: kaścit tvadbhaktaḥ prāg abhyastaṃ durācāratvam atyajan na bhaved api dharmātmā /
analyzed: kaścid tvad bhaktaḥ prāk abhyastam durācāra tvam atyajan na bhavet api dharma ātmā
translated: But someone who is devoted to You may not be a righteous soul, even though he has given up the evil conduct that he has practiced before.

original: tathā ca sa naśyed eveti nety āha bhaktānukampāparavaśatayā kupita iva bhagavān /
analyzed: tathā ca sa naśyet evā iti nā iti āha bhakta anukampā paravaśa tayā kupitaḥ iva bhagavān
translated: And in that case, he would certainly perish. To this, the Lord, out of His compassion for the devotees and His supremacy, as if angry, says, No.

original: naitad āścaryaṃ manvīthā he kaunteya niścitam evedṛśaṃ madbhakter māhātmyam /
analyzed: na etat āścaryam manvīthāḥ he kaunteya niścitam evā īdṛśam mad bhakteḥ māhātmyam
translated: You should not consider this a wonder, O son of Kunti. This greatness of devotion to Me is certainly so.

original: ato vipratipannānāṃ purastād api tvaṃ pratijānīhi sāvajñaṃ sagarvaṃ ca pratijñāṃ kuru /
analyzed: atas vipratipannānām purastāt api tvam pratijānīhi sa avajñam sa garvam ca pratijñām kuru
translated: Therefore, even in the presence of those who disagree, you should make an oath with contempt and pride.

original: na me vāsudevasya bhatko 'tidurācāro 'pi prāṇasaṅkaṭam āpanno 'pi sudurlabham ayogyaḥ san prārtahaymāno 'pi atimūḍho 'śaraṇo 'pi na praṇaśyati
analyzed: na me vāsudevasya ti durācāraḥ pi prāṇa saṅkaṭam āpannaḥ pi su durlabham ayogyaḥ san ati mūḍhaḥ śaraṇaḥ pi na praṇaśyati  /
translated: My devotee, even if he is extremely wicked, even if he is in danger of losing his life, even if he is very unworthy, even if he is extremely deluded, even if he has no refuge, does not perish.

original: kiṃ tu kṛtārtha eva bhavatīti /
analyzed: kim tu kṛtārthaḥ eva bhavati iti
translated: But he becomes one who has attained his goal.

original: dṛṣṭāntāś cājāmilaprahlādadhruvagajendrādayaḥ prasiddhā eva /
analyzed: dṛṣṭāntāḥ ca ajāmila prahlāda dhruva gajendra ādayaḥ prasiddhāḥ eva
translated: And the examples of Ajāmila, Prahlāda, Dhruva, Gajendra, etc. are well-known.

original: śāstraṃ ca na vāsudevabhaktānām aśubhaṃ vidyate kvacit iti ////
analyzed: śāstram ca na vāsudeva bhaktānām aśubham vidyate kvacid iti
translated: And the scripture also says, “For the devotees of Lord Vāsudeva, there is no inauspiciousness anywhere.”

original: viśvanāthaḥ nanu tādṛśasyādharmiṇaḥ kathaṃ bhajanaṃ tvaṃ gṛhṇāsi /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ nanu tādṛśasya adharmiṇaḥ katham bhajanam tvam gṛhṇāsi
translated: Viśvanātha: Well, how can you accept the worship of such a sinful person?

original: kāmakrodhādidūṣitāntaḥkaraṇena niveditam annapānādikaṃ katham aśnāsīty ata āha kṣipraṃ śīghram eva sa dharmātmā bhavati /
analyzed: kāma krodha ādi dūṣita antaḥkaraṇena niveditam anna pāna ādikam katham aśnāsi iti atas āha kṣipram śīghram eva sa dharma ātmā bhavati
translated: How can you eat the food, drink, etc. offered by one whose heart is polluted by lust, anger, etc.? To this, the Lord replies: He quickly becomes righteous.

original: atra kṣipraṃ bhāvī sa dharmātmā śaśvacchāntiṃ gamiṣyatīti aprayujya bhavati gacchatīti
analyzed: atra kṣipram bhāvī sa dharma ātmā śaśvat śāntim gamiṣyati iti a prayujya bhavati gacchati iti
translated: Here, the future righteous one quickly becomes, and will go to eternal peace, without using the future tense, He will become, He will go,

original: vartamānaprayogāt adharmakaraṇānantaram eva mām anusmṛtya kṛtānutāpaḥ kṣipram eva dharmātmā bhavati /
analyzed: vartamāna prayogāt adharma karaṇa anantaram eva mām anusmṛtya kṛta anutāpaḥ kṣipram eva dharma ātmā bhavati
translated: by using the present tense, immediately after committing an unrighteous act, he remembers Me, repents, and quickly becomes righteous.

original: hanta hanta mattulyaḥ ko 'pi bhaktalokaṃ kalaṅkayann adhamo nāsti /
analyzed: hanta hanta mad tulyaḥ kaḥ pi bhakta lokam kalaṅkayan adhamaḥ nā asti
translated: Alas, alas, there is no low person like me who defiles the devotees.

original: tad vidyām iti śaśvat punaḥ punar api śāntiṃ nirvedaṃ nitarāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: tat vidyām iti śaśvat punar punar api śāntim nirvedam nitarām gacchati
translated: He knows that and again and again goes to eternal peace, renunciation.

original: yad vā kiyataḥ samayād anantaraṃ tasya bhāvi dharmātmatvaṃ tadānīm api sūkṣmarūpeṇa
analyzed: yat vā kiyataḥ samayāt anantaram tasya bhāvi dharma ātma tvam tadānīm api sūkṣma rūpeṇa
translated: Or, after how much time will he become righteous? Even then, in a subtle form,

original: vartata evaṃ tan manasi bhakteḥ preveśāt yathā pīte mahauṣadhi sati tadānīṃ kiyakālaparyantaṃ🔽naśyadavastho jvaradāho
analyzed: vartate evam tat manasi bhakteḥ preveśāt yathā pīte mahauṣadhi sati tadānīm kiyat kāla paryantam  naśyat avasthaḥ jvara dāhaḥ
translated: This is the meaning. Thus, when the great medicine of devotion enters the mind, for some time

original: viṣadāho vā vartamāno 'pi na gaṇyata iti dhvaniḥ /
analyzed: viṣa dāhaḥ vā na gaṇyate iti dhvaniḥ
translated: the fever or burning sensation caused by the poison, though present, is not counted. This is the suggestion.

original: tataś ca tasya bhaktasya durācāratvagamakāḥ kāmakrodhādyā utkhātadaṃṣṭroragadaṃśavad akiñcitkarā eva jñeyā iti anudhvaniḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca tasya bhaktasya durācāra tva gamakāḥ kāma krodha ādyāḥ utkhāta daṃṣṭra uraga daṃśa vat akiñcitkarāḥ eva jñeyāḥ iti anudhvaniḥ
translated: And from that, it is understood that lust, anger, etc., which indicate that devotee's bad conduct, are as ineffective as a snake bite from which the fangs have been extracted. This is the secondary suggestion.

original: ataeva śaśvat sarvadaiva śāntiṃ kāmakrodhādyupaśamaṃ nitarāṃ gacchaty atiśayena prāpnotīti durācāratvadaśāyām api sa śuddhāntaḥkaraṇa eva
analyzed: ataeva śaśvat sarvadā eva śāntim kāma krodha ādi upaśamam nitarām gacchati atiśayena prāpnoti iti durācāra tva daśāyām api sa śuddha antaḥkaraṇaḥ eva
translated: And therefore, he always, at all times, goes to peace, the cessation of lust, anger, etc., to a very great extent, attains it to an extraordinary degree. Thus, even in the state of bad conduct, he is said to be one whose inner self is pure.

original: ucyata iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: ucyate iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: nanu yadi sa dharmātmā syāt tadā nāsti ko 'pi vivādaḥ /
analyzed: nanu yadi sa dharma ātmā syāt tadā na asti kaḥ vivādaḥ
translated: If he were a righteous soul, there is no dispute about that.

original: kintu kaścid durācārabhakto maraṇaparyantam api durācāratvaṃ na jahāti /
analyzed: kintu kaścid durācāra bhaktaḥ maraṇa paryantam api durācāra tvam na jahāti
translated: But some devotee of bad conduct does not give up his bad conduct even until death.

original: tasya kā vārtā ity ato bhaktavatsalo bhagavān saprauḍhi sakopam ivāha kaunteyeti /
analyzed: tasya kā vārtā iti atas bhakta vatsalaḥ bhagavān sa prauḍhi sa kopam iva āha kaunteya iti
translated: What is the condition of such a one? Therefore, the Lord, who is affectionate towards devotees, speaks as if with pride and anger, O son of Kunti.

original: mama bhakto na praṇaśyati /
analyzed: mama bhaktaḥ na praṇaśyati
translated: My devotee does not perish.

original: tad api prāṇanāśe adhaḥpātaṃ na yāti /
analyzed: tat api prāṇa nāśe adhaḥpātam na yāti
translated: That also does not lead to a fall into hell in the destruction of life.

original: kutarkakarkaśavādino naitan manyerann iti śokaśaṅkāvyākulam arjunaṃ protsāhayati
analyzed: kutarka karkaśa vādinaḥ na etat manyeran iti śoka śaṅkā vyākulam arjunam protsāhayati
translated: In order that even those who speak harshly with bad reasoning might not think so, [the Lord] encourages Arjuna, who is agitated with grief and doubt,

original: he kaunteya paṭahakāhalādimahāghoṣapūrvakaṃ vivadamānānāṃ sabhāṃ gatvā bāhum utkṣipya
analyzed: he kaunteya paṭaha kāhala ādi mahā ghoṣa pūrvakam vivadamānānām sabhām gatvā bāhum utkṣipya
translated: saying, O son of Kunti, having gone to the assembly of those who dispute, preceded by the great sound of drums, conches, etc., raising up your arm,

original: niḥśaṅkaṃ pratijānīhi pratijñāṃ kuru /
analyzed: niḥśaṅkam pratijānīhi pratijñām kuru
translated: declare your vow without doubt, make your promise.

original: katham / me mama parameśvarasya bhakto durācāro 'pi na praṇeśyety api tu kṛtārtha eva bhavati /
analyzed: katham me mama parameśvarasya bhaktaḥ na api tu kṛtārthaḥ eva bhavati
translated: How? Even a wicked devotee of Me, the Supreme Lord, is not lost, but rather becomes successful.

original: tataś ca te taṃ prauḍhivijṛmbhitavidhvaṃsitakutarkāḥ santo niḥsaṃśayaṃ tvām eva gurutvenāśrayeran iti svāmicaraṇāḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca te tam prauḍhi vijṛmbhita vidhvaṃsita kutarkāḥ santaḥ niḥsaṃśayam tvām eva guru tvena āśrayeran iti svāmi caraṇāḥ
translated: And then, having destroyed the bad reasoning of those who display their arrogance, they will certainly take refuge in You alone as their teacher, say the venerable [Vyāsa].

original: nanu kathaṃ bhagavān svayam apratijñāya pratijñātum arjunam evātidideśa /
analyzed: nanu katham bhagavān svayam a pratijñāya pratijñātum arjunam eva atidideśa
translated: But how is it that the Lord himself, without making a promise, directed Arjuna to make a promise?

original: yathaivāgre mām evaiṣyasi satyaṃ te pratijāne priyo 'si me iti vakṣyate /
analyzed: yathā eva agre mām eva eṣyasi satyam te pratijāne priyaḥ si me iti vakṣyate
translated: Just as it will be said later, You will come to Me alone. I promise you truly. You are dear to Me,

original: tathaivātrāpi kaunteya pratijāne 'haṃ na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati iti kathaṃ noktam /
analyzed: tathā eva atra api kaunteya pratijāne ham na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati iti katham nā uktam
translated: in the same way, here too, why was it not said, O son of Kunti, I promise that my devotee is not lost?

original: ucyate bhagavatā tadānīm eva vicāritaṃ bhaktavatsalena mayā svabhaktāpakarṣaleśam
analyzed: ucyate bhagavatā tadānīm eva vicāritam bhakta vatsalena mayā sva bhakta apakarṣa leśam
translated: It is said that the matter has been considered by me, who am affectionate towards my devotees, at that very time, by me who am unable to bear even the slightest diminution of my devotees,

original: apy asahiṣṇunā svapratijñāṃ khaṇḍayitvāpi svāpakarṣam aṅgīkṛtyāpi bhaktapratijñaiva rakṣitā bahutra /
analyzed: api asahiṣṇunā sva pratijñām khaṇḍayitvā api sva apakarṣam aṅgīkṛtya api bhakta pratijñā eva rakṣitā bahutra
translated: by me who, having broken my own vow and accepted my own diminution, have protected the vow of my devotee in many places.

original: yathā tatraiva bhīṣmayuddhe svapratijñām apy apākṛtya bhīṣmapratijñaiva rakṣiṣyate /
analyzed: yathā tatra eva bhīṣma yuddhe sva pratijñām api apākṛtya bhīṣma pratijñā eva rakṣiṣyate
translated: As there itself, in the battle with Bhishma, having even set aside my own vow, I will protect only Bhishma's vow.

original: bahirmukhā vādino vaitaṇḍikā matpratijñāṃ śrutvā hasiṣyanti arjunapratijñā tu pāṣāṇarekhaiveti te pratiyanti /
analyzed: bahirmukhāḥ vādinaḥ vaitaṇḍikāḥ mad pratijñām śrutvā hasiṣyanti arjuna pratijñā tu pāṣāṇa rekhā eva iti te pratiyanti
translated: The disputants who are outwardly oriented will laugh upon hearing my vow, but they will think that Arjuna's vow is like the lines on a stone.

original: ato 'rjunam eva pratijñāṃ kārayāmīti /
analyzed: atas rjunam eva pratijñām kārayāmi iti
translated: Therefore, I make Arjuna himself take the vow.

original: atra etādṛśadurācārasyāpi ananyabhaktiśravaṇād ananyabhaktābhidhāyakavākyeṣu sarvatra na vidyate
analyzed: atra etādṛśa durācārasya api ananya bhakti śravaṇāt ananya bhakta abhidhāyaka vākyeṣu sarvatra na vidyate
translated: Here, because even such a wicked person's exclusive devotion is heard, the explanation by the foolish that in all the statements expressing exclusive devotion there is nothing else,

original: 'nyatstrīputrādyāsaktividharmaśokamohakāmakrodhādikaṃ yatreti kupaṇḍitavyākhyā na grāhyeti ////
analyzed: nyat strī putra ādi āsakti vidharma śoka moha kāma krodha ādikam yatra iti ku paṇḍita vyākhyā na grāhyā iti
translated: such as attachment to wife, son, etc., adharma, grief, delusion, desire, anger, etc., should not be accepted.

original: baladevaḥ iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ iti
translated: Balarama says:

original: sudurācāro 'pi māṃ bhajan śīghraṃ dharmacitto bhavati /
analyzed: su durācāraḥ mām bhajan śīghram dharma cittaḥ bhavati
translated: Even a very wicked person, by worshipping me, quickly becomes one with a virtuous mind.

original: tataś ca śaśvac chāntiṃ cittopaplavoparamarūpāṃ parameśvaraniṣṭhāṃ nitarāṃ gacchati prāpnoti /
analyzed: tatas ca śaśvat śāntim citta upaplava uparama rūpām parameśvara niṣṭhām nitarām gacchati prāpnoti
translated: And then he attains, i.e., reaches, the highest state of the Supreme Lord, which is the cessation of the disturbance of the mind in the form of the cessation of all disturbances.

original: kutarkakarkaśavādino naitātmanyerann iti śaṅkākulam arjunaṃ protsāhayati he kaunteya
analyzed: kutarka karkaśa vādinaḥ iti śaṅkā ākulam arjunam protsāhayati he kaunteya
translated: In order to encourage Arjuna, who is agitated by the doubt that the harsh words of bad reasoning will not be accepted by them, [the Lord] says: O son of Kunti,

original: paṭahādimahāghoṣapūrvakaṃ vivadamānānāṃ sabhāṃ gatvā bāhum utkṣipya niḥśaṅkaṃ
analyzed: paṭaha ādi mahā ghoṣa pūrvakam vivadamānānām sabhām gatvā bāhum utkṣipya niḥśaṅkam
translated: having gone to the assembly of the disputing parties preceded by the loud sounds of drums etc., having raised your arm, without hesitation,

original: pratijānīhi pratijñāṃ kuru /
analyzed: pratijānīhi pratijñām kuru
translated: make a declaration, i.e., make a vow.

original: katham / me parameśvarasya bhaktaḥ sudurācāro 'pi na praṇaśyati /
analyzed: katham me parameśvarasya bhaktaḥ su durācāraḥ na praṇaśyati
translated: How? Even a very wicked devotee of Me, the Supreme Lord, does not perish.

original: api tu kṛtārtha eva bhavatīti /
analyzed: api tu kṛtārthaḥ eva bhavati iti
translated: But he becomes successful.

original: tataś ca te tvat prauḍhivijṛmbhavidhvaṃsitakutarkāḥ santo niḥsaṃśayaṃ tvām eva gurutvenāśrayeran ////🔽BhG /
analyzed: tatas ca te tvat prauḍhi vijṛmbha vidhvaṃsita kutarkāḥ santaḥ niḥsaṃśayam tvām eva guru tvena āśrayeran  bhg
translated: And then, having their bad reasoning destroyed by the manifestation of your prowess, they will certainly take refuge in you alone as their teacher.

original: māṃ hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye 'pi syuḥ pāpayonayaḥ /
analyzed: mām hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye pi syuḥ pāpa yonayaḥ
translated: O Partha, even those who are of sinful birth,

original: striyo vaiśyās tathā śūdrās te 'pi yānti parāṃ gatim ////
analyzed: striyaḥ vaiśyāḥ tathā śūdrāḥ te yānti parām gatim
translated: women, Vaishyas, and Shudras, they also attain the highest state by resorting to Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ svācārabhraṣṭaṃ madbhaktiḥ pavitrīkarotīti kim atra citram /
translated: What is wonderful in this, that My devotion purifies one who has fallen from his own duty?

original: yato madbhaktir duṣkulān apy anadhikāriṇo 'pi saṃsārān mocayatīty āha māṃ hīti /
analyzed: yatas mad bhaktiḥ duṣkulān api anadhikāriṇaḥ saṃsārāt mocayati iti āha mām hi iti
translated: For, devotion to Me delivers even those who are not entitled, even those of bad families, from the world. Thus the Lord says, For, etc.

original: ye 'pi pāpayonayaḥ syur nikṛṣṭajanmāno 'ntyajādayo bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: ye pi pāpa yonayaḥ syuḥ nikṛṣṭa janmānaḥ ntyaja ādayaḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Even those who are of sinful wombs, who are of low birth, such as the outcasts, etc.

original: ye 'pi vaiśyāḥ kevalaṃ kṛṣyādiniratāḥ /
analyzed: ye vaiśyāḥ kevalam kṛṣi ādi niratāḥ
translated: Even those who are Vaishyas, who are engaged only in agriculture, etc.

original: striyaḥ śūdrāś cāpy adhyayanādirahitāḥ /🔽te 'pi māṃ vyāpāśritya saṃsevya parāṃ gatiṃ yānti /
analyzed: striyaḥ śūdrāḥ ca api adhyayana ādi rahitāḥ  te pi mām saṃsevya parām gatim yānti
translated: Even women and Shudras, who are devoid of Vedic study, etc.

original: hi niścitam ////🔽madhusūdanaḥ evam āgantukadoṣeṇa duṣṭānāṃ bhagavadbhaktiprabhāvān nistāram uktvā svābhāvikadoṣeṇa duṣṭānām api tam āha māṃ hīti /
analyzed: hi niścitam  madhusūdanaḥ evam āgantuka doṣeṇa duṣṭānām bhagavat bhakti prabhāvāt nistāram uktvā svābhāvika doṣeṇa duṣṭānām api tam āha mām hi iti
translated: They also, having resorted to Me, having served Me, attain the highest state.

original: hi niścitaṃ he pārtha māṃ vyapāścitya śaraṇam āgatya ye 'pi syuḥ pāpayonayo 'ntyajās tiryañco vā jātidoṣeṇa duṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: hi niścitam he pārtha mām vyapāścitya śaraṇam āgatya ye syuḥ pāpa yonayaḥ ntyajāḥ tiryañcaḥ vā jāti doṣeṇa duṣṭāḥ
translated: For, O son of Prtha, those who are of sinful wombs, who are of low birth, such as the outcasts, or even animals, who are defiled by the fault of birth,

original: tathīa vedādhyayanādiśūnyatayā nikṛṣṭāḥ striyo vaiśyāḥ kṛṣyādimātraratāḥ /
analyzed: veda adhyayana ādi śūnya tayā nikṛṣṭāḥ striyaḥ vaiśyāḥ kṛṣi ādi mātra ratāḥ
translated: and similarly, who are low due to the absence of Vedic study, etc., such as women, Vaishyas, who are engaged only in agriculture, etc.,

original: tathā śūdrā jātito 'dhyayanādyabhāvena ca paramagatyayogyās te 'pi yānti parāṃ gatim /
analyzed: tathā śūdrāḥ jātitaḥ dhyayana ādi abhāvena ca parama gati ayogyāḥ te yānti parām gatim
translated: and similarly, Shudras, who are unfit for the highest state due to birth and the absence of Vedic study, etc., they also attain the highest state.

original: apiśabdāt prāguktadurācārā api ////
analyzed: api śabdāt prāc ukta durācārāḥ api
translated: And the word api (even) indicates that those who are of bad conduct as mentioned before are also included.

original: viśvanāthaḥ evaṃ karmaṇā durācārāṇām āgantukān doṣān madbhaktir na gaṇayati iti kiṃ citram /🔽yato jātyaiva durācārāṇāṃ svābhāvikān api doṣān madbhaktir na gaṇayatīty āha mām iti /
analyzed: na gaṇayati iti      yatas jātyā eva durācārāṇām svābhāvikān api doṣān mad bhaktiḥ na gaṇayati iti āha mām iti
translated: Visvanatha: Thus, it is not surprising that devotion to Me does not take into account the adventitious faults of those of bad conduct due to karma.🔽Since devotion to Me does not take into account even the natural faults of those who are of bad conduct by nature, it is said: mam (to Me).

original: pāpayonayo 'ntyajā mlecchā api / yad uktam
analyzed: pāpa yonayaḥ ntyajāḥ mlecchāḥ api yat uktam
translated: Even those of sinful wombs, the lowest castes, barbarians,

original: kirātahūṇāndhrapulindapulkaśā
analyzed: kirāta hūṇa āndhra pulinda pulkasā
translated: Kiratas, Huns, Andhras, Pulindas, Pulkasas,

original: ābhīraśumbhā yavanāḥ khasādayaḥ /🔽ye 'nye ca pāpā yadapāśrayāśrayāḥ
analyzed: ābhīra śumbhāḥ yavanāḥ khasa ādayaḥ  ye nye ca pāpāḥ yad apāśraya āśrayāḥ
translated: Abhiras, Shumbhas, Yavanas, Khasas and others,

original: śudhyanti tasmai prabhaviṣṇave namaḥ // BhP / / iti /
analyzed: śudhyanti tasmai prabhaviṣṇave namaḥ bhp  iti
translated: and those other sinners who take refuge in Me - I offer salutations to that powerful one by whom they are purified.

original: aho bata śvapaco 'to garīyān
analyzed: aho bata śvapacaḥ taḥ garīyān
translated: Oh! The dog-cooker is indeed greater than this,

original: yajjihvāgre vartate nāma tubhyam /
analyzed: yat jihvā agre vartate nāma tubhyam
translated: at the tip of whose tongue your name remains.

original: tepus tapas te juhuvuḥ sasnur āryā
analyzed: tepuḥ tapaḥ te juhuvuḥ sasnuḥ āryā
translated: Those noble ones who have performed austerities, offered oblations, taken baths,

original: brahmānūcur nāma gṛṇanti ye te // BhP / /
analyzed: brahma anūcuḥ nāma gṛṇanti ye te
translated: and chant your name - they have purified themselves.

original: kiṃ punaḥ strīvaiśyādyā aśuddhyalīkādimantaḥ ////
analyzed: kim punar strī vaiśya ādyāḥ aśuddhi alīka ādimantaḥ
translated: What to speak of women, Vaishyas and others who are impure, deceitful and so on?

original: baladevaḥ mahāghoṣapūrvakaṃ vivadamānānāṃ sabhāṃ gatvā bāhum utkṣipya niḥśaṅkaṃ pratijānīhi pratijñāṃ kuru sarveśvaro 'haṃ madekāntināṃ
analyzed: baladevaḥ mahā ghoṣa pūrvakam vivadamānānām sabhām gatvā bāhum utkṣipya niḥśaṅkam pratijānīhi pratijñām kuru sarva īśvaraḥ ham mad ekāntinām
translated: Balarāma, having gone to the assembly of the disputing parties with a loud proclamation, raising his arm, fearlessly declares, makes a promise, I am the Lord of all, I remove the adventitious faults of those who are exclusively devoted to Me.

original: āgantukadoṣān vidhunomīti kiṃ citram /
analyzed: āgantuka doṣān vidhunomi iti kim citram
translated: What is wonderful in this?

original: yad atipāpino 'pi madbhaktaprasaṅgād vidhūtāvidyā vimucyanta ity āha māṃhīti /
analyzed: yat ati pāpinaḥ mad bhakta prasaṅgāt vidhūta avidyāḥ vimucyante iti āha
translated: That even the extremely sinful, by association with My devotees, shake off ignorance and become liberated - this He says in Those born in sinful wombs and so on.

original: ye pāpayonayo 'ntyajāḥ sahajadurācārāḥ syus te 'pi madbhaktaprasaṅgena māṃ sarveśaṃ
analyzed: ye pāpa yonayaḥ ntyajāḥ sahaja durācārāḥ syuḥ te mad bhakta prasaṅgena mām sarva īśam
translated: Those born in sinful wombs, the lowest castes, naturally evil in conduct, even they, by association with My devotees, resort to Me, the Lord of all,

original: vasudevasutaṃ vyapāśritya śaraṇam āgatya parāṃ yogidurlabhāṃ gatiṃ matprāptiṃ
analyzed: vasudeva sutam vyapāśritya śaraṇam āgatya parām yogi durlabhām gatim mad prāptim
translated: the son of Vasudeva, come to the refuge, and attain the highest goal difficult for even the great yogis to attain, attaining Me.

original: yānti hi niścitam etat /
analyzed: yānti hi niścitam etat
translated: They certainly go to that.

original: evam āha śrīmān śukaḥ
analyzed: evam āha śrīmān śukaḥ
translated: The glorious Śuka said this:

original: kirātahūṇāndhrapulindapulkaśā
analyzed: kirāta hūṇa āndhra pulinda pulkasā
translated: Kirātas, Hūṇas, Andhras, Pulindas, Pulkasas,

original: ābhīraśumbhā yavanāḥ khasādayaḥ /
analyzed: ābhīra śumbhāḥ yavanāḥ khasa ādayaḥ
translated: Ābhīras, Śumbhas, Yavanas, Khasas and others,

original: ye 'nye ca pāpā yadapāśrayāśrayāḥ
analyzed: ye nye ca pāpāḥ yad apāśraya āśrayāḥ
translated: and those other sinners who take refuge in Him,

original: śudhyanti tasmai prabhaviṣṇave namaḥ // BhP / / iti /
analyzed: śudhyanti tasmai prabhaviṣṇave namaḥ bhp  iti
translated: are purified. Salutations to that powerful Lord.

original: atrāsya lokasyānityatvaṃ kaṇṭhato bruvan harir mithyātvaṃ tasya nirāsāt ////
analyzed: atrā asya lokasya anitya tvam kaṇṭhataḥ bruvan hariḥ mithyātvam tasya nirāsāt
translated: Here, Hari, directly stating the impermanence of this world, by denying it, declares its falsity.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: kiṃ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣayas tathā /
analyzed: kim punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyāḥ bhaktāḥ rājarṣayaḥ tathā
translated: What to speak of the Brahmanas who are meritorious, and the devoted royal sages?

original: anityam asukhaṃ lokam imaṃ prāpya bhajasva mām ////
analyzed: anityam asukham lokam imam prāpya bhajasva mām
translated: Having attained this world which is impermanent and miserable, worship Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ yadaivaṃ tadā satkulāḥ sadācārāś ca madbhaktāḥ parāṃ gatiṃ yānti iti kiṃ vaktavyam ity āha kiṃ punar iti /
translated: Sridhar: When it is so, then what to speak of the good families and good conduct, My devotees attain the highest goal?

original: puṇyāḥ sukṛtino brāhmaṇāḥ /
analyzed: puṇyāḥ sukṛtinaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: The meritorious ones are the Brahmanas who have done good deeds.

original: tathā rājānaś ca ta ṛṣayaś ca kṣatriyāḥ /
analyzed: tathā rājānaḥ ca te ṛṣayaḥ ca kṣatriyāḥ
translated: Similarly, the kings and the sages, the Kshatriyas.

original: evaṃ bhūtāḥ parāṃ gatiṃ yāntīti kiṃ punar vaktavyam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: evam bhūtāḥ parām gatim yānti iti kim punar vaktavyam iti arthaḥ
translated: What to speak of such people attaining the highest goal? This is the meaning.

original: atas tvam imaṃ rājarṣirūpaṃ dehaṃ prāpya labdhvā māṃ bhajasva /
analyzed: atas tvam imam rājarṣi rūpam deham prāpya labdhvā mām bhajasva
translated: Therefore, having attained this body in the form of a royal sage, worship Me.

original: kiṃcānityam adhruvam asukhaṃ sukharahitaṃ cemaṃ martyalokaṃ prāpya anityatvād vilambam akurvan asukhatvāc ca sukhārtham udyamaṃ hitvā mām
analyzed: kiṃca anityam adhruvam asukham sukha rahitam ca imam martya lokam prāpya anitya tvāt vilambam akurvan asukha tvāt ca sukha artham udyamam hitvā mām
translated: And having attained this mortal world which is impermanent, unstable, and miserable, without delay due to its impermanence, and giving up striving for happiness due to its misery,

original: eva bhajasvety arthaḥ ////
analyzed: eva bhajasva iti arthaḥ
translated: worship only Me. This is the meaning.

original: madhusūdanaḥ evaṃ cet puṇyāḥ sadācārā uttamayonayaś ca brāhmaṇās tathā rājarṣayaḥ
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ evam ced puṇyāḥ sat ācārāḥ uttama yonayaḥ ca brāhmaṇāḥ tathā rājarṣayaḥ
translated: Madhusudana: If it is so, then what to speak of the meritorious, well-behaved, and high-born Brahmanas, and the royal sages,

original: sūkṣmavastuvivekinaḥ kṣatriyā mama bhaktāḥ parāṃ gatiṃ yāntīti kiṃ punar vācyam
analyzed: sūkṣma vastu vivekinaḥ kṣatriyāḥ mama bhaktāḥ parām gatim yānti iti kim punar vācyam
translated: What to speak of the Kshatriyas who are devoted to Me and who are discriminators of subtle things, they attain the supreme goal.

original: atra kasyacid api sandehābhāvād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: atra kasyacid api sandeha abhāvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is no doubt about this for anyone.

original: yato madbhakter īdṛśo mahimāto mahatā pratnenemaṃ lokaṃ sarvapuruṣārthasādhanayogyam
analyzed: yatas mad bhakteḥ īdṛśaḥ mahimā atas mahatā pratnena imam lokam sarva puruṣa artha sādhana yogyam
translated: Since such is the greatness of devotion to Me, therefore, having obtained this human body which is the means of attaining all human goals,

original: atidurlabhaṃ ca mauṣyadeham anityam āśuvināśinam asukhaṃ garbhavāsādyanekaduḥkhabahulaṃ
analyzed: ati durlabham ca mauṣya deham anityam āśu vināśinam asukham garbha vāsa ādi aneka duḥkha bahulam
translated: which is extremely difficult to obtain, which is impermanent and quickly perishes, which is not blissful, which is full of many sufferings such as dwelling in the womb,

original: labdhvā yāvad ayaṃ na naśyati tāvad atiśīghram eva bhajasva māṃ śaraṇam āśrayasva /
analyzed: labdhvā yāvat ayam na naśyati tāvat ati śīghram eva bhajasva mām śaraṇam āśrayasva
translated: as long as it does not perish, worship Me very quickly, take refuge in Me.

original: anityatvād aukhatvāc cāsya vilambaṃ sukhārtham udyamaṃ ca mā kārṣīs tvaṃ ca rājarṣir ato madbhajanenātmānaṃ saphalaṃ kuru /
analyzed: anitya tvāt aukha tvāt ca asya vilambam sukha artham udyamam ca mā kārṣīḥ tvam ca rājarṣiḥ atas mad bhajanena ātmānam saphalam kuru
translated: Do not delay and do not make efforts for happiness, thinking it to be impermanent and not blissful. And you are a royal sage, therefore, make your life fruitful by devotion to Me.

original: anyathā hy etādṛśaṃ janma niṣphalam eva te syād ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: anyathā hi etādṛśam janma niṣphalam eva te syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Otherwise, such a birth would be fruitless for you. This is the meaning.

original: viśvanāthaḥ tato 'pi kiṃ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyāḥ satkulāḥ sadācārāś ca ye bhaktāḥ /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ kim punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyāḥ sat kulāḥ sat ācārāḥ ca ye bhaktāḥ
translated: Visvanatha: What to speak of the Brahmanas who are virtuous, born in good families and of good conduct and who are devotees?

original: tasmāt tvaṃ māṃ bhajasva ////
analyzed: tasmāt tvam mām bhajasva
translated: Therefore, you worship Me.

original: baladevaḥ kim iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ kim iti
translated: Baladeva: What is the purpose?

original: yady evaṃ tarhi brāhmaṇā rājarṣayaḥ kṣatriyāś ca satkulāḥ puṇyāḥ sadācāriṇo bhaktāḥ santaḥ parāṃ gatiṃ yāntīti kiṃ punar vācyam /
analyzed: yadi evam tarhi brāhmaṇāḥ rājarṣayaḥ kṣatriyāḥ ca sat kulāḥ puṇyāḥ sat ācāriṇaḥ bhaktāḥ santaḥ parām gatim yānti iti kim punar vācyam
translated: If it is so, then what need be said about the fact that Brahmanas, royal sages, Kshatriyas of good families, virtuous, righteous and devoted ones attain the highest state?

original: nāsty atra saṃśayaleśo 'pi /🔽tasmāt tvam api rājarṣir imaṃ lokaṃ prāpya māṃ bhajasva anityaṃ naśvaram asukham🔽īṣat sukhaṃ vināśiny alpasukhe 'smin loke rājyaspṛhāṃ vihāya nityam anantānandaṃ
analyzed: na asti atra saṃśaya leśaḥ  tasmāt tvam api rājarṣiḥ imam lokam prāpya mām bhajasva anityam naśvaram asukham  īṣat sukham vināśini alpa sukhe smin loke rājya spṛhām vihāya nityam ananta ānandam
translated: There is not even the slightest doubt in this matter.🔽Therefore, you too, being a royal sage, having attained this world, worship Me. Renouncing the desire for worldly pleasures, which are transient, perishable, and not truly blissful,

original: mām upāsya prāpnuhīti tvarātra vyajyate /
analyzed: mām upāsya prāpnuhi iti tvarā atra vyajyate
translated: and which are of little happiness and destruction in this world, worship Me, who am eternal, infinite bliss, and attain Me. Thus, haste is implied.

original: atrāsya lokasyānityatvaṃ kaṇṭhato bruvan harir mithyātvaṃ tasya nirāsāt ////
analyzed: atrā asya lokasya anitya tvam kaṇṭhataḥ bruvan hariḥ mithyātvam tasya nirāsāt
translated: Here, Hari, directly stating the impermanence of this world, denies its falsity by refuting it.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: manmanā bhava madbhakto madyājī māṃ namaskuru /
analyzed: mad manāḥ bhava mad bhaktaḥ mad yājī mām namaskuru
translated: Be intent on Me, be devoted to Me, worship Me, bow down to Me.

original: mām evaiṣyasi yuktvaivam ātmānaṃ matparāyaṇaḥ ////
analyzed: mām eva eṣyasi yuktvā evam ātmānam mad parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Thus, uniting your self with Me, who am the supreme goal, you will attain Me alone.

original: śrīdharaḥ bhajanaprakāraṃ daśrayann upasaṃharati manmanā iti /
translated: The Lord concludes by showing the way of worship in the verse beginning with Be intent on Me.

original: mayy eva mano yasya sa manmanāḥ tādṛśas tvaṃ bhava /
analyzed: mayi eva manaḥ yasya sa manmanāḥ tādṛśaḥ tvam bhava
translated: Be such that your mind is fixed on Me alone.

original: tathā mamaiva bhaktaḥ sevako bhava /
analyzed: tathā mama eva bhaktaḥ sevakaḥ bhava
translated: Be devoted to Me, be My servant.

original: madyājī matpūjanaśīlo bhava /
analyzed: mad yājī mad pūjana śīlaḥ bhava
translated: Be a worshipper of Me, be devoted to My worship.

original: mām eva ca namaskuru /
analyzed: mām eva ca namaskuru
translated: And offer salutations to Me alone.

original: evam ebhiḥ prakārair matparāyaṇaḥ sann ātmānaṃ mano mayi yuktvā samādhāya mām eva paramānandarūpam eṣyasi prāpsyasi ////
