analyzed: evam ebhiḥ prakāraiḥ mad parāyaṇaḥ san ātmānam manaḥ mayi yuktvā samādhāya mām eva parama ānanda rūpam eṣyasi prāpsyasi
translated: Thus, being devoted to Me in these ways, having fixed your mind on Me, having concentrated your mind on Me, you will attain Me alone, who am of the nature of supreme bliss.

original: nijam aiśvaryam āścaryaṃ bhakteś cādbhutavaibhavam /
analyzed: nijam aiśvaryam āścaryam bhakteḥ ca adbhuta vaibhavam
translated: The wonderful lordship and the marvelous greatness of devotion,

original: navame rājaguhyākhye kṛpayāvocad acyutaḥ //🔽iti śrīśrīdharasvāmikṛtāyāṃ bhagavadgītāṭīkāyāṃ subodhinyāṃ
analyzed: navame rājaguhī ākhye kṛpayā avocat acyutaḥ  iti śrī śrīdhara svāmi kṛtāyām bhagavadgītā ṭīkāyām subodhinyām
translated: were spoken by Achyuta (Krishna) out of compassion in the ninth chapter named Rajaguhya (Secret of Kings).

original: rājavidyārājaguhyayogo nāma navamo 'dhyāyaḥ ////
analyzed: rājavidyārājaguhyayogaḥ nāma navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the ninth chapter named The Yoga of the Secret of the Kings in the commentary called Subodhini written by Sri Sridhara Svami on the Bhagavad Gita.

original: madhusūdanaḥ bhajanaprakāraṃ darśayann upasaṃharati manmanā bhaveti /
translated: Madhusudana concludes by showing the way of worship with the verse Be of My mind.

original: rājabhaktasyāpi rājabhṛtyasya putrādau manas tathā sa tanmanā api na tadbhakta ity ata uktaṃ manmanā bhava madbhakta iti /
analyzed: rāja bhaktasya api rāja bhṛtyasya putra ādau manaḥ tathā sa tad manāḥ api na tad bhaktaḥ iti atas uktam mad manāḥ bhava mad bhaktaḥ iti
translated: Even a king's servant whose mind is on the king's son etc. is not a devotee of the king. Therefore it is said Be of My mind, be My devotee.

original: tathā madyājī matpūjanaśīlo māṃ namaskuru manovākkāyaiḥ /
analyzed: tathā mad yājī mad pūjana śīlaḥ mām namaskuru manaḥ vāc kāyaiḥ
translated: Similarly, be a worshipper of Me, be devoted to My worship. Offer salutations to Me with mind, speech and body.

original: evam ebhiḥ prakārair matparāyaṇo madekaśaraṇaḥ sann ātmānam antaḥkaraṇaṃ yuktvā
analyzed: evam ebhiḥ prakāraiḥ mad parāyaṇaḥ mad eka śaraṇaḥ san ātmānam antaḥkaraṇam yuktvā
translated: Thus, being devoted to Me, having only Me as your refuge, and having fixed your mind,

original: mayi samādhāya mām eva paramānandaghanaṃ svaprakāśaṃ sarvopadravaśūnyam abhayam
analyzed: mayi samādhāya mām eva parama ānanda ghanam sva prakāśam sarva upadrava śūnyam abhayam
translated: having concentrated your mind on Me alone, who am the essence of supreme bliss, who am self-luminous, who am devoid of all calamities, who am fearless,

original: eṣyasi prāpsyasi // //
analyzed: eṣyasi prāpsyasi
translated: you will attain Me.

original: śrīgovindapadāravindamakarandāsvādaśuddhāśayāḥ
translated: Those whose minds are purified by tasting the nectar of the lotus feet of Sri Govinda,

original: saṃsārāmbudhim uttaranti sahasā paśyanti pūrṇaṃ mahaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsāra ambudhim uttaranti sahasā paśyanti pūrṇam mahaḥ
translated: suddenly cross the ocean of worldly existence and behold the complete great light.

original: vedāntair avadhārayanti paramaṃ śreyas tyajanti bhramaṃ
analyzed: vedāntaiḥ avadhārayanti paramam śreyaḥ tyajanti bhramam
translated: They understand the supreme good through the Vedanta scriptures, abandon the delusion,

original: dvaitaṃ svapnasamaṃ vidanti vimalāṃ vindanti cānandatām //🔽iti śrīmatparamahaṃsaparivrājakācāryaśrīviśveśvarasarasvatīpādaśiṣyaśrīmadhusūdanasarasvatīviracitāyāṃ🔽śrīmadbhagavadgītāgūḍhārthadīpikāyām adhikāribhedena rājavidyārājaguhyayogo
analyzed: dvaitam svapna samam vidanti vimalām vindanti ca ānanda tām  iti śrīmat paramahaṃsa parivrājaka ācārya śrī viśveśvara sarasvatī pāda śiṣya śrī madhusūdana sarasvatī viracitāyām
translated: know duality to be like a dream, and attain the pure state of bliss.🔽Thus ends the ninth chapter named The Yoga of the Royal Knowledge, the Royal Secret, according to the qualifications of the aspirant, in the commentary called The Lamp for the Hidden Meaning of the Blessed Lord's Gītā,

original: nāma navamo 'dhyāyaḥ ////
analyzed: nāma navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: composed by the great Madhusūdana Sarasvatī, the disciple of the venerable Śrī Viśveśvara Sarasvatī, the teacher of the great paramahaṃsa mendicants.

original: viśvanāthaḥ bhajanaprakāraṃ darśayann upasaṃharati manmanā iti /
translated: Viśvanātha concludes by showing the way of devotion with the words Mamanā bhava (have your mind fixed on Me).

original: evam ātmānaṃ mano dehaṃ ca yuktvā mayi niyojya ////
analyzed: evam ātmānam manaḥ deham ca yuktvā mayi niyojya
translated: Thus, having identified the Self, the mind, and the body with Me, having dedicated them to Me,

original: pātrāpātravicāritvaṃ svasparśāt sarvaśodhanam /
translated: The consideration of worthy and unworthy recipients, the purification of all by one's own touch,

original: bhakter evātraitad asyāḥ rājaguhyatvam īkṣyate //🔽iti sārārthavarṣiṇyāṃ harṣiṇyāṃ bhaktacetasām /
analyzed: bhakteḥ eva atra etat asyāḥ rāja guhya tvam īkṣyate  iti sāra artha varṣiṇyām harṣiṇyām bhakta cetasām
translated: This is seen as the royal secret of devotion alone here.🔽Thus, in the Gītā, the ninth chapter, which showers the essence, which delights the minds of devotees,

original: gītāsu navamo 'dhyāyaḥ saṅgataḥ saṅgataḥ satām ////
analyzed: gītāsu navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ saṅgataḥ saṅgataḥ satām
translated: Is well-connected with the good people.

original: baladevaḥ atha pariniṣṭhitasyārjunasyābhīṣṭāṃ śuddhāṃ bhaktim upadiśann upasaṃharati manmanā iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ atha pariniṣṭhitasya arjunasya abhīṣṭām śuddhām bhaktim upadiśan upasaṃharati mad manāḥ iti
translated: [Baladeva Vidyābhūṣaṇa:] Now, instructing Arjuna who has reached perfection, the Lord concludes by teaching the desired pure devotion, with the words Having Me in the mind.

original: rājabhakto 'pi rājabhṛtyaḥ patnyādimanās tathā sa tanmanā api na tadbhakto bhavati /
analyzed: rāja bhaktaḥ pi rāja bhṛtyaḥ patnī ādi manāḥ tathā sa tad manāḥ api na tad bhaktaḥ bhavati
translated: Even a king's servant, who is devoted to the king, is not so if his mind is on his wife, etc.

original: tvaṃ tu tadvilakṣaṇabhāvena manmanā madbhakto bhava /
analyzed: tvam tu tad vilakṣaṇa bhāvena mad manāḥ mad bhaktaḥ bhava
translated: But you, being different from him, should have your mind on Me, be devoted to Me.

original: mayi nīlotpalaśyāmalatvādiguṇavati vasudevasūnau svasvāmitvasvapumarthatvabuddhyānavacchinnamadhudhārāvat satataṃ mano yasya saḥ /
analyzed: mayi nīlotpala śyāmala tva ādi guṇavati vasudeva sūnau sva svāmi tva sva pumartha tva buddhyā anavacchinna madhu dhārāvat satatam manaḥ yasya saḥ
translated: He whose mind is always on Me, the son of Vasudeva, who possesses qualities like the blueness of a blue lotus, etc., without any restriction like the thought of being a master or a servant or one's own highest goal, like a continuous stream of honey.

original: tathā madyājī tādṛśasyātimātrapriyasya mamārcane nirato bhava /
analyzed: tathā mad yājī tādṛśasya atimātra priyasya mama arcane nirataḥ bhava
translated: Similarly, be engaged in worshipping Me, who am extremely dear to such a one.

original: tādṛśaṃ mām atipremṇā namaskuru daṇḍavat praṇama /
analyzed: tādṛśam mām ati premṇā namaskuru daṇḍa vat praṇama
translated: Worship Me thus with very great love, by prostrating yourself like a rod.

original: evam ātmānaṃ mano dehaṃ ca yuktā mayi nivedya matparāyaṇo madekāśrayaḥ san mām upaiṣyasi /
analyzed: evam ātmānam manaḥ deham ca yuktāḥ mayi nivedya mad parāyaṇaḥ mad eka āśrayaḥ san mām upaiṣyasi
translated: Thus, having offered yourself, your mind and your body to Me, being devoted to Me, having only Me as your refuge, you will come to Me.

original: eṣā bhaktir arpitaiva kriyeteti bodhyam ////
analyzed: eṣā bhaktiḥ arpitā eva kriyeta iti bodhyam
translated: It should be understood that this devotion is offered in this way.

original: pātrāpātradhiyā śūnyā sparśāt sarvāghanāśinī /
analyzed: pātra apātra dhiyā śūnyā sparśāt sarva agha nāśinī
translated: Free from the notion of worthy or unworthy, destroying all sins by contact,

original: gaṅgeva bhaktir eveti rājaguhyam iha smṛtā //
analyzed: gaṅgā iva bhaktiḥ evā iti rāja guhyam iha smṛtā
translated: Devotion is like the Ganges itself. This is considered the secret of kings.

original: iti śrīmadbhagavadgītopaniṣadbhāṣye navamo 'dhyāyaḥ ////🔽ENDNOTE tam ekaṃ govindaṃ saccidānandavigraham pañcapadaṃ vṛndāvanasurabhūruhatalāsīnaṃ satataṃ samarudgaṇo 'haṃ paramayā stutyā 🔽toṣayāmi /
analyzed: iti śrīmat bhagavadgītā upaniṣad bhāṣye navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ 🔽tam eka govindam saccidānanda vigraham pañca padam vṛndāvana sura bhūruha tala āsīnam satatam sa marut gaṇaḥ haṃ paramayā stutyā 🔽toṣayāmi
translated: Thus ends the Ninth Chapter in the Bhagavad Gita, of the preaching of the Blessed Lord.
